A remote authenticated non-administrative user can supply specially crafted CLI commands to exploit a role-based access control (RBAC) flaw and execute administrative commands to modify the configuration or boot image on the target device [CVE-2018-0293].

A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted SNMP packet to the target device to trigger a protocol data unit validation flaw and cause the target device to restart [CVE-2018-0291].

A local user can supply specially crafted CLI command arguments to exploit an input validation flaw and execute arbitrary commands with root privileges [CVE-2018-0307]. On systems that support multiple virtual device contexts (VDC), this can be exploited to access arbitrary files from any VDC.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target system to reload.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.

A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A local or remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisories are available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewErp.x?alertId=ERP-67770
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180620-nxossnmp
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180620-nxosigmp
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180620-nxosrbac
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180620-nxosadmin
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180620-nxosbgp
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180620-fxos-dos
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180620-n4k-snmp-dos
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180620-firepwr-pt
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180620-nxos-bo
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180620-fxnxos-ace
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180620-fx-os-fabric-dos
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180620-nx-os-cli-execution
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180620-nx-os-cli-injection
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180620-fxnxos-fab-ace
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180620-n3k-n9k-clisnmp
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180620-nx-os-fabric-dos
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180620-nx-os-fabric-services-dos
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180620-fx-os-cli-execution
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180620-nx-os-api-execution
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180620-fx-os-fabric-execution
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180620-nxos-nxapi
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180620-nxos-cdp

Title: Cisco IOS XE AAA Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code on the Target System
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can attempt to authenticate and send specially crafted username data to trigger a memory error in the authentication, authorization, and accounting (AAA) security services and execute arbitrary code on the target system.

AAA login authentication services on tty lines, including console port (CTY) lines, auxiliary (AUX) port lines, virtual terminal (VTY) lines, and asynchronous tty (TTY) lines, are affected.

Login authentication on the web user interface is not affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvi25380 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180606-aaa

Title: F5 BIG-IP Data Compression Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can conduct a 'Zip Bomb' attack by sending specially crafted data to a target system that uses the inflate function, either via an iRule or via the PEM module, to cause a data plane service disruption on the target system.

Systems deployed in Forward Proxy mode with the inflate functionality enabled are affected. Other configurations may also be affected.

The control plane is not affected.

The vendor has assigned ID 676457 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target data plane.
Solution:
F5 has issued a fix (11.5.6, 11.6.3.2, 12.1.3.2, 13.1.0.4).

The F5 advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K52167636

Title: F5 BIG-IP Configuration Utility Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Bypass Security Restrictions on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote authenticated user can bypass security restrictions.
A remote authenticated administrative user can run commands in the Traffic Management User Interface (TMUI) (e.g., BIG-IP Configuration utility) to bypass command restrictions.

The vendor has assigned ID 699455 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated administrative user can bypass command restrictions on the target system.
Solution:
F5 has issued a fix.

The F5 advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K50254952

Title: F5 BIG-IP GeoIP Lookup Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input in a GeoIP lookup response. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the F5 BIG-IP interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned ID 631204 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the F5 BIG-IP interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
F5 has issued a fix (11.5.6, 11.6.3.2, 12.1.3.2).

The F5 advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K23124150

Title: F5 BIG-IP SSL Profile Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted TLS data to cause the target service to degrade in certain cases.

Virtual servers configured with Client SSL or Server SSL profiles and that use network hardware security module (HSM) functionality are affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
F5 has issued a fix (11.6.3.2, 12.1.3.2, 13.0.1, 13.1.0.6).

The F5 advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/#/article/K53931245

Title: F5 BIG-IP ASM Behavioral DoS Protection Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP ASM. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can cause the target Behavioral DoS (BADoS) protection to fail during an attack.

The vendor has assigned ID 714350s and 714369 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
F5 has issued a fix (ASM 13.1.0.6).

The F5 advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K62201098

Title: F5 BIG-IP Configuration Utility Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users View Files on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote authenticated user can obtain files on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can exploit a flaw in the BIG-IP Configuration utility to view files containing vendor-provided data on the target system.

Configuration data, proxied traffic, and other potentially sensitive customer data is not affected.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can obtain files containing vendor-provided data on the target system.
Solution:
F5 has issued a fix (11.5.6, 11.6.3.2, 12.1.2 HF1, 12.1.3, 13.1.0, 13.0.0 HF1).

The F5 advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K00363258

Title: F5 BIG-IP TLS Handshake Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted data during a Transport Layer Security (TLS) handshake to cause the target Traffic Management Microkernel (TMM) to stop responding.

Systems with a Proxy SSL configuration enabled are affected.

The control plane is not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target data plane.
Solution:
F5 has issued a fix (11.5.6, 11.6.3.2, 12.1.3.4, 13.0.1, 13.1.0.4).

The F5 advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/#/article/K46940010

Title: Blue Coat ProxySG Lets Remote Users Bypass SAML Authentication on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Blue Coat ProxySG. A remote user can bypass authentication.
The system does not properly process SAML responses that contain XML nodes with comments. A remote user can modify a valid SAML response so that the target system will still validate the cryptographic signature, allowing SAML authentication security controls to be bypassed.

Administrator user authentication for the management console is not affected.
Impact': A remote user can bypass SAML authentication on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://www.symantec.com/security-center/network-protection-security-advisories/SA167

Title: Cisco IOS XR netconf Interface Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Reload
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR. A remote user can cause the target service to reload.
A remote user can send specially crafted requests to the target netconf interface to cause the netconf process to restart.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvg95792 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180502-iosxr

Title: Cisco 5500 and 8500 Series Wireless LAN Controller Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco 5500 and 8500 Series Wireless LAN Controllers. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
A remote user can submit a specially crafted URL to the REST API to view potentially sensitive information on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvg89442 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180502-wlc-id

Title: Cisco 3500, 5500, and 8500 Series Wireless LAN Controller IPv4 Fragment Reassembly Bug Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Reload
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco 3500, 5500, and 8500 Series Wireless LAN Controllers. A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
A remote user can send specially crafted IPv4 fragments to the target device to trigger a fragment reassembly flaw and cause the target device to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvf89222 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180502-wlc-ip

Title: Cisco 3500, 5500, and 8500 Series Wireless LAN Controller IPv4 Fragment Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Reload
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco 3500, 5500, and 8500 Series Wireless LAN Controllers. A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
A remote user can send specially crafted IPv4 fragments to the target device to trigger a data structure corruption error and cause the target device to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvf89222 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180502-wlc-ip

Title: Cisco Aironet Access Points PPTP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Reload
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Aironet Access Points. A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
A remote user on a device that is registered to the local network can initiate a Point-to-Point Tunneling Protocol (PPTP) connection to the target device on the same local network and send a specially crafted Generic Routing Encapsulation (GRE) frame through the data plane on the target device to cause the NSS core process to crash and the device to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvf73890 to this vulnerability.

Simon Lockhart of CableCom Networking reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.5.120.0).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180502-ap-ptp

Title: Cisco Aironet FlexConnect Access Points Central Web Authentication Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Bypass ACLs on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Aironet. A remote authenticated user can bypass security restrictions.
A remote authenticated user on the local network can exploit a flaw in Central Web Authentication (CWA) on FlexConnect Access Points to bypass client FlexConnect access control list (ACL) restrictions.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCve17756 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user on the local network can bypass client FlexConnect access control list (ACL) restrictions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180502-ap-acl

Title: Cisco Aironet 1800, 2800, and 3800 Series Access Points SSH Access Management Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Aironet 1800, 2800, and 3800 Series Access Points. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges.
A remote authenticated user can exploit a flaw in the management of user accounts for SSH access to gain administrative privileges on the target system.

Systems running certain versions Cisco Mobility Express are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCva68116 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180502-aironet-ssh

Title: Cisco 1800 Series Aironet Access Points 802.11 AR Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Aironet 1800 Series Access Points. A remote user on the wireless network can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send a stream of specially crafted 802.11 Association Requests to cause denial of service conditions and prevent new clients from joining the access point.

Qualcomm Atheros (QCA) based hardware platforms are affected.

The following models are affected:

1560 Series Access Points
1810 Series OfficeExtend Access Points
1810w Series Access Points
1815 Series Access Points
1830 Series Access Points
1850 Series Access Points

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvg02116 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can prevent new clients from joining the access point.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180502-aironet-dos

Title: Cisco Aironet Access Points WebAuth Bug Lets Remote Users Bypass Authentication on the Target Network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Aironet Access Points. A remote user on the local network can bypass authentication and pass traffic on the network.
A remote user on the local network can exploit a flaw in the Web Authentication (WebAuth) client to bypass authentication and pass traffic on the network.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvf71789 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the local network can bypass authentication and pass traffic on the network.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180502-aironet-auth

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller WebAuth Bug Lets Remote Users Bypass Authentication on the Target Network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller. A remote user on the local network can bypass authentication and pass traffic on the network.
A remote user on the local network can exploit a flaw in the Web Authentication (WebAuth) client to bypass authentication and pass traffic on the network.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvc79502 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the local network can bypass authentication and pass traffic on the network.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180502-aironet-auth

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller 802.11 Frame Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users on the Wireless Network Cause the Target System to Reload
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller. A remote user on the wireless network can cause the target system to reload.
A remote user on the wireless network can send a specially crafted 802.11 management frame to the target device to trigger an input validation flaw and cause the target device to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvg07024 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the wireless network can cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180502-wlc-mfdos

Title: F5 BIG-IP TCP Processing Flaw in the TMM Kernel Lets Remote Users Deny Data Plane Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted TCP packets to the target self IP address or FastL4 virtual server to trigger a flaw in the TMM kernel and interrupt data plan service.

The control plane is not affected.

The vendor has assigned ID 702232 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target data plane.
Solution:
F5 has issued a fix (13.1.0.6).

The F5 advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/#/article/K25573437

Title: F5 BIG-IP HTTP/2 Request Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target TMM Component to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can send specially crafted HTTP/2 request frames to cause the target Traffic Management Microkernel (TMM) component to restart, interrupting traffic processing.

The control plane is not affected.

Virtual servers with the HTTP2 profile enabled are affected.

The vendor has assigned ID 707186 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target TMM component to restart.
Solution:
F5 has issued a fix (13.1.0.6).

The F5 advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/#/article/K45320419

Title: F5 BIG-IP ssldump Lets Remote Authenticated Users Modify Files on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote authenticated user can modify files on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can exploit a flaw in the slldump utility to write to arbitrary file paths.

The vendor has assigned ID 688009 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can write to arbitrary file paths on the target system.
Solution:
F5 has issued a fix (12.1.3.4, 13.1.0.6).

The F5 advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/#/article/K46121888

Title: F5 BIG-IP IPv6 RADIUS Response Processing Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Cause the Target TMM Component to Restart
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote authenticated user can cause the target TMM kernel to restart.
A remote IPv6 RADIUS server can return a specially crafted authentication response to cause the target Traffic Management Microkernel (TMM) component to restart.

Systems configured with RADIUS authentication for BIG-IP administrative users are affected.

The vendor has assigned ID 706086 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote RADIUS server can cause the target TMM component to restart.
Solution:
F5 has issued a fix (13.1.0.6).

The F5 advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/#/article/K62750376

Title: F5 BIG-IP LRO and SYN Cookie Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target TMM Component to Restart
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user can cause the target TMM kernel to restart.
A remote user can send specially crafted traffic to cause the target Traffic Management Microkernel (TMM) component to restart, interrupting data plane processing.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target TMM component to restart, interrupting data plane processing.
Solution:
F5 has issued a fix (13.1.0.6).

The F5 advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/#/article/K51754851

Title: F5 BIG-IP Flaw in TMOS Shell Lets Remote Authenticated Low-Privileged Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
A remote authenticated low-privileged user can exploit a flaw in the TMOS Shell (tmsh) to bypass tmsh restrictions and obtain potentially sensitive information on the target file system.

The vendor has assigned ID 623875 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated low-privileged user can bypass tmsh restrictions and obtain potentially sensitive information on the target file system.
Solution:
F5 has issued a fix (12.1.3, 13.0.6).

The F5 advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/#/article/K37442533

Title: F5 BIG-IP Flaw in TMOS Shell Lets Remote Authenticated Administrative Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
A remote authenticated administrative user can exploit a flaw in the TMOS Shell (tmsh) via the dig utility to obtain potentially sensitive information on the target file system.

Systems configured in Appliance mode are affected.
Impact': A remote authenticated administrative user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target file system.
Solution:
F5 has issued a fix (12.1.3.2, 13.1.0.6).

The F5 advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/#/article/K02043709

Title: F5 BIG-IP vCMP Bug Lets Local Users on a Guest System Cause Denial of Service Conditions on Other Guest Systems
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A local user on the vCMP guest system can cause denial of service conditions on other guest systems.
A local root user on a vCMP guest system that is operating in "host-only" or "bridged" mode can cause the vcmpd process on other vCMP guest systems on the host to restart.

The vendor has assigned IDs 589233, 688516, and 693312 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local root user on the vCMP guest system can cause the vcmpd process on other vCMP guest systems on the host to restart.
Solution:
F5 has issued a fix (12.1.3.4, 13.1.0.6).

The F5 advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/#/article/K03165684

Title: Juniper Junos MPLS Buffer Memory Leak Lets Remote Users Consume Excessive Buffer Memory Resources
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can consume excessive buffer memory on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted MPLS packet to a target device interface that has VPLS routing-instances configured on the interface to trigger an mbuf leak. When the target device mbuf buffers are exhausted, the device will become inaccessible. A restart is required to return the system to normal operations.

IPv4 traffic is affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 1272898 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to become inaccessible. A restart is required to return the system to normal operations.

Title: Juniper Junos Short MacSec Key Weakness May Let Remote Users Conduct Man-in-the-Middle Attacks to Recover Key Passphrases
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user may be able to recover key passphrases in certain cases.
On systems configured with short MacSec keys, if all 64 digits of the connectivity association name (CKN) key or all 32 digits of the connectivity association key (CAK) key are not configured, all remaining digits will be auto-configured to 0. As a result, a remote user that can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack may be able to spoof packets and conduct guessing attacks to recover the passphrases for the keys.

The vendor has assigned PR 1251909 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user that can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack may be able to recover key passphrases in certain cases.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (14.1R9, 14.1X53-D47, 15.1R4-S9, 15.1R6-S6, 15.1R7, 15.1X49-D100, 15.1X53-D59, 16.1R3-S8, 16.1R4-S8, 16.1R5, 16.2R1-S6, 16.2R2, 17.1R2, 17.2R1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10854

Title: Juniper Junos BGP UPDATE Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Cause the Target 'rpd' Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can send a specially crafted BGP UPDATE to cause the target routing process daemon (rpd) to crash and restart.

The vendor has assigned PR 1299199 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target rpd service to crash and restart.

Title: Juniper Junos SNMP Processing Flaw in SNMP MIB-II Subagent Daemon Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can cause the target SNMP MIB-II subagent daemon (mib2d) to crash, preventing access via SNMP.

Systems with SNMP mib2d enabled are affected.

Routing, switching, and firewall functions are not affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 1241134 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target mib2d service to crash.

Title: Juniper Junos SRX Series IDP Policy Compilation Flaw Lets Remote Users Bypass the Firewall
Description:
A vulnerability reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted packets when IDP policies are being compiled to bypass the firewall and access resources on the target system or network.

Systems with IDP policies applied to one or more rules are affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 1151743 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can bypass the firewall to access hosts or resources on the protected network.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.1X46-D60, 12.3X48-D35, 15.1X49-D60, 17.3R1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10846

Title: Juniper Junos Processing Flaw in NAT-PT Function Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can send a specially crafted valid IPv6 packet to trigger a flaw in the Network Address Translation - Protocol Translation (NAT-PT) function and cause the target flowd service to crash.

The vendor has assigned PR 1261863 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.1X46-D76 (pending release), 12.3X48-D55, 15.1X49-D90, 17.3R1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10845

Title: Juniper Junos CLNP Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code on the Target System
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted Connectionless Network Protocol (CLNP) packet to a target interface IP address on the target system to cause the kernel to crash or execute arbitrary code.

Systems with 'clns-routing' or ESIS explicitly configured are affected.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system or cause the target kernel to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (15.1F5-S3, 15.1F6-S8, 15.1F7, 15.1R5, 15.1X49-D60, 15.1X53-D66, 15.1X53-D233, 15.1X53-D471, 16.1R1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10844

Title: (Juniper Issues Fix for Juniper Junos) Stunnel Redirect Option Connection Forwarding Flaw Lets Remote Users Bypass Authentication
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Stunnel. A remote user can bypass authentication on the target system. Juniper Junos is affected.
When the redirect option is used, the system forwards connections (other than the initial connection) with the 'connect' specification indicating successful authentcation instead of the 'redirect' specification.

Johan Olofsson reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass authentication on the target system.
Solution:
The Juniper has issued a fix (12.1X46-D76, 12.3X48-D50, 15.1R7, 15.1X49-D100, 16.1R5, 16.2R2, 17.1R2, 17.2R1).

The Juniper advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10852

Title: (Juniper Issues Fix for Juniper Junos) OpenSSL Overflow in rsaz_1024_mul_avx2() Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information in Certain Cases and SSL_read()/SSL_write() Error State Bug May Bypass Decryption/Encryption in Certain Application Dependent Cases
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system in certain cases. A remote user may be able to cause an application to bypass decryption/encryption in certain limited cases. Juniper Junos is affected.
A remote user can exploit an overflow bug in the AVX2 Montgomery multiplication procedure used in exponentiation with 1024-bit moduli to potentially determine information about the private key in certain situations [CVE-2017-3738].

Processors that support the AVX2 but not ADX extensions (e.g., Intel Haswell (4th generation)) are affected.

Attacks against DH1024 may be feasible.

EC algorithms are not affected.

A remote user can invoke a handshake failure to trigger a bug in OpenSSL error handling code for applications that directly make an SSL_read() or SSL_write() call for an SSL object after receiving a fatal error, causing data to bypass the decryption or encryption process [CVE-2017-3737]. Versions 1.0.2b and after are affected.

David Benjamin (Google) reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can potentially determine information about the private key in certain situations.

A remote user may be able to cause an application to bypass decryption/encryption in certain limited cases.
Solution:
The Juniper has issued a fix for JunOS (12.3X48-D70, 14.1R9, 14.1X53-D130, 14.1X53-D47, 15.1R6-S6, 15.1R7, 15.1X49-D130, 15.1X53-D233, 15.1X53-D471, 15.1X53-D59, 15.1X53-D67, 16.1R3-S8, 16.1R5-S4, 16.1R6-S3, 16.2R1-S6, 16.2R2-S5, 17.1R2-S6, 17.2R2-S3, 17.3R3, 17.4R2, 18.1R1).

The Juniper advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10851

Title: Blue Coat ProxySG Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Remote Authenticated Administrators Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks and Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Blue Coat ProxySG. A remote user can cause the target service to crash. A remote authenticated administrator user may be able to cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote authenticated administrator user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
A remote user can send specially crafted HTTP/HTTPS requests to cause the target management console application to crash [CVE-2017-13677]. Version 6.7.4.x is not affected.

The management console interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input [CVE-2017-13678]. A remote authenticated administrator user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Blue Coat ProxySG interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote authenticated administrator user can create and upload a specially crafted file to the management console that, when downloaded and executed by the target administrator user, will execute arbitrary code on the target administrator user's system [CVE-2016-10258]. Version 6.7.4.x is not affected.

Robert Jaroszuk @ RBS Security, Jakub Palaczynski, and Pawel Bartunek reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote authenticated administrator user can create content that, when loaded by the target authenticated administrator user, will execute arbitrary code on the target authenticated administrator user's system.

A remote user can cause the target management console application to crash.

A remote authenticated administrator user can access the target administrator user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Blue Coat ProxySG management console interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (6.5.10.8, 6.6.5.14, 6.7.3.1, 6.7.4.107).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://www.symantec.com/security-center/network-protection-security-advisories/SA162

Title: Cisco 5000 Series ASR Routers StarOS IKEv2 Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service to VPN Tunnels
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in StarOS on Cisco 5000 Series ASR Routers. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted IKEv2 messages to the target system to trigger a flaw in the IPsec Manager and cause all active IPsec VPN tunnels to be terminated and prevent new tunnels from being established.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCve29605 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause all active IPsec VPN tunnels to be terminated and prevent new tunnels from being established.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180418-starosasr

Title: Cisco ASR 5700 Series Router StarOS Packet Length Validation Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in StarOS on Cisco ASR 5700 Series Routers. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
The StarOS egress packet processing does not properly check that the length of packets to be transmitted do not exceed the network card's maximum supported packet length. A remote user can send a specially crafted IP packet or series of specially crafted IP fragments through an interface on the targeted device to cause the network interface to stop forwarding packets.

A manual restart is required to return the system to normal operations.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvf32385 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target interface to stop forwarding packets. A manual restart is required to return the system to normal operations.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (N5.0.4 (21.0.v4), N5.1.9 (21.1.v7), N5.5.0 (21.3.v10)).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180418-staros

Title: Cisco IOS XE on cBR Converged Broadband Routers DHCP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Consume Excessive CPU Resources on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE on cBR Converged Broadband Routers. A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted DHCP packets to a specific segment of the target system to consume excessive CPU resources on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvg73687 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180418-cbr8

Title: Cisco Industrial Ethernet Switch Access Control Flaw in Device Manager Web Interface Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Industrial Ethernet Switch. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.
A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML page or URL that, when loaded by the target authenticated user, will take actions on the target device manager web interface acting as the target user.

The following models are affected:

2000 Series
2000U Series
3000 Series
3010 Series
4000 Series
4010 Series
5000 Series

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvc96405 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can take actions on the target system acting as the target authenticated user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180418-iess

Title: Cisco IOS XR UDP Broadcast Processing Flaw Lets Remote Adjacent Network Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR. A remote user on the local network can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user on the local network can send specially crafted UDP broadcast packets to a target interface that is configured with an IPv4 helper address to trigger a buffer leak in the UDP broadcast forwarding function's Software Packet Path (SPP) on the active Route Processor (RP). As a result, the system may drop some control plane traffic, including routing protocol packets, and may also drop pass-through traffic.

A manual reload is required to return the system to normal operations.

Systems with at least one IPv4 helper address configured on an interface are affected.

DHCP Relay Profile helper addresses and DHCPv6 Relay Service configurations are not affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvi35625 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user on the local network can cause the target system to drop control plane traffic and pass-through traffic.

A manual reload is required to return the system to normal operations.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (6.3.2).

Software maintenance upgrades (SMUs) for Cisco ASR 9000 Series routers are also available:

For 5.3.4:  AA14136
For 6.1.4:  AA14137
For 6.2.3:  AA14138

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180418-iosxr

Title: F5 BIG-IP DNS Lets Remote Users Hijack the Target DNS in Certain Cases
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP DNS. A remote user can hijack the target DNS in certain cases.
On systems where the hostname is a public domain name that the BIG-IP system owner does not control, a remote user may be able to hijack the DNS to cause DNS queries to be redirected to a remote DNS server.

Systems that have a DNS zone that contains an NS resource record configured using the BIG-IP hostname (such as when a wide IP is created for a zone that does not yet exist in the local BIND server) and that are configured to use the local instance of BIND server are affected.

The vendor has assigned ID 712653 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user may be able to cause DNS queries to be redirected to a remote DNS server.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

F5 has described a workaround in their advisory.

The F5 advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/#/article/K32518458

Title: Cisco IOS XE Web Interface Access Control Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges.
The web-based user interface does not properly reset privilege levels for sessions.

A remote authenticated user can access a VTY line to gain the privileges of the previously logged-in user on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvf71769 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can gain the privileges of the previously logged-in user on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180328-xepriv

Title: Cisco IOS/IOS XE Smart Install Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Reload
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS and IOS XE. A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
A remote user can send a specially crafted Smart Install packet to the target device on TCP port 4786 to trigger an input validation flaw and cause the target system to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCvd36820 and CSCvd40673 to this vulnerability.

This vulnerability was found during internal security testing.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180328-smi

Title: Cisco IOS/IOS XE IKE Processing Flaws Let Remote Users Cause the Target System to Reload
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS and IOS XE. A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
A remote user can send specially crafted Internet Key Exchange Version 1 (IKEv1) packets to the target system during an IKE negotiation to trigger an input validation flaw and cause the target system to reload [CVE-2018-0159].

A remote user can send specially crafted IKEv2 packets to the target system to trigger a memory leak and cause the target system to reload [CVE-2018-0158].

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuj73916 and CSCvf22394 to these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisories are available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180328-ike-dos
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180328-ike

Title: (Cisco Issues Fix for Cisco Catalyst Switch) Cisco IOS XE IGMP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users on the Local Network Consume Excessive Buffer Resources
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE. A remote user can consume excessive buffers on the target system. Cisco Catalyst Switch is affected.
A remote user on the local network can send a large number of Internet Group Management Protocol (IGMP) Membership Query packets to consume all available buffers and cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

A manual reload is required to return the system to normal operations.


The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuw09295 and CSCve94496 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

A manual reload is required to return the system to normal operations.
Solution:
The Cisco has issued a fix for Cisco Catalyst Switch.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180328-igmp

Title: Cisco IOS XE Zone-Based Firewall IP Fragment Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Reload
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE. A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
A remote user can send specially crafted fragmented IPv4 or IPv6 packets through the target device to trigger an error in the Zone-Based Firewall function and cause the target device to reload.

The following releases are affected:

Everest-16.4.1
Everest-16.4.2
Everest-16.5.1
Everest-16.5.1b
Everest-16.6.1
Everest-16.6.1a

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvf60296 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180328-fwip

Title: Cisco IOS XE IGMP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users on the Local Network Consume Excessive Buffer Resources
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE. A remote user can consume excessive buffers on the target system.
A remote user on the local network can send a large number of Internet Group Management Protocol (IGMP) Membership Query packets to consume all available buffers and cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

A manual reload is required to return the system to normal operations.


The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuw09295 and CSCve94496 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

A manual reload is required to return the system to normal operations.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180328-igmp

Title: Cisco IOS/IOS XE DHCP Option 82 Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Cause the Target System to Reload
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS and IOS XE. A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
A remote DHCP relay agent can return DHCPv4 packets with specially crafted DHCP option 82 data to trigger a heap overflow and cause the target system to reload [CVE-2018-0172].

A remote DHCP server can return DHCPv4 DHCPOFFER messages with specially crafted DHCP option 82 data to trigger an error and cause the target system to reload [CVE-2018-0173].

A remote DHCP relay agent can return DHCPv4 packets with specially crafted DHCP option 82 data to trigger an input validation flaw and cause the target system to reload [CVE-2018-0174].

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCvg62730, CSCvg62754, and CSCuh91645 to these vulnerabilities.

Tenable reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisories are available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180328-dhcpr1
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180328-dhcpr2
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180328-dhcpr3

Title: Cisco IOS XE Umbrella Integration Memory Free Error Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Reload
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE. A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
A remote user can send specially crafted IP packets to the target device to trigger a freed memory access error in the Cisco Umbrella Integration feature and cause the target system to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvb86327 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180328-opendns-dos

Title: Cisco Catalyst 2960-L and Digital Building Series SNMP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Cause the Target System to Reload
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Catalyst 2960-L and Digital Building Series switches. A remote authenticated user can cause the target system to reload.
A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted SNMP request for the ciscoFlashMIB object ID (OID) to trigger a SYS-3-CPUHOG error condition and cause the target system to restart.

The following models are affected:

Catalyst 2960-L Series Switches

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvd89541 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target system to restart.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180328-snmp

Title: Cisco Catalyst 3850 and 3650 Series Switches IPv4 Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Consume Excessive CPU Resources on the Target System
Version(s): 3850 and 3650 Series Switches; IOS XE 16.1.1 and after
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Catalyst Switch. A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted IPv4 packets to an IPv4 address on the target device to consume excessive CPU resources or generate traceback messages on the target system or cause the target system to reload.

If the device does not reboot automatically, a manual reboot is required to return the system to normal operations.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvd80714 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources or generate traceback messages on the target system or cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180328-ipv4

Title: Cisco Catalyst 4500 and 4500-X Series Switches Bidirectional Forwarding Detection Error Handling Bug Lets Remote Users Cause the Target 'iosd' Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Catalyst Switch. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can send a specially crafted Bidirectional Forwarding Detection (BFD) packet to or through the target device to trigger an error handling flaw and cause the target 'iosd' process to crash and the system to reload.

The following models are affected when the BFD feature is enabled:

Catalyst 4500 Supervisor Engine 6-E (K5)
Catalyst 4500 Supervisor Engine 6L-E (K10)
Catalyst 4500 Supervisor Engine 7-E (K10)
Catalyst 4500 Supervisor Engine 7L-E (K10)
Catalyst 4500E Supervisor Engine 8-E (K10)
Catalyst 4500E Supervisor Engine 8L-E (K10)
Catalyst 4500E Supervisor Engine 9-E (K10) 
Catalyst 4500-X Series Switches (K10)
Catalyst 4900M Switch (K5)
Catalyst 4948E Ethernet Switch (K5) 

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvc40729 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180328-bfd

Title: Cisco IOS/IOS XE/IOS XR Link Layer Discovery Protocol Bugs Let Remote Users on the Local Network Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS, IOS XE, and IOS XR. A remote user can gain elevated privileges.
A remote authenticated user on the local network can send a specially crafted Link Layer Discovery Protocol (LLDP) data unit (PDU) to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges on the target system [CVE-2018-0167].

A remote authenticated user on the local network can send a specially crafted LLDP PDU that, when a local user executes a specific show command via the command line interface, will trigger a format string error and execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges on the target system [CVE-2018-0175].

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuo17183, CSCvd73487, and CSCvd73664 to these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user on the local network can gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180328-lldp

Title: Cisco IOS Integrated Services Module for VPN Unspecified Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS Integrated Services Module for VPN (ISM-VPN). A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
A remote user can send specially crafted VPN traffic to the target device to cause the target device to hang or crash.

Systems with ISM-VPN installed are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvd39267 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to hang or crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180328-dos

Title: Cisco IOS XE SNMP Memory Management Error Lets Remote Authenticated Users Cause the Target System to Reload
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE. A remote authenticated user can cause the target system to reload.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted SNMP packets to the target device to trigger a memory resource management error and cause the device to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCve75818 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180328-snmp-dos

Title: Cisco IOS XE Command Line Interface Validation Bugs Let Local Users Obtain Root Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS XE. A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
A local user with user EXEC mode privileges (level 1 privileges) can send command line interface commands with specially crafted arguments to execute arbitrary commands on the underlying operating system with root privileges.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCtw85441, CSCtw85441CSCus42252, CSCus42252CSCuv95370, and CSCuv95370 to these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180328-privesc1

Title: Cisco IOS/IOS XE QoS Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS and IOS XE. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to UDP port 18999 on the target system to trigger a buffer overflow in the quality of service (QoS) subsystem and execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges on the target system.

Traffic transiting a device is not an attack vector.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvf73881 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180328-qos

Title: Cisco IOS/IOS XE Buffer Overflow in Processing Smart Install Packets Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS and IOS XE. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted Smart Install message to TCP port 4786 to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.

Systems that have the Smart Install client feature enabled are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCvd36820 and CSCvg76186 to this vulnerability.

[Editor's note: On April 9, 2018, the vendor clarified that this vulnerability is not being actively exploited. However, the vendor also reported that a general "protocol misuse issue" in the Cisco Smart Install Client is being actively exploited on systems that have the feature enabled, not specific to any individual vulnerability in the Smart Install feature.]

George Nosenko (via GeekPwn) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180328-smi2

[Editor's note: On April 9, 2018, the vendor advised that action is required to secure the Smart Install feature and issued an additional informational advisory, available at:  https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180409-smi]

Title: Cisco IOS XE Default Credentials Let Remote Users Access the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE. A remote user can gain access to the target system.
The system includes an undocumented user account with a default username and password. A remote user can use these credentials to gain access to the target system with level 15 privileges.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCve89880 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain access to the target system with level 15 privileges.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

As a workaround, the 'no username cisco' command can be applied in the device configuration to remove the account, or the password for the 'cisco' user account can be changed.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180328-xesc

Title: F5 BIG-IP Unspecified Flaw in Traffic Management Operating System (TMOS) Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted traffic to trigger a flaw in the Traffic Management Operating System (TMOS) and cause the target Traffic Management Microkernel (TMM) to crash.

Systems with a virtual server in a specific and uncommon configuration are affected.

Systems with a virtual server configured to process non-TCP protocols, use a fastL4 Protocol profile, and use the Hash persistence, HTTP, and/or FIX profile types are affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
F5 has issued a fix that prevents the vulnerable configuration from being applied (12.1.3.2, 13.1.0).

The F5 advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/#/article/K49440608

Title: F5 BIG-IP Client SSL Certificate Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Reload
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
A remote user can send a specially crafted client certificate to trigger a flaw in the target virtual servers associated with Client SSL profile and cause the target Traffic Management Microkernel (TMM) to restart.

The control plane is not affected.

The vendor has assigned ID 699012 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target TMM kernel to restart.
Solution:
F5 has issued a fix (13.1.0.4).

The F5 advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/#/article/K43121447

Title: F5 BIG-IP Policy Enforcement Manager (PEM) Content Insertion Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP PEM. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted page that, when processed via a virtual server with an associated policy enforcement manager (PEM) policy that has a content insertion action, will cause the target Traffic Management Microkernel (TMM) to restart.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
F5 has issued a fix (12.1.3.2, 13.1.0.4).

The F5 advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/#/article/K54562183

Title: F5 BIG-IP ASM and BIG-IP Analytics DNS Profile Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP ASM and BIG-IP Analytics. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
When BIG-IP ASM and BIG-IP Analytics are both provisioned and when the virtual server is configured with a DNS procotol and the Protocol setting is set to 'TCP', a remote user can cause the target Traffic Management Microkernel (TMM) to restart while processing DNS requests.

Virtual servers configured with the Protocols setting set to 'UDP' are not affected.

The vendor has assigned IDs 703517 and ID 705161 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target TMM to restart.
Solution:
F5 has issued a fix (ASM and Analytics 13.1.0.4).

The F5 advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/#/article/K23520761

Title: F5 BIG-IP TMM WebSocket Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code on the Target System
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted WebSocket packet to cause the target Traffic Management Microkernel (TMM) to execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
F5 has issued a fix (12.1.3.2, 13.1.0.4).

The F5 advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K11718033

Title: Cisco ASR 5000 Series Router StartOS CLI Input Validation Flaws Let Local Users Obtain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco ASR 5000 Series Routers. A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
A local user with administrator privileges can supply specially crafted command line interface (CLI) command arguments to exploit an input validation flaw in the Cisco StarOS operating system and execute arbitrary commands on the target system [CVE-2018-0217, CVE-2018-0224].

CVE-2018-0224 can be exploited to obtain root privileges.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCvg29441 and CSCvg38807 to these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A local administrative user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisories are available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180307-staros
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180307-staros1

Title: Cisco IOS/IOS XE Input Validation Bug in Diagnostic Shell Lets Local Users Overwrite System Files on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS/IOS XE. A local user can overwrite system files on the target system.
A local user on the diagnostic shell can supply specially crafted diagnostic shell commands to exploit an input validation flaw and overwrite ostensibly restricted system files.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvg41950 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can overwrite system files on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (16.8(0.99)).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180207-ios

Title: Cisco Small Business RV132W/RV134W Routers Let Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information Including Passwords
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Small Business RV132W/RV134W routers. A remote user can obtain the administrator password on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
Certain web interface pages do not require authentication to access. A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP request to view potentially sensitive configuration  parameters, including the administrator password.


The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCvg92739 and CSCvh60172 to this vulnerability.

An independent security researcher (via Beyond Security's SecuriTeam Secure Disclosure program) reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can obtain the administrator password on the target system.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive configuration parameter information on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180207-rv13x_2

Title: Cisco IOS XR Routing Update Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
The system does not properly process extremely long routing updates. A remote user can send a large routing update to trigger an inconsistency between the forwarding information base (FIB) and the routing information base (RIB) and cause denial of service conditions.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCus84718 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180207-iosxr

Title: Cisco ASR 5000 Series Router CLI Input Validation Flaw Lets Local Users Overwrite Files in Flash Memory on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASR 5000 Series Router. A local user can overwrite files on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvf93335 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local administrator user can overwrite files in flash memory on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180207-asr

Title: Cisco Small Business RV132W/RV134W Routers Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code on the Target System
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Small Business RV132W/RV134W routers. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP request to the target system to exploit an input validation flaw and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with root privileges.

The Cisco RV132W ADSL2+ Wireless-N VPN and RV134W VDSL2 Wireless-AC VPN Routers are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCvg92737 and CSCvh60170 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code with root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180207-rv13x

Title: F5 BIG-IP Policy Enforcement Manager (PEM) URL Categorization Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted URLs to trigger a flaw in the Policy Enforcement Manager (PEM) URL categorization process and disrupt traffic processing or cause the target virtual system to fail.

Systems with PEM provisioned and using the URL categorization feature via an iRule, a Centralized Policy Matching (CPM) rule, or a BIG-IP PEM policy are affected.

The vendor has assigned ID 648786 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can disrupt traffic processing or cause the target virtual system to fail.
Solution:
F5 has issued a fix (BIG-IP PEM 11.6.3, 12.1.3.1, 13.0.0 HF1, 13.1.0).

The F5 advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/#/article/K31404801

Title: Cisco ASR 9000 Series Router IOS XR IPv6 Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Reload
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASR 9000 Series Router. A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
A remote user can send specially crafted IPv6 packets with a fragment header extension to or through the target Trident-based line card to cause the line card to reload.

Systems with Trident-based line cards that have IPv6 configured are affected.

The following Trident-based line cards are affected:

A9K-40GE-L
A9K-40GE-B
A9K-40GE-E
A9K-4T-L
A9K-4T-B
A9K-4T-E
A9K-8T/4-L
A9K-8T/4-B
A9K-8T/4-E
A9K-2T20GE-L
A9K-2T20GE-B
A9K-2T20GE-E
A9K-8T-L
A9K-8T-B
A9K-8T-E
A9K-16/8T-B

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvg46800 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target line card to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Service Pack 7 for Cisco IOS XR Software Release 5.3.4).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180131-ipv6

Title: ASUS RT-N10 Router Series Input Validation Flaws in 'apply.cgi' Let Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Request Forgery and Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): RT-N10, RT-N10E, RT-N10LX, and RT-N10U; firmware version 1.9.2.7 on RT-N10; possibly other models and versions
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in ASUS Routers. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the ASUS Router interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The 'current_page' and 'next_host' parameters of 'apply.cgi' are affected.

Some demonstration exploit URLs are provided:

http://[target]/apply.cgi?current_page=%22%3E%3Cbody%20onload=alert%28document.cookie%29%3E

http://[target]/apply.cgi?next_host=%22%3E%3Cbody%20onload=alert%28document.cookie%29%3E

A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML page or URL that, when loaded by the target authenticated user, will take actions on the target interface acting as the target user.

Some demonstration exploit URLs (to change the admin account password) are provided:

http://[target]/apply.cgi?action_mode=+Save+&next_page=SaveRestart.asp&sid_list=General%3B&http_passwd=admin&v_password=admin&action=Save

http://[target]/apply.cgi?action_mode=Save%26Restart+&next_page=Restarting.asp&sid_list=General%3B&action=Save%26Restart

The original advisory is available at:

http://websecurity.com.ua/8267/

MustLive reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can take actions on the target system acting as the target authenticated user.

A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the ASUS Router interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: (Brocade Communications Systems Issues Fix for Brocade vADX) Intel/AMD/ARM CPU Data Cache Race Conditions Let Local Users Read Arbitrary Virtual CPU Memory
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Intel, AMD, and ARM CPUs. A local user can read arbitrary virtual memory on the target CPU device. Brocade virtual ADX (vADX) is affected.
A local user can exploit race conditions in CPU data cache processing to obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system. This can be exploited to read arbitrary virtual memory on the target system, including by a local user on a guest operating system of a virtual machine to read arbitrary memory from other guest systems, the host operating system, and the hypervisor.

In certain cases, a local user can run a specially crafted application to exploit several flaws in the CPU speculative branch instruction execution feature and leverage CPU data cache timing behavior to infer information or read information from various CPU caches.

A local user that can trigger an out-of-bounds index error in an application can read data from another process from the CPU virtual memory [CVE-2017-5753]. The eBPF interpreter or the eBPF JIT engine can be used to create vulnerable code.

A local user can run specially crafted code to cause the CPU to speculatively execute an indirect branch to leak memory contents from another process into a CPU cache and then read the contents of the cache [CVE-2017-5715].

A local user can run specially crafted code to cause the CPU to read memory from a CPU cache before an asynchronous permission check occurs [CVE-2017-5754]. AMD CPUs are reportedly not affected.

The Intel Core, Xeon, Atom, Celeron, and Pentium product lines are affected.

CPUs from AMD and ARM are also affected.

CPUs from other vendors may also affected.

The CVE-2017-5753 and CVE-2017-5715 vulnerabilities are referred to as "Spectre".

The CVE-2017-5754 vulnerability is referred to as "Meltdown".

The original advisories are available at:

https://spectreattack.com/spectre.pdf
https://meltdownattack.com/meltdown.pdf
https://googleprojectzero.blogspot.com/2018/01/reading-privileged-memory-with-side.html

Paul Kocher, Daniel Genkin, Daniel Gruss, Werner Haas, Mike Hamburg, Moritz Lipp, Stefan Mangard, Thomas Prescher, Michael Schwarz, Yuval Yarom, Anders Fogh, Jann Horn, the Google Project Zero Team, and others reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A local user can view arbitrary virtual memory contents on the target CPU device [which can lead to elevated privileges on the target system].
Solution:
The Brocade Communications Systems advisory is available at:

http://www.brocade.com/content/dam/common/documents/content-types/security-bulletin/brocade-security-advisory-2018-522.htm

Title: F5 BIG-IP Advanced Firewall Manager Certificate Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users That Can Conduct a Man-in-the-Middle Attack Access and Modify IP Intelligence Policy Data Communicated By the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP Advanced Firewall Manager (AFM). A remote user can access and modify data communicated by the target system.
The early access 'user id' feature does not properly validate the remote server's X.509 certificate. A remote user that can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can access and modify IP Intelligence (IPI) policy enforcement data communicated between the remote server and the target Advanced Firewall Manager.

The vendor has assigned ID 627747 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user that can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can access and modify IPI policy data communicated by the target system.
Solution:
F5 has issued a fix (AFM 11.6.3, 12.1.2 HF1, 12.1.3, 13.0.0 HF1, 13.1.0).

The F5 advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/#/article/K20682450

Title: Cisco NX-OS RBAC Bug Lets Certain Local Users Bypass Access Controls to Delete Other User Accounts
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A local user can bypass security restrictions.
A local user with network-operator role privileges can bypass role-based access control (RBAC) checks and delete other user accounts on on the target system.

The following Nexus switches are affected:

3000 Series
3600 Platform
9000 Series, in standalone NX-OS mode
9500 R-Series Line Cards and Fabric Modules

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvg21120 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user with network-operator role privileges can delete other user accounts on on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20180117-nxos1

Title: Cisco NX-OS Management Interace ACL Configuration Error Lets Remote Users Consume Excessive CPU Resources on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources on the target system.
