Systems with the HTTP Server feature enabled are affected.

The vulnerability was introduced in version 16.2.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuz46036 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass authentication and gain access to the web user interface REST API.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170927-restapi

Title: Cisco IOS XE Web User Interface Default Permissions Error Lets Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges.
The web user interface creates new user accounts with incorrect permissions. A remote authenticated user can create a new user account and then login to the new user account to gain elevated privileges on the target system.

Systems with the HTTP Server feature enabled are affected.

The vulnerability was introduced in version 16.2.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuy83062 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170927-privesc

Title: Cisco IOS/IOS XE Buffer Overflow in DHCP Relay Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS/IOS XE. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted DHCPv4 packet to trigger a buffer overflow in the DHCP relay subsystem and execute arbitrary code on the target system. This can be exploited to gain full control of the target system.

Systems configured for DHCP relay are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCsm45390 and CSCuw77959 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170927-dhcp

Title: Cisco IOS/IOS XE IPv6 SNMP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS/IOS XE. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can send specially SNMP data to trigger a flaw in the processing of IPv6 packets and consume excessive CPU resources on the target system or cause the target device to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvb14640 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can consume excessive CPU resources on the target system or cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170906-snmp

Title: Cisco IOS/IOS XE UDP Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS/IOS XE. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted UDP packets to destination port 0 to trigger an interface queue wedge.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCup10024, CSCva55744, and CSCva95506 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can trigger an interface queue wedge on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170906-ios-udp

Title: Cisco Catalyst 4000 Series Switch Dynamic ACL Bug Lets Remote Users Bypass Port Access Controls on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Catalyst 4000 Series Switch. A remote user can bypass access controls on the target system.
A remote user on the local network can trigger an error condition in the reassignment of the auth-default-ACL dynamic access control list (ACL) to a switch port to cause the port to fail in the open condition. As a result, the remote user can pass traffic to the default VLAN for the affected switch port.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvc72751 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the local network can bypass port access controls on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170906-cat

Title: Cisco IOS XE on ASR 920 Series Router Input Validation Flaw in USB Modem Command Lets Local Users Overwrite Files on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE on ASR 920 Series Routers. A local user can overwrite files on the target system.
A local user can supply a specially crafted USB modem command to exploit an input validation flaw and overwrite arbitrary files on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvf10783 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can overwrite arbitrary files on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170906-asr920-2

Title: Cisco IOS XE on ASR 920 Series Routers Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE on ASR 920 Series Routers. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can supply a specially crafted USB modem command to exploit an input validation flaw and execute arbitrary commands on the target underlying operating system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCve48949 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can execute arbitrary commands on the target underlying operating system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170906-asr920-1

Title: Cisco ASR 5500 Series SAE Gateways GPRS Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Restart
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASR 5500 Series System Architecture Evolution (SAE) Gateways. A remote user can cause the target service to restart.
A remote user can send specially crafted General Packet Radio Service (GPRS) Tunneling Protocol packet headers to trigger an input validation flaw and cause the target GTPUMGR process to restart, affecting traffic processing while the process restarts.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCve07119 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target GTPUMGR process to restart.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170906-asr

Title: Cisco IR800 Integrated Services Routers Input Validation Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IR800 Integrated Services Routers. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user on the router console can enter ROMMON mode and modify ROMMON variables to exploit an input validation flaw and execute arbitrary code and boot an unsigned hypervisor.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvb44027 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170906-isr

Title: Cisco Small Business RV340/RV345/RV345P Router Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Small Business RV Series. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP request to the target web interface of the Cisco RV340, RV345, and RV345P Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Routers to view potentially sensitive information on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCve37988 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170816-crr

Title: Cisco StarOS for ASR 5000 Series Routers Incorrect User Permissions Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco StarOS for Cisco ASR 5000 Series Routers. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
The system sets incorrect permissions for certain users. A local user can modify environment variables to gain admin-level privileges on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvd47741 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain admin-level privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170816-staros3

Title: Cisco StarOS for ASR 5000 Series Routers FTP-Accessible System Files Let Remote Authenticated Users Overwrite or Modify Sensitive System Files
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco StarOS for Cisco ASR 5000 Series Routers. A remote authenticated user can overwrite or modify certain files on the target system.
The system contains sensitive system files that are located within specific FTP subdirectories. A remote authenticated user can use FTP to overwrite or modify the files.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvd47739 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can overwrite or modify certain sensitive system files on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170816-staros2

Title: Cisco StarOS for ASR 5000 Series Routers CLI Input Validation Flaw Lets Local Users Bypass Security Restrictions
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco StarOS for Cisco ASR 5000 Series Routers. A local user can bypass security restrictions.
A local user can exploit an input validation flaw in the command line interface (CLI) to bypass security controls and execute commands on the underlying operating system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvd47722 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can bypass security controls and execute operating system commands on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170816-staros1

Title: F5 BIG-IP Edge Client Keep-Alive Bug Lets Remote Users Obtain Session IDs in Certain Cases
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP Edge Client. A remote user can obtain session IDs in certain cases.
The system includes the current session ID in the request URI when issuing Keep-Alive requests via SSL. A remote user in a trusted network position (e.g., SSL terminating proxy that logs the URIs) can obtain the session ID.

The vendor has assigned ID 598419 to this vulnerability.

Edge Client for Mac is not affected.
Impact': A remote user can obtain session IDs in certain cases.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Edge Client for Windows 7136.x).

No solution was available at the time of this entry for Edge Client for iOS.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K06635145

Title: Cisco IOS/XE OSPF Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Modify the OSPF LSA Database to Take Control of the Target Autonomous System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS and IOS XE. A remote user can modify the OSPF LSA database to take full control of the target Autonomous System.
A remote user can send a specially crafted Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) Link State Advertisement (LSA) type 1 packet from a valid or spoofed address to the target system's OSPF multicast address or to an OSPF-enabled interface on the target system to flush the routing table on the target system and inject arbitrary routes. This can be exploited to establish false routes and route traffic to a black hole or to an arbitrary destination.

The remote user must know or guess certain parameters of the target system to exploit this vulnerability, such as IP addresse, LSA DB sequence numbers, and the router ID of the OSPF Designated Router.

OSPFv3 and FSPF are not affected by this vulnerability.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCva74756 to this vulnerability.

Dr. Gabi Nakibly from Rafael Advanced Defense Systems reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can modify the routing table and take full control of the target Autonomous System.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170727-ospf

Title: Cisco Nexus 7000 Series Switches OSPF Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Modify the OSPF LSA Database to Take Control of the Target Autonomous System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Nexus 7000 Series Switches. A remote user can modify the OSPF LSA database to take full control of the target Autonomous System.
A remote user can send a specially crafted Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) Link State Advertisement (LSA) type 1 packet from a valid or spoofed address to the target system's OSPF multicast address or to an OSPF-enabled interface on the target system to flush the routing table on the target system and inject arbitrary routes. This can be exploited to establish false routes and route traffic to a black hole or to an arbitrary destination.

The remote user must know or guess certain parameters of the target system to exploit this vulnerability, such as IP addresse, LSA DB sequence numbers, and the router ID of the OSPF Designated Router.

OSPFv3 and FSPF are not affected by this vulnerability.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCve47401 to this vulnerability.

Dr. Gabi Nakibly from Rafael Advanced Defense Systems reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can modify the routing table and take full control of the target Autonomous System.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170727-ospf

Title: Cisco IOS/IOS XE Autonomic Networking Bug Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Reload
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS and IOS XE. A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
A remote user on the local network can replay captured packets to cause the target Autonomic Control Plane (ACP) channel to reset and the target device to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvd88936 to this vulnerability.

Omar Eissa of ERNW (at Black Hat USA 2017) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170726-anidos

Title: Cisco IOS/IOS XE Autonomic Networking Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS and IOS XE. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
A remote user on the local network can replay captured packets to cause the target Autonomic Control Plane (ACP) to reset and can view potentially sensitive information in ACP packets that are transferred in clear text within the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvd51214 to this vulnerability.

Omar Eissa of ERNW (at Black Hat USA 2017) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170726-aniacp

Title: Cisco IOS/IOS XE Autonomic Networking Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Bypass the Certificate Revocation List
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS and IOS XE. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.
The system does not transfer certificate revocation lists (CRLs) across Autonomic Control Plane (ACP) channels. A remote user can bypass the CRL checks and access resources on the target Autonomic Networking infrastructure after the certificate has been revoked.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvd22328 to this vulnerability.

Omar Eissa of ERNW (at Black Hat USA 2017) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass the certificate revocation list check to access resources on the target network.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170726-anicrl

Title: Cisco ASR 5000 Series Router Lets Remote Users Bypass Security Restrictions on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASR 5000 Series Routers. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted HTTP packets to the target device to bypass access control lists (ACLs) for the target device.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCvb99022, CSCvc16964, CSCvc37351, CSCvc54843, CSCvc63444, CSCvc77815, CSCvc88658, CSCve08955, CSCve14141, and CSCve33870 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass access control lists on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170719-asr1

Title: Cisco ASR 5000 Series Router Packet Validation Flaw in Gateway GPRS Support Lets Remote Users Redirect Traffic
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASR 5000 Series Routers. A remote user can redirect packets to other hosts.
A remote user can send specially crafted HTTP packets with additional bytes at the end of the packets to the target device to trigger a packet validation flaw in the gateway GPRS support node (GGSN) and redirect traffic to other hosts.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvc67927 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can redirect packets to other hosts.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170719-asr

Title: Juniper Junos Default Credentials in SRX Series Integrated User Firewall Lets Remote Users Access the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos on SRX Series devices. A remote user can gain access to the target system.
The Integrated User Firewall feature includes hardcoded authentication credentials. A remote user can access the target system and gain full control of the target system. This can potentially be exploited to gain full control of other vulnerable SRX Series devices in the same environment and Active Directory servers and services.

The vendor has assigned PR 1171966 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain access to and full control of the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.3X48-D35, 15.1X49-D50).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10791

Title: Juniper Junos Configuration Error Lets Remote Users Bypass Authentication and Access the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can bypass authentication.
On systems with a specific device configuration error, a remote user can bypass password-based authentication to gain access on the target system.

The vendor has assigned PR 1075580 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass authentication to gain access on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.3R10, 12.3R11, 12.3X48-D20, 13.2R8, 13.3R7, 14.1R4-S12, 14.1R5, 14.1R6, 14.1X53-D30, 14.2R4, 15.1F2, 15.1F3, 15.1R2, 15.1X49-D10, 16.1R1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10802

Title: Juniper Junos Command Line Interface XML Injection Bug Lets Local Users Obtain Root Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
A local user can inject XML data via the command line interface (CLI) to execute arbitrary commands on the target system with root privileges.

The vendor has assigned PR 1091037 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (15.1X53-D47, 15.1R3).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10805

Title: Juniper Junos Buffer Overflow in Command Line Interface Lets Local Users Obtain Root Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
A local user with read only privileges can trigger a buffer overflow in the command line interface (CLI) to execute arbitrary code on the target system with root privileges.

The vendor has assigned PR 1149652 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (14.2R6, 15.1F5, 15.1F6, 15.1R3, 15.1X49-D40, 15.1X53-D47, 15.1X53-D70, 16.1R1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10803

Title: Juniper Junos IPv6 UDP Packet Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Consume Excessive CPU Resources on the Target System or Cause the jdhcpd Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources on the target system or cause the target jdhcpd service to crash.
A remote user can send a specially crafted IPv6 UDP packet to cause the target Juniper Enhanced jdhcpd daemon to consume excessive CPU resources on the target system or crash and restart.

Systems with jdhcpd service enabled are affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 1119019 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources on the target system or cause the target jdhcpd service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (14.1X53-D12, 14.1X53-D38, 14.1X53-D40, 15.1F2-S18, 15.1R4, 15.1X49-D80, 15.1X53-D51, 15.1X53-D60, 16.1R1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10800

Title: Juniper Junos on SRX Series Devices Lets Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos on SRX Series devices. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges.
A remote authenticated user can trigger a command injection flaw in the IDP feature to execute shell commands and gain elevated privileges on the target system.

The vendor has assigned PR 1091623 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.1X44-D60, 12.1X47-D30, 12.1X47-D35, 12.3X48-D20, 12.3X48-D30, 15.1X49-D20, 15.1X49-D30, 12.1X46-D50).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10801

Title: (Juniper Issues Fix for Juniper Junos) BIND RPZ and DNS64 State Error Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in BIND. A remote user can cause the target service to crash in certain cases. Juniper Junos is affected.
A remote user can trigger a state error in query processing and cause the target service to crash.

Some configurations using both Response Policy Zones (RPZ) and DNS64 to rewrite query responses are affected.

Ramesh Damodaran (Infoblox) and Aliaksandr Shubnik (Infoblox) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The Juniper has issued a fix for Juniper Junos (12.1X46-D67, 12.3X48-D50, 15.1X49-D80, 17.2R1).

The Juniper advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10799

Title: Juniper Junos Buffer Overflow in Internal Sockets Library Lets Local Users Deny Service or Obtain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can that can run a specially crafted application on the target system can trigger a buffer overflow in an internal Junos OS sockets library and cause a kernel panic or cause arbitrary code to be executed with elevated privileges.

[Editor's note: The vendor indicates that there are no known exploit methods using signed binaries that ship with the product. The vendor also indicates that 'veriexec' restricts arbitrary binaries from running on the device.]

The vendor has assigned PR 1282562 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

Title: Juniper Junos on MX Series Routers Fragmented Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can send specially crafted large fragmented packets through an Application Layer Gateway (ALG) to cause the target MS-MPC or MS-MIC Service PIC to crash.

Systems with NAT or stateful-firewall rules configured with ALGs enabled are affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 1214134 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (14.1X55-D35, 14.2R7-S4, 14.2R8, 15.1R5-S2, 15.1R6, 16.1R3-S2, 16.1R4).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10794

Title: (Juniper Issues Fix for Juniper Junos) GD Library Heap Overflow in Processing Files Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in GD Library (libgd). A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target system. Juniper Junos is affected.
A remote user can create a file containing specially crafted compressed gd2 data that, when loaded by the target application, will trigger a signedness error and resulting heap overflow to execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target application.

Hans Jerry Illikainen reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The Juniper has issued a fix for Juniper Junos (12.1X46-D65, 12.3X48-D40, 12.3X48-D45, 14.2R8, 15.1F7, 15.1R5, 15.1X49-D70, 15.1X53-D47, 16.1R4, 16.2R2, 17.1R1).

The Juniper advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10798

Title: Juniper Junos Virtualized Environment Authentication Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges on the Host System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A local user on a virtualized instance can gain elevated privileges on the host system.
A local user can exploit an authentication flaw to gain elevated privileges on the host system.

Junos OS instances run in a virtualized environment are affected.

Systems with FIPS mode enabled are not affected.

vMX is not affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 1161762 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user on the virtualized system can gain elevated privileges on the host system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (14.1X53-D40, 15.1R5, 15.1X49-D70, 16.1R2).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10787

Title: Juniper Junos MPLS Ping Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user on the local network can send a specially crafted MPLS ping packet to cause the target rpd daemon to crash.

Systems with MPLS OAM configured are affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 1204027 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.

Title: Juniper Junos DHCP Processing Bug on vSRX and SRX Series Devices Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can send a specially crafted packet to cause the target flowd process to crash. As a result, traffic flowing through the target device will be interrupted.

vSRX and SRX Series devices configured with DHCP or DHCP relay are affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 1270493 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash, interrupting traffic flowing through the target device.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.1x46-D67, 12.3X48-D55, 15.1X49-D91, 15.1X49-D100).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10789

Title: Juniper Junos SRX300 Series MACsec Non-Secure Fallback Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos on SRX300 Series devices. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
When MACsec is configured on a port that is not capable of MACsec or when a secure link can not be established, the system falls back to an unencrypted link without notice. A remote user that can monitor the network can view potentially sensitive information on the target link.

SRX300 series devices are affected.

The vendor has assigned PRs 1244795 and 1261983 to this vulnerability.

Eric Haszlakiewicz and Thor Simon of Two Sigma Investments, LP reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information from the target unencrypted link.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (15.1X49-D100).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10790

Title: Juniper Junos BGP OPEN Message Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can send a specially crafted BGP OPEN message to cause the target routing protocol daemon (rpd) process to crash and restart.

Systems with BGP enabled are affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 1159781 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.3R12-S4, 12.3R13, 12.3R3-S4, 12.3X48-D50, 13.3R10, 13.3R4-S11, 14.1R8-S3, 14.1R9, 14.1X53-D40, 14.1X55-D35, 14.2R4-S7, 14.2R6-S4, 14.2R7, 15.1F2-S11, 15.1F4-S1-J1, 15.1F5-S3, 15.1F6, 15.1R4, 15.1X49-D100, 15.1X53-D33, 15.1X53-D50, 16.1R1, 16.2R1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10779

Title: Juniper Junos SRX Series Cluster Mode Account Lockout Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
On SRX Series systems in cluster mode that are configured to perform account lockout with a defined period of time, a remote user can attempt to login to the root account with an incorrect password to trigger a lockout of the root account. As a result, if a cluster sync or failover operation occurs during the lockout, errors may occur.

The vendor has assigned PR 1222250 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.1X46-D65, 12.3X48-D45, 15.1X49-D75).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10806

Title: (Juniper Issues Fix for Juniper Junos J-Web) PHP Double Free Error in Zend zend_ts_hash_graceful_destroy() Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in PHP. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. Juniper Junos J-Web is affected.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a double free memory error in the zend_ts_hash_graceful_destroy() function in 'zend_ts_hash.c' to cause denial of service conditions.

bugreports at internot dot info reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The Juniper has issued a fix for Juniper Junos J-Web (12.1X46-D65, 12.1X47-D40, 12.1X47-D45, 12.3R12-S5, 12.3X48-D35, 14.2R8, 15.1R4, 15.1X49-D50, 16.1R1, 16.1R1, 16.1R2).

The Juniper advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10804

Title: (Juniper Issues Fix for Juniper Junos J-Web) PHP OpenSSL Memory Corruption Flaw in openssl_x509_parse() Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in PHP. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. Juniper Junos J-Web is affected.
A remote user can send a specially crafted certificate to trigger a memory corruption flaw in openssl_x509_parse() and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target PHP application.

Stefan Esser reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The Juniper has issued a fix for Juniper Junos J-Web (12.1X46-D65, 12.1X47-D40, 12.1X47-D45, 12.3R12-S5, 12.3X48-D35, 14.2R8, 15.1R4, 15.1X49-D50, 16.1R1, 16.1R1, 16.1R2).

The Juniper advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10804

Title: (Juniper Issues Fix for Juniper Junos J-Web) PHP Heap Overflow in xml_parse_into_struct() Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in PHP. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. Juniper Junos J-Web is affected.
A remote user can send specially crafted nested XML to trigger a heap overflow in xml_parse_into_struct() and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.

A demonstration exploit is provided:

xml_parse_into_struct(xml_parser_create_ns(), str_repeat("<blah>", 1000), $a);
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The Juniper has issued a fix for Juniper Junos J-Web (12.1X46-D65, 12.1X47-D40, 12.1X47-D45, 12.3R12-S5, 12.3X48-D35, 14.2R8, 15.1R4, 15.1X49-D50, 16.1R1, 16.1R1, 16.1R2).

The Juniper advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10804

Title: (Juniper Issues Fix for Juniper Junos J-Web) PHP SQLite Bug Lets Users Bypass open_basedir Restrictions
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in PHP. A remote or local user can bypass security restrictions. Juniper Junos J-Web is affected.
A user can exploit an unspecified flaw in SQLite to bypass the open_basedir restrictions.
Impact': A user can bypass the open_basedir restrictions.
Solution:
The Juniper has issued a fix for Juniper Junos J-Web (12.1X46-D65, 12.1X47-D40, 12.1X47-D45, 12.3R12-S5, 12.3X48-D35, 14.2R8, 15.1R4, 15.1X49-D50, 16.1R1, 16.1R1, 16.1R2).

The Juniper advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10804

Title: Cisco IOS XR Permissions Error Lets Local Users Obtain Root Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR. A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
A local user can exploit a user permissions error via the command line interface to oexecute arbitrary code on the target system with root privileges.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvb99389 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170705-ios

Title: Cisco IOS XR MSDP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Restart
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR. A remote user can cause the target service to restart.
A remote user can send a specially crafted ulticast Source Discovery Protocol (MSDP) packet for an established MSDP session to trigger an error handling bug and cause the target session to restart within a few seconds.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvd94828 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to restart.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170705-iosxr

Title: Cisco ASR 5000 Series Routers StarOS BGP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Reload
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASR 5000 Series Routers. A remote user can cause the target service to reload.
A remote user send specially crafted TCP packets to an interface on the target system to trigger a flaw in the StarOS Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) process and cause the target process to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvc44968 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target BGP service to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170705-staros

Title: Cisco ASR 5000, 5500, and 5700 Routers StarOS CLI Bug Lets Local Users Obtain Root Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in StarOS on Cisco ASR 5000, 5500, and 5700 Routers. A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
A local user can exploit a flaw in several StarOS command line interface (CLI) commands to execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system with root privileges.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCvc69329 and CSCvc72930 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (StarOS 18.7.6, 19.6.5, 20.2.9, 21.1.1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170705-asrcmd

Title: Cisco IOS/IOS XE Buffer Overflow in SNMP Service Lets Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS and IOS XE. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) packet to the target system to trigger a buffer overflow in the SNMP service and execute arbitrary code on the target system.

For SNMPv2c and before, the SNMP read-only community string is required to exploit this flaw. For SNMPv3, user authentication credentials on the target system are required to exploit this flaw. 

Systems configured with the following MIBs are affected:

ADSL-LINE-MIB
ALPS-MIB
CISCO-ADSL-DMT-LINE-MIB
CISCO-BSTUN-MIB
CISCO-MAC-AUTH-BYPASS-MIB
CISCO-SLB-EXT-MIB
CISCO-VOICE-DNIS-MIB
CISCO-VOICE-NUMBER-EXPANSION-MIB
TN3270E-RT-MIB

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCve54313, CSCve54313CSCve57697, CSCve57697CSCve60276, CSCve60276CSCve60376, CSCve60376CSCve60402, CSCve60402CSCve60507, CSCve60507CSCve66540, CSCve66540CSCve66601, CSCve66601CSCve66658, CSCve66658CSCve78027, CSCve78027CSCve89865, and CSCve89865 to these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170629-snmp

Title: Cisco ASR 5000 Series Routers IKE Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASR 5000 Series Routers. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted IPsec Internet Key Exchange (IKE) messages to cause the target ipsecmgr service to reload. As a result, all IPsec VPN tunnels will be terminated and new tunnels will not be established until the service has restarted.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvc21129 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause all IPsec VPN tunnels to be terminated.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170621-asr

Title: Cisco IOS XR Command Injection and File Overwrite Flaws Let Local Users Obtain Root Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS XR. A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
A local user can send specially crafted data to a command in a specific group to trigger an input validation flaw and execute arbitrary commands on the target system with root privileges [CVE-2017-6718].

A local user can send specially crafted commands to trigger a file permissions error and overwrite binaries on the target system to gain root privileges [CVE-2017-6719].

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCvb99406 and CSCvb99384 to these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisories are available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170621-ios
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170621-ios1

Title: Cisco StarOS for ASR 5000 Series Routers Lets Remote Authenticated Users Overwrite or Modify Files on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco StarOS for ASR 5000 Series Routers. A remote authenticated user can modify files on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted command-line requests to trigger an input validation flaw in StarOS to overwrite or modify files on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvd73726 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can overwrite or modify files on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170607-staros

Title: Cisco IOS XR on Network Convergence System 5500 Series Routers Lets Local Users Cause Denial of Service Conditions
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR on Network Convergence System 5500 Series Routers. A local administrative user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A local administrative user with can issue the 'clear arp-cache' command to cause adjacency information for a Traffic Engineering (TE) tunnel's physical source interface to be cleared and not propagated to hardware. As a result, the target system will stop forwarding data traffic across TE tunnels.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvd16665 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user with administrator privileges can cause the target system to stop forwarding data traffic across TE tunnels.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170607-ncs

Title: Cisco NX-OS Fibre Channel over Ethernet Frame Validation Bug Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A remote user can cause the target service to reload.
A remote user on the local network can send specially crafted data to trigger a Fibre Channel over Ethernet (FCoE) frame padding validation flaw and cause the target FCoE-related process to reload.

The following models are affected (when configured for FCoE):

Multilayer Director
Nexus 5000 Series 
Nexus 5500 Platform
Nexus 5600 Platform
Nexus 7000 Series
Nexus 7700 Series

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvc91729 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170607-nxos

Title: F5 BIG-IP Virtual Edition Azure Default Password Lets Remote Users Access the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP Virtual Edition Azure. A remote user can gain access to the target system.
A remote user can use a default administrative password for the Azure instance administrative user account to gain access to the target system.

BIG-IP Virtual Edition (VE) Azure instances and Azure Web Application Firewall solutions on the Azure Marketplace are affected.

BIG-IP VE instances on other cloud services are not affected.

The vendor has assigned ID 652151 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain access to the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.1.2 HF1, 13.0.0 HF2).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K61757346

Title: Cisco Nexus 5000 Series Switches Input Validation Flaw Lets Local Users Read and Write Files on the Target System
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Nexus 5000 Series Switches. A local user can read and write files on the target system.
A local user can supply specially crafted command arguments to exploit an input validation flaw in a command line interface (CLI) command to read and write files located outside of the user's path on the target system [CVE-2017-6649]. The files will be accessed with the privileges of the user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvb86787 to this vulnerability.

A local user can supply specially crafted command arguments to exploit an input validation flaw in a telnet command line interface (CLI) command to read and write files located outside of the user's path on the target system [CVE-2017-6650]. The files will be accessed with the privileges of the user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvb86771 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can read and write files on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor advisories are available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170517-nss
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170517-nss1

Title: Cisco Industrial Ethernet 1000 Series Switches Access Control Flaw Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Industrial Ethernet 1000 Series Switches. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.
A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML page or URL that, when loaded by the target authenticated user, will take actions on the target Device Manager interface acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvc88811 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can take actions on the target system acting as the target authenticated user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170517-ie1000csrf

Title: F5 BIG-IP APM Input Validation Flaw in Access Reports Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP APM. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the F5 BIG-IP APM interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The Access Reports page is affected.

The vendor has assigned IDs 621371 and 641256 to this vulnerability.

Simon Waters of Surevine Ltd reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the F5 BIG-IP APM interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K43523962

Title: F5 BIG-IP Websocket Traffic Processing FLaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted websocket traffic to disrupt service on the target system.

The vendor has assigned ID 630150 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.1.2 HF1, 13.0.0).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K51351360

Title: F5 BIG-IP Unspecified Flaw in iControl REST Lets Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges.
A remote authenticated user can issue a specially crafted iControl REST connection to gain elevated privileges on the target system.

The vendor has assigned ID 623885 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.1.2 HF1, 13.0.0).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K41107914

Title: F5 BIG-IP Bug in Web Configuration Utility, iControl REST, and iControl SOAP Lets Remote Users Delete Arbitrary Files on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user can delete files on the target system.
A remote user can exploit a flaw in the Web Configuration Utility, iControl REST, and iControl SOAP functions to access the control plane and delete arbitrary files on the target system.

The vendor has assigned ID 631582 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can delete arbitrary files on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.1.2 HF1, 13.0.0).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K55792317

Title: F5 BIG-IP TCP Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted sequence of packets to cause the target Traffic Management Microkernel (TMM) to be disrupted.

Systems with software SYN cookie protection, TMM fast forward, and TCP segmentation offload (TSO) enabled are affected.

In addition, a remote user can cause the high-speed bridge (HSB) to lockup. Models 3900, 6900, 8900, 8950, 11000, and 11050 are affected.

The vendor has assigned ID 635412 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target TMM to be disrupted.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A workaround is also described in the vendor advisory.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K82851041

Title: F5 BIG-IP APM URL Validation Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP APM. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can submit a specially crafted URL that is less than 16 characters to cause denial of service conditions on the target TMM service. As a result, traffic may be disrupted.

The vendor has assigned ID 641612 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.1.2 HF1, 13.0.0 HF2).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K87141725

Title: Brocade NetIron SSH Port Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Reload
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Brocade NetIron. A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
A remote user can repeatedly scan port 22 on the target system to cause the target management module to crash and reload.

Brocade NetIron XMR/MLX and Brocade CES/CER on NetIron is affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target management module to crash and reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.8.00fb, 5.9.00C, 6.0.00c, 6.1.00a).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://www.brocade.com/content/dam/common/documents/content-types/security-bulletin/brocade-security-advisory-2017-315.htm

Title: Brocade Fabric OS Command Line Interface Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Brocade Fabric OS. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges.
A remote authenticated user on the command line interface can supply specially crafted commands and parameters to gain root privileges on the target system.

Brocade Fibre Channel SAN products are affected.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can gain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Brocade FOS 7.4.1d, 8.0.1b).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://www.brocade.com/content/dam/common/documents/content-types/security-bulletin/brocade-security-advisory-2017-208.htm

Title: Cisco CVR100W Wireless-N VPN Router Lets Remote Users Bypass Remote Management Interface ACL Restrictions on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco CVR100W Wireless-N VPN Router. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.
A remote user can bypass the access control list on the management interface.

Systems with the Remote Management configuration parameter set to Disabled are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvc14457 to this vulnerability.

opalliosl reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (model CVR100W, firmware 1.0.1.24).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170503-cvr100w2

Title: Cisco Aironet PnP Reponse Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code on the Target System
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Aironet. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can return specially crafted Plug-and-Play (PnP) response data to the target device while the target device does not have a configuration loaded (e.g., on first boot, after factory reset) to execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with root privileges.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvb42386 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.3.112.0).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170503-cme

Title: Cisco IOS XR gRPC Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR. A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
A remote user can send specially crafted gRPC requests to the target Event Management Service daemon (emsd) to cause the target device to crash. A manual restart is required to return the system to normal operations.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvb14441 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to crash. A manual restart is required to return the system to normal operations.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (XR 6.1.2).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170503-ios-xr

Title: Cisco CVR100W Wireless-N VPN Router Buffer Overflow in UPnP Lets Remote Users on the Local Network Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco CVR100W Wireless-N VPN Router. A remote user on the local network can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user on the local (layer 2) network can send specially crafted data to the Universal Plug-and-Play (UPnP) listening port to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with root privileges.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuz72642 to this vulnerability.

GeekPwn reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the local network can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (CVR100W firmware version 1.0.1.22).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170503-cvr100w1

Title: F5 BIG-IP Unspecified Flaw in SSHD Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can exploit an unspecified flaw in SSHD to cause denial of service conditions.

The vendor has assigned ID 475743 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.5.4 HF3, 11.6.1 HF2, 12.0.0 - 12.1.2, 13.0.0).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K92140924

Title: Cisco IOS XE SNMP Race Condition Lets Remote Authenticated Users Cause the Target System to Restart
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE. A remote authenticated user can cause the target system to restart.
A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted SNMP read request when an active crypto session is disconnected on the target system to trigger a memory access error and cause the target system to restart.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvb94392 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target system to restart.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170419-ios-xe-snmp

Title: Cisco IOS/IOS XE EnergyWise Packet Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Cause the Target System to Crash
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS/IOS XE. A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
A remote user can send specially crafted EnergyWise packets via IPv4 to port 43440 to cause the target system to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCur29331, CSCur29331CSCut47751, CSCut47751CSCut50727, CSCut50727CSCuu76493, and CSCuu76493 to these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170419-energywise

Title: Juniper Junos BGP UPDATE Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target RPD Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can send a specially crafted BGP UPDATE packet to cause the target routing processing daemon (rpd) to crash and restart.

Systems with BGP enabled are affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 1229868 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (15.1F2-S15, 15.1F5-S7, 15.1F6-S5, 15.1F7, 15.1R4-S7, 15.1R5-S2, 15.1R6, 15.1X49-D78, 15.1X49-D80, 15.1X53-D230, 15.1X53-D63, 15.1X53-D70, 16.1R3-S3, 16.1R4, 16.2R1-S3, 16.2R2, 17.1R1, 17.2R1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10778

Title: Juniper Junos ICMPv6 Fragment Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted ICMPv6 packets to the target device to conduct fragmentation attacks against the target system.

Systems with IPv6 enabled are affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 1250832 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.3X48-D50, 14.1R8-S3, 14.1R9, 14.2R7-S6, 14.2R8, 15.1F2-S16, 15.1F6-S5, 15.1R4-S7, 15.1R5-S2, 15.1R6, 15.1X49-D80, 16.1R3-S3, 16.1R4-S1, 16.1R5, 16.2R1-S3, 16.2R2, 17.1R1, 17.2R1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10780

Title: (Juniper Issues Fix for Juniper Junos) FreeBSD Buffer Overflow in Keyboard Driver Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the FreeBSD Kernel. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. Juniper Junos is affected.
A local user can issue a specially crafted IOCTL command to trigger a buffer overflow in the atkbd(4) and execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel-level privileges.

CTurt and the HardenedBSD team reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
Juniper has issued a fix for Juniper Junos ( 12.3X48-D55, 14.1R9, 14.1X53-D50, 14.2R7, 15.1F5-S5, 15.1F7, 15.1R5, 15.1X49-D60, 15.1X53-D230, 16.1R2, 16.2R1, 17.1R1).

The Juniper advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10784

Title: Juniper Junos on M/MX Series Routers IPv6 ND Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos on M/MX Series routers. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can send specially crafted IPv6 neighbor discover (ND) packets to the target system to cause the target packet forwarding engine (PFE) to hang or crash. M/MX series routers running Junos OS with Enhanced Subscriber Management for DHCPv6 configured are affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 1212431 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target packet forwarding engine (PFE) to hang or crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (15.1R5, 16.1R3, 16.2R1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10786

Title: Juniper Junos EX Series Ethernet Switches IPv6 ND Processing Memory Leak Lets Remote Users Consume Excessive Memory Resources
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos on EX Series Ethernet Switches. A remote user can consume excessive memory on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted IPv6 neighbor discover (ND) packet to the target switch to trigger a memory leak and eventually consume excessive memory on the target system.

EX Series Ethernet Switches with IPv6 enabled are affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 1206593 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive memory resources on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.3R12-S4, 12.3R13, 13.3R10, 14.1R8-S3, 14.1R9, 14.1X53-D12, 14.1X53-D40, 14.1X55-D35, 14.2R6-S4, 14.2R7-S6, 14.2R8, 15.1R5, 16.1R3, 16.2R1-S3, 16.2R2, 17.1R1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10781

Title: Juniper Junos LDP Packet Processing Memory Leak Lets Remote Users Cause the Target rpd Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user on the local network can send specially crafted LDP packets to the target routing engine (RE) to trigger a memory leak. A remote user can send multiple packets to consume excessive memory on the target system and cause the routing protocol daemon (rpd) to crash and restart.

Systems with LDP enabled are affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 1197631 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the local network can cause the target routing protocol daemon (rpd) to crash and restart.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (13.3R10, 14.1R8, 14.2R7-S6, 14.2R8, 15.1F2-S14, 15.1F6-S4, 15.1F7, 15.1R4-S7, 15.1R5, 15.1X49-D70, 15.1X53-D230, 15.1X53-D63, 15.1X53-D70, 16.1R2, 16.2R1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10777

Title: Cisco IOS XR gRPC Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can send specially crafted Google-defined remote procedure call (gRPC) requests to trigger a memory leak in the Event Management Service daemon (emsd) and cause the target emsd service to crash.

Systems with gRPC enabled are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvb14433 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target emsd service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (6.1.2.13i.MGBL, 6.1.21.12i.MGBL, 6.1.22.9i.MGBL, 6.2.1.22i.MGBL).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170405-ios

Title: Cisco IOS XE Console ROMMON Variable Validation Flaw Lets Physically Local Users Obtain Root Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE. A physically local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
The system does not properly validate ROMMON variables values. A physically local user with access to the console can modify ROMMON variable values to exploit a flaw in an IOS XE startup script to execute arbitrary commands on the target system with root privileges when the target system is reloaded.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuz06639 and CSCuz42122 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A physically local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170405-iosxe

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller RADIUS CoA Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted RADIUS Change of Authorization (CoA) request to trigger an input validation flaw and cause a single connection through the target WLC to be disconnected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvb01835 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause a single connection to be disconnected.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.3(102.3)).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170405-wlc1

Title: Cisco Aironet 1800/2800/3800 Series Access Points Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Aironet 1800/2800/3800 Series Access Points. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user with the root password can bypass shell access restrictions and gain root access on the underlying Linux operating system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvb13893 to this vulnerability.

Reuben Farrelly reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user with the root password can gain root access on the underlying Linux operating system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.2(124.1), 8.2(130.0), 8.3(104.23), 8.3(111.0), 8.4(1.52), 8.4(1.53)).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170405-aironet

Title: Cisco 903/920 Series ASR Routers IPv6 Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users on the Local Network Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco 903/920 Series ASR Routers. A remote user on the local network can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user on the local network can send specially crafted IPv6 packets to cause the target processor to attempt to process IPv6 traffic even when not configured for IPv6, which may adversely affect other control packets.

Systems running with an RSP2 card are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuy94366 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the local network can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170405-asr

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Missing Internal Handler Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Reload
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller. A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
A remote user can request a specific hidden URL on the target web management interface for which there is no internal handler and cause the target system to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvb48198 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.3.111.0).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170405-wlc3

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller IPv6 UDP Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Reload
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller. A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
A remote user can send a specially crafted IPv6 UDP packet to a specific port on the target system to cause the target system to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCva98592 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.2.130.0, 8.3.111.0).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170405-wlc2

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller WME Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users on the Wireless Network Cause the Target System to Reload
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller. A remote user on the wireless network can cause the target system to reload.
A remote user on the wireless network can send specially crafted 802.11 Wireless Multimedia Extensions (WME) frames to trigger an input validation flaw and cause the target system to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCva86353 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the wireless network can cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.0.140.0, 8.2.130.0, 8.3.111.0).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170405-wlc

Title: Cisco Aironet 1830/1850 Series Default Credentials Lets Remote Users Access the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Aironet 1830/1850 Series. A remote user can gain access to the target system.
The Cisco Mobility Express Software on Cisco Aironet 1830 and 1850 Series devices uses default credentials.

A remote user can access the target system via SSH and take full control of the target system.

Cisco Mobility Express Software versions 8.2.x are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCva50691 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain access to the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Cisco Mobility Express Software Release 8.2.111.0).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170405-ame

Title: NetComm NB16WV-02 Router Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the NetComm NB16WV-02 Router. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target authenticated user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the NetComm Router interface and will run in the security context of the interface. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

http://[target]/hdd.htm?rc=&S801F0334=/dkmvc%3C/script
%3E%3Cscript%3Ealert%28String.fromCharCode%28101,90,101,90%29
%29%3C/script%3Ed29f

Luke Symons reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the NetComm Router interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor plans to issue a fix.

Title: F5 BIG-IP MCPD Cache Bug Lets Local Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information, including passwords.
A local user with Advanced Shell access or with privileges to generate a qkview can exploit a flaw in the (Master Control Program) MCPD binary cache to obtain potentially sensitive information, including passwords, for recently created local user accounts and passphrases that have been set since the last reboot.

The vendor has assigned IDs 601938 and 601927 to this vulnerability.

Michael Molho of e-Xpert Solutions SA  reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user with Advanced Shell access or with privileges to generate a qkview can obtain potentially sensitive information, including passwords, for recently created local user accounts and passphrases that have been set since the last reboot.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K52180214

Title: F5 BIG-IP IPv6 MTU Option Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted IPv6 MTU option data to trigger a flaw in the Traffic Management Microkernel (TMM) and cause the TMM process to restart.

The vendor has assigned ID 597394 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target TMM to restart.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.5.4 HF3, 11.6.1 HF2, 12.1.2, 13.0.0).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K46535047

Title: F5 BIG-IP APM SAML SSO Plugin Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP APM. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted signed SAML authentication request via an SP connector on a target BIG-IP that is configured as a SAML Identity Provider to trigger a flaw in the SSO plugin and cause traffic to be disrupted or cause a failover to occur.

The vendor has assigned ID 611469 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause traffic to be disrupted or cause a failover to occur.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.5.4 HF3, 11.6.1 HF2, 12.1.2).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K95444512

Title: F5 BIG-IP Flaw in TCP Progressive Stack Lets Remote Users Disrupt Network Services
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted network traffic to cause the target Traffic Management Microkernel (TMM) to restart. As a result, traffic processing will be interrupted.

Systems with 'tm.tcpprogressive database' enabled are affected.

The vendor has assigned ID 611830 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause network traffic processing to be interrupted.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.5.4 HF3).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/csp/article/K13053402

Title: Cisco IOx for Cisco ASR 1000 Series Routers Lets Remote Authenticated Users Write or Modify Files on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOx for ASR 1000 Series Routers. A remote authenticated user can write or modify files on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted requests to the target Cisco application-hosting framework (CAF) component to trigger an input validation flaw and write or modify arbitrary files on the target virtual instance running on the target device.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuy52317 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can write or modify arbitrary files on the target virtual instance running on the target device.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (IOx 1.2.4.2).

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20170322-caf2

Title: Cisco IOx for 800 Series Industrial Integrated Services Routers Lets Remote Authenticated Users Write or Modify Files on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOx for 800 Series Industrial Integrated Services Routers. A remote authenticated user can write or modify files on the target system.
