A local user can supply specially crafted iox command line parameters to trigger an input validation flaw and execute arbitrary commands on the target IOx Linux guest operating system (GOS).

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuz59223 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160921-iox

Title: Cisco IOS/IOS XE Data in Motion Application Bug Lets Remote Users Cause Denial of Service Conditions
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS and IOS XE. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a boundary error in the Cisco Data in Motion (DMo) component and cause denial of service conditions on the target DMo process.

Cisco IOS and IOS XE with the IOx feature set is affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuy54015 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target DMo process.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160921-dmo

Title: Cisco IOS/IOS XE Input Validation Flaw in Cisco Application-hosting Framework Lets Remote Users Force an Arbitrary File Download to the Target User
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS and IOS XE. A remote user can cause the target user to download an arbitrary file.
A remote user can insert specially crafted HTTP headers into the communications path between the user and the target IOS system to exploit an input validation flaw in the Cisco Application-hosting Framework (CAF) component and cause the target CAF user to download an arbitrary file controlled by the remote user.

Cisco IOS and IOS XE with the IOx feature set is affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuz84773 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target user to download an arbitrary file.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160921-caf1

Title: Cisco IOS/IOS XE Cisco Application-hosting Framework Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users View Files on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS and IOS XE. A remote authenticated user can obtain files on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted data to trigger an input validation flaw in the Cisco application-hosting framework (CAF) and read arbitrary files on the target system.

Cisco IOS and IOS XE with the IOx feature set is affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuy19856 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can obtain files on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160921-caf

Title: Cisco Cloud Services Platform 2100 Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Code on the Target System with Root Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Cloud Services Platform. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted data to trigger an input validation flaw in the web interface and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with root privileges.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCva00541 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system with root privileges.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (2100; version 2.1.0).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160921-csp2100-1

Title: Cisco Cloud Services Platform 2100 Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code on the Target System
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Cloud Services Platform. A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted dnslookup request to the target system to exploit an input validation flaw in the web interface and execute arbitrary code on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuz89093 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (2100; version 2.1.0).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160921-csp2100-2

Title: Cisco IOS, IOS XE, and IOS XR IKEv1 Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain Memory Contents on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS, IOS XE, and IOS XR. A remote user can obtain memory contents on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted IKEv1 packets via IPv4 or IPv6 to the IKE service on the target device to obtain memory contents from the target device.

The IKE service may run on UDP ports 500, 848, 4500, or 4848.

[Editor's note: This vulnerability is similar to the BENIGNCERTAIN vulnerability reported by Shadow Brokers.]

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCvb29204 and CSCvb36055 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain memory contents on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor plans to issue a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160916-ikev1

Title: Cisco IOS/IOS XE Cisco Local Manager Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Local Manager for Cisco IOS/IOS XE. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The Cisco Local Manager web framework does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Local Manager interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuy19854 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Local Manager interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160914-ios

Title: Cisco IOS/IOS XE Data in Motion Application Bug Lets Remote Users Cause Denial of Service Conditions
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Data in Motion for Cisco IOS/IOS XE. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger an input validation flaw in the Data in Motion (DMo) application to cause denial of service conditions on the target DMo process.

Systems with the IOx feature set are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuy82904, CSCuy82909, and CSCuy82912 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target service.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160914-ios-xe

Title: Cisco IOS XR for Carrier Routing System OSPFv3 Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR for Carrier Routing System. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can send specially crafted OSPFv3 packets to trigger a logic error and cause the target OSPFv3 process to restart on the target device. As a result, data traffic relying on the OSPF exchanged routes may be adversely affected.

Cisco 64-bit releases of IOS XR for Cisco NCS6000 series devices are affected.

Systems configured to process OSPFv3 are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuz66289 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target OSPFv3 service to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160914-iosxr

Title: Cisco Carrier Routing System IPv6 Over MPLS Logic Error Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Carrier Routing System. A remote user can cause the target line card to reload.
A remote user can send a specially IPv6 over MPLS packet to trigger a logic error and cause the target line card to reload.


The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCva32494 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target line card to reload.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160914-crs

Title: Cisco Application Control Engine SSL/TLS Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Device to Reload
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Application Control Engine. A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
A remote user can send specially crafted SSL/TLS packets to the target device to cause the target device to reload.

The Cisco ACE 4710 Application Control Engine appliance and the Cisco ACE30 Application Control Engine Module for Cisco Catalyst 6500 Series Switches and Cisco 7600 Series Routers are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvb16317 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor plans to issue a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160908-ace

Title: Cisco IOS PPTP Server Bug Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information from Packet Buffer Memory on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted Point-to-Point Tunneling Protocol (PPTP) request to the target system to obtain up to 63 bytes of memory contents previously used for sending or receiving PPTP packets from the target system.

Transit traffic is not affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCvb16274 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160902-ios

Title: F5 BIG-IP DNS Resolver Bug Lets Remote Users Consume Excessive System Resources on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user can consume excessive resources on the target system.
A remote user can return a specially crafted reply to a DNS query from 'RESOLV::lookup' to consume excessive resources on the target system or trigger a Traffic Management Microkernel (TMM) crash.

Systems that use the 'RESOLV::lookup' iRule command to resolve PTR records are affected.

The vendor has assigned ID 550596 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive resources on the target system or cause the target system to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/k/52/sol52638558.html

Title: Cisco Small Business 220 Series Smart Plus (Sx220) Switches Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Management Interface to Stop Responding
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Small Business 220 Series Smart Plus (Sx220) Switches. A remote user can cause the target interface to stop responding.
A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP request to the target web-based management interface to cause the interface to stop responding.

The interface must be restarted manually to return to normal operations.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuz76238 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target management interface to stop responding.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.0.1.1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160831-sps2

Title: Cisco Small Business 220 Series Smart Plus (Sx220) Switches Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Small Business 220 Series Smart Plus (Sx220) Switches. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The web-based management interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Small Business 220 Series interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuz76232 to this vulnerability.

Nicolas Collignon and Renaud Dubourguais of Synacktiv reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Small Business 220 Series interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.0.1.1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160831-sps1

Title: Cisco Small Business 220 Series Smart Plus (Sx220) Switches Access Control Flaw Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Small Business 220 Series Smart Plus (Sx220) Switches. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.
A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML page or URL that, when loaded by the target authenticated user, will take actions on the target interface acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuz76230 to this vulnerability.

Nicolas Collignon and Renaud Dubourguais of Synacktiv reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can take actions on the target system acting as the target authenticated user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.0.1.1).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160831-sps

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller SNMP Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Restart
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller. A remote user can cause the target system to restart.
A remote user on the local network can send specially crafted Inter-Access Point Protocol (IAPP) packets followed by a Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) request for traffic stream metrics (TSM) to cause the target Wireless LAN Controller to restart.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuz40221 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to restart.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.0.140, 8.2.121.0, 8.3.102.0).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160831-wlc-1

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller wIPS Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Restart
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller. A remote user can cause the target system to restart.
A remote user on the local network can send a specially crafted Wireless Intrusion Prevention System (wIPS) packet to trigger an input validation flaw and cause the target system to restart.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuz40263 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to restarted.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.0.140.0, 8.2.121.0, 8.3.102.0).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160831-wlc-2

Title: Cisco Small Business 220 Series Smart Plus (Sx220) Switches Default SNMP Community String Lets Remote Users Access and Modify Data on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Small Business 220 Series. A remote user can access and modify data on the target system.
The system adds a default Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) community string during installation that cannot be deleted. A remote user can access the system via SNMP to read and write SNMP objects and gain full control of the target system.

Systems with SNMP enabled (not the default) are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuz76216 to this vulnerability.

Nicolas Collignon and Renaud Dubourguais of Synacktiv reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access and modify data to take full control of the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160831-sps3

Title: F5 BIG-IP Packet Filtering Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted network traffic to cause the target Traffic Management Microkernel (TMM) to restart and fail to process traffic.

Systems with Packet Filtering enabled are affected.

Virtual servers of all types are affected.

All protocols are affected.

The management interface is not affected.

The vendor has assigned ID 573124 and ID 472178 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can disrupt services on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/k/06/sol06045217.html

Title: Juniper Junos IPv6 Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted IPv6 Neighbor Discovery packets to trigger a processing logic error and cause the target device to stop processing IPv6 traffic.

Junos OS and JUNOSe are affected.

The vendor has assigned PRs 1183115, 1183124 (QFX), 1188939 (MX), and 1188949 (PTX) to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to stop processing IPv6 traffic.
Solution:
The vendor has described a configuration solution.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10749

Title: Cisco Aironet AMPDU Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Reload
Version(s): Models 1800, 2800, and 3800; prior to versions 8.2.121.0 and 8.3.102.0
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Aironet. A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
A remote user can send a specially crafted Aggregated MAC Protocol Data Unit (AMPDU) packet to the target device to trigger an input validation flaw and cause the device to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuz56288 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.2.121.0, 8.3.102.0).

The vendor advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160817-aap

Title: Cisco Aironet 802.11 Rate Limiting Error Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Reload
Version(s): Models 1800, 2800, and 3800; prior to versions 8.2.121.0 and 8.3.102.0
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Aironet. A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
A remote user on the wireless network can send specially crafted 802.11 data to the target device to trigger a rate limiting error and cause the device to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCva06192 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the wireless network can cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.2.121.0, 8.3.102.0)

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160817-aap2

Title: Cisco Aironet CLI Input Validation Flaw Lets Local Users Obtain Root Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Aironet. A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
A local user can supply specially crafted command line-interface (CLI) parameters to trigger an input validation flaw and execute arbitrary commands on the target system with root privileges.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuz24725 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.2.110.0, 8.2.121.0, 8.3.102.0).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160817-aap1

Title: F5 BIG-IP Configuration Utility Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Access APM Logs on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote authenticated user can access data on the target system.
A remote authenticated administrative user can exploit a flaw in the Configuration Utility to view the Access Policy Manager (APM) access logs.

The vendor has assigned ID 539923 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can obtain Access Policy Manager access log data on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/k/31/sol31925518.html

Title: Actiontec T2200H Router Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Actiontec T2200H Router. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges.
A remote authenticated user can submit specially crafted data via the 'Advanced Setup > Samba Configuration' menu in the Samba username or password field while a USB drive is connected to the USB port to execute arbitrary shell commands with root privileges.

The Telus-branded model T2200H is affected. Other brands may be affected, but the report did not identify any other brands as affected.

Andrew Klaus reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can gain root privileges on the target system.
Solution: [Editor's note: Telus has reportedly issued a fix for affected Telus-branded devices, pushed automatically to the device.]

Title: F5 BIG-IP Configuration Utility File Validation Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Upload Files and Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote authenticated user can upload files to the target system. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges.
The Access Policy Manager customization configuration section does not properly validate file types or file contents when uploading files. A remote authenticated user can upload files to the target system. This can be exploited by users with Application Editor or higher privileges to gain elevated privileges.

The vendor has assigned ID 472093 to this vulnerability.

Pedro Worcel reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can upload files to the target system.

A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/k/12/sol12401251.html

Title: Cisco Aironet ARP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Reload
Version(s): Models 1800, 2800, and 3800; prior to versions 8.2.121.0 and 8.3.102.0
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Aironet. A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
A remote user on the local network can send specially crafted address resolution protocol (ARP) packets to eventually cause the target device to reload.

Cisco Aironet 1800, 2800, and 3800 Access Point platforms are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuy55803 and CSCuz64127 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.2.121.0 and 8.3.102.0).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160608-aironet

Title: F5 BIG-IP Packet Processing Flaw in the Traffic Management Microkernel Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted network traffic to cause the target Traffic Management Microkernel (TMM) to restart, temporarily failing to process traffic.

Virtual servers configured with TCP profiles are affected.

The vendor has assigned ID 572495 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target TMM to restart.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

[Editor's note: On August 19, 2016, the vendor updated their advisory to retract a previously recommended mitigation for versions 11.3.0 - 11.5.4 regarding the tm.tcpprogressive db variable.]

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/k/19/sol19784568.html

Title: F5 BIG-IP Anonymous IPsec IKE Peer Configuration Lets Remote Users Bypass Security Restrictions on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.
The default configuration enables the anonymous IPsec IKE peer configuration object. As a result, a remote user can establish an IKE phase 1 negotiation and then conduct attacks against phase 2 negotiations.

On systems configured with IPsec tunnels, a remote user can cause denial of service conditions or inject traffic onto the target network.

The vendor has assigned ID 570716 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can establish IKE phase 1 connections.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/k/10/sol10133477.html

Title: Cisco IOS XR ASR 9001 Router Memory Leak in Route Processor Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASR 9001 Router. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted fragmented IPv4 or IPv6 packets to the unicast address of any configured interface on the target device to trigger a memory leak on the target route processor and cause the device to drop all control-plane protocols and deny service.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCux26791 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause all control-plane protocols to be dropped.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.3.3). Software Maintenance Updates (SMUs) are also available for prior affected versions.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160810-iosxr

Title: Cisco IOS NTP Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
The system does not properly clear invalid Network Time Protocol (NTP) packets from the interface queue. A remote user can send multiple specially crafted NTP packets to trigger an interface wedge and cause denial of service conditions.

Systems configured for NTP operations are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCva35619 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160804-wedge

Title: Cisco Small Business RV110W/RV130W/RV215W Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Small Business RV110W/RV130W/RV215W. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can supply specially crafted command-line interface (CLI) command parameters to inject and execute arbitrary shell commands on the target system with administrator privileges.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuv90134, CSCux58161, and CSCux73567 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain administrator privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160803-rv110_130w1

Title: Cisco Small Business RV180/RV180W Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain Files on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Small Business RV180/RV180W. A remote user can obtain files on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP request to trigger a path input validation flaw and view arbitrary files on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuz43023 to this vulnerability.

Harri Kuosmanen reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain arbitrary files on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160803-rv180_1

Title: Cisco Small Business RV180/RV180W Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Commands on the Target System
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Small Business RV180/RV180W. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted HTTP requests to trigger an input validation flaw and execute arbitrary commands on the target system with root privileges.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuz48592 to this vulnerability.

Harri Kuosmanen reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands with root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160803-rv180_2

Title: Cisco Small Business RV110W/RV130W/RV215W Access Control Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Small Business RV110W/RV130W/RV215W. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges.
A remote authenticated user can exploit a role-based access control (RBAC) flaw in the default, ostensibly read-only, account to gain root privileges on the target system.

A specific configuration of the RV110W/RV130W/RV215W devices is affected.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuv90139, CSCux58175, and CSCux73557 to this vulnerability.

Adam Zielinski reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can gain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160803-rv110_130w2

Title: Cisco Nexus 1000v AVS Input Validation Flaw in Processing CDP Packets Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Version(s): Nexus 1000v AVS; prior to 5.2(1)SV3(1.5i) and prior to 5.2(1)SV3(1.6)
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Nexus 1000v Application Virtual Switch (AVS). A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted Cisco Discovery Protocol (CDP) packet to the target Cisco Nexus 1000v AVS device to trigger an input validation flaw and cause the target ESXi hypervisor to crash and display a purple diagnostic screen.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuw57985 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target ESXi hypervisor to crash and display a purple diagnostic screen.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160727-avs

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Wireless Management Frame Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user on the wireless network can send specially crafted wireless management frames to cause denial of service conditions on the target device.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCun92979 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the wireless network can cause denial of service conditions on the target device.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160727-wlc

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco ASR 5000 Series Routers) ASN1C Buffer Overflow in rtxMemHeapAlloc() Lets Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in ASN1C. A remote or local user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. Cisco ASR 5000 Series Routers running StarOS are affected.
A user can send specially crafted ASN.1 data to trigger a buffer overflow in rtxMemHeapAlloc() in the 'asn1rt_a.lib' library and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target application or service using the affected library component.

The specific impact depends on the application or service using the vulnerable library component.

The original advisory is available at:

https://github.com/programa-stic/security-advisories/tree/master/ObjSys/CVE-2016-5080

Lucas Molas reported this vulnerability via Programa Seguridad en TIC and CERT/CC.
Impact': A user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. The specific impact depends on the application or service using the vulnerable library component.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry for Cisco ASR 5000 routers running StarOS.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160721-asn1c

Title: Blue Coat ProxySG Lets Remote Users Bypass Security Restrictions on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Blue Coat ProxySG. A remote user can bypass security controls on the target system.
In certain cases where the system must perform a reverse DNS lookup for a hostname, the system may not properly apply access, authentication, and scanning policy rules. A remote user can can exploit this to bypass security policy rules on the target system.

Systems configured as a forward proxy, reverse proxy, or web application firewall are affected.

Mike Brookes and Nathan Fowler reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass access, authentication, and scanning security controls on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

A workaround is described in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://bto.bluecoat.com/security-advisory/sa130

Title: Cisco IOS/IOS XE BGP Attribute Processing Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Cause the Target Device to Reload
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS/IOS XE. A remote authenticated user can cause the target system to reload.
A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) message to trigger a BGP attribute processing flaw and cause the target device to reload.


The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuz21061 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor has described some workarounds in their advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160715-bgp

Title: Cisco IOS XR Input Validation Flaw in Command Line Utility Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can exploit a flaw in the command-line utility to execute arbitrary commands on the target system with root privileges.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuz62721 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160714-ios-xr

Title: Juniper Junos on SRX Series Lets Local Users Obtain Root Privileges in Certain Cases
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos on SRX Series devices. A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system in certain cases.
A local user can login with root privileges without a password.

SRX Series devices upgraded from Junos OS 12.1X45 or 12.1X46 to 12.1X46-D50 via the 'request system software' command with the 'partition' option are affected.

The vendor has assigned PRs 1118748 and 1153914 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.1X46-D65).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10753

Title: Juniper Junos ICMP Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
A remote user can send a specially crafted ICMP packet to the target interface to trigger a kernel panic and cause the target device to crash.

Systems configured with a GRE or IPIP tunnel are affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 1159454 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.1X46-D50, 12.1X47-D40, 12.3X48-D30, 13.3R9, 14.1R8, 14.1X53-D40, 14.2R6, 15.1F6, 15.1R3, 15.1X49-D40).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10752

Title: Juniper Junos High-End SRX-Series Application Layer Gateway Bugs Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can trigger failure conditions and cause denial of service conditions on High-End SRX-Series chassis systems.

Systems with policies with one or more application layer gateways (ALGs) enabled for in-transit traffic are affected.

Both standalone and cluster mode configurations are affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 1150971 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions for in-transit traffic.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.1X46-D50, 12.1X47-D23, 12.1X47-D35, 12.3X48-D25, 15.1X49-D40).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10751

Title: Juniper Junos UDP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target 64-bit System to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
A remote user can send a specially crafted UDP packet destined to the target interface IP address on a 64-bit system to cause a kernel crash.

32-bit systems are not affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 1142939 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.1X46-D45, 12.1X46-D51, 12.1X47-D35, 12.3X48-D30, 13.3R9-S1, 13.3R10, 14.1R7, 14.2R6, 15.1F2-S5, 15.1F4-S2, 15.1F5, 15.1R2-S3, 15.1R3, 15.1X49-D40).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10758

Title: Juniper Junos CN Validation Error Lets Remote Users Bypass Certificate Validation on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can bypass certificate validation on the target system.
A remote user can supply a specially crafted self-signed certificate with a spoofed Common Name (CN) value that matches a valid certificate authority (CA) on the system to bypass certificate validation on the target system.


The vendor has assigned PR 1096758 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass IPSec/IKE certificate validation on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.1X44-D52, 12.1X44-D55, 12.1X46-D37, 12.1X46-D40, 12.1X47-D30, 12.3R12, 12.3X48-D20, 13.3R10, 14.1R8, 14.1X53-D40, 14.2R7, 15.1R4, 15.1X49-D20, 15.1X53-D60, 16.1R1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10755

Title: Juniper Junos J-Web Information Leak Lets Remote Users Access the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos J-Web. A remote user can gain access to the target system.
A remote user can exploit an information leak in J-Web to gain administrative privileges on the target system.

The vendor has assigned PR 1114274 to this vulnerability.

Kyle Lovett and Dor Tumarkin reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain privileged access to the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.1X46-D45, 12.1X46-D46, 12.1X46-D51, 12.1X47-D35, 12.3R12, 12.3X48-D25, 13.3R10, 13.3R9-S1, 14.1R7, 14.1X53-D35, 14.2R6, 15.1A2, 15.1F4, 15.1X49-D30, 15.1R3).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10754

Title: Juniper Junos IPv6 MAC Address Ethernet Flood Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user on the local network can send a flood of specially crafted Ethernet packets with and EtherType field of IPv6 (0x86DD) to trigger an mbuf leak and cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

Systems with VPLS enabled are affected.


The vendor has assigned PR 1132568 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (13.3R9, 14.1R6-S1, 14.1R7, 14.2R1, 15.1R1, 15.1F2, 16.1R1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10750

Title: (Juniper Issues Fix for Juniper Junos) FreeBSD libc db(3) May Leak Potentially Sensitive Information into db Files
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in libc on FreeBSD.  A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information. Juniper Junos is affected.
The FreeBSD libc db(3) interface code used to create Berkeley database files does not properly initialized some data structures. The utility may cause potentially sensitive information to be unintentionally written to Berkeley DB 1.85 database files when the files are created.  A local user may be able to obtain the potentially sensitive information (e.g., login credentials) from those files.

Jaakko Heinonen and Xin LI reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information from db files.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.1X44-D55 12.1X46-D40 12.1X47-D25 12.3X48-D20 12.3X50-D50 12.3R11 13.2X51-D40 13.2X52-D30 13.2R8 13.3R7 14.1X53-D30 14.1R6 14.2R4 15.1X49-D10 15.1X49-D20 15.1R2 15.1F3).

The Juniper advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10756

Title: Cisco ASR 5000 Series Router Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain the SNMP Read-Write Community String on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASR 5000 Series Routers. A remote user can obtain an SNMP password on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted SNMP query to view the read-write SNMP community string on the target system. This can be exploited to read and modify the device configuration.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuz29526 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain the SNMP read-write community string on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160713-asr

Title: Cisco IOS XR Resource Leak on Network Convergence System 6000 Series Routers Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Version(s): IOS XR for Network Convergence System 6000 Series Routers
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR on Cisco Network Convergence System 6000 routers. A remote user can consume excessive system timer resources and cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can establish multiple Secure Shell (SSH), Secure Copy Protocol (SCP), and Secure FTP (SFTP) connections via IPv4 or IPv6 to the target system management interface to trigger a system timer resource leak and cause the target system to stop operating. The Router Processor on the target system will eventually reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCux76819 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to stop functioning and the Route Processor (RP) on the target system to eventually reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160713-ncs6k

Title: (Apple Issues Fix for Apple AirPort) Apple macOS mDNSResponder Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Apple macOS mDNSResponder. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. Apple AirPort is affected.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow and deny service or execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2015-7987]. The GetValueForIPv4Addr(), GetValueForMACAddr(), rfc3110_import(), and CopyNSEC3ResourceRecord() functions are affected.

A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a null pointer dereference in handle_regservice_request() and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2015-7988].

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/143335
Impact':
A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
Apple has issued a fix for Apple AirPort (7.6.7, 7.7.7).

The Apple advisory is available at:

https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT206846

Title: F5 BIG-IP iControl REST API Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Administrative Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
A remote authenticated administrative user can send specially crafted data to the target iControl REST API to obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

The vendor has assigned ID 546080 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated administrative user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.5.4, 11.6.1, 12.0.0 HF3, 12.1.0).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/k/99/sol99998454/

Title: Cisco ASR 5000 Series Packet Data Network Gateway Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Session Manager Service to Restart
Version(s): Cisco ASR 5000 Series Packet Data Network Gateway; prior to Release 19.4
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASR 5000 Series Packet Data Network Gateway. A remote user can cause the target service to restart.
A remote user can send specially crafted General Packet Radio Switching Tunneling Protocol Version 1 (GTPv1) packet headers to trigger an input validation flaw and cause the target Session Manager process to restart.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuz46198 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target Session Manager service to restart.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160621-asr

Title: Cisco Integrated Services Routers SSH TCP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Consume Excessive Memory Resources
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Integrated Services Routers. A remote user can consume excessive memory on the target system.
A remote user can connect to the SSH service and then send specially crafted, out-of-order TCP packets or packets with invalid flags to the target device to consume excessive memory on the target device.

Cisco Integrated Services Router (ISR) models 800, 819, and 829 are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuu13476 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive memory resources on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160620-isr

Title: Cisco IOS XE SNMP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Cause the Target System to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE. A remote authenticated user can cause the target device to restart.
A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted series of SNMP read requests with certain parameters for a specific object ID (OID) to trigger a double-free memory error and cause the target device to restart.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCux13174 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target device to restart.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160620-iosxe

Title: Apple AirPort DNS Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code on the Target System
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in AirPort. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted DNS data to trigger a memory corruption error in parsing DNS data and execute arbitrary code on the target system.

The AirPort Express, AirPort Extreme, and AirPort Time Capsule base stations with 802.11n are affected. The AirPort Extreme and AirPort Time Capsule base stations with 802.11ac are also affected.

Alexandre Helie reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.6.7, 7.7.7).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://support.apple.com/en-us/HT206849

Title: F5 BIG-IP EAV Monitor Scripts Let Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges.
A remote authenticated user with the Resource Administrator role can use specially crafted external EAV monitor scripts to modify user accounts on the target system.

The vendor has assigned ID 520924 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.0.0 HF3, 12.1.0).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/k/00/sol00265182.html

Title: Cisco IOS LLDP Processing Error Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
A remote user on the local network can send specially crafted Link Layer Discovery Protocol (LLDP) packets to cause the target device to crash.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCun66735 to this vulnerability for 15.0(2)SG5, 15.1(2)SG3, 15.2(1)E, 15.3(3)S, and 15.4(1.13)S.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCun63132 to this vulnerability for 15.2(1)T1.11 and 15.2(2)TST.
Impact': A remote user on the local network can cause the target device to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisories are available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160616-ios
https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160616-ios1

Title: Cisco Small Business RV110W/RV130W/RV215W Series Buffer Overflows Let Remote Authenticated Users Cause the Target System to Reload
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Small Business RV110W/RV130W/RV215W Series Routers. A remote authenticated user can cause the target system to reload.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted HTTP data via the web management interface to trigger a buffer overflow and cause the target system to reload [CVE-2016-1397, CVE-2016-1398].

If the remote management interface is enabled, this vulnerability can be exploited from the WAN interface.

The following models are affected:

RV110W Wireless-N VPN Firewall
RV130W Wireless-N Multifunction VPN Router
RV215W Wireless-N VPN Router

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCux82523, CSCux82531, and CSCux82536 [for CVE-2016-1397] and CSCux86664, CSCux86669, and CSCux86675 [for CVE-2016-1398] to this vulnerability.

Samuel Huntley reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor plans to issue a fix in the third quarter of 2016 (RV110W 1.2.1.7, RV130W 1.0.3.16, RV215W 1.3.0.8).

The vendor's advisories are available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160615-rv2

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160615-rv3

Title: Cisco Small Business RV110W/RV130W/RV215W Series Routers Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Small Business RV110W/RV130W/RV215W Series Routers. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The web management interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Small Business RV Series interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

If the remote management interface is enabled, this vulnerability can be exploited from the WAN interface. 

The following models are affected:

RV110W Wireless-N VPN Firewall
RV130W Wireless-N Multifunction VPN Router
RV215W Wireless-N VPN Router

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCux82567, CSCux82583, and CSCux82599 to this vulnerability.

Samuel Huntley reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Small Business RV Series interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor plans to issue a fix in the third quarter of 2016 (RV110W 1.2.1.7, RV130W 1.0.3.16, RV215W 1.3.0.8).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160615-rv1

Title: Cisco Small Business RV110W/RV130W/RV215W Series Input Validation Flaw in Web Interface Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Small Business RV110W, RV130W, and RV215W Series routers. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted HTTP request data to the target web interface to execute arbitrary code with root privileges.

If the remote management interface is enabled, this vulnerability can be exploited from the WAN interface.

The following models are affected:

RV110W Wireless-N VPN Firewall
RV130W Wireless-N Multifunction VPN Router
RV215W Wireless-N VPN Router

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCux82416, CSCux82422, and CSCux82428 to this vulnerability.

Samuel Huntley reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system with root privileges.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor plans to issue a fix in the third quarter of 2016 (RV110W 1.2.1.7, RV130W 1.0.3.16, RV215W 1.3.0.8).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160615-rv

Title: F5 BIG-IP APM SSO Open Redirect Flaw Lets Remote Users Redirect the Target User's Browser to an Arbitrary Site
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP APM. A remote user can redirect the target user's browser to an arbitrary site.
The SSO_ORIG_URI parameter is not properly validated. A remote user can create a URL that, when loaded by the target user, will cause the APM module to redirect the target user's browser in a multi-domain single sign-on (SSO) environment to an arbitrary site.

Systems with the BIG-IP APM module provisioned are affected.

The vendor has assigned ID 526514 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target user's browser to be redirected to an arbitrary web site.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.6.0 HF6, 11.6.1, 12.0.x).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/k/26/sol26738102.html

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco IOS/IOS XE) ntp Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Modify Parameters and Deny Service
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in ntp. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A remote user can modify configuration parameters in certain cases. Cisco IOS and IOS XE is affected.
A remote user can send a specially crafted spoofed packet containing an invalid MAC to the target system to demobilize its ephemeral association [CVE-2016-4953].

A remote user can send specially crafted spoofed packets to bypass some validation checks in the receive() function and be processed by the process_packet() function in 'ntp_proto.c' [CVE-2016-4954]. In some cases, the remote user may be able to modify certain peer variables on the target system.

A remote user can send a specially crafted spoofed packet with an invalid MAC or crypto-NAK to the target system to reset its association and potentially prevent the association from working [CVE-2016-4955]. Systems using autokey for authentication are affected.

A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause a target broadcast client to switch to interleave mode and cause the client synchronization to become disabled [CVE-2016-4956].

A remote user can send a specially crafted crypto-NAK packet to the target system to trigger a null pointer dereference and cause the ntpd process to crash [CVE-2016-4957].

Jakub Prokes of Red Hat Quality Engineering, Miroslav Lichvar of Red Hat, and Nicolas Edet of Cisco reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can modify configuration parameters in certain cases.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions, including crashing the daemon, destabilizing ephemeral associations, and disabling synchronization.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry for Cisco IOS and IOS XE.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160603-ntpd

Title: Cisco Aironet CLI Input Validation Flaw Lets Local Users Obtain Root Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Aironet. A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
A local user can supply specially crafted command-line interface parameter values to exploit an input validation flaw and execute arbitrary Linux shell commands on the target system with root privileges.

The following models are affected:

1830e
1830i
1850e
1850i
2800 Series
3800 Series

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuy64037 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160606-aap

Title: F5 BIG-IP SSL Handshake Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send an SSL alert during the SSL handshake process to cause the target Traffic Management Microkernel (TMM) to restart.

Virtual servers with SSL profiles enabled are affected.

The vendor has assigned ID 518275 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target Traffic Management Microkernel (TMM) to restart.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.5.4 HF1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/k/48/sol48042976.html

Title: Cisco IOS XE/XR IPv6 Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE/XR. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted IPv6 Neighbor Discovery packets to trigger a processing logic error and cause the target device to stop processing IPv6 traffic.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuz66542 and CSCuz79330 to this vulnerability.

The following products running IOS XR and IOS XE are affected:

IOS XR:

Cisco 12000 Series Routers
Cisco ASR 9000 Series Aggregation Services Routers
Cisco Carrier Routing System
Cisco Network Convergence System 4000 Series
Cisco Network Convergence System 6000 Series Routers

IOS XE:

Cisco 4300 Series Integrated Services Routers
Cisco 4400 Series Integrated Services Routers
Cisco ASR 1000 Series Aggregation Services Routers
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to stop processing IPv6 traffic.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor is working on a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160525-ipv6

Title: Cisco Carrier Routing System IPv6 Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Carrier Routing System. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted IPv6 Neighbor Discovery packets to trigger a processing logic error and cause the target device to stop processing IPv6 traffic.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuz66542 and CSCuz79330 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to stop processing IPv6 traffic.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor is working on a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160525-ipv6

Title: Cisco 1000/9000 Series ASR Router IPv6 Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco 1000/9000 Series ASR Router. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted IPv6 Neighbor Discovery packets to trigger a processing logic error and cause the target device to stop processing IPv6 traffic.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuz66542 and CSCuz79330 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to stop processing IPv6 traffic.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor is working on a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160525-ipv6

Title: Cisco 12000 Series Routers IPv6 Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco 12000 Series Routers. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted IPv6 Neighbor Discovery packets to trigger a processing logic error and cause the target device to stop processing IPv6 traffic.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuz66542 and CSCuz79330 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to stop processing IPv6 traffic.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor is working on a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20160525-ipv6

Title: (Brocade Communications Systems Issues Fix for Brocade 5400 and 5600 vRouters) OpenSSL Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can cause the target service to crash. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system. Brocade 5400 and 5600 vRouters are affected.
A remote server can send a specially crafted ServerKeyExchange for an anonymous DH ciphersuite with the value of p set to 0 to potentially cause the target service to crash [CVE-2015-1794]. Version 1.0.2 is affected.

The vendor was notified on August 3, 2015.

Guy Leaver (Cisco) reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can exploit a carry propagation flaw in BN_mod_exp() to potentially determine information about the private key in certain situations [CVE-2015-3193].

Systems configured for persistent DH parameters and sharing a private key between multiple clients are affected. Version 1.0.2 is affected.

The vendor was notified on August 13, 2015.

Hanno Bock reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a certificate with a specially crafted ASN.1 signature that uses the RSA PSS algorithm and does not contain the mast generation function parameter to trigger a null pointer dereference and crash [CVE-2015-3194]. Versions 1.0.1 and 1.0.2 are affected.

The vendor was notified on August 27 2015.

Loic Jonas Etienne (Qnective AG) reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can supply a specially crafted X509_ATTRIBUTE structure to trigger a memory leak and potentially disclose sensitive information [CVE-2015-3195]. Applications that read PKCS#7 or CMS data from untrusted sources are affected. SSL/TLS is not affected.

The vendor was notified on November 9, 2015.

Adam Langley (Google/BoringSSL) reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can send send PSK identity hints to a multi-threaded client to trigger a race condition and then a double free memory error and cause the target service to crash [CVE-2015-3196]. Versions 1.0.0, 1.0.1 (prior to 1.0.1p), and 1.0.2 (prior to 1.0.2d) are affected.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target service to crash.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
Solution:
Brocade Communications Systems has issued a fix for CVE-2015-1794, CVE-2015-3193, CVE-2015-3194, CVE-2015-3195, and CVE-2015-3196 for Brocade 5400 (6.7R10 for CVE-2015-1794, CVE-2015-3193, CVE-2015-3195, and CVE-2015-3196; 6.7R12 for CVE-2015-3194) and 5600 (3.5R7 for CVE-2015-3194, CVE-2015-3195, CVE-2015-3196; 4.1R1 for CVE-2015-1794, CVE-2015-3193) vRouters.

The Brocade Communications Systems advisory is available at:

http://www.brocade.com/content/dam/common/documents/content-types/security-bulletin/brocade-security-advisory-2016-006.pdf

Title: (Brocade Communications Systems Issues Fix for Brocade 5400 and 5600 vRouters) ntp Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Spoof Messages, Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, and Deny Service
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in ntp. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system. A remote user can impersonate ntp peers. Brocade 5400 and 5600 vRouters are affected.
A remote user can conduct a replay attack against authenticated broadcast mode packets [CVE-2015-7973].

A remote authenticated user can exploit a key check flaw to impersonate a peer [CVE-2015-7974].

A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow in the nextvar() function in ntpq and cause the target service to crash [CVE-2015-7975].

A remote authenticated user can send an ntpq saveconfig command with specially crafted filename characters to cause unintended results [CVE-2015-7976].

A remote user can send a specially crafted ntpdc reslist command to trigger a null pointer dereference and cause the target service to crash [CVE-2015-7977].

A remote user can send a specially crafted reslist command to consume all available stack memory [CVE-2015-7978].

A remote user can send a specially crafted broadcast mode packet to cause the target broadcast client to tear down the association with the broadcast server [CVE-2015-7979].

A remote server can send a specially crafted packet with an origin timestamp of zero to bypass the timestamp validation check in certain cases [CVE-2015-8138].

A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger an infinite loop in ntpq [CVE-2015-8158].

A remote user can trigger an origin leak in ntpq and ntpdc to obtain potentially sensitive information [CVE-2015-8139].

A remote user on the local network may be able to conduct replay attacks against ntpq [CVE-2015-8140].

Cisco ASIG reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.

A remote authenticated user can impersonate an ntp peer.
Solution:
Brocade Communications Systems has issued a fix for CVE-2015-7973 and CVE-2015-7978 for Brocade 5400 (6.7R13) and 5600 (5.0R1) vRouters.

The Brocade Communications Systems advisory is available at:

http://www.brocade.com/content/dam/common/documents/content-types/security-bulletin/brocade-security-advisory-2016-006.pdf

Title: (Brocade Communications Systems Issues Fix for Brocade 5400 and 5600 vRouters) OpenSSH AES-GCM Memory Corruption Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Bypass Access Controls
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSH. A remote authenticated user can bypass access control restrictions. Brocade 5400 and 5600 vRouters are affected.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted data to trigger a memory corruption flaw when an AES-GCM cipher is selected during key exchange to execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.

This can be exploited to bypass login shell restrictions.

Markus Friedl reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can bypass access control restrictions.
Solution:
Brocade Communications Systems has issued a fix for CVE-2013-4548 for Brocade 5400 (6.7R12) and 5600 vRouters (4.2R1).

The Brocade Communications Systems advisory is available at:

http://www.brocade.com/content/dam/common/documents/content-types/security-bulletin/brocade-security-advisory-2016-006.pdf

Title: (Brocade Communications Systems Issues Fix for Brocade Network OS) OpenSSL Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can cause the target service to crash. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system. Brocade Network OS is affected.
A remote server can send a specially crafted ServerKeyExchange for an anonymous DH ciphersuite with the value of p set to 0 to potentially cause the target service to crash [CVE-2015-1794]. Version 1.0.2 is affected.

The vendor was notified on August 3, 2015.

Guy Leaver (Cisco) reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can exploit a carry propagation flaw in BN_mod_exp() to potentially determine information about the private key in certain situations [CVE-2015-3193].

Systems configured for persistent DH parameters and sharing a private key between multiple clients are affected. Version 1.0.2 is affected.

The vendor was notified on August 13, 2015.

Hanno Bock reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a certificate with a specially crafted ASN.1 signature that uses the RSA PSS algorithm and does not contain the mast generation function parameter to trigger a null pointer dereference and crash [CVE-2015-3194]. Versions 1.0.1 and 1.0.2 are affected.

The vendor was notified on August 27 2015.

Loic Jonas Etienne (Qnective AG) reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can supply a specially crafted X509_ATTRIBUTE structure to trigger a memory leak and potentially disclose sensitive information [CVE-2015-3195]. Applications that read PKCS#7 or CMS data from untrusted sources are affected. SSL/TLS is not affected.

The vendor was notified on November 9, 2015.

Adam Langley (Google/BoringSSL) reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can send send PSK identity hints to a multi-threaded client to trigger a race condition and then a double free memory error and cause the target service to crash [CVE-2015-3196]. Versions 1.0.0, 1.0.1 (prior to 1.0.1p), and 1.0.2 (prior to 1.0.2d) are affected.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target service to crash.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
Solution:
Brocade Communications Systems has issued a fix for CVE-2015-3194 for Brocade Network OS (7.0.1).

The Brocade Communications Systems advisory is available at:

http://www.brocade.com/content/dam/common/documents/content-types/security-bulletin/brocade-security-advisory-2016-006.pdf

Title: (Brocade Communications Systems Issues Fix for Brocade Fabric OS) OpenSSL Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can cause the target service to crash. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system. Brocade Fabric OS is affected.
A remote server can send a specially crafted ServerKeyExchange for an anonymous DH ciphersuite with the value of p set to 0 to potentially cause the target service to crash [CVE-2015-1794]. Version 1.0.2 is affected.

The vendor was notified on August 3, 2015.

Guy Leaver (Cisco) reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can exploit a carry propagation flaw in BN_mod_exp() to potentially determine information about the private key in certain situations [CVE-2015-3193].

Systems configured for persistent DH parameters and sharing a private key between multiple clients are affected. Version 1.0.2 is affected.

The vendor was notified on August 13, 2015.

Hanno Bock reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a certificate with a specially crafted ASN.1 signature that uses the RSA PSS algorithm and does not contain the mast generation function parameter to trigger a null pointer dereference and crash [CVE-2015-3194]. Versions 1.0.1 and 1.0.2 are affected.

The vendor was notified on August 27 2015.

Loic Jonas Etienne (Qnective AG) reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can supply a specially crafted X509_ATTRIBUTE structure to trigger a memory leak and potentially disclose sensitive information [CVE-2015-3195]. Applications that read PKCS#7 or CMS data from untrusted sources are affected. SSL/TLS is not affected.

The vendor was notified on November 9, 2015.

Adam Langley (Google/BoringSSL) reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can send send PSK identity hints to a multi-threaded client to trigger a race condition and then a double free memory error and cause the target service to crash [CVE-2015-3196]. Versions 1.0.0, 1.0.1 (prior to 1.0.1p), and 1.0.2 (prior to 1.0.2d) are affected.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target service to crash.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
Solution:
Brocade Communications Systems has issued a fix for CVE-2015-3194 for Brocade Fabric OS (8.0.1).

The Brocade Communications Systems advisory is available at:

http://www.brocade.com/content/dam/common/documents/content-types/security-bulletin/brocade-security-advisory-2016-006.pdf

Title: (Brocade Communications Systems Issues Fix for Brocade FabricOS) Oracle Java SE Hotspot Component Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Oracle Java SE. A remote user can gain full control of the target user's system. Brocade FabricOS is affected.
A remote user can create specially crafted content that, when loaded by the target user, will exploit a flaw in the Java SE Hotspot component to gain elevated privileges [CVE-2016-0636].
