A vulnerability was reported in Cisco DPQ3925 Wireless Residential Gateway. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP request to view potentially sensitive information on the target system.

The Cisco Model DPQ3925 8x4 DOCSIS 3.0 Wireless Residential Gateway with Embedded Digital Voice Adapter (EDVA) is affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuv03958 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151217-gateway

Title: Cisco IOS XE IPv6 Neighbor Discovery Processing Lets Remote Users on the Local Network Cause the Target System to Crash
Version(s): IOS XE; prior to versions 15.5(2)S2 (3.15.2S) and 15.5(3)S1 (3.16.1S)
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE. A remote user on the local network can cause the target system to crash.
A remote user on the local network can send a flood of IPv6 neighbor discovery (ND) messages to consume all available memory on the target device and cause the device to crash.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCup28217 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the local network can cause the target device to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (15.5(2)S2 (3.15.2S), 15.5(3)S1 (3.16.1S)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151214-ios

Title: HP Network Switch Unspecified Flaws Let Local Users Bypass Security Restrictions and Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in HP Network Switches. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. A local user can bypass security restrictions.
A local authenticated user can bypass unspecified security restrictions [CVE-2015-6859].

A local user can gain full control of the target system [CVE-2015-6860].

The following model numbers are affected:

J9821A HP 5406R zl2 Switch
J9822A HP 5412R zl2 Switch
J9823A HP 5406R-Gig-T-PoE+/SFP+ v2 zl2 Swch
J9824A HP 5406R-Gig-T-PoE+/SFP v2 zl2 Swch
J9825A HP 5412R-Gig-T-PoE+/SFP+ v2 zl2 Swch
J9826A HP 5412R-Gig-T-PoE+/SFP v2 zl2 Swch
J9850A HP 5406R zl2 Switch
J9851A HP 5412R zl2 Switch
J9868A HP 5406R-8XGT/8SFP+ v2 zl2 Swch
Impact':
A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

A local user can bypass security controls on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (KB.15.18.0008, KB.16.01.0004).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://h20564.www2.hpe.com/hpsc/doc/public/display?docId=emr_na-c04920918

Title: Cisco Small Business RV Series Weak Random Number Generation Lets Remote Users Determine TLS Session Keys on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Small Business RV Series. A remote user can determine TLS session keys.
The system's random number generator uses insufficient sources of entropy. As a result, the system may generate HTTPS Transport Layer Security (TLS) session keys that are predictable.

A remote user that can obtain large amounts of TLS handshake data can predict the random numbers used by the target device to generate a key pair. With the key, the user can decrypt session data between a target host and the target device.

Cisco Small Business RV Series Routers and Cisco SA500 Series Security Appliances are affected.

The following models are affected:

RV042 Dual WAN VPN Router
RV042G Dual Gigabit WAN VPN Router
RV082 Dual WAN VPN Router
RV016 Multi-WAN VPN Router

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCus15224, CSCus15238, CSCus15436, CSCus15440, CSCus15446, CSCus15451, and CSCus15463 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can determine TLS session keys.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151210-dwvr

Title: Cisco Wireless Residential Gateway EPC3928 Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Commands on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco EPC3928 Wireless Residential Gateway. A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.
The web interface does not properly authenticate requests. A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP request to execute certain administrative commands on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCux24941 to this vulnerability.

Patryk Bogdan from the Secorda Security Team reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute certain administrative commands on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151208-cwr

Title: Cisco Wireless Residential Gateway EPC3928 Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco EPC3928 Wireless Residential Gateway. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The web interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Wireless Residential Gateway interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCux24935 to this vulnerability.

Patryk Bogdan from the Secorda Security Team reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Wireless Residential Gateway interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the interface, or take actions on the interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151208-wrg

Title: Cisco Wireless Residential Gateway DPQ3925 Access Control Flaw Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco DPQ3925 Wireless Residential Gateway. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.
A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML page or URL that, when loaded by the target authenticated user, will take actions on the target web interface acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuv05430 and CSCuv05943 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can take actions on the target system acting as the target authenticated user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151208-gateway

Title: F5 BIG-IP iCall Script Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges.
A remote authenticated user with 'Resource Administrator' role permissions can exploit a flaw in iCall Scripts and associated handlers to create and modify user account properties. This can be exploited to gain administrative privileges on the target system.

The vendor has assigned ID 520466 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user with 'Resource Administrator' role permissions can gain administrative privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/16000/700/sol16728.html

Title: Cisco IOS XE on IOS XE 3S Flaw Lets Local Users Bypass License Restrictions
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE on IOS XE 3S. A local user can bypass license restrictions.
A local user can on the the command-line interface can supply specially crafted diagnostic commands parameters to bypass license restrictions and gain root shell access without the proper license.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuv93130 to this vulnerability.

[Editor's note: The vendor previously released an advisory for Cisco ASR 1000 Series Routers describing a similar vulnerability and assigning the same Cisco Bug ID number and CVE number (see Alert ID 1034277). As of December 5, 2015, the previous advisory was no longer available on the vendor's web site.]
Impact': A local user can bypass license restrictions on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151130-iosxe3s

Title: Cisco Nexus 5000 Series NX-OS USB Driver Input Validation Flaw Lets Local Users Cause the Target System to Crash
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Nexus 5000 Series NX-OS. A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A local user can supply specially crafted parameters to the target USB driver to cause the kernel to crash.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCus89408 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151204-nexus

Title: Brocade Fabric OS File Access Controls Let Local Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Brocade Fabric OS. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
A local user can obtain password hashes from the '/etc/passwd' file.

A local user may be able to exploit weak access permissions on world-writable and set user id (setuid) files to gain elevated privileges.

Karn Ganeshen reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information on the target system.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco ASR 1000 Series Router Flaw Lets Local Users Bypass License Restrictions
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASR 1000 Series Routers. A local user can bypass license restrictions.
A local user can on the the command-line interface can supply a specially crafted file name for loading of software packages to bypass license restrictions and gain root shell access without the proper license.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuv93130 to this vulnerability.

[Editor's note: On December 3, 2015, the vendor released an advisory for Cisco IOS XE describing a similar vulnerability and assigning the same Cisco Bug ID number and CVE number (see Alert ID 1034296). As of December 5, 2015, the vendor advisory for Cisco ASR 1000 Series Routers was no longer available on the vendor's web site.]
Impact': A local user can bypass license restrictions on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151130-asa

Title: Cisco Cloud Services Router Command Injection Flaw Lets Local Users Obtain Root Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Version(s): Cisco Cloud Services Router 1000V Series; 15.5(2)S and 15.5(3)S
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS on Cisco Cloud Services Router 1000V Series devices. A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
A local administrative user can exploit a command injection flaw in the event manager environment and publish-event function to execute arbitrary commands on the target system with root privileges.

The user can modify the configuration of the device and then invoke a specially crafted event manager script to trigger the vulnerability.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCux14943 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151130-csr

Title: (Brocade Communications Systems Issues Fix for Brocade Switch) ISC BIND DNSSEC Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service in Certain Cases
Version(s): 5400 vRouter prior to 6.7R10, 5600 vRouter prior to 3.5R5
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in ISC BIND. A remote user can cause the target service to crash. Brocade 5400/5600 vRouters are affected.
A remote user can send a query to the target service for a DNS zone that contains specially crafted zone data to cause the target recursive resolver to crash.

Recursive resolvers that perform DNSSEC validation are affected.

Breno Silveira Soares of Servico Federal de Processamento de Dados (SERPRO) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target recursive resolver service to crash.
Solution:
Brocade Communications Systems has issued a fix for CVE-2015-4620 for Brocade 5400 (6.7R10) and 5600 (3.5R5) series vRouters.

The Brocade Communications Systems advisory is available at:

http://www.brocade.com/content/dam/common/documents/content-types/security-bulletin/brocade-security-advisory-2015-009.pdf

Title: (Brocade Communications Systems Issues Fix for Brocade 5400/5600 vRouters) OpenSSL Alternative Certificate Chain Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Forge Certificates
Version(s): 5400 vRouter prior to 6.7R9, 5600 vRouter prior to 3.5R5
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can bypass certificate validation on the target system. Brocade 5400/5600 vRouters are affected.
When the validation of a certificate chain fails, the system attempts to validate an alternate certificate chain but does not check the CA flag of untrusted certificates. As a result, a remote user can cause the target system to validate an invalid certificate using a valid leaf certificate.

Applications that verify certificates are affected.

SSL/TLS/DTLS clients and SSL/TLS/DTLS servers using client authentication are affected.

The vendor was notified on June 24, 2015.

Adam Langley/David Benjamin (Google/BoringSSL) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass certificate validation on the target system.
Solution:
Brocade Communications Systems has issued a fix for CVE-2015-1793 for Brocade 5400 (6.7R9) and 5600 (3.5R5) series vRouters.

The Brocade Communications Systems advisory is available at:

http://www.brocade.com/content/dam/common/documents/content-types/security-bulletin/brocade-security-advisory-2015-009.pdf

Title: Cisco Small Business RV Series Routers Use Static Certificates and Keys That Let Remote Users Decrypt Potentially Sensitive User Connections
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Small Business RV Series Routers. A remote user can decrypt user connections to obtain potentially sensitive information in certain cases.
The system uses a hard-coded certificate and hard-coded keys to protect user connections. A remote user that can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can use the static credentials to decrypt user connections and obtain potentially sensitive information.

The following models are affected:

RV320 Dual Gigabit WAN VPN Router
RV325 Dual Gigabit WAN VPN Router
RV325 Dual WAN Gigabit VPN Router
WRV210 Wireless-G VPN Router - RangeBooster
WAP4410N Wireless-N Access Point - PoE/Advanced Security
WRV200 Wireless-G VPN Router - RangeBooster
WAP200 Wireless-G Access Point - PoE/Rangebooster
SRW224P 24-port 10/100 + 2-port Gigabit Switch - WebView/PoE
WET200 Wireless-G Business Ethernet Bridge
WAP2000 Wireless-G Access Point - PoE
WAP4400N Wireless-N Access Point - PoE
RV120W Wireless-N VPN Firewall
RV180 VPN Router
RV180W Wireless-N Multifunction VPN Router
RV315W Wireless-N VPN Router
WRP500 Wireless-AC Broadband Router with 2 Phone Ports
SPA400 Internet Telephony Gateway with 4 FXO Ports
RTP300 Broadband Router
RV220W Wireless Network Security Firewall

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuw46610, CSCuw46620, CSCuw46637, CSCuw46654, CSCuw46665, CSCuw46672, CSCuw46677, CSCuw46682, CSCuw46705, CSCuw46716, CSCuw46979, CSCuw47005, CSCuw47028, CSCuw47040, CSCuw47048, CSCuw47061, CSCuw90860, CSCuw90869, CSCuw90875, CSCuw90881, CSCuw90899, and CSCuw90913 to this vulnerability.

Stefan Viehbck from SEC Consult Vulnerability Lab reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user that can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can decrypt user connections and obtain potentially sensitive information.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151125-ci

Title: Cisco Small Business SRP Series Devices Use Static Certificates and Keys That Let Remote Users Decrypt Potentially Sensitive User Connections
Description:

The system uses a hard-coded certificate and hard-coded keys to protect user connections. A remote user that can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can use the static credentials to decrypt user connections and obtain potentially sensitive information.

Small Business SRP520 Models
Small Business SRP520-U Models

Description:

The system uses a hard-coded certificate and hard-coded keys to protect user connections. A remote user that can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can use the static credentials to decrypt user connections and obtain potentially sensitive information.

The following models are affected:

RVS4000 4-port Gigabit Security Router - VPN
WRVS4400N Wireless-N Gigabit Security Router - VPN V2.0

Stefan Viehbck from SEC Consult Vulnerability Lab reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user that can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can decrypt user connections and obtain potentially sensitive information.

Title: Cisco ASR 5000 Series Router Telnet Bug Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASR Router. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can exploit a flaw in the Telnet implementation to cause the target telnetd process to restart.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuv25815 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target telnet service to restart.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151125-asr5000

Title: Cisco IOS Virtual PPP Access Control Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Bypass Virtual PPP Access Control Lists
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote authenticated user can bypass certain access controls on the target system.
A remote authenticated user connected to a virtual PPP interface can bypass access control lists (ACLs) on the virtual PPP interface if the ACL on the physical interface permits the traffic to pass.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCur61303 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can bypass virtual PPP access controls on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151112-ios1

Title: Cisco Aironet SSHv2 Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Consume Excessive CPU Resources on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Aironet. A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources on the target system.
A remote user can initiate a large number of specially crafted SSHv2 connections with the target device to consume excessive CPU and connection resources on the target device.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCux13374 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive CPU and connection resources on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151113-aironet

Title: Cisco IOS Lets Remote Users Bypass Tunnel Interface Access Control Lists
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can bypass access controls on the target system.
A remote user connected to a tunnel interface can bypass the access control lists (ACLs) when the physical interface ACLs permit the traffic to pass.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCur01042 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass tunnel interface access control lists.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151112-ios2

Title: F5 BIG-IP Datastor Kernel Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service and Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges.
A remote authenticated user that can upload and execute customized code may be able to trigger a flaw in the Datastor kernel to cause denial of service conditions or gain administrative access.


Version 12.0.0 is not affected.

Francois Goichon of Context Information Security reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/17000/400/sol17407.html

Title: Cisco ASR 5500 SAE Gateway Lets Remote Users Cause the Target BGP Process to Restart
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASR 5500 SAE Gateway. A remote user can cause the target BGP process to restart.
The system does not properly validate Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) packet headers. A remote user can send a specially crafted BGP packet to cause the target BGP process to restart.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuw65781 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target BGP process to restart.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151028-asr

Title: (Juniper Issues Advisory for Juniper Junos) ntp Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Deny Service, View Files, and Bypass Authentication to Modify the Time
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in ntp. A remote user can view files on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A remote user can bypass authentication. A remote user can modify the time on the target system. Juniper Junos is affected.
A remote user can trigger a memory leak in CRYPTO_ASSOC [CVE-2015-7701].

A remote user can send AutoKey messages with a specially crafted AutoKey data packet length value to cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2015-7691, CVE-2015-7692, CVE-2015-7702].

A remote user can overwrite "pidfile" and "driftfile" configuration file directives [CVE-2015-7703].

A remote user can supply specially crafted data to cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2015-7704, CVE-2015-7705].

A remote user can trigger a mode 7 loop counter integer overflow in ntpd [CVE-2015-7848].

A remote user can trigger a use-after-free memory error in the processing of trusted keys [CVE-2015-7849].

A remote user can exploit a logfile-keyfile configuration flaw to cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2015-7850].

A remote user can exploit a directory traversal flaw in ntpd saveconfig [CVE-2015-7851].

A remote user can trigger a memory corruption error in the ntpq atoascii() function [CVE-2015-7852].

A remote user can supply specially crafted reference clock data to trigger a buffer overflow [CVE-2015-7853].

A remote user can supply a specially crafted password value to trigger a memory corruption error [CVE-2015-7854].

A remote user can send a specially crafted control packet message to exploit a flaw in decodenetnum() to cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2015-7855].

A remote user can exploit a flaw in the crypto-NAK() function to bypass symmetric association authentication [CVE-2015-7871].

Cisco ASIG, IDA, Cisco TALOS, Tenable, RedHat, OpenVMS, and Boston University reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can modify time on the target system.

A remote user can view files on the target system.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote user can bypass authentication on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Juniper Junos is affected when NTP is enabled within the [edit system ntp] hierarchy level of the Junos configuration.

Juniper has assigned PR 1132181 to this vulnerability.

The Juniper advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10711

Title: (Juniper Issues Fix for Juniper Junos) OpenSSL Null Pointer Dereference in do_ssl3_write() Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. Juniper Junos is affected.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a null pointer dereference in do_ssl3_write() and cause the target service to crash.

The vulnerability resides in 'ssl/s3_pkt.c'.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
Juniper has issued a fix for Juniper Junos (11.4R12-S4, 12.1X44-D40, 12.1X46-D20, 12.1X46-D25, 12.1X47-D15, 12.2R9, 12.3R8, 13.1R4-S3, 13.2R5-S1, 13.3R3, 14.1R2).

Juniper has assigned PR 988917 to this vulnerability.

The Juniper advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10629

Title: (Juniper Issues Fix for Juniper Junos) OpenSSL ssl3_read_bytes() and Anonymous ECDH Ciphersuite Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. Juniper Junos is affected.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a race condition in ssl3_read_bytes() and inject data across sessions or cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2010-5298]. Multithreaded applications are affected on versions 1.0.0 and 1.0.1 when SSL_MODE_RELEASE_BUFFERS is enabled.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on TLS clients that have enabled ECDH ciphersuites [CVE-2014-3470].

The vendor was notified on May 28, 2014.

Felix Grobert and Ivan Fratric at Google reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote user can inject data across sessions.
Solution:
Juniper has issued a fix for CVE-2010-5298 for Juniper Junos (12.1X44-D40, 12.1X46-D20, 12.1X46-D25, 12.1X47-D10, 12.2R9, 12.3R7, 13.1R4-S3, 13.2R5, 13.3R2-S3, 13.3R3, 14.1R1). A fix is pending for Junos version 11.4.

Juniper has assigned PR 984416 to this vulnerability.

The Juniper advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10629

Title: (Juniper Issues Fix for Juniper Junos) OpenSSL Montgomery Ladder Timing Lets Local Users Conduct Side-Channel Attacks to Obtain ECDSA Nonces
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A local user can obtain Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm (ECDSA) nonces. Juniper Junos is affected.
A local user can exploit a timing flaw in the Montgomery ladder implementation during swap operations to perform a FLUSH+RELOAD cache side-channel attack and potentially recover ECDSA nonces.

The original advisory is available at:

http://eprint.iacr.org/2014/140.pdf

Yuval Yarom and Naomi Benger reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can recover ECDSA nonces.
Solution:
Juniper has issued a fix for Juniper Junos.

Juniper has assigned PR 982853 to this vulnerability.

The Juniper advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10629

Title: (Juniper Issues Fix for Juniper Junos) OpenSSL SSL/TLS Weak Key Man-in-the-Middle Attack Lets Remote Users Decrypt and Modify Data
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack to decrypt and modify data. Juniper Junos is affected.
A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack between an affected client and an affected server can use a specially crafted handshake to cause the system to use a weak key.

Server versions 1.0.1 and 1.0.2-beta1 are affected.

All client versions are affected.

The vendor was notified on May 1, 2014.

KIKUCHI Masashi (Lepidum Co. Ltd.) reported this vulnerability via JPCERT/CC.
Impact': A remote user can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack to decrypt and modify data.
Solution:
Juniper has issued a fix for Juniper Junos (11.4R12-S1, 12.1X44-D40, 12.1X46-D20, 12.1X46-D25, 12.1X47-D15, 12.2R9, 12.3R8, 13.1R4-S2, 13.2R5, 13.3R2-S3, 13.3R3, 14.1R1).

Juniper has assigned PR 999736 to this vulnerability.

The Juniper advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10629

Title: F5 BIG-IP Unspecified vCMP Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user on the local network can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user on the local network can send specially crafted data to cause denial of service conditions on the target vCMP host and the target vCMP guests running on the host.

The vendor has assigned ID 533156 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target vCMP host and the target vCMP guests running on the host.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/17000/300/sol17386.html

Title: Cisco ASR 5000 Series Router Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASR 5000 Series Routers. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can send a specially rafted Proxy Mobile IPv6 (PMIPv6) packet header to cause the target hamgr process to restart.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuv63280 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target hamgr process to restart.

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Web Management GUI Lets Remote Users Disconnect Client Sessions
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to the target Web Management GUI to cause clients to disconnect.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuw10610 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause client sessions to disconnect.

No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Juniper Junos Trio (Trinity) Chipset uBFD Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos Trio (Trinity) Chipset. A remote user can cause the target linecard to crash.
A remote user can send specially crafted uBFD packets to cause the target linecard to crash.

The following devices with the Trio (Trinity) chipset line cards are affected: 

MX-Series, EX 9200, TXP with T-4000 Trio (Trinity) chipset line cards, T-4000.

Packets received directly, via VPN, MPLS, multicast, broadcast, and vt-interfaces can trigger this flaw.

The vendor has assigned PR 1102581 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target linecard to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (13.3R8, 14.1R6, 14.2R5, 15.1R2, 15.1F3).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10701

Title: Juniper vSRX-Series Junos J-Web Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper vSRX-Series Junos. A remote user can cause the target system to reboot.
A remote user can exploit a flaw in the vSRX J-Web service to cause the target vSRX instance to reboot.

The vendor has assigned PR 1085414 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to reboot.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (15.1X49-D20).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10700

Title: Juniper vSRX-Series Junos Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service on the Target PFE Daemon
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper vSRX-Series Junos. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target service.
A remote user can send a specially crafted connection request to the vSRX host operating system to deny service to the vSRX PFE daemon.

The vendor has assigned PR 1085900 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target vSRX PFE daemon.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (15.1X49-D20).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10703

Title: Juniper Junos IPv6 Processing Error Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
A remote user can send specially crafted IPv6 packets to trigger mbuf chain corruption and cause a kernel panic.

Systems IPv6 enabled are affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 1016371 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to crash.

Title: (Juniper Issues Fix for Juniper Junos) OpenSSH 'KbdInteractiveDevices' Lets Remote Users Bypass Security Restrictions on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSH. A remote user can bypass authentication attempt limits on the target system. Juniper Junos is affected.
A remote user can request the keyboard-interactive authentication option ('KbdInteractiveDevices') to open a large number of keyboard-interactive devices on the target server and perform a brute-force password guessing attack against the target sshd service. The number of password attempts can effectively exceed the 'MaxAuthTries' limit and are permitted to occur until the 'LoginGraceTime' limit is reached or the number of keyboard-interactive devices are used.

Servers that have keyboard-interactive authentication enabled (e.g., FreeBSD in the default configuration) are affected.

A demonstration exploit command is provided:

ssh -l[username] -oKbdInteractiveDevices=`perl -e 'print "pam," x 10000'` [target]

The original advisory is available at:

https://kingcope.wordpress.com/2015/07/16/openssh-keyboard-interactive-authentication-brute-force-vulnerability-maxauthtries-bypass/

kingcope reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass authentication attempt limits on the target system.
Solution:
Juniper has issued a fix for Juniper Junos (12.1X44-D55, 12.1X46-D40, 12.1X47-D30*, 12.3R11, 12.3X48-D20, 13.2X51-D40, 13.2X52-D30, 13.3R8, 14.1R6, 14.2R5, 15.1F3, 15.1F2-S1, 15.1R2, 15.1X49-D20, 15.1X53-D20).

The Juniper advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10697

Title: Juniper Junos Fragmented Packet Processing Flaw Lets Local Users Consume Excessive Buffer Memory Resources
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A local user can consume excessive buffer memory on the target system.
A local user can supply specially crafted fragmented packets to the target device to consume all available buffer resources on the target system and deny service for connections to the target device. Transit connections through the target device are not affected.
Impact': A local user can consume excessive buffer memory resources on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.1X44-D50, 12.1X46-D35, 12.1X47-D25, 12.3R10, 12.3X48-D15, 13.2R8, 13.3R7, 14.1R5, 14.2R1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10696

Title: Juniper Junos Command Shell Python Flaws Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can exploit flaws in the command shell to execute arbitrary python code on the target system.

The vendor has assigned PRs 968728, 968731, 971889, 971893, 971941, and 972273 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (13.2R5, 13.3R3).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10695

Title: Juniper Junos SSH Server Bug Lets Remote Users Consume Excessive CPU Resources on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources on the target system.
A remote user that can access the SSH service on the target device can consume excessive CPU resources on the target system prior to authentication processing.

The vendor has assigned PR 1058906 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.1X44-D50, 12.1X46-D35, 12.1X47-D25, 12.3R10, 12.3X48-D10, 13.2R8, 13.2X51-D35, 13.3R6, 14.1R5, 14.1X53-D25, 14.2R3, 15.1R1, 15.1X49-D20).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10708

Title: Juniper Junos 'pam.conf' Corruption May Let Remote Users Access the Target System with Root Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can gain access to the target system in certain cases.
On systems where the 'pam.conf' file has been corrupted in a certain way, a remote user can gain root access to the target system without requiring a password.

The corruption may occur inadvertently.

The remote user cannot corrupt the file without exploiting a separate vulnerability.

The vendor has assigned PR 965378 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain root access to the target system in certain cases.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.1X44-D50, 12.1X46-D35, 12.1X47-D25, 12.3R9, 12.3X48-D15, 13.2R7, 13.2X51-D35, 13.3R6, 14.1R5, 14.1X50-D105, 14.1X51-D70, 14.1X53-D25, 14.1X55-D20, 14.2R1, 15.1F2, 15.1R1, 15.1X49-D10).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10707

Title: Cisco ASR Router TACACS Implementation Bug Lets Remote Users Cause the Target vpnmgr Service to Restart
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASR 5000/5500 Routers. A remote user can cause the target service to restart.
A remote user can send a specially crafted TACACS packet to cause the vpnmgr process to restart.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuw01984 and CSCuw01985 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target vpnmgr service to restart.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151012-asr

Title: (F5 Networks Issues Advisory for F5 FirePass) Net-snmp Incomplete Parsing in snmp_pdu_parse() Lets Remote Users Crash snmpd or Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Net-snmp. A remote user can cause the target service to crash. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. F5 FirePass is affected.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a parsing error in snmp_pdu_parse() and cause the target snmpd process to crash or execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target snmp service.

Qinghao Tang of QIHU 360, China, reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target service to crash.

A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
F5 Networks has issued an advisory for CVE-2015-5621 for F5 FirePass. No solution was available at the time of this entry.

F5 has assigned ID 475753 to this vulnerability.

The F5 Networks advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/17000/300/sol17378.html

Title: (F5 Networks Issues Advisory for F5 BIG-IP) Net-snmp Incomplete Parsing in snmp_pdu_parse() Lets Remote Users Crash snmpd or Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Net-snmp. A remote user can cause the target service to crash. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. F5 BIG-IP is affected.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a parsing error in snmp_pdu_parse() and cause the target snmpd process to crash or execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target snmp service.

Qinghao Tang of QIHU 360, China, reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target service to crash.

A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
F5 Networks has issued an advisory for CVE-2015-5621 for F5 BIG-IP. No solution was available at the time of this entry.

F5 has assigned ID 540767 to this vulnerability.

The F5 Networks advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/17000/300/sol17378.html

Title: Cisco IOS RADIUS Packet Processing Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Cause the Target System to Reload
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote authenticated user can cause the target system to reload.
A remote authenticated RADIUS server can return specially crafted RADIUS packets in response to the RADIUS client on the target device to cause the target device to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuu59324 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated server can cause the connected target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151005-ios-radius

Title: Cisco Aironet 1850 Series CLI Input Validation Bug Lets Local Users Obtain Root Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Aironet 1850 Series. A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
A local user can supply specially crafted command line interface parameters to access the restricted shell and execute arbitrary commands on the target system with root privileges.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuv79694 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20151005-aironet

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller 802.11i Processing Error Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user on the local wireless network can send a specially crafted 802.11i management frame to an access point that is managed by the target Wireless LAN Controller (WLC) to cause the target WLC to stop functioning.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCub65236 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target Wireless LAN Controller to stop functioning.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=41249

Title: Cisco Nexus 3000 Series NX-OS Lets Remote Authenticated Users Cause the Target SNMP Service to Temporarily Stop Responding
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A remote authenticated user can cause the target service to temporarily stop processing.
A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted SNMP request containing a non-existent Object Identifier (OID) to cause valid requests to the target SNMP service to temporarily timeout.

The Nexus 3000 (N3K) Series Switch is affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuw36684 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target service to temporarily stop responding to valid SNMP requests.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=41240

Title: Cisco IOS/IOS-XE IPv6 Snooping Bug Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Crash
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS/IOS-XE. A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
A remote user send specially crafted IPv6 packets with the Cryptographically Generated Address (CGA) option to the target device that has IPv6 snooping enabled to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2015-6279].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuo04400 to this vulnerability.

A remote user send a flood of specially crafted IPv6 Network Discovery (ND) packets to the target device that has IPv6 snooping enabled to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2015-6278].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCus19794  to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
Cisco has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150923-fhs

Title: Cisco IOS/IOS XE SSHv2 Bug Lets Remote Users Bypass Authentication on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS/IOS XE. A remote user can bypass authentication.
A remote user with knowledge of a username configured for SSHv2 RSA authentication and with access to the target user's public key can supply a specially crafted RSA private key to bypass authentication and access the target device with the privileges of the target user configured for the virtual teletype (VTY) line. 
The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCus73013 to this vulnerability.

Mathias Seiler from MiroNet AG reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass authentication on the target system.
Solution:
Cisco has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150923-sshpk

Title: Cisco IOS XE NAT/MPLS Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Reload
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE. A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
A remote user can send specially crafted IPv4 packets that require Network Address Translation (NAT) and Multiprotocol Label Switching (MPLS) processing through the target device to cause the device to reload.

Inbound interfaces configured with the 'ip nat inside' command are affected when the destination outbound interface is configured with the 'ip nat outside' and 'mpls ip' commands are affected.

Cisco ASR 1000 Series, Cisco ISR 4300 Series, Cisco ISR 4400 Series, and Cisco Cloud Services 1000v Series Routers are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCut96933 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
Cisco has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150923-iosxe

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller RADIUS Disconnect-Request Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Disconnect Sessions
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller. A remote user can cause user sessions on the target system to become disconnected.
A remote user can send specially crafted RADIUS Disconnect-Request packets to the target device to trigger an input validation flaw and cause random user sessions to be disconnected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuw29419 to this vulnerability.

Casper Joost Eyckelhof from Quarantainenet BV reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause user sessions on the target system to become disconnected.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=41102

Title: Cisco IOS for ASR 9000 Series Routers DHCPv6 Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS for ASR 9000 Series Routers. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can send specially crafted DHCPv6 packets to be processed by the target device to cause a process on the target device to restart.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCun72171 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target process to restart.
Solution:
Cisco has issued a fix.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=41101

Title: Cisco IOS for ASR 9000 Series Router Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Reset
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS for Cisco ASR 9000 Series Routers. A remote user can cause the target system to reset.
A remote user can send specially crafted DHCPv6 packets to be processed by the target device to cause the target device to reset.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCun36525 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to reset.
Solution:
Cisco has issued a fix.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=41060

Title: Cisco Catalyst 4500 Series Switch Cisco Discovery Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users on the Local Network Cause the Target Service to Stop Functioning
Version(s): 4500 Series; IOS XE 3.6(2)E and prior, IOS 15.2(3)E and prior
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Catalyst 4500 Series Switch. A remote user on the local network can cause the target service to stop functioning.
A remote user on the local network can send specially crafted Cisco Discovery Protocol packets to cause the target Cisco Discovery Protocol packet process to stop functioning.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuu25770 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the local network can cause the target service to stop functioning.
Solution:
Cisco has issued a fix.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=41006

Title: Cisco NX-OS VLAN Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users on the Local Network Consume Excessive CPU Resources on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A remote user on the local network can consume excessive CPU resources on the target system.
A remote user on the local network can send Layer 2 packets tagged with a specially crafted Nexus 9000 Series Switch (N9K) reserved VLAN number to consume excessive CPU resources on the target system. As a result, the control plane may become unstable.

The packets may be incorrectly forwarded to the connected interfaces instead of being dropped by the target device.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuw13560 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the local network can consume excessive CPU resources and cause the control plane to become unstable on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=40990

Title: F5 BIG-IP FastL4 Virtual Server Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can send a specially crafted fragmented packet to cause the target Traffic Management Microkernel (TMM) to restart and fail to process traffic while restarting.

The vulnerability resides in the FastL4 virtual server component.

The vendor has assigned IDs 437627 and 513034 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target Traffic Management Microkernel (TMM) to restart and fail to process traffic while restarting.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

Configuration instructions are also provided to mitigate the vulnerability.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/17000/100/sol17155.html

Title: ASUS TM-AC1900 Router Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the ASUS TM-AC1900 Router. A remote user on the local network can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user on the local network can send specially crafted HTTP header values to trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.

The vendor was notified on May 5, 2015.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-15-409

Elvis Collado of HP DVLabs reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the local network can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: F5 BIG-IP Configuration Utility Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Traverse the Directory to View Certain Files on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote authenticated user can view files on the target system.
The Configuration Utility does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted request to view files on the target system that are located within the web root directory.

The vendor has assigned ID 485762 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can view files located within the web root directory on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix for some BIG-IP products (12.0.0).

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/17000/200/sol17253.html

Title: Cisco NX-OS Lets Remote Adjacent Network Users Cause the Target ARP Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A remote user on the local network can cause the target service to restart.
A remote user on the local network can send a specially crafted ARP packet to the target device to trigger an input validation flaw and cause the target ARP service to restart.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCut25292, CSCuw02034, CSCuw02035, CSCuw02037, and CSCuw02038 to this vulnerability.

The following models and versions are affected:

Cisco MDS 9000 NX-OS and SAN-OS Software running NX-OS release 7.0(0)HSK(0.353)
Cisco Nexus 1000V Switch for VMware vSphere running NX-OS release 5.2(1)SV3(1.4)
Cisco Nexus 3000 Series Switches running NX-OS release 7.3(0)ZD(0.47)
Cisco Nexus 9000 Series Switches running NX-OS release 7.3(0)ZD(0.61)
Cisco Nexus 4000 Series Switches running NX-OS release 4.1(2)E1
Impact': A remote user on the local network can cause the target ARP service to restart.
Solution:
Cisco has issued a fix.

[Editor's note: The fix is only available for Cisco Bug ID CSCut25292.]

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=40748

Title: Cisco ASR 1000 Series Router Fragmented IPv4 Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Consume Excessive CPU Resources on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASR 1000 Series Routers. A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources on the target system.
A remote user can send 100,000 fragmented IPv4 packets per second (or higher) to consume excessive Cisco QuantumFlow Processor (QFP) CPU resources on the target Embedded Services Processor (ESP) system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuv71273 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources on the target ESP system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=40708

Title: Cisco ASR 1000 Series Router L2TP/IPv4/IPv6/SIP/H.323 Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Cause the Target System to Crash
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco ASR 1000 Series Routers. A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
A remote user can send a specially crafted packet to cause the target Embedded Services Processor (ESP) to crash and the target device to reload.

Layer 2 Tunneling Protocol (L2TP) processing is affected [CVE-2015-6267].

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCsw95722 and CSCsw95496 to this vulnerability.

IPv4 and IPv6 processing is affected [CVE-2015-6269].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCsw69990 to this vulnerability.

IPv6 processing is affected [CVE-2015-6270].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCsv98555 to this vulnerability.

SIP processing on systems configured with Network Address Translation Application Layer Gateway (NAT ALG) are affected [CVE-2015-6271].

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCta74749 and CSCta77008 to this vulnerability.

H.323 processing on systems configured with NAT ALG or the Firewall feature are affected [CVE-2015-6272].

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCsx35393, CSCsx07094, and CSCsw93064 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisories are available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=40684
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=40686
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=40687
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=40688
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=40689

Title: Cisco ASR 1000 Series Router IOS XE VFR Bug Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Reload
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASR 1000 Series Routers. A remote user can cause the target system to reload.
A remote user can send specially crafted transit IP packets to the target device to exploit a flaw in the Virtual Fragment Reassembly (VFR) feature and cause the target Embedded Services Processor (ESP) to crash.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCtf87624, CSCte93229, CSCtd19103, and CSCti63623 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=40690

Title: Cisco ASR 1000 Series Router UDP Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Version(s): ASR 1000 Series Routers; prior to 2.2.3 and prior to 2.3.0
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASR 1000 Series Routers. A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user can send a specially crafted UDP packet via IPv4 to the target device to cause the Embedded Services Processor (ESP) processing the packet to crash and the device to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCsw95482 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=40685

Title: Cisco Application Control Engine 4710 Lets Local Users Read and Modify Files on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Application Control Engine. A local user can read and modify files on the target system.
A local user can exploit a flaw in the command-line interface (CLI) to view and modify files that belong to other contexts.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCur23662 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can read and modify files that belong to other contexts.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=40666

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller IAPP Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Forward Network Traffic to Other Destinations
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller. A remote user can forward network traffic to other destinations.
A remote user can send a specially crafted IPv6 packet to exploit an input validation flaw in the Internet Access Point Protocol (IAPP) module and cause network traffic to be forwarded to an unexpected destination on a remote sub-network.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuv40033 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause network traffic to be forwarded to an unexpected destination on a remote sub-network.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=40586

Title: Cisco ASR 5000 Series Router OSPF Header Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target OSPF Service to Restart
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASR 5000 Series Routers. A remote user can cause the target service to restart.
A remote user can send specially crafted Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) protocol packets to the target device to trigger an input validation flaw cause the target OSPF process to restart.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuv62820 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target OSPF process to restart.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=40585

Title: F5 BIG-IP ICMP Memory Leak Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can trigger a memory leak in the processing of ICMP packets to consume excessive memory resources on the target system.

The vendor has assigned ID 511651 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive memory resources on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/17000/000/sol17047.html

Title: Cisco NX-OS IGMPv3 Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A remote user on the local network can cause the target service to crash.
A remote user on the local network can send a specially crafted Internet Group Management Protocol version 3 (IGMPv3) packets to the target device to trigger a buffer overflow and cause the target IGMP process to restart.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuv69713, CSCuv69717, CSCuv69723, CSCuv69732, and CSCuv48908 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the local network can cause the target IGMP service to restart.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=40470

Title: (F5 Networks Issues Advisory for F5 BIG-IP) OpenSSH 'KbdInteractiveDevices' Lets Remote Users Bypass Security Restrictions on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSH. A remote user can bypass authentication attempt limits on the target system. F5 BIG-IP is affected.
A remote user can request the keyboard-interactive authentication option ('KbdInteractiveDevices') to open a large number of keyboard-interactive devices on the target server and perform a brute-force password guessing attack against the target sshd service. The number of password attempts can effectively exceed the 'MaxAuthTries' limit and are permitted to occur until the 'LoginGraceTime' limit is reached or the number of keyboard-interactive devices are used.

Servers that have keyboard-interactive authentication enabled (e.g., FreeBSD in the default configuration) are affected.

A demonstration exploit command is provided:

ssh -l[username] -oKbdInteractiveDevices=`perl -e 'print "pam," x 10000'` [target]

The original advisory is available at:

https://kingcope.wordpress.com/2015/07/16/openssh-keyboard-interactive-authentication-brute-force-vulnerability-maxauthtries-bypass/

kingcope reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass authentication attempt limits on the target system.
Solution:
F5 Networks has issued an advisory for F5 BIG-IP. No solution was available at the time of this entry.

F5 Networks has assigned ID 534633 to this vulnerability.

The F5 Networks advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/17000/100/sol17113.html

Title: Cisco NX-OS ARP Processing Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A remote user on the local network can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user on the local network can send a specially crafted Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) packet to exploit an input validation flaw and trigger a buffer overflow, causing the target device to become unavailable.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuv71933, CSCuv61341, CSCuv61321, CSCuu78074, CSCut37060,  CSCuv61266,  CSCuv61351, CSCuv61358, and CSCuv61366 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the local network can cause the target device to become unavailable.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=40469

Title: Belkin N300 Dual-Band Wi-Fi Range Extender Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Commands on the Target System
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in the Belkin N300 Dual-Band Wi-Fi Range Extender. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted request to execute arbitrary commands on the target system.

The formUSBStorage, formWpsStart, formiNICWpsStart, formWlanSetupWPS, formWlanMP, formBSSetSitesurvey, formHwSet, and formConnectionSetting requests are affected.

The original advisories are available at:

http://www.zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-15-343/
http://www.zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-15-346/
http://www.zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-15-347/
http://www.zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-15-348/
http://www.zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-15-349/
http://www.zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-15-350/
http://www.zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-15-351/

Elvis Collado of HP DVLabs reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (firmware V1.04.10).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.belkin.com/us/support-article?articleNum=4975

Title: Cisco Nexus 9000 Series NX-OS '/tmp' Directory File Processing Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Consume Excessive Memory Resources
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Nexus 9000 Series NX-OS. A remote authenticated user can consume excessive memory on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can copy large files to the '/tmp' directory to trigger a file processing error and consume excessive memory to cause the target device to stop responding.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuu77225 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can consume excessive memory resources and cause the target device to stop responding.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=40431

Title: Cisco Nexus 3000 Series NX-OS Java Connection Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Restart
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Nexus 3000 Series NX-OS. A remote user can cause the target service to restart.
A remote user can send specially crafted Java connections to the target Nexus Data Broker (NDB) service to cause the target Java process to restart.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCut87006 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target Java service to restart.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=40426

Title: Cisco ASR 9000 Series Router vty Session Closing Bug Lets Local Users Consume Excessive Memory Resources
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASR 9000 Series Routers. A local user can consume excessive memory on the target system.
A local user can exploit a flaw in the closing of vty sessions to create an excessive number of 'tmp/*config' files and consume excessive memory resources on the system. As a result, the system will become unresponsive.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCut93842 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can consume excessive memory resources to cause the target system to become unresponsive.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=39939

Title: Cisco ASR 1000 Series Routers Fragmented Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASR 1000 series routers. A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
A remote user can send a specially crafted sequence of IPv4 or IPv6 packets to the target IOS-XE ASR 1000 series device to cause the target Embedded Services Processor (ESP) to crash. As a result, the target device will reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCtd72617 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (2.4.3, 2.5.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150730-asr1k

Title: Cisco IOS-XE Packet Fragmentation Error Message Lets Remote Users Consume Excessive CPU Resources on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS-XE. A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources on the target system.
A remote user can send a series of specially crafted fragmented IPv4 or IPv6 packets to the target device to trigger an ATTN-3-SYNC_TIMEOUT error message and consume excessive CPU resources on the target device, preventing network traffic from being processed.

Cisco IOS-XE devices rate-limit error messages to once every 60 seconds by default.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuo37957 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources on the target device, preventing network traffic from being processed.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=40215

Title: (F5 Networks Issues Advisory for F5 BIG-IP) ISC BIND TKEY Query Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in ISC BIND. A remote user can cause the target service to crash. F5 BIG-IP is affected in certain configurations.
A remote user can send a specially crafted TKEY query packet to trigger a REQUIRE assertion failure and cause the named service to crash. The flaw occurs prior to the access control list checks.

Recursive and authoritative servers are affected.

Jonathan Foote reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target named service to crash.
Solution:
F5 Networks has issued an advisory for F5 BIG-IP.

F5 BIG-IP is affected if a self IP address or management IP address is configured to allow inbound connections on port 53. 

The F5 Networks advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/16000/900/sol16909.html

Title: (F5 Networks Issues Advisory for F5 BIG-IP) ISC BIND DNSSEC Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service in Certain Cases
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in ISC BIND. A remote user can cause the target service to crash. F5 BIG-IP is affected.
A remote user can send a query to the target service for a DNS zone that contains specially crafted zone data to cause the target recursive resolver to crash.

Recursive resolvers that perform DNSSEC validation are affected.

Breno Silveira Soares of Servico Federal de Processamento de Dados (SERPRO) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target recursive resolver service to crash.
Solution:
F5 Networks has issued an advisory for F5 BIG-IP.

No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor indicates that the default configuration of BIND in F5 BIG-IP is not exploitable and that F5 BIG-IP is only vulnerable if BIND is manually configured to allow recursion and perform Domain Name System Security Extensions (DNSSEC) validation.

The F5 Networks advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/16000/900/sol16912.html

Title: Cisco ASR 9000 Series Router IOS XR LPTS Network Stack Lets Remote Users Consume Excessive CPU Resources on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR for Cisco ASR 9000 Series Router. A remote user can consume excessive resources on the target system.
A remote user can send continuous connection attempts to trigger a flaw in the Local Packet Transport Services (LPTS) network stack to cause TCP and UDP ports to be opened erroneously and consume excessive resources on the target system.

Systems with LPTS enabled are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCur88273 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive resources on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=40068

Title: Cisco NX-OS Application Policy Infrastructure Controller (APIC) Lets Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Version(s): APICs prior to 1.0(4o), 1.0(3o), 1.1(1j); Nexus 9000 Series ACI prior to 11.0(4o) and 11.1(1j)
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS Application Policy Infrastructure Controller (APIC). A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges.
A remote authenticated user can exploit an access control flaw in the cluster management configuration and gain root access to the target system.

Cisco Application Policy Infrastructure Controllers and Cisco Nexus 9000 Series ACI Mode Switches are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuu72094 and CSCuv11991 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can gain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.0(4o), 1.0(3o), 1.1(1j)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150722-apic

Title: Cisco IOS and IOS XE TFTP Memory Management Error Lets Remote Users Cause the Target System to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS and IOS XE. A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
A remote user can send multiple TFTP requests to the target device to trigger a memory management flaw and cause the target device to hang or reload.

Systems with the TFTP server enabled are affected.

Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCts66733 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to hang or crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150722-tftp

Title: Cisco IOS XR for ASR 9000 Series Router Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Cause the Target BGP Service to Crash
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASR 9000 Series Routers. A remote user can cause the target service to reload.
A remote user can send specially crafted BGPv4 packets to trigger a processing error and cause the target BGP process to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCur70670 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target BGP service to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=40067

Title: (Brocade Communications Systems Issues Fix for Brocade Switch) OpenSSL Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Downgrade Session Security
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can downgrade the session security in certain cases. Brocade Switch is affected.
A remote user can send a specially crafted DTLS message to trigger a null pointer dereference fault in dtls1_get_record() and cause the target service to crash [CVE-2014-3571].

The vendor was notified on October 22, 2014.

Markus Stenberg of Cisco Systems, Inc. reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can send repeated DTLS records with the same sequence number but for the next epoch to trigger a memory leak in dtls1_buffer_record() and consume excessive memory resources on the target system [CVE-2015-0206]. Versions 1.0.0 and 1.0.1 are affected.

The vendor was notified on January 7, 2015. 

Chris Mueller reported this vulnerability.

On systems built with the 'no-ssl3' option, a remote user can send a SSLv3 ClientHello message to later trigger a null pointer dereference [CVE-2014-3569].

The vendor was notified on October 17, 2014.

Frank Schmirler reported this vulnerability.

A remote server can initiate a handshake using an ephemeral ECDH ciphersuite using an ECDSA certificate but with the server key exchange message omitted to downgrade from ECDHE to ECDH and remove forward secrecy from the ciphersuite [CVE-2014-3572].

The vendor was notifed on October 22, 2014.

Karthikeyan Bhargavan of the PROSECCO team at INRIA reported this vulnerability.

A remote server can supply a weak RSA temporary key for a non-export RSA key exchange ciphersuite to downgrade the session security [CVE-2015-0204].

The vendor was notified on October 22, 2014.

Karthikeyan Bhargavan of the PROSECCO team at INRIA reported this vulnerability.

A remote client can send a DH certificate for client authentication without the certificate verify message to systems that trust a client certificate authority that issues certificates containing DH keys to authenticate without the use of a private key [CVE-2015-0205].
