A remote user can select a DHE ciphersuite and send a zero length ClientKeyExchange message to cause the target service to crash [CVE-2015-1787]. Only version 1.0.2 is affected. Matt Caswell of the OpenSSL development team reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

A remote user may be able to more readily predict keys in certain cases.
Solution:
Juniper has issued an advisory for CVE-2015-0209, CVE-2015-0286, CVE-2015-0287, CVE-2015-0288, CVE-2015-0289, CVE-2015-0292, and CVE-2015-0293 for Juniper SRC.

No solution was available at the time of this entry. The vendor is working on a fix (reference PR 1073259).

The Juniper advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10680

Title: (Juniper Issues Fix for Juniper SRC) GNU bash Environment Variable Processing Flaws Let Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in GNU bash. A user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. Juniper SRC is affected.
The software does not properly process environment variables.

A user can supply a specially crafted value that includes a bash function followed by additional code that, when processed by bash, will execute the additional code [CVE-2014-6271]. This vulnerability is known as "Shellshock".

Stephane Chazelas reported this vulnerability.

An initial fix for CVE-2014-6271 did not properly fix this flaw [CVE-2014-7169].

A user can supply a specially crafted value to trigger an out-of-bounds memory access in redir_stack() and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-7186].

Florian Weimer of Red Hat Product Security reported this vulnerability.

A user can supply specially crafted, deeply nested flow control constructs to trigger an off-by-one error and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-7187].

Florian Weimer of Red Hat Product Security reported this vulnerability.

A user can supply specially crafted data to access uninitialized memory and overwrite a pointer to potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-6277].

A user can supply specially crafted data to execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-6278].

Michal Zalewski reported these vulnerabilities.

On a system with an application that passes data from a remote or remote authenticated user to bash, a remote or remote authenticated user may be able to exploit these vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code.

Some common system application configurations are affected.

Demonstration exploit code is available.

This vulnerability is being actively exploited.
Impact': A user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. In some application configurations, a remote user may be able to exploit this.
Solution:
Juniper has issued a fix for Juniper SRC (4.4.0-R14, 4.5.0-R5, 4.6.0-R5, 4.7.0-R2, 4.8.0-R1).

The Juniper advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10648

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user on the local network can send specially crafted TCP traffic to the target device to cause denial of service conditions on the target device and the associated wireless access points.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCug67104 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the local network can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=39041

Title: (F5 Networks Issues Advisory for F5 BIG-IP) QEMU Floppy Disk Controller Emulation Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Version(s): 11.0.0 - 11.6.0; See vendor advisory for specific version numbers
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in QEMU. A local user on the guest system can obtain elevated privileges on the target host system. F5 BIG-IP is affected.
A local user on the guest system can supply specially crafted commands (e.g., FD_CMD_READ_ID, FD_CMD_DRIVE_SPECIFICATION_COMMAND) to trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target host system with the privileges of the QEMU process on the host.

VMware, Microsoft Hyper-V, and Bochs hypervisors are not affected.

The original advisory is available at:

http://venom.crowdstrike.com/

Jason Geffner, CrowdStrike Senior Security Researcher, reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user on the guest system can obtain elevated privileges on the target host system.
Solution:
F5 Networks has issued an advisory for F5 BIG-IP.

No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Versions prior to 11.0.0 are not affected.

The F5 Networks advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/16000/600/sol16620.html

Title: NETGEAR Router KCodes NetUSB Driver Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in multiple NETGEAR Routers. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted computername value via TCP port 20005 to trigger a stack overflow in the run_init_sbus() function in the KCodes NetUSB driver (i.e., NETGEAR ReadySHARE feature) and execute arbitrary code on the target system or cause the target system to reboot.

Other port numbers may also be affected.

The following model is affected:

NETGEAR WNDR4500 

The following models may be affected:

NETGEAR AC1450
NETGEAR CENTRIA (WNDR4700/4720)
NETGEAR D6100
NETGEAR D6200
NETGEAR D6300
NETGEAR D6400
NETGEAR DC112A
NETGEAR DC112A (Zain)
NETGEAR DGND4000
NETGEAR EX6200
NETGEAR EX7000
NETGEAR JNR3000
NETGEAR JNR3210
NETGEAR JR6150
NETGEAR LG6100D
NETGEAR PR2000
NETGEAR R6050
NETGEAR R6100
NETGEAR R6200
NETGEAR R6200v2
NETGEAR R6220
NETGEAR R6250
NETGEAR R6300v1
NETGEAR R6300v2
NETGEAR R6700
NETGEAR R7000
NETGEAR R7500
NETGEAR R7900
NETGEAR R8000
NETGEAR WN3500RP
NETGEAR WNDR3700v5
NETGEAR WNDR4300
NETGEAR WNDR4300v2
NETGEAR WNDR4500
NETGEAR WNDR4500v2
NETGEAR WNDR4500v3
NETGEAR XAU2511
NETGEAR XAUB2511

The original advisory is available at:

https://www.sec-consult.com/fxdata/seccons/prod/temedia/advisories_txt/20150519-0_KCodes_NetUSB_Kernel_Stack_Buffer_Overflow_v10.txt

Stefan Viehbock of SEC Consult Vulnerability Lab reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco IOS Voice Gateway ISDN Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS Voice Gateway. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted Integrated Services Digital Network (ISDN) Q.931 SETUP messages to trigger a flaw in the ISDN processing code and cause the target device to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCut37890 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=38833

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can submit specially crafted parameter values to cause the target device to crash.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCum65159 and CSCum65252 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=38789

Title: F5 BIG-IP Phone Home Signature Update Flaw Lets Remote Users Bypass Certificate Validation
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user can bypass certificate validation on the target system.
The automatic signature update function does not properly validate server SSL certificates. A remote user can create a specially crafted certificate and conduct a man-in-the-middle attack.
Impact': A remote user can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/16000/000/sol16090.html

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Wireless Web Authentication Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller. A remote user on the adjacent network can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a flaw in the wireless web authentication subsystem and cause the target device to restart.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum03269 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the adjacent network can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=38749

Title: Cisco StarOS for Cisco ASR 5000 Series Router HTTP Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco StarOS for Cisco ASR 5000 Series Router. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted HTTP packets to cause the target session manager service to reload. As a result, packet loss may occur during a recovery period.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCud14217 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target session manager service to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=38580

Title: Cisco StarOS for Cisco ASR 5000 Series Router Proxy Mobile IPv6 Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco StarOS for Cisco ASR 5000 Series Router. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted IPv6 proxy mobile (PM) packets to cause the target 'hamgr' service to reload. As a result, new calls may fail during the recovery period.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCut94711 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause new calls to fail.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=38557

Title: Cisco IOS XE Overlay Transport Virtualization Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user on the adjacent network can send specially crafted Overlay Transport Virtualization (OTV) frames to cause the target device to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCup37676 and CSCup30335 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the adjacent network can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=38549

Title: Cisco IOS/IOS-XE RADIUS Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS and IOS-XE. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted RADIUS packets to cause the target device to crash.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCur21348 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target device to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=38544

Title: Cisco IOS/IOS-XE DHCPv6 SOLICIT Message Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS and IOS XE. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user on the adjacent network can send specially crafted DHCPv6 packets to cause the target device to crash.

DHCPv6 packets for a SOLICIT message for an Identity Association for Non-Temporary Addresses (IA-NA) can trigger this flaw.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCur29956 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the adjacent network can cause the target device to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=38543

Title: Blue Coat ProxySG Discloses NTLM Hashes to Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Blue Coat ProxySG. A remote user can obtain authentication information on the target system.
A remote user can send an HTTP 407 authentication challenge request to obtain the NTLM hashes for ProxySG users. The hashes can then be used to obtain the Active Directory passwords of the proxy users.

Systems configured for explicit proxy are affected.

Jonas Vestberg at Sentor Managed Security Services AB reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain NTLM hashes for users on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (6.5.7.1).

A fix is not available for version 6.2.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://bto.bluecoat.com/security-advisory/sa93

Title: Cisco IOS XR on ASR 9000 Routers BVI Interface Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR on ASR Routers. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted IPv4 packets through the target device that is configured to route the packets via the bridge-group virtual interface (BVI) to cause the target network processor chip to lockup and eventually reload.

Systems configured to route traffic via the BVI and with the Unicast Reverse Path Forwarding (uRPF), policy-based routing (PBR), quality of service (QoS), or access control list (ACL) features enabled are affected.

Cisco Aggregation Services Routers (ASR) 9000 Series routers with Typhoon-based line cards are affected.

The Cisco ASR 9001 and Cisco ASR 9001-S Routers are affected.

IOS XR prior to version 4.3.0 is not affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCur62957 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target network processor chip to lockup and eventually reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix:

For 4.3.4:  asr9k-px-4.3.4.CSCur62957.pie
For 5.1.2:  asr9k-px-5.1.2.CSCur62957.pie
For 5.1.3:  asr9k-px-5.1.3.CSCur62957.pie
For 5.2.2:  asr9k-px-5.2.2.CSCur62957.pie
For 5.3.0:  asr9k-px-5.3.0.CSCur62957.pie

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150415-iosxr

Title: Juniper Junos CLI Bugs Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can supply specially crafted command line interface (CLI) commands and arguments to gain root privileges on the target system.

The vendor has assigned PRs 1007391, 980411, and 961823 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.1X44-D45, 12.1X46-D30, 12.1X47-D20, 12.3R9, 12.3X48-D10, 13.2R6, 13.3R5, 14.1R3, 14.2R1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10674

Title: Juniper Junos SRX Series Console Port Logout Bug Lets Local Users Gain Administrative Access
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos SRX Series. A local physically user can gain access on the target system.
The "log-out-on-disconnect" feature that is configured via the system port console ("stanza") may not disconnect a user after a system reboot. A physically local user may be able to reconnect to the console port and gain full administrative access.

The vendor has assigned PR 1000407 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A physically local user can gain full administrative access.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.1X44-D45, 12.1X46-D30, 12.1X47-D15, 12.3X48-D10).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10672

Title: Juniper Junos J-Web Missing 'X-Frame-Options' HTTP Header Lets Remote Users Conduct Clickjacking Attacks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos J-Web. A remote user can conduct click-jacking attacks.
Junos J-Web does not supply the 'X-Frame-Options' HTTP header. A remote user may be able to cause a target Junos J-Web user to perform certain administrative tasks.

Systems with J-Web enabled are affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 969531 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can conduct clickjacking attacks.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.4R12, 12.1X44-D35, 12.1X46-D25, 12.1X47-D10, 12.3X48-D10, 12.2R9, 12.3R7, 13.2R6, 13.2X51-D20, 13.3R5, 14.1R3, 14.1X53-D10, 14.2R1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10675

Title: Juniper Junos SRX Series Dynamic VPN Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos SRX Series Dynamic VPN. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Juniper Junos SRX Series Dynamic VPN interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

SRX series devices with Dynamic VPN enabled are affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 1031103 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Juniper Junos SRX Series Dynamic VPN interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.1X44-D45, 12.1X46-D30, 12.1X47-D20, 12.3X48-D10).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10677

Title: Juniper Junos on QFX3500 and QFX3600 Switches Insufficient Entropy May Result in Weak Keys
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos on QFX3500 and QFX3600 Switches. The system may generate keys that are not secure.
The system uses an insufficient number of bytes from the RANDOM_INTERRUPT entropy source when the device boots up. This may cause generated keys to be weak or duplicates of other keys and generated certificate signatures to be weak.

[Editor's note: The vendor notes that entropy increases after the system has been running for a while.]

The vendor has assigned PR 1000779 to this vulnerability.
Impact': SSH keys and self-signed certificates generated on these platforms may be insecure.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.2X50-D70, 13.1X50-D30, 13.2X51-D25, 13.2X51-D30, 13.2X52-D15, 14.1X53-D10).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10678

Title: (Juniper Issues Fix for Juniper SRC) OpenSSL Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Downgrade Session Security
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can downgrade the session security in certain cases. Juniper SRC is affected.
A remote user can send a specially crafted DTLS message to trigger a null pointer dereference fault in dtls1_get_record() and cause the target service to crash [CVE-2014-3571].

The vendor was notified on October 22, 2014.

Markus Stenberg of Cisco Systems, Inc. reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can send repeated DTLS records with the same sequence number but for the next epoch to trigger a memory leak in dtls1_buffer_record() and consume excessive memory resources on the target system [CVE-2015-0206]. Versions 1.0.0 and 1.0.1 are affected.

The vendor was notified on January 7, 2015. 

Chris Mueller reported this vulnerability.

On systems built with the 'no-ssl3' option, a remote user can send a SSLv3 ClientHello message to later trigger a null pointer dereference [CVE-2014-3569].

The vendor was notified on October 17, 2014.

Frank Schmirler reported this vulnerability.

A remote server can initiate a handshake using an ephemeral ECDH ciphersuite using an ECDSA certificate but with the server key exchange message omitted to downgrade from ECDHE to ECDH and remove forward secrecy from the ciphersuite [CVE-2014-3572].

The vendor was notifed on October 22, 2014.

Karthikeyan Bhargavan of the PROSECCO team at INRIA reported this vulnerability.

A remote server can supply a weak RSA temporary key for a non-export RSA key exchange ciphersuite to downgrade the session security [CVE-2015-0204].

The vendor was notified on October 22, 2014.

Karthikeyan Bhargavan of the PROSECCO team at INRIA reported this vulnerability.

A remote client can send a DH certificate for client authentication without the certificate verify message to systems that trust a client certificate authority that issues certificates containing DH keys to authenticate without the use of a private key [CVE-2015-0205]. Versions 1.0.0 and 1.0.1 are affected.

The vendor was notified on October 22, 2014.

Karthikeyan Bhargavan of the PROSECCO team at INRIA reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can modify the certificate fingerprint in certain cases [CVE-2014-8275]. Applications that rely on the uniqueness of certificate fingerprints may be affected.

The vendor was notified on December 1, 2014 and December 12, 2014 by separate parties.

Antti Karjalainen and Tuomo Untinen from the Codenomicon CROSS program (via NCSC-FI) reported one variant of this vulnerability. Konrad Kraszewski from Google reported another variant of this vulnerability.

Bignum squaring (BN_sqr) may randomly and rarely produce incorrect results on some platforms (including x86_64). The impact was not specified [CVE-2014-3570].

The vendor was notified on November 2, 2014.

Pieter Wuille (Blockstream) reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target system to crash.

A remote user can consume excessive memory resources on the target system.

A remote server can downgrade the session security in certain cases.

A remote user can bypass authentication in certain rare cases.
Solution:
Juniper has issued an advisory for Juniper SRC Series.

A fix is pending.

Juniper has assigned PR 1073259 to this vulnerability.

The Juniper advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10679

Title: (Juniper Issues Fix for Juniper Junos) OpenSSL Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Downgrade Session Security

The vendor was notified on December 1, 2014 and December 12, 2014 by separate parties.

Pieter Wuille (Blockstream) reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can cause the target system to crash.

A remote user can consume excessive memory resources on the target system.

A remote server can downgrade the session security in certain cases.

A remote user can bypass authentication in certain rare cases.
Solution:
Juniper has issued a fix for Juniper Junos (12.1X44-D50 (pending), 12.1X46-D35 (pending), 12.1X47-D25 (pending), 12.3R10, 12.3X48-D10, 13.2R8, 13.3R6, 14.1R5 (pending), 14.2R3 (pending)).

The Juniper advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10679

Title: (Juniper Issues Fix for Juniper Junos) ISC BIND Resolver Resource Consumption Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in ISC BIND. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. Juniper Junos is affected on SRX Series devices.
A remote user can send queries for domains that are in certain configurations (e.g., with difficult to resolve domain names) to consume excessive resources on the target system. This may cause the target 'named' service to crash.

Recursive resolvers are affected.

Authoritative servers may be affected if a remote user has control of a delegation traversed by the authoritative server in servicing the zone.

Florian Maury of ANSSI reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause excessive resource consumption on the target system, which may cause the target 'named' service to crash.
Solution:
Juniper has issued a fix for Juniper Junos (12.1X44-D50, 12.1X46-D35, 12.1X47-D25, 12.3X48-D10).

SRX Series devices running Junos OS 12.1X44, 12.1X46, and 12.1X47 are affected.

Juniper has assigned PR 1048628 to this vulnerability.

The Juniper advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10676

Title: (Cisco Issues Fix for Cisco Nexus 1000V/7000) Ntpd MAC Checking Failure Lets Remote Users Bypass Authentication
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Ntpd. A remote user can bypass authentication on the target system. Cisco Nexus 1000V and 7000 are affected.
When configured for symmetric key authentication, the system accepts packets that do not contain a message authentication code (MAC) as valid packets. A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can send a specially crafted spoofed packet that does not contain a MAC value to bypass authentication.

Authentication using autokey is not affected.

Miroslav Lichvar of Red Hat reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass authentication on the target system.
Solution:
Cisco has issued an advisory for Cisco Nexus 1000V and 7000.

A fix for Nexus 1000V (5.2(1)SV3(2.1)) is planned for August 2015.

Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCut77412 (for Nexus 7000) and CSCut77414 (for Nexus 1000V) to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150408-ntpd

Title: (Cisco Issues Fix for Cisco Nexus 1000V/7000) Ntpd Symmetric Mode Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Ntpd. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. Cisco Nexus 1000V and 7000 are affected.
A remote user with knowledge of a symmetric association between two hosts can periodically send a specially crafted packet to one host of the symmetric association to cause both hosts to fail to synchronize.

Systems that are configured to use symmetric key authentication are affected.

Miroslav Lichvar of Red Hat reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause two hosts of a symmetric association to fail to synchronize.
Solution:
Cisco has issued an advisory for Nexus 1000V and 7000.

A fix for Nexus 1000V (5.2(1)SV3(2.1)) is planned for August 2015.

Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCut77412 (for Nexus 7000) and CSCut77414 (for Nexus 1000V) to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150408-ntpd

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco MDS 9000) Ntpd MAC Checking Failure Lets Remote Users Bypass Authentication
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Ntpd. A remote user can bypass authentication on the target system. Cisco MDS 9000 is affected.
When configured for symmetric key authentication, the system accepts packets that do not contain a message authentication code (MAC) as valid packets. A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can send a specially crafted spoofed packet that does not contain a MAC value to bypass authentication.

Authentication using autokey is not affected.

Miroslav Lichvar of Red Hat reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass authentication on the target system.
Solution:
Cisco has issued an advisory for Cisco MDS 9000.

Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCut77411 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150408-ntpd

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco MDS 9000) Ntpd Symmetric Mode Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Ntpd. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. Cisco MDS 9000 is affected.
A remote user with knowledge of a symmetric association between two hosts can periodically send a specially crafted packet to one host of the symmetric association to cause both hosts to fail to synchronize.

Systems that are configured to use symmetric key authentication are affected.

Miroslav Lichvar of Red Hat reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause two hosts of a symmetric association to fail to synchronize.
Solution:
Cisco has issued an advisory for Cisco MDS 9000.

Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCut77411 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150408-ntpd

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco IOS/IOS XE) Ntpd Symmetric Mode Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Ntpd. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. Cisco IOS and IOS XE are affected.
A remote user with knowledge of a symmetric association between two hosts can periodically send a specially crafted packet to one host of the symmetric association to cause both hosts to fail to synchronize.

Systems that are configured to use symmetric key authentication are affected.

Miroslav Lichvar of Red Hat reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause two hosts of a symmetric association to fail to synchronize.
Solution:
Cisco has issued an advisory for Cisco IOS and IOS XE.

Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCut77619 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150408-ntpd

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco IOS/IOS XE) Ntpd MAC Checking Failure Lets Remote Users Bypass Authentication
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Ntpd. A remote user can bypass authentication on the target system. Cisco IOS and IOS XE are affected.
When configured for symmetric key authentication, the system accepts packets that do not contain a message authentication code (MAC) as valid packets. A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can send a specially crafted spoofed packet that does not contain a MAC value to bypass authentication.

Authentication using autokey is not affected.

Miroslav Lichvar of Red Hat reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass authentication on the target system.
Solution:
Cisco has issued an advisory for Cisco IOS and IOS XE.

Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCut77619 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150408-ntpd

Title: Cisco ASR 9000 Router ACL Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Bypass Access Controls
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco 9000 ASR Router. A remote user can bypass access controls on the target system.
The Object-ACL matching process does not properly process host access control entries, granting access to any address instead of the specified host address.

A remote user can exploit this to bypass a configured access control list (ACL) and access resources on the target network.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCur28806 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass access controls on the target system and gain access to restricted network resources.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=38292

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Input Validation Flaw in HTML Help System Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The HTML help system does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Cisco Wireless LAN Controller web interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assgined bug ID CSCun95178 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Cisco Wireless LAN Controller web interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=38222

Title: Cisco ASR 1000 Series Router H.323 Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASR Router. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted H.323 packets to a device configured to use Network Address Translation (NAT) to trigger a flaw in the Embedded Services Processor (ESP) module and cause the target device to crash.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCup21070 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=38210

Title: Cisco Catalyst 4500 SNMP Polling Error Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Catalyst 4500 Series devices. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can trigger a flaw in the SNMP code to cause the target device to crash.

The flaw occurs when SNMP polling is performed on a device configured for Virtual Switching System (VSS) where there is only one switch in the VSS cluster.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuq04574 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target device to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=38194

Title: Cisco Nexus 9000 SNMP Subsystem Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Nexus 9000. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can trigger a flaw in the SNMP subsystem to cause the target device to reload.

Systems configured with the High Availability (HA) policy set to Reset are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuq92240 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=38193

Title: Cisco ASR 1000 Series Router Adjacency Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Version(s): Cisco ASR 1000 Series; IOS XE prior to 3.7.5S
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASR 1000 Series Router. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
The system does not properly processing route adjacencies. A remote user can send specially crafted IP packets to the target device to cause the device to stop responding.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCub31873 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to stop responding.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=38124

Title: Cisco NX-OS DHCP PowerOn Auto Provisioning Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Commands
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.
A remote user on the adjacent network can return specially crafted DHCP options to trigger a flaw in the PowerOn Auto Provisioning (POAP) feature and execute arbitrary commands on the target device. The commands will run with root privileges.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCur14589 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the adjacent network can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=38062

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Web Authentication Password Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user on the adjacent network can send specially crafted password values to trigger a flaw in the web authentication feature and cause the target device to crash and reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui57980 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the adjacent can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=38076

Title: Cisco IOS Common Industrial Protocol Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted UDP packets to the target Common Industrial Protocol (CIP) port (i.e., 2222, 44818) on the target device via IPv4 and cause the target device to reload [CVE-2015-0647].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum98371 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted sequence of TCP packets to the target CIP port (i.e., 44818) on the target device via IPv4 to trigger a memory leak and cause the target device to eventually reload [CVE-2015-0648].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCun49658 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted TCP packets to the target CIP port (i.e., 44818) on the target device via IPv4 to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2015-0649].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCun63514 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150325-cip

Title: Cisco IOS Virtual Routing and Forwarding Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted ICMPv4 packets to a target interface that is configured to perform virtual routing and forwarding (VRF) to cause a queue wedge and prevent the interface from processing additional packets.

Packets sent through the device do not trigger this flaw.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCsi02145 to this vulnerability.

Cisco IOS-XE is not affected.

Cisco IOS XR is not affected.

Cisco NX-OS is not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target interface to stop processing packets.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150325-wedge

Title: Cisco IOS and IOS-XE ANI Flaws Let Remote Users Spoof Responses and Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS and IOS-XE. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A remote user can spoof ANRA responses.
The system does not properly validate Autonomic Networking (AN) response messages. A remote user can send specially crafted AN response messages to spoof Autonomic Networking Registration Authority (ANRA) messages and cause the target device to bootstrap into an untrusted autonomic domain [CVE-2015-0635]. This can be exploited to obtain limited command and control access to the AN node, cause denial of service conditions, and disrupt access to the valid autonomic domain.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCup62191 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted AN messages to spoof an AN node and reset the finite state machine to cause denial of service conditions and disrupt access to the autonomic domain from the target AN node [CVE-2015-0636].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCup62293 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted AN messages to spoof an AN node and cause the target device to reload [CVE-2015-0637].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCup62315 to this vulnerability.

The following devices are affected:

Cisco ASR 901, 901S, and 903 Series Aggregation Services Routers
Cisco ME 3600, 3600X, and 3800X Series Ethernet Access Switches
Impact':
A remote user can disrupt access to the target autonomic domain.

A remote user can spoof ANRA responses.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150325-ani

Title: Cisco ASR Series IOS-XE Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS-XE on Cisco ASR 1000, 4400, and 1000v Series Routers. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send a large amount of specially crafted (oversized) IP packets that require fragmentation that, when processed by the target network address translation and high-speed logging functions will cause the target device to reload [CVE-2015-0640].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuo25741 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted TCP packet that requires processing by the target AppNav component to cause the target device to reload or execute arbitrary code on the forwarding engine [CVE-2015-0644].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuo53622 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted IPv6 packets to the target device to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2015-0641].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCub68073 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send multiple specially crafted IPv4 or IPv6 packets that require processing by the Layer 4 Redirect (L4R) processing code on the target device to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2015-0645].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuq59131 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send multiple specially crafted IPv6 packets encapsulated in IPv4 UDP packets that, when processed by the target system configured with Media Monitoring (MMON) or Network-Based Application Recognition (NBAR) configured, will trigger a flaw in the Common Flow Table (CFT) processing and cause the target device to reload [CVE-2015-0639].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCua79665 to this vulnerability.

Cisco 1000 Series Aggregation Services Routers (ASR), 4400 Series Integrated Services Routers (ISR), and 1000v Series Cloud Services Routers (CSR) are affected.

Cisco IOS is not affected.

Cisco IOS XR is not affected.
Impact':
A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150325-iosxe

Title: Cisco IOS and IOS-XE TCP Packet Memory Leak Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS and IOS-XE. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted sequence of TCP data via IPv4 or IPv6 to the target device to trigger a memory leak cause the target system to eventually reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum94811 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150325-tcpleak

Title: Cisco IOS and IOS-XE mDNS Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS and IOS-XE. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted mDNS packets on UDP port 5353 via IPv4 or IPv6 to cause the target device to reload.

Packets destined for any interface configured on the target device, the IPv4 multicast address 224.0.0.251, or the IPv6 multicast address FF02::FB are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCup70579 to this vulnerability.

Cisco IOS XR is not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150325-mdns

Title: Cisco IOS and IOS-XE IKEv2 Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS and IOS-XE. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted IKEv2 packets to the target device to consume excessive resources on the target system or cause the target system to reload.

Systems with Internet Security Association and Key Management Protocol (ISAKMP) enabled are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuo75572 and CSCum36951 to these vulnerabilities.

Cisco IOS XR is not affected.

Cisco NX-OS is not affected.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive resources on the target system or cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150325-ikev2

Title: Cisco 9000 Series Aggregation Services Routers DHCPv4 Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco 9000 Series Aggregation Services Routers. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send a large amount of specially crafted DHCPv4 data to the targeted interface to cause the target device to stop responding to DHCP requests on that interface.

Cisco IOS XR is affected on 9000 Series ASR routers.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCup67822 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target interface to stop processing DHCP requests.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=38006

Title: Cisco IOS ANI Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Modify the Configuration and Cause Denial of Service Conditions
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can modify the configuration and cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted data Autonomic Networking (AN) messages to overwrite some configuration values and cause partial denial of service conditions.

A limited set of router services are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCup62167 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can modify the configuration and cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=37935

Title: Cisco Content Services Switch 11500 Port Forwarding Flaw Lets Remote Users Connect to Other Devices
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Content Services Switch 11500. A remote user can connect to other devices on the target network.
The system does not properly process port forwarding on SSH packets. A remote user can send specially crafted SSH packets to the Management Interface to connect to other devices on the target network.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCut14855 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can connect to other devices on the target network.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=37889

Title: (Cisco Issues Fix for Cisco Application Control Engine) OpenSSL Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Downgrade Session Security
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can downgrade the session security in certain cases. Cisco Application Control Engine is affected.
A remote user can send a specially crafted DTLS message to trigger a null pointer dereference fault in dtls1_get_record() and cause the target service to crash [CVE-2014-3571].

The vendor was notified on October 22, 2014.

Markus Stenberg of Cisco Systems, Inc. reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can send repeated DTLS records with the same sequence number but for the next epoch to trigger a memory leak in dtls1_buffer_record() and consume excessive memory resources on the target system [CVE-2015-0206]. Versions 1.0.0 and 1.0.1 are affected.

The vendor was notified on January 7, 2015. 

Chris Mueller reported this vulnerability.

On systems built with the 'no-ssl3' option, a remote user can send a SSLv3 ClientHello message to later trigger a null pointer dereference [CVE-2014-3569].

The vendor was notified on October 17, 2014.

Frank Schmirler reported this vulnerability.

A remote server can initiate a handshake using an ephemeral ECDH ciphersuite using an ECDSA certificate but with the server key exchange message omitted to downgrade from ECDHE to ECDH and remove forward secrecy from the ciphersuite [CVE-2014-3572].

The vendor was notifed on October 22, 2014.

Karthikeyan Bhargavan of the PROSECCO team at INRIA reported this vulnerability.

A remote server can supply a weak RSA temporary key for a non-export RSA key exchange ciphersuite to downgrade the session security [CVE-2015-0204].

The vendor was notified on October 22, 2014.

Karthikeyan Bhargavan of the PROSECCO team at INRIA reported this vulnerability.

A remote client can send a DH certificate for client authentication without the certificate verify message to systems that trust a client certificate authority that issues certificates containing DH keys to authenticate without the use of a private key [CVE-2015-0205]. Versions 1.0.0 and 1.0.1 are affected.

The vendor was notified on October 22, 2014.

Karthikeyan Bhargavan of the PROSECCO team at INRIA reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can modify the certificate fingerprint in certain cases [CVE-2014-8275]. Applications that rely on the uniqueness of certificate fingerprints may be affected.

The vendor was notified on December 1, 2014 and December 12, 2014 by separate parties.

Antti Karjalainen and Tuomo Untinen from the Codenomicon CROSS program (via NCSC-FI) reported one variant of this vulnerability. Konrad Kraszewski from Google reported another variant of this vulnerability.

Bignum squaring (BN_sqr) may randomly and rarely produce incorrect results on some platforms (including x86_64). The impact was not specified [CVE-2014-3570].

The vendor was notified on November 2, 2014.

Pieter Wuille (Blockstream) reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target system to crash.

A remote user can consume excessive memory resources on the target system.

A remote server can downgrade the session security in certain cases.

A remote user can bypass authentication in certain rare cases.
Solution:
Cisco has issued a fix for Cisco ACE30 Application Control Engine Module (3.0(0)A5, (3.1.15)).

Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCus42709 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150310-ssl

Title: (Cisco Issues Fix for Cisco IOS) OpenSSL Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Downgrade Session Security
Description:

The vendor was notified on December 1, 2014 and December 12, 2014 by separate parties.

Solution:
Cisco has issued a fix for Cisco IOS (15.5(3)S).

Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCus61884 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150310-ssl

Title: Cisco IOS XE ANI Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Add Invalid Device Entries
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE. A remote user can modify data on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted Autonomic Networking (AN) message to add invalid device entries or cause an adjacency to be formed with another device.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCup62157 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can add invalid device entries or cause an adjacency to be formed with another device.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2015-0659

Title: Cisco IOS XR SNMP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted SNMPv2 packet to the target device to cause the target SNMP service to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCur25858 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target snmp process to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2015-0661

Title: Cisco IOS/IOS XE RADIUS Processing Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS and IOS XE. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
The system does not properly processing RADIUS Accept packets with specially crafted IPv6 attribute value pairs. A remote authenticated user can inject specially crafted packets to cause the target device to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCur84322 and CSCur27693 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2015-0598

Title: Cisco IOS XR RSVP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted RSVP packet to cause the target RSVP process to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCur69192 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target RSVP process to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2015-0657

Title: Cisco IOS Bug in Authentication Proxy May Let Remote Users Bypass Authentication
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can bypass authentication on the target authentication proxy.
The Authentication Proxy feature does not properly process unsupported AAA return codes. A remote user can send an empty password to attempt to cause the target Authentication Proxy to fail in the case where the AAA server returns a code that is not supported by the Authentication Proxy.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuo09400 and CSCun16016 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass authentication on the target authentication proxy.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2015-0607

Title: Cisco IOS/IOS-XE IPv6 Neighbor Discovery Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS and IOS-XE. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
A remote user on the adjacent network can send a flood of specially crafted IPv6 router solicitations to trigger a race condition when the interface state changes and cause denial of service conditions.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuo67770 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the adjacent network can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2015-0632

Title: Cisco Application Control Engine 4710 Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Application Control Engine 4710. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.
A remote user can create a specially crafted link that, when loaded by the target user, will take actions on the target interface acting as the target user.

The vulnerability resides in the Cisco Application Networking Manager (ANM) and the Device Manager (DM) components.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuo99753 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can take actions on the target interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2015-0651

Description:

Title: Cisco IOS XR for Carrier Routing System IPv6 Parsing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR for Cisco Carrier Routing System. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted IPv6 packets with extension headers through the target Cisco IOS XR device line card to cause the target line card to reload.

Systems configured to process IPv6 traffic passing through the target device are affected. 

The vendor has assigned bug ID bug ID CSCuq95241 to this vulnerability.

Cisco IOS XR release version 5.3.2 for Cisco NCS 6000 is not affected. Cisco IOS XR release version 5.3.0 for CRS-X is not affected.

Cisco Network Convergence System 6000 (NCS 6000) is also affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target line card to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix:

hfr-px-5.1.3.CSCuq95241.pie for version 5.1.3 for CRS-X
hfr-px-5.1.4.CSCuq95241.pie for version 5.1.4 for CRS-X

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150220-ipv6

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller IDS Bug Lets Remote Wireless Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user on the wireless network can send a large number of specially crafted packets to the target device to trigger a flaw in the wireless intrusion detection (WIDS) feature and cause the target device to later become unresponsive. The device will become unresponsive when the administrator later selects the IDS events under Security > Wireless Protection Policies > Signature Events Summary via the administrative interface.

All wireless clients will be disconnected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCus46861 to this vulnerability.

Darren Johnson reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the wireless network can cause the target device to become unresponsive.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2015-0622

Title: Netgear WNDR Router SOAP Interface Discloses Authentication Information to Remote Users on the Local Network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Netgear WNDR Routers. A remote user can obtain authentication information.
A remote user on the local network can submit a specially crafted HTTP SOAP request to bypass authentication and obtain sensitive information, including administrative authentication credentials.

On systems with remote management enabled, a remote user can exploit this flaw via the Internet.

The following models are affected:

NetGear WNDR3700v4 - V1.0.0.4SH
NetGear WNDR3700v4 - V1.0.1.52
NetGear WNR2200 - V1.0.1.88
NetGear WNR2500 - V1.0.0.24
NetGear WNDR3700v2 - V1.0.1.14
NetGear WNDR3700v1 - V1.0.16.98
NetGear WNDR3700v1 - V1.0.7.98
NetGear WNDR4300 - V1.0.1.60
NetGear R6300v2 - V1.0.3.8
NetGear WNDR3800 - V1.0.0.48

The following models may be affected:

NetGear WNDR3800
NetGear WNDRMAC
NetGear WPN824N
NetGear WNDR4700

The vendor was notified on January 18, 2015.

A demonstration exploit is available at:

https://github.com/darkarnium/secpub/tree/master/NetGear/SOAPWNDR

Peter Adkins reported this vulnerability. Paula Thomas, Michal Bartoszkiewicz, Ronny Lindner, and Robert Muller identified additional vulnerable versions.
Impact': A remote user on the local network can obtain administrative authentication credentials.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco ASR 5500 System Architecture Evolution Gateway SNMP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASR 5500 System Architecture Evolution Gateway. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted SNMP data to cause excessive CPU resource consumption on the target system and potentially cause the target SNMP service to crash.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCur13393 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause excessive CPU resource consumption on the target system and potentially cause the target SNMP service to crash.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2015-0617

Title: Cisco IOS Race Condition Lets Remote Users Bypass Access Controls
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can bypass access controls.
A remote user can send an amount of traffic through the target device to trigger a race condition between process switching and CEF switching and potentially bypass access controls on object groups.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCun21071 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass access controls.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2015-0610

Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS Measurement, Aggregation, and Correlation Engine. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to the target router to trigger a race condition between process switching and CEF switching and cause the target device to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCul48736 and CSCuj96752 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2015-0608

Title: Cisco IOS Shell Command Processing Flaw Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
An unprivileged local user can cause issue IOS Shell commands to cause the target device to crash.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCur59696 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can cause the target device to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2015-0606

Title: Cisco IOS Zone-Based Firewall Session Management Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted traffic through the target device to exploit a flaw in managing firewall session objects the Zone-Based Firewall feature and cause the target device to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul65003 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-2153

Title: Cisco IOS Zone-Based Firewall Kernel Timer Management Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted traffic to trigger a flaw in the management of kernel timers and cause the target device to reload.

Timers used by the Zone-Based Firewall feature are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuh25672 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2015-0592

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco Nexus 7000 and 1000V Series Switches) Glibc Buffer Overflow in __nss_hostname_digits_dots() Lets Remote and Local Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Glibc. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. Cisco Nexus 7000 and 1000V Series Switches are affected.
A remote or local user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow in __nss_hostname_digits_dots() and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target application or service using the glibc library.

The buffer overflow can be accessed via the various gethostbyname() functions.

Several Linux-based applications that use glibc are affected.

Qualys reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
Cisco has issued an advisory for Cisco Nexus 7000 and 1000V Series Switches.

Cisco has assigned bug IDs CSCus68892 (for Nexus 7000) and CSCus71708 (for Nexus 1000V) to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150128-ghost

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco MDS 9000 Series Multilayer Switches) Glibc Buffer Overflow in __nss_hostname_digits_dots() Lets Remote and Local Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Glibc. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. Cisco MDS 9000 Series Multilayer Switches are affected.
A remote or local user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow in __nss_hostname_digits_dots() and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target application or service using the glibc library.

The buffer overflow can be accessed via the various gethostbyname() functions.

Several Linux-based applications that use glibc are affected.

Qualys reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
Cisco has issued an advisory for Cisco MDS 9000 Series Multilayer Switches.

Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCus68360 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150128-ghost

Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Glibc. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. Cisco IOS-XE for Catalyst is affected.
A remote or local user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow in __nss_hostname_digits_dots() and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target application or service using the glibc library.

The buffer overflow can be accessed via the various gethostbyname() functions.

Several Linux-based applications that use glibc are affected.

Qualys reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCus69731 to this vulnerability.
