http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150128-ghost

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco IOS-XE for ASR) Glibc Buffer Overflow in __nss_hostname_digits_dots() Lets Remote and Local Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Glibc. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. Cisco IOS-XE for ASR1k and ASR903 Series routers are affected.
A remote or local user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow in __nss_hostname_digits_dots() and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target application or service using the glibc library.

The buffer overflow can be accessed via the various gethostbyname() functions.

Several Linux-based applications that use glibc are affected.

Qualys reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
Cisco has issued an advisory for Cisco IOS-XE for ASR1k and ASR903 routers.

Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCus69732 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150128-ghost

Title: Cisco NX-OS TACACS+ Command Processing Flaw Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can submit a specially crafted command that requires command authorization to exploit a flaw in the TACACS+ command authorization cause the system to reset.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCur54182 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-8013

Title: (Juniper Issues Advisory for Juniper SRC) Glibc Buffer Overflow in __nss_hostname_digits_dots() Lets Remote and Local Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Glibc. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. Juniper SRC is affected.
A remote or local user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow in __nss_hostname_digits_dots() and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target application or service using the glibc library.

The buffer overflow can be accessed via the various gethostbyname() functions.

Several Linux-based applications that use glibc are affected.

Qualys reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
Juniper has issued an advisory for Juniper SRC.

No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Juniper has assigned PR 1060350 to this vulnerability.

The Juniper advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10671

Title: Cisco 2900 Series Router NBAR Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco 2900 Series Router. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted IPv4 packets through the target router to trigger a flaw in the Network-Based Application Recognition (NBAR) protocol process to cause denial of service conditions.

A router restart is required to return the system to normal operations.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuo73682 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2015-0586

Title: Siemens Scalance X-300/X 408 HTTP/HTTPS/FTP Flaws Let Remote Users Deny Service
Version(s): X-300 and X-408 Switches; prior to 4.0
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Siemens Scalance X-300 and X 408 Switches. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted HTTP requests to the web server port to cause the target device to reboot [CVE-2014-8478].

A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted network packets to the FTP server port to cause the target device to reboot [CVE-2014-8479].

Deja vu Security reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote or remote authenticated user can cause the target device to reboot.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (4.0).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.siemens.com/innovation/pool/de/forschungsfelder/siemens_security_advisory_ssa-321046.pdf

Title: Juniper Junos MX Series PPP Authentication Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted PAP Authenticate-Request to cause the target PPP daemon (jpppd) to crash. The target broadband edge router will not send any response to the subscriber.

MX Series routers deployed as broadband edge (BBE) routers are affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 1040665 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target PPP daemon to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (13.3R6, 14.1R4, 14.1X50-D70, 14.2R2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10665

Title: Juniper Junos OSPFv3 IPsec AH Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user on the adjacent network can send a specially crafted fragmented OSPFv3 packet containing an IPsec Authentication Header (AH) to cause the target kernel to crash and the routing engine to restart.

Systems with OSPFv3 IPsec authentication enabled are affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 993022 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target routing engine to restart.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.4R13, 12.1X44-D45, 12.1X46-D30, 12.1X47-D15, 12.2R9, 12.3R7-S1, 12.3R8, 13.1R5, 13.2R6, 13.3R4, 14.1R2, 14.2R1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10668

Title: F5 BIG-IP Application Security Manager Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP Application Security Manager. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The system does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user with the Application Security Editor role cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target administrative user's browser. The code will originate from the F5 BIG-IP interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The 'Response Body' custom response configuration page is affected.

The vendor was notified on June 9, 2014.

Peter Lapp reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the F5 BIG-IP interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution: The vendor silently issued a fix (11.6).

Title: Juniper Junos Does Not Properly Enforce IPv4 Stateless Port Matching Filters
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can bypass firewall rules.
The IPv4 port matching filters do not properly detect matching packets. A remote user may be able to bypass stateless firewall filters.

Systems with Trio-based PFE modules (e.g., MX Series) are affected when running specific versions of Junos OS: 13.3R3, 14.1R1, and 14.1R2.
Impact': A remote user can bypass firewall rules.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (13.3R3-S3​, 13.3R4, 14.1R3, 14.2R1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10666

Title: Juniper Junos BGP FlowSpec Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted BGP FlowSpec prefix to cause the target routing process daemon (rpd) to crash.

Systems with BGP FlowSpec enabled are affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause target routing process daemon (rpd) to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.4R8, 12.1X44-D35, 12.1X45-D25, 12.1X46-D20, 12.1X47-D10, 12.2R9, 12.3R2-S3, 12.3R3, 13.1R4, 13.2R1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10670

Title: Juniper Junos TACACS+ Configuration Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
When authorization attributes in the TACACS+ configuration contain double quotes, a local user can bypass policy to run restricted commands.
Impact': A local user can run restricted commands that are ostensibly block by policy.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.1X44-D45, 12.1X46-D25, 12.1X47-D15, 12.3R9, 13.1R4-S3, 13.2R6, 13.3R5, 14.1R3, 14.2R1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10667

Title: Cisco MDS 9000 NX-OS High Availability Subsystem Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco MDS 9000. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted traffic to a target device to trigger a flaw in the high availability (HA) subsystem of Cisco NX-OS running on MDS 9000 series devices to cause unspecified denial of service conditions.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuo09129 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2015-0582

Title: (Juniper Issues Advisory for Junos) NTP Buffer Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in NTP. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. Juniper Junos is affected.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target ntpd process.

A buffer overflow may occur in crypto_recv() when Autokey Authentication is enabled.

A buffer overflow may occur in ctl_putdata().

A buffer overflow may occur in configure().

Stephen Roettger of the Google Security Team reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system with the privileges of the ntpd process.
Solution:
Juniper Junos is affected.

The Juniper advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10663

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco Nexus 3000 and 9000 Series Switches) NTP Logic Error in the receive() Function in 'ntp_proto.c' May Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in NTP. A remote user may be able to cause denial of service conditions. Cisco Nexus 3000 and 9000 Series Switches are affected.
A remote user may be able to trigger a certain and rare error to exploit a logic error in ntp_proto.c:receive() and adversely affect system integrity.

The vulnerability occurs due to a missing return statement.

[Editor's note: The vendor indicates that they have not be able to identify a method to affect system integrity.]

Stephen Roettger of the Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user may be able to adversely affect system integrity.
Solution:
Cisco has issued an advisory for Cisco Nexus 3000 and 9000 series switches.

Cisco has assigned bug IDs CSCus26875 (for Nexus 3000) and CSCus29415 (for Nexus 9000) to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20141222-ntpd

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco Nexus 3000 and 9000 Series Switches) NTP Buffer Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in NTP. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. Cisco Nexus 3000 and 9000 Series Switches are affected.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target ntpd process.

A buffer overflow may occur in crypto_recv() when Autokey Authentication is enabled.

A buffer overflow may occur in ctl_putdata().

A buffer overflow may occur in configure().

Stephen Roettger of the Google Security Team reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system with the privileges of the ntpd process.
Solution:
Cisco has issued an advisory for Cisco Nexus 3000 and 9000 series switches.

Cisco has assigned bug IDs CSCus26875 (for Nexus 3000) and CSCus29415 (for Nexus 9000) to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20141222-ntpd

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco Nexus 3000 and 9000 Series Switches) NTP Uses Weak Default Encryption Key and Weak RNG Seed
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in NTP. A remote user can access and modify data. Cisco Nexus 3000 and 9000 Series Switches are affected.
A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can obtain encrypted data and decrypt it.

When no auth key is specified in the configuration file, the system generates a 31-bit key using a weak randomization function [CVE-2014-9293]. Versions prior to 4.2.7p11 [January 2010] are affected.

Neel Mehta of the Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.

The system uses a week seed for ntp-keygen to genearte symmetric keys [CVE-2014-9294]. Versions prior to 4.2.7p230 are affected [Nov 2011].

Stephen Roettger of the Google Security Team reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access and modify data.
Solution:
Cisco has issued an advisory for Cisco Nexus 3000 and 9000 series switches.

Cisco has assigned bug IDs CSCus26875 (for Nexus 3000) and CSCus29415 (for Nexus 9000) to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20141222-ntpd

Title: Cisco IOS XR RSVP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted RSVP packet to cause the target RSVP service to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCub63710 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target RSVP service to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-8014

Title: Cisco Application Control Engine SSLv3 Decoding Function Lets Remote Users Decrypt TLS Traffic
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Application Control Engine. A remote user can decrypt TLS sessions in certain cases.
The system may accept incorrect TLS padding when terminating TLSv1 CBC connections. A remote user can with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can force a client to use a vulnerable SSLv3 decoding function with TLS and then conduct a BEAST-style of attack to decrypt portions of the session.

This protocol vulnerability is a variant of the POODLE ("Padding Oracle On Downgraded Legacy Encryption") attack.

This is a flaw in the protocol rather than in the TLS implementation.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCus09311 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco ACE 4700 Series Application Control Engine appliances are not affected, even though some vulnerability scanners may (incorrectly) identify them as vulnerable.

The original advisory is available at:

https://www.imperialviolet.org/2014/12/08/poodleagain.html

Brian Smith, Adam Langley, and Yngve Pettersen separately reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can decrypt TLS sessions.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-8730

Title: Juniper WLC Series Lets Remote Users on the Wireless Network Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper WLC Series devices. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user on the wireless network can send specially crafted data to cause the target WLC device to disconnect from the cluster, denying service to the wireless access points.

Systems with the 'Proxy ARP' or 'No Broadcast' features enabled in a clustered WLC setup are affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target WLC device to disconnect from the cluster, denying service to the wireless access points.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (8.0.4, 9.0.2.11, 9.0.3.5, 9.1.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10662

Title: F5 BIG-IP SSLv3 Decoding Function Lets Remote Users Decrypt TLS Traffic
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user can decrypt TLS sessions in certain cases.
The system may accept incorrect TLS padding when terminating TLSv1 CBC connections. A remote user can with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can force a client to use a vulnerable SSLv3 decoding function with TLS and then conduct a BEAST-style of attack to decrypt portions of the session.

This protocol vulnerability is a variant of the POODLE ("Padding Oracle On Downgraded Legacy Encryption") attack.

This is a flaw in the protocol rather than in the TLS implementation.

The vendor has assignd IDs 451218, 450804, 454465 (BIG-IP), 494328, 494330, and 494331 (BIG-IQ) to this vulnerability.

[Editor's note: The vendor has also assigned ID 494339, 494341, and 494342 to this vulnerability for F5 Enterprise Manager, which contains the affected code but does not expose SSL profiles and is not vulnerable.]

The original advisory is available at:

https://www.imperialviolet.org/2014/12/08/poodleagain.html

Brian Smith, Adam Langley, and Yngve Pettersen separately reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can decrypt TLS sessions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/15000/800/sol15882.html

Title: Cisco IOS XR Flaw in lighttpd Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can attempt to establish multiple specially crafted TCP sessions to cause the target lighttpd service to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuq45239 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target lighttpd service to restart.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-8005

Title: Cisco IOS XR LISP TCP Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send multiple specially crafted Locator/ID Separation Protocol (LISP) TCP sessions to cause the target LISP service to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuq90378 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target LISP process to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-8004

Title: Cisco IOS DLSw Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
The system does not properly initialize packet buffers. A remote user can connect to the DLSw port (TCP port 2067) to obtain potentially sensitive information from previously processed packets. This may include clear-text passwords and SNMP community strings.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCur14014 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-7992

Title: Cisco Aironet EAP Processing Error Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Aironet. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted EAP packet when the 'debug dot11 aaa authenticator all' command is enabled on the device to cause unspecified denial of service conditions.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul15509 to this vulnerability.

Maxim Salomon and Timo Warns of Airbus Operations GmbH reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-7998

Title: Cisco Aironet DHCP Lease Renewal Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Aironet. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user on the adjacent network can prevent the target access point from renewing its DHCP lease to cause the target device to restart.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCtn16281 to this vulnerability.

Maxim Salomon and Timo Warns of Airbus Operations GmbH reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the local network can cause the target device to restart.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-7997

Title: F5 BIG-IP Lets Remote Authenticated Users Delete Files on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote authenticated user can delete files on the target system.
A remote authenticated user with Resource Administrator or Administrator privileges can submit a specially crafted request to determine and delete files on the target system.

A demonstration exploit is available at:

http://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/35222/

Anastasios Monachos (secuid0) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can delete files on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (10.2.2, 11.0.0).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/13000/100/sol13109.html

Title: Belkin Play N750 DB Wireless Dual-Band N+ Router Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Belkin Play N750 DB Wireless Dual-Band N+ Router. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted request to trigger a buffer overflow in 'login.cgi' in MiniHttpdand and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with root privileges.

Marco Vaz reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target device with root privileges.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a firmware fix (F9K1103_WW_1.10.17m).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.belkin.com/us/support-article?articleNum=4831

Title: Cisco IOS XE Flaw in 'request system shell' Command Lets Local Administrative Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user with administrative privilege (15) can provide a specially crafted crafted challenge response to exploit a flaw in the 'request system shell' command and gain access to the operating system shell.

Systems with the 'service internal' command configured are affected.

The WS-C3850, WS-C3860, and AIR-CT5760 platforms are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCur09815 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local administrative user can gain access to the operating system shell.
Solution:
The vendor has described a workaround.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-7990

Title: Cisco Small Business RV Series Router Bugs Let Remote Users Upload Arbitrary Files and Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Commands Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): Models RV120W, RV180, RV180W, and RV220W
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Small Business RV Series routers. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system. A remote user can upload arbitrary files to the target system.
A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted HTTP request to exploit a flaw in the network diagnostics administration pages to execute arbitrary commands on the target system [CVE-2014-2177]. The commands will run with root privileges.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuh87126 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can conduct a cross-site request forgery (CSRF) attack to take actions on the target administrative interface acting as the target administrator [CVE-2014-2178].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuh87145 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP request to the target device to upload files to arbitrary locations on the target device with root privileges [CVE-2014-2179].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuh86998 to this vulnerability.

Yorick Koster of Securify (www.securify.nl) reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system with root privileges.

A remote user can upload files to arbitrary locations with root privileges.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (RV180 firmware version 1.0.4.14, RV180W firmware version 1.0.4.14, RV120W firmware 1.0.5.9).

The vendor plans to issue a fix for Cisco model RV220W Wireless Network Security Firewall Release during November 2014.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20141105-rv

Title: F5 BIG-IP External Entity Processing Flaw in Configuration Utility Lets Remote Authenticated Users Obtain Information and Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can determine the installation path.
A remote authenticated user can submit an XML request containing a specially crafted XML external entity reference to access potentially sensitive information on the target system or cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

The vendor has assigned ID 477278 to this vulnerability.

The original advisories are available at:

https://www.portcullis-security.com/security-research-and-downloads/security-advisories/cve-2014-6032/

https://www.portcullis-security.com/security-research-and-downloads/security-advisories/cve-2014-6033/

Oliver Gruskovnjak of Portcullis, Inc. reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/15000/600/sol15605.html

Title: Cisco ASR 901 Series Aggregation Router IPv4 Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASR 901 Series Router. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a flood of specially crafted IPv4 packets to the target ASR 901 router to cause the CPU to process the packets, resulting in BGP neighbor flaps.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuo29736 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause BGP neighbor flaps.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3293

Title: Cisco IOS/IOS XE Bug in Ethernet Connectivity Fault Management Code Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS/IOS XE. A remote user on the local network can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user on the adjacent network can send specially crafted Ethernet Connectivity Fault Management (CFM) packets to the target device to cause the target device to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCur49659 and CSCuq93406 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the local network can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3409

Title: Blue Coat ProxySG SSL 3.0 Protocol Downgrade Flaw Lets Remote Users Decrypt SSL Traffic
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Blue Coat ProxySG. A remote user can decrypt SSL sessions in certain cases.
A remote user can with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can force a client to negotiate a downgrade to SSLv3 instead of a TLS v1.x protocol and then conduct a BEAST-style of attack to decrypt portions of the session.

This protocol vulnerability is referred to as the POODLE ("Padding Oracle On Downgraded Legacy Encryption") vulnerability.

This is a flaw in the protocol rather than in the SSL implementation.

The original advisory is available at:

https://www.openssl.org/~bodo/ssl-poodle.pdf

Bodo Moller, Thai Duong, and Krzysztof Kotowicz reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can decrypt SSL sessions.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor notes that SGOS version 6.5 disables SSL 3.0 by default for all connections other than SSL/TLS proxy and that SSL 3.0 can be disabled for SSL/TLS proxy.

The vendor notes that SGOS versions 5.5 and 6.1 thru 6.4 enable SSL 3.0 by default for all connections and that SSL 3.0 can be disabled for all connections.

The vendor has described a workaround in their advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://bto.bluecoat.com/security-advisory/sa83

Description:

A remote user can with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can force a client to negotiate a downgrade to SSLv3 instead of a TLS v1.x protocol and then conduct a BEAST-style of attack to decrypt portions of the session.

This protocol vulnerability is referred to as the POODLE ("Padding Oracle On Downgraded Legacy Encryption") vulnerability.

This is a flaw in the protocol rather than in the SSL implementation.

Cisco has assigned bug IDs CSCur28178 (for Cisco Nexus 3000 Series Switches), CSCur28114 (for Cisco Nexus 9000 (ACI/Fabric Switch)), and CSCur28092 (Cisco Nexus 9000 Series (standalone, running NxOS)) to this vulnerability.

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20141015-poodle

Description:

A remote user can with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can force a client to negotiate a downgrade to SSLv3 instead of a TLS v1.x protocol and then conduct a BEAST-style of attack to decrypt portions of the session.

A remote user can with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can force a client to negotiate a downgrade to SSLv3 instead of a TLS v1.x protocol and then conduct a BEAST-style of attack to decrypt portions of the session.

Title: Juniper Junos FPC Fragmented Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted set of fragmented packets to the target router to cause the target em driver to become blocked.

The vendor has assigned PR 942437 to this vulnerability.

Systems using  an em interface for communications are affected, including M, T, MX, SRX5400/5600/5800, EX, QFX, PTX Series, and MAG-Series CMC.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target em driver to become blocked.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.4R11, 12.1R9, 12.1X44-D30, 12.1X45-D20, 12.1X46-D15, 12.1X47-D10, 12.2R8, 12.2X50-D70, 12.3R6, 13.1R4, 13.1X49-D55, 13.1X50-D30, 13.2R4, 13.2X50-D20, 13.2X51-D15, 13.2X52-D15, 13.3R1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10655

Title: Juniper Junos Duplicate RADIUS Configuration Entry May Let Remote Users Bypass Authentication in Certain Cases
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user may be able to bypass authentication in certain cases.
On systems configured for RADIUS authentication and accounting, when a RADIUS accounting server is configured (under '[system accounting destination radius]'), a duplicate entry may be automatically made to 'pam_radius.conf'. If the accounting server is later removed from the original configuration, the duplicate entry in 'pam_radius.conf' will remain and may allow for unintended authentication success.

The vendor has assigned PR 947307 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user may be able to bypass authentication in certain cases.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.4R12, 12.1R10, 12.1X44-D35, 12.1X45-D25, 12.1X46-D20, 12.1X47-D10, 12.2R8, 12.2X50-D70, 12.3R6, 13.1R4-S3, 13.1X49-D55, 13.1X50-D30, 13.2R4, 13.2X50-D20, 13.2X51-D26, 13.2X51-D30, 13.2X52-D15, 13.3R2, 14.1R1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10654

Title: Juniper Junos BGP UPDATE Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted BGP UPDATE to trigger a memory corruption error and cause the target routing protocol daemon (rpd) to crash and restart.

A specially crafted set of transitive attributes can trigger the flaw.

Only routers supporting 4-byte AS numbers are affected if the BGP peer does not support 4-byte AS numbers.

The vendor has assigned PR 953037 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target rpd to crash and restart.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.4R11, 12.1R10, 12.1X44-D40, 12.1X46-D30, 12.1X47-D11, 12.1X47-D15, 12.1X48-D41, 12.1X48-D62, 12.2R8, 12.2X50-D70, 12.3R6, 13.1R4-S2, 13.1X49-D49, 13.1X50-D30, 13.2R4, 13.2X50-D20, 13.2X51-D25, 13.2X52-D15, 13.3R2, 14.1R1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10653

Title: Juniper Junos RSVP PATH Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted RSVP PATH message packet to cause the target routing protocol daemon (rpd) to crash, preventing routing updates from being processed.

Interfaces with RSVP enabled are affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 954509 and 954508 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target rpd to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.4R12-S4, 12.1X44-D35, 12.1X45-D30, 12.1X46-D25, 12.1X47-D10, 12.2R9, 12.2X50-D70, 12.3R7, 13.1R4-S3, 13.1X49-D55, 13.1X50-D30, 13.2R5, 13.2X50-D20, 13.2X51-D26, 13.2X51-D30, 13.2X52-D15, 13.3R3, 14.1R1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10652

Title: Juniper Junos SRX Series flowd Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted packet to cause the target flowd service to crash.

SRX Series devices with an Application Layer Gateway (ALG) enabled are affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 986369 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.4R12-S4, 12.1X44-D40, 12.1X45-D30, 12.1X46-D25, 12.1X47-D10).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10650

Title: Juniper JunosE ICMP Processing Error Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper JunosE. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted ICMP packet to the target interface or loopback IP address when DEBUG severity icmpTraffic logging is enabled to cause an SRP reset.

Logging severity levels below DEBUG will not trigger an SRP reset.

E Series routers are affected.

The vendor has assigned CQ 97568 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause a SRP reset.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (JunosE 13.3.3p0-1, 14.3.2, 15.1.0).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10651

Title: Cisco IOS XE Autonomic Networking Infrastructure Bugs Let Remote Users Bypass Certificate Validation and Inject Routes
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS XE. A remote user can bypass certificate validation. A remote user can inject routes.
A remote user can send specially crafted messages to the target Autonomic Networking Infrastructure (ANI) device to exploit a certificate validation flaw and masquerade as another device [CVE-2014-3403].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuq22647 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted message to the target ANI device to exploit a certificate validation and have the ANI device accept it as valid [CVE-2014-3404].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuq22677 to this vulnerability.

A remote user on the adjacent network can send specially crafted IPv6 Routing Protocol for Low-Power and Lossy Networks (RPL) advertisements to the target ANI device to inject routes into the Autonomic Control Plane (ACP) [CVE-2014-3405].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuq22673 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can bypass certification validation.

A remote user on the adjacent network can inject routes.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisories are available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3403
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3404
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3405

Title: Cisco ASR 9000 Series IOS XR Compression Flaw Lets Remote Users Bypass Access Controls
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASR 9000 Series Routers. A remote user can bypass access controls.
A remote user can exploit a flaw in the port or address range compression encoding for access control lists (ACLs) on Typhoon line cards to bypass access control list protections.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCup30133 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass access controls.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3396

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco IOS-XE) GNU bash Environment Variable Processing Flaws Let Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in GNU bash. A user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. Cisco IOS-XE is affected.
The software does not properly process environment variables.

A user can supply a specially crafted value that includes a bash function followed by additional code that, when processed by bash, will execute the additional code [CVE-2014-6271]. This vulnerability is known as "Shellshock".

Stephane Chazelas reported this vulnerability.

An initial fix for CVE-2014-6271 did not properly fix this flaw [CVE-2014-7169].

A user can supply a specially crafted value to trigger an out-of-bounds memory access in redir_stack() and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-7186].

Florian Weimer of Red Hat Product Security reported this vulnerability.

A user can supply specially crafted, deeply nested flow control constructs to trigger an off-by-one error and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-7187].

Florian Weimer of Red Hat Product Security reported this vulnerability.

A user can supply specially crafted data to access uninitialized memory and overwrite a pointer to potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-6277].

A user can supply specially crafted data to execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-6278].

Michal Zalewski reported these vulnerabilities.

On a system with an application that passes data from a remote or remote authenticated user to bash, a remote or remote authenticated user may be able to exploit these vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code.

Some common system application configurations are affected.

Demonstration exploit code is available.

This vulnerability is being actively exploited.
Impact': A user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. In some application configurations, a remote user may be able to exploit this.
Solution:
Cisco has issued an advisory for CVE-2014-6271 and CVE-2014-7169 for Cisco IOS-XE.

Cisco has assigned bug IDs CSCur02734 (for IOS-XE for ASR1k, ASR903, ISR4400, CSR1000v) and CSCur03368 (for IOS-XE for Catalyst 3k, 4k, and AIR-CT5760) to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140926-bash

The Cisco advisory is available at:

A user can supply a specially crafted value to trigger an out-of-bounds memory access in redir_stack() and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-7186].

A user can supply specially crafted, deeply nested flow control constructs to trigger an off-by-one error and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-7187].

Florian Weimer of Red Hat Product Security reported this vulnerability.

A user can supply specially crafted data to access uninitialized memory and overwrite a pointer to potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-6277].

A user can supply specially crafted data to execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-6278].

Michal Zalewski reported these vulnerabilities.

On a system with an application that passes data from a remote or remote authenticated user to bash, a remote or remote authenticated user may be able to exploit these vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code.

Some common system application configurations are affected.

Demonstration exploit code is available.

This vulnerability is being actively exploited.
Impact': A user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. In some application configurations, a remote user may be able to exploit this.
Solution:
Cisco has issued an advisory for Cisco ASR 1000 and 5000 Series Routers.

Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCur02734 (for ASR 1000) and CSCur05102 (for ASR 5000) to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140926-bash

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco Application Control Engine) GNU bash Environment Variable Processing Flaw Lets Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in GNU bash. A user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. Cisco Application Control Engine is affected. The impact may vary.
The software does not properly process environment variables.

A user can supply a specially crafted value that includes a bash function followed by additional code that, when processed by bash, will execute the additional code [CVE-2014-6271]. This vulnerability is known as "Shellshock".

Stephane Chazelas reported this vulnerability.

An initial fix for CVE-2014-6271 did not properly fix this flaw [CVE-2014-7169].

A user can supply a specially crafted value to trigger an out-of-bounds memory access in redir_stack() and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-7186].

Florian Weimer of Red Hat Product Security reported this vulnerability.

A user can supply specially crafted, deeply nested flow control constructs to trigger an off-by-one error and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-7187].

Florian Weimer of Red Hat Product Security reported this vulnerability.

A user can supply specially crafted data to access uninitialized memory and overwrite a pointer to potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-6277].

A user can supply specially crafted data to execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-6278].

Michal Zalewski reported these vulnerabilities.

On a system with an application that passes data from a remote or remote authenticated user to bash, a remote or remote authenticated user may be able to exploit these vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code.

Some common system application configurations are affected.

Demonstration exploit code is available.

This vulnerability is being actively exploited.
Impact': A user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. In some application configurations, a remote user may be able to exploit this.
Solution:
Cisco has issued an advisory for Cisco Application Control Engine.

Cisco has assigned bug ID CSCur02195 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140926-bash

The software does not properly process environment variables.

A user can supply a specially crafted value that includes a bash function followed by additional code that, when processed by bash, will execute the additional code [CVE-2014-6271]. This vulnerability is known as "Shellshock".

Stephane Chazelas reported this vulnerability.

An initial fix for CVE-2014-6271 did not properly fix this flaw [CVE-2014-7169].

A user can supply a specially crafted value to trigger an out-of-bounds memory access in redir_stack() and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-7186].

Florian Weimer of Red Hat Product Security reported this vulnerability.

A user can supply specially crafted, deeply nested flow control constructs to trigger an off-by-one error and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-7187].

Florian Weimer of Red Hat Product Security reported this vulnerability.

A user can supply specially crafted data to access uninitialized memory and overwrite a pointer to potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-6277].

A user can supply specially crafted data to execute arbitrary code [CVE-2014-6278].

Title: Cisco IOS mDNS Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted multicast Domain Name System (mDNS) packets to the target device to trigger a memory leak and cause an interface queue wedge or cause the target device to reload [CVE-2014-3358]. Specially crafted UDP packets sent via IPv4 or IPv6 on port 5353 to the unicast address of any interface configured on a device, IPv4 multicast address 224.0.0.251, or IPv6 multicast address FF02::FB can trigger this flaw.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuj58950 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted mDNS packets to the target device to trigger an input validation flaw and cause the target device to reload [CVE-2014-3357]. Specially crafted UDP packets sent via IPv4 or IPv6 on port 5353 to the unicast address of any interface configured on a device, IPv4 multicast address 224.0.0.251, or IPv6 multicast address FF02::FB can trigger this flaw.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul90866 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140924-mdns

Title: Cisco NX-OS Nexus 1000V Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS Nexus 1000V. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The VMware vCloud Director of the Cisco Nexus 1000V does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the vCloud Director interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuq90524 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco NX-OS software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted SNMPv2 packet to cause the target snmpd process to reload [CVE-2014-3377]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCun67791 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted TACACS+ packet to cause the target TACACS+ process to reload [CVE-2014-3378]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum00468 to this vulnerability.

A remote user on the local network can send a specially crafted MPLS packet to the target Cisco Network Convergence System 6000 Series Router to cause a network processor unit and line card to lockup and reload [CVE-2014-3379]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuq10466 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can create a specially crafted request that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the BIG-IP interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The BIG-IP Configuration utility and the Enterprise Manager Configuration utility are affected.

The vendor has assigned ID 470796 (for BIG-IP) and ID 476101 (for Enterprise Manager) to this vulnerability.

The vendor was notified on July 8, 2014.

Title: (Juniper Issues Fix for Junos) Multiple Vendor TCP Stack Implementations Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in several TCP stack implementations. A remote user may be able to cause denial of service conditions using a TCP reset attack. Multiple vendors are affected. Juniper Junos is affected.
The UK National Infrastructure Security Co-Ordination Centre (NISCC) reported that some implementations of the Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) are particularly vulnerable to TCP reset attacks.  A remote user can cause TCP sessions to terminate prematurely, causing denial of service conditions.

The specific impact on applications that use TCP depends on the mechanisms built into the application to address premature TCP session termination.

According to the report, NISCC considers the Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) to be one of the most affected applications, as it relies on a persistent TCP session between BGP peer entities.  Premature termination of an underlying TCP session may require routing tables to be rebuilt and may cause "route flapping".  In the case of BGP, using the TCP MD5 Signature Option and anti-spoofing measures can mitigate the vulnerability.

Other applications, such as Domain Name System (DNS) and (Secure Sockets Layer) SSL based applications may also be affected, but to a lesser degree, the report said.

A remote user can reportedly send a TCP packet with the RST (reset) flag set (or the SYN flag) with the appropriate spoofed source and destination IP addresses and TCP ports to cause the TCP session to be terminated.  Ordinarily, the remote user may have the probability of 1 in 2^32 of guessing the correct sequence number, the report said.  However, in actuality, a remote user may be able to guess an appropriate sequence number with much greater probability because many implementations will accept any sequence number within a certain window of the expected sequence number.  The Associate Press reports that the proper number can be guessed within as few as four attempts, requiring only seconds to achieve.

The report credits Paul A. Watson for discovering a practical method for conducting TCP reset attacks (presented in "Slipping In The Window: TCP Reset Attacks" at the CanSecWest 2004 conference).

The report indicates that the following vendors are affected [this is not an inclusive list]:

- Cray Inc. is vulnerable on their UNICOS, UNICOS/mk and UNICOS/mp systems

- Check Point is affected, but has issued a protection mechanism in the latest release for VPN-1/FireWall-1 (R55 HFA-03) that can protect both the firewall device and hosts located behind the firewall.

- Internet Initiative Japan, Inc (IIJ) is affected.

- InterNiche NicheStack and NicheLite are affected.

- Juniper Networks products are affected.

- Cisco products are affected, including IOS and non-IOS based devices.

Other vendors are assessing the impact of this flaw.

The NISCC Vulnerability Advisory 236929 is available at:

http://www.uniras.gov.uk/vuls/2004/236929/index.htm
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service on the target TCP session.  The specific impact depends on the specific vendor implementation.
Solution:
Juniper has issued a fix for Juniper Junos (1.4R11, 12.1R10, 12.1X44-D35, 12.1X45-D25, 12.1X46-D20, 12.1X47-D10, 12.2R8, 12.3R6, 13.1R4, 13.2R4, 13.3R2, 14.1R1).

The Juniper advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10638

Title: Juniper Junos PIM Routing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted PIM packet to cause the target RPD routing process to crash.

Systems with PIM enabled and Auto-RP configured are affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 947395 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the RPD routing process to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.4R12, 12.1R10, 12.1X44-D35, 12.1X45-D25, 12.1X46-D20, 12.1X47-D10, 12.2R8, 12.3R7, 13.1R4, 13.2R4, 13.3R2, 14.1R1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10637

Title: Juniper Junos SRX Series IPv6/IPv4 Translation flowd Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted packet to cause the target flowd process to crash when the packet is translated from IPv6 to IPv4.

SRX Series devices are affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 747680 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the flowd process to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.4R8, 12.1R5, 12.1X44-D20, 12.1X45-D15, 12.1X46-D10, 12.1X47-D10).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10641

Title: Juniper Junos Unspecified Command Line Interface Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Root Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
A local user on the command line interface can invoke certain combinations of commands to gain root privileges on the target system.

The vendor has assigned PRs 969408, 969365, 966808, 965762, 965758, 964860, 962834, 961449, 961397, and 928128 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.4R12, 12.1R11, 12.1X44-D35, 12.1X45-D30, 12.1X46-D20, 12.1X47-D10, 12.2R8-S2, 12.3R7, 13.1R4-S2, 13.2R5, 13.3R2-S2, 14.1R1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10634

Title: Juniper Junos SRX Series NAT flowd Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
On systems with NAT protocol translation from IPv4 to IPv6 enabled, a remote user can send a specially crafted packet to cause the target flowd process to crash.

SRX Series devices are affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 954437 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the flowd process to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.4R12, 12.1X44-D32, 12.1X44-D35, 12.1X45-D25, 12.1X46-D20, 12.1X47-D10).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10635

Title: Juniper Junos SRX Series SIP ALG flowd Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
On systems with SIP ALG enabled, a remote user can send a specially crafted SIP packet to cause the target flowd process to crash.

SRX Series devices are affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 964817 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the flowd process to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.1X46-D20, 12.1X47-D10).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10633

Title: Cisco IOS/IOS XE NTP Group Access Controls Can Be Bypassed By Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS and IOS XE. A remote user can bypass access controls to query the NTP server.
The ntp access-group command contains a flaw that allows a remote user to bypass the configured Network Time Protocol (NTP) access group and query the target NTP server.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuj66318 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass access controls to query the target NTP server.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3309

Title: Cisco ASR 9000 Series Router IOS XR Punt Policer Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ISO XR on ASR 9000 Series Router. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a large number of specially crafted packets to the target device to trigger a flaw in the punt policer implementation on Trident line cards to overload the card's CPU or the Route Processor CPU and deny service for some traffic queues.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCun83985 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions for some traffic queues.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3308

Title: Cisco IOS IPSec Processing Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted IPsec packets to cause the target device to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui79745 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3299

Title: Cisco IOS XE mDNS Bug Lets Remote Users Read or Modify Autonomic Networking Services
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE. A remote user on the local network can read or modify autonomic networking service data.
A remote user on the local network can send specially crafted multicast Domain Name System (mDNS) data to overwrite autonomic networking services on the target system.

A remote user on the local network can also monitor the network to obtain mDNS data.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCun64867 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the local network can read or modify autonomic networking service data.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3290

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller CDP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user on the local network can send specially crafted Cisco Discovery Protocol requests and then cause the target user to initiate an SNMP poll of the target MIB to trigger a null pointer error and cause the target service to restart.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuo12321 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the local network can cause the target service to restart.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3291

Title: Cisco NX-OS HSRP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user on the local network can send specially crafted Hot Standby Router Protocol (HSRP) authentication data to bypass authentication and cause active HSRP group members to enter the 'SPEAK' state. As a result, traffic will be black holed.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCup11309 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause HSRP group member traffic to be black holed.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3295

Title: Cisco IOS XR ASR 9000 IPv6 Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR on ASR 9000 routers. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted IPv6 packets to cause the target Network Processor (NP) chip and line card to lock up and eventually reload.

Only Trident-based line cards on Cisco ASR 9000 Series Aggregation Services Routers are affected.

On systems not configured for IPv6, a remote user on the adjacent network can exploit this flaw. On systems configured for IPv6, a remote user can exploit this flaw.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCun71928 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target Network Processor (NP) chip and line card to lock up and reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix:

For 4.2.1:  asr9k-p-4.2.1.CSCun71928 and asr9k-px-4.2.1.CSCun71928
For 4.2.3:  asr9k-px-4.2.3.CSCun71928 and asr9k-p-4.2.3.CSCun71928
For 4.3.1:  asr9k-px-4.3.1.CSCun71928
For 4.3.2:  asr9k-px-4.3.2.CSCun71928
For 4.3.4:  asr9k-px-4.3.4.CSCuo22306
For 5.1.1:  asr9k-px-5.1.1.CSCuo22306

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140611-ipv6

Title: (F5 Issues Advisory for F5 BIG-IP) OpenSSL SSL/TLS Weak Key Man-in-the-Middle Attack Lets Remote Users Decrypt and Modify Data
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack to decrypt and modify data. F5 BIG-IP is affected.
A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack between an affected client and an affected server can use a specially crafted handshake to cause the system to use a weak key.

Server versions 1.0.1 and 1.0.2-beta1 are affected.

All client versions are affected.

The vendor was notified on May 1, 2014.

KIKUCHI Masashi (Lepidum Co. Ltd.) reported this vulnerability via JPCERT/CC.
Impact': A remote user can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack to decrypt and modify data.
Solution:
No solution was available for F5 BIG-IP at the time of this entry.

F5 has assigned ID 465799 to this vulnerability.

The F5 advisory is available at:

http://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/15000/300/sol15325.html

Title: F5 BIG-IP Input Validation Flaw in Configuration Utility 'list.jsp' Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The configuration utility 'list.jsp' page does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in some parameters before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the F5 BIG-IP interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned ID 462582 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the F5 BIG-IP interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/15000/200/sol15296.html

Title: Cisco IOS XE ASR1000 PPPoE Processing Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE on the ASR1000. A remote user on the local network can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user on the local network can send a specially crafted Point-to-Point Protocol over Ethernet (PPPoE) packet to cause the target IOS XE ASR1000 device to reload. Devices configured with PPPoE termination are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuo55180 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the local network can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3284

Title: Cisco NX-OS Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Execute Arbitrary Code and Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote authenticated user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
On systems with multiple virtual device contexts (VDC), a remote authenticated user on the SSH management interface can exploit an SSH key file privilege escalation flaw to gain the privileges of an administrator in a different VDC [CVE-2013-1191]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCud88400 to this vulnerability.

On systems with multiple virtual device contexts (VDC), a remote authenticated user on the SSH management interface can exploit an SSH privilege escalation flaw to gain the privileges of an administrator in a different VDC [CVE-2014-2200]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCti11629 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a large amount of specially crafted data to trigger a null pointer dereference in the Message Transfer Service (MTS) and cause a kernel panic [CVE-2014-2201]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCtw98915 to this vulnerability. MDS 9000 is affected.

A remote SMTP server can return specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow in the Smart Call Home feature to execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges on the target device [CVE-2014-3261]. Several Nexus product models are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCtk00695 (Cisco Unified Computing System Fabric Interconnects, CSCts56633 (Nexus 3000, CSCts56632 (Nexus 5000), CSCts56628 (Nexus 7000), CSCug14405 (Nexus 4000), and CSCuf61322 (Cisco Connected 1000 Series Connected Grid Routers running CG-OS) to this vulnerability.

Nexus 7000 is affected by all four vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A remote user can cause the target system to crash.

A remote authenticated user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140521-nxos

Title: Cisco IOS XR DHCPv6 Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS XR. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted DHCP version 6 (DHCPv6) packet to cause the target DHCPv6 server process to stop stop processing DHCPv6 requests.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul80924 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted DHCPv6 packet to cause the target DHCPv6 server process to crash.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCum85558, CSCum20949, CSCul61849, and CSCul71149 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target DHCPv6 service to hang or crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisories are available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3270
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3271

Title: Cisco IOS LLDP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user on the local network can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user on the local network can send a specially crafted Link Layer Discovery Protocol (LLDP) packet to cause the target device to reload.

Systems with LLDP enabled are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum96282 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the local network can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3273

Title: Cisco NX-OS Command Line Bug Lets Local Users Access Arbitrary Files
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A local user can access files on the target system.
A local user can exploit a flaw in the command line interface to conduct a directory traversal attack and access arbitrary files on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul05217 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can access arbitrary files on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-6975

Title: Cisco IOS ScanSafe HTTPS Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS ScanSafe. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted HTTPS packets that will be redirect to a ScanSafe tower to cause the target device to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum97038 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3263

Title: Cisco IOS and IOS XE LISP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS and IOS XE. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted LISP control messages to the target Ingress Tunnel Router (ITR) to disable Cisco Express Forwarding and cause the system to stop passing traffic.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCun73782 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the system to stop processing traffic.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-3262

Title: HP H-series Fibre Channel Switch Discloses Potentially Sensitive Information to Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in some HP H-series Fibre Channel Switches. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
No details were provided.

The following model numbers are affected:

AQ233B, AQ233A
AK242B, AK242A
AK241B, AK241A
AW575B, AW575A
AW576B, AW576A
BK780B, BK780A

The vendor has assigned SSRT101555 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (firmware version 8.0.14.08.00).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://h20564.www2.hp.com/portal/site/hpsc/public/kb/docDisplay?docId=emr_na-c04277407

Title: Cisco NX-OS Nexus 1000V IGMPv2/IGMPv3 Access Control Flaw Lets Remote Users Bypass Security Controls
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS Nexus 1000V. A remote user can bypass access controls in certain cases.
A remote user can can send IGMPv2 and IGMPv3 traffic to bypass 'deny' statements in access control lists (ACLs).

IGMPv1 processing is not affected.

Cisco Nexus 1000V InterCloud for VMware	is affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCug61691 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass IGMPv2 and IGMPv3 access controls.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-0685

Title: Cisco NX-OS Nexus 7000 'sed' Command Processing Flaw Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS Nexus 7000. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can supply specially crafted data to the 'sed' command to trigger an input validation flaw and cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui56136 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-0684

Title: Cisco IOS XE L2TP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted Layer 2 Tunneling Protocol (L2TP) packets via an established L2TP session to cause the target ESP card to reload.

Cisco ASR 1000 Series Routers are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCun09973 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can the target ESP card to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-2183

Title: AirPort Extreme and AirPort Time Capsule OpenSSL TLS Heartbeat Buffer Overread Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in AirPort Extreme and AirPort Time Capsule. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
A remote user can trigger a buffer overread in the processing of the TLS heartbeat extension to obtain up to 64k of memory (per heartbeat request), potentially including encryption keys.

Only AirPort Extreme and AirPort Time Capsule base stations with 802.11ac are affected.

Only systems with 'Back to My Mac' or 'Send Diagnostics' enabled are affected.

[Editor's note: This vulnerability is known as the OpenSSL heartbleed vulnerability.]

Neel Mehta of Google Security and Riku, Antti, and Matti of Codenomicon reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information, including encryption keys.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.7.3).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.apple.com/kb/HT6203

Title: (F5 Issues Advisory for F5 BIG-IP) OpenSSL Incorrect Version Number Used in ssl_get_algorithm2() Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. F5 BIG-IP is affected.
The ssl_get_algorithm2() function in 'ssl/s3_lib.c' uses an incorrect version number. A remote user can send specially crafted data (using TLS 1.2) to cause the target service to crash.

Ron Barber reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
F5 has issued an advisory for F5 BIG-IP. No solution was available at the time of this entry.

F5 has assigned ID 442452 to this vulnerability.

Some previous versions are not affected.

The F5 advisory is available at:

http://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/15000/100/sol15147.html

Title: Cisco IOS XE OpenSSL TLS Heartbeat Buffer Overread Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
