A remote user can trigger a buffer overread in the processing of the TLS heartbeat extension to obtain up to 64k of memory (per heartbeat request), potentially including encryption keys.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuo19730 to this vulnerability.

[Editor's note: This vulnerability is known as the OpenSSL heartbleed vulnerability.]

Neel Mehta of Google Security and researchers from Codenomicon reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information, including encryption keys.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140409-heartbleed

Title: Juniper Junos IGMP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted IGMP packets at high rate to trigger a kernel panic on the target system.

A transmit rate exceeding approximately 1000 packets per second is required to trigger this vulnerability.

Systems with PIM enabled are affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 944135 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (13.2R3, 13.3R1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10618

Title: Juniper Junos Input Validation Flaw in J-Web Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos J-Web. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The J-Web interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Juniper Junos J-Web interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned PR 940744 to this vulnerability.

Chuck McAuley reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Juniper Junos J-Web interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.4R11, 11.4X27.62 (BBE), 12.1R9, 12.1X44-D35, 12.1X45-D25, 12.1X46-D20, 12.2R7, 12.3R6, 13.1R4, 13.2R3, 13.3R1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10619

Title: Juniper Junos SRX Series Enhanced Web Filtering Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted URL to cause the target flow daemon (flowd) process to crash and restart.

Systems with Enhanced Web Filtering (EWF) enabled are affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 877830 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target flow daemon to crash and reboot.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (10.4R15, 11.4R9, 12.1R7, 12.1X44-D20, 12.1X45-D10, 12.1X46-D10).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10622

Title: Juniper Junos MX Series and T4000 IP Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Version(s): MX Series and T4000 routers using either Trio or Cassis-based PFEs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos MX Series and T4000 routers. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted IP packet to the target device to cause the target packet forwarding engine to reboot.

MX Series and T4000 routers using either Trio or Cassis-based PFEs are affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 904887 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target packet forwarding engine to reboot.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.4R11, 12.1R9, 12.2R7, 12.3R4-S3, 12.3R5, 13.1R4, 13.2R2, and 13.3R1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10621

Title: Juniper Junos Input Validation Flaw in J-Web Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos J-Web. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The J-Web interface 'index.php' script does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the Juniper Junos J-Web interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned PR 738631 and 939456 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Juniper Junos J-Web interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (10.0S25, 10.4R10, 11.4R11, 12.1R9, 12.1X44-D30, 12.1X45-D20, 12.1X46-D10, 12.2R1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10521

Title: Juniper Junos Branch SRX Series Dynamic VPN Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Version(s): SRX 100, SRX 110, SRX 210, SRX 220, SRX 240, SRX 550, and SRX 650
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos Branch SRX Series. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user can cause new Dynamic VPN connections to fail and cause excessive CPU consumption and disk usage on the target system.

Systems configured with a Dynamic IPsec VPN are affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 934366 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause new Dynamic VPN connections to fail and cause excessive CPU and consumption and disk usage on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.4R10-S1, 11.4R11, 12.1X44-D26, 12.1X44-D30, 12.1X45-D20, 12.1X46-D10).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10620

Title: (Juniper Issues Advisory for Junos) OpenSSL TLS Heartbeat Buffer Overread Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information. Juniper Junos is affected.
A remote client or server can trigger a buffer overread in the processing of the TLS heartbeat extension to obtain up to 64k of memory (per heartbeat request), potentially including encryption keys.

The vulnerability was introduced to the source code in December 2011 and to release version 1.0.1 in March 2012.

[Editor's note: This vulnerability is known as the OpenSSL heartbleed vulnerability.]

Neel Mehta of Google Security reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information, including encryption keys.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Junos versions 13.3R1.6, 13.3R1.7, and 13.3R1-S1 are affected.

Junos versions 13.2 and prior are not affected.

The Juniper advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10623

Title: (F5 Issues Advisory for F5 BIG-IP) OpenSSL TLS Heartbeat Buffer Overread Lets Remote Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information. F5 BIG-IP is affected.
A remote client or server can trigger a buffer overread in the processing of the TLS heartbeat extension to obtain up to 64k of memory (per heartbeat request), potentially including encryption keys.

The vulnerability was introduced to the source code in December 2011 and to release version 1.0.1 in March 2012.

[Editor's note: This vulnerability is known as the OpenSSL heartbleed vulnerability.]

Neel Mehta of Google Security reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information, including encryption keys.
Solution:
F5 BIG-IP versions 11.5.0 - 11.5.1 are affected. No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Some earlier versions are not affected. F5 recommends using a version that is known to be not vulnerable, as described in their advisory.

F5 has assigned ID 456033 (BIG-IP), ID 456302 (BIG-IP Edge Client for Windows, Mac OS, and Linux), and ID 456345 (BIG-IP Edge Client for Apple iOS) to this vulnerability.

The F5 advisory is available at:

http://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/15000/100/sol15159.html

Title: Cisco ONS 15454 Controller Card Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in the Cisco ONS 15454 Controller Card. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can conduct a TCP FIN attack to consume all available file descriptors and system write access to the flash memory [CVE-2014-2139]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCug97315 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can conduct a TCP FIN attack to cause a CAL pipe to fail and the target controller card to reload [CVE-2014-2140]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCug97348 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can close sessions in a specific manner to cause the target controller card to reset [CVE-2014-2141]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCug97416 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP request to the target node to cause the target controller card to reload [CVE-2014-2142]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCun06870 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisories are available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-2139
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-2140
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-2141
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-2142

Title: Cisco IOS XR ICMPv6 Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions in certain cases.
A remote user on the adjacent network can send specially crafted Internet Control Message Protocol version 6 (ICMPv6) redirect packets to the target device to cause the target device to drop IPv4 and IPv6 traffic.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum14266 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to drop IPv4 and IPv6 traffic.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-2144

Title: Cisco IOS and IOS XE IKE Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS and IOS XE. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can exploit a flaw in the Internet Key Exchange (IKE) module and send specially crafted IKE Main Mode packets to delete established security associations on the target device.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCun31021 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can delete established security associations on the target device.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-2143

Title: Cisco IOS SSL VPN HTTP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS SSL VPN. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted HTTP request to consume excessive memory on the target device. This may result in performance degradation or a restart.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuf51357 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause excessive memory consumption on the target device or cause the target device to restart.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140326-ios-sslvpn

Title: Cisco IOS IPv6 Stack Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted IPv6 packets to the target device to consume all available I/O memory on the target device. This may result in device instability and could cause the device to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui59540 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to become unstable or reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140326-ipv6

Title: Cisco IOS Bugs in DNS ALG and TCP Input Module Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted DNS packets through the target device to trigger a flaw in the Application Layer Gateway (ALG) module when performing network address translation and cause the target device to reload [CVE-2014-2111].

Packets sent via IPv6 are not affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCue00996 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted sequence of TCP packets through the target device to trigger a memory leak in the TCP input module or cause the target device to reload [CVE-2014-2109].

Packets sent via IPv6 are not affected.

The vendor has assigned bugs ID CSCuh33843 and CSCuj41494 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause a memory leak or cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140326-nat

Title: Cisco IOS IKEv2 Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted IKEv2 messages via UDP port 500 or 4500 to cause the target device to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui88426 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140326-ikev2

Title: Cisco 7600 Series Route Switch Processor 720 FPGA Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Cisco 7600 Series Route Switch Processor 720. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target processor to reboot or stop forwarding traffic.

The vulnerability resides in the Kailash field-programmable gate array (FPGA) versions prior to 2.6.

Systems with 10 Gigabit Ethernet Uplinks (models RSP720-3C-10GE, RSP720-3CXL-10GE) are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCug84789 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target processor to reboot or stop forwarding traffic.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140326-RSP72010GE

Title: Cisco IOS SIP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) messages to cause the target device to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCug45898 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (IOS XE 3.10.2S).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140326-sip

Title: Cisco Catalyst 6500 Supervisor Engine 2T Multicast Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Catalyst 6500 Supervisor Engine 2T. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted packets to exploit a flaw in the processing of multicast data in the Supervisor Engine 2T (Sup2T) and cause the target device to crash.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuf60783 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-2124

Title: Cisco Small Business RV Series Wireless-N VPN Discloses Password to Remote Users
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Small Business RV Series. A remote user can gain administrative access on the target system.
The web management interface does not properly handle authentication requests. A remote user can intercept and modify an authentication request to gain administrative privileges on the target web interface.

The following product versions are affected:

Cisco RV110W Wireless-N VPN Firewall, firmware versions 1.2.0.9 and prior
Cisco RV215W Wireless-N VPN Router, firmware versions 1.1.0.5 and prior
Cisco CVR100W Wireless-N VPN Router, firmware versions 1.0.1.19 and prior

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCul94527, CSCum86264, and CSCum86275 to this vulnerability.

Gustavo Javier Speranza reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain administrative access on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

Cisco CVR100W firmware version 1.0.1.21
Cisco RV110W firmware version 1.2.0.10
Cisco RV215W firmware version 1.1.0.6

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140305-rpd

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller (WLC). A remote user can gain unauthorized access to the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a large number of WebAuth requests at a high rate to trigger a memory allocation flaw to consume all available memory on the target device and cause the device to restart [CVE-2014-0701]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuf52361 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can trigger a a race condition in the administrative HTTP server of a target Cisco Aironet 1260, 2600, 3500, and 3600 Series access point to gain access to the administrative HTTP server even if it has been explicitly disabled [CVE-2014-0703]. Then, the remote user can use locally-stored credentials (if they have not been changed) to gain privileged access to the target device. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuf66202 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted IGMPv3 messages to trigger a memory over-read error and cause the target WLC to restart [CVE-2014-0704]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuh33240 to this vulnerability.

A remote use can send a specially crafted MLDv2 packet to the multicast listener discovery (MLD) service of a target WLC configured for IPv6 to cause the target device to restart [CVE-2014-0705]. Systems configured for MLDv2 Snooping (not the default) are affected. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuh74233 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted Ethernet 802.11 frame to trigger an unspecified flaw and cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2014-0706]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCue87929 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted Ethernet 802.11 frame to trigger an unspecified flaw and cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2014-0707]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuf80681 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can gain unauthorized access to the target system.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.0.250.0, 7.4.121.0, 7.6.100.0).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140305-wlc

Title: Linksys Router Installation/Upgrade Flaw Lets Remote Users Gain Administrative Access
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in some Linksys Routers. A remote user can gain administrative access to the target system.
During the installation and upgrade process, a remote user can connect to TCP port 8083 on the WAN interface to access portions of the administrative interface even though the console indicates that remote access is disabled.

On some systems, TCP port 443 may also be open.

The vendor was notified in July 2013.

Kyle Lovett and Matt Claunch reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain administrative access on the target system.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager Input Validation Flaw in Java Database Interface Lets Remote Users Inject SQL Commands
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can inject SQL commands.
The Java database interface does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCum05313, CSCup23440, CSCup23461, and CSCup23465 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-0728

Title: F5 FirePass Edge Client Lets Local Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 FirePass. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
A local user can exploit a flaw in the Edge Client to obtain information from Edge Client memory.

The vendor has assigned ID 432784 to this vulnerability.

The system running the Edge Client is affected. The host is not affected.

Giorgio Casali and Simone Cecchini with Verizon Enterprise Solutions GCIS Threat and Vulnerability Management reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/14000/900/sol14969.html

Title: F5 BIG-IP APM and Edge Gateway Edge Client Lets Local Users Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP APM and Edge Gateway. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
A local user can exploit a flaw in the Edge Client to obtain information from Edge Client memory.

The vendor has assigned ID 432784 to this vulnerability.

The system running the Edge Client is affected. The host is not affected.

Giorgio Casali and Simone Cecchini with Verizon Enterprise Solutions GCIS Threat and Vulnerability Management reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (APM and Edge Gateway 11.5.0).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/14000/900/sol14969.html

Title: NETGEAR Router D6300B Telnet Backdoor Lets Remote Users Gain Root Access
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in NETGEAR Router D6300B. A remote user can gain root access on the target system.
A remote user on the local network or the wireless network can send a specially crafted packet to the telnet service to gain a root shell on the target device.

On systems with a USB drive, a remote user on the guest wireless network can access files on the target drive via UPnP.

A remote authenticated user can exploit a flaw in the web interface to execute arbitrary operating system commands.

The web interface is not secure. Authentication credentials are sent in plaintext via HTTP.

The system stores the web interface authentication credentials in clear text in the '/data/nvram' file.

The vendor was notified on December 12, 2013.

Daniel Sauder, Marcel Mangold, and Pascal Uter reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the local network can gain root access on the target system.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco NX-OS Label Distribution Protocol Message Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted Label Distribution Protocol (LDP) Hello messages to cause the target device to stop accepting valid LDP sessions for a 60-second period.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul88851 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to stop accepting valid LDP sessions for a 60-second period.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-0677

Title: Cisco NX-OS Lets Local Users Bypass TACACS+ Authorization to Execute Commands
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can execute a specially crafted sequence of multiple commands to exploit a TACACS+ command authorization bug and execute commands without proper authorization.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum47367 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can bypass TACACS+ authorization to execute commands.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor has described a workaround.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-0676

Title: Juniper Junos ntpd Query Function Lets Remote Users Conduct Amplified Denial of Service Attacks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can conduct amplified denial of service attacks.
A remote user can exploit an administrative query function in ntpd to amplify distributed denial of service (DDoS) attacks against other sites.

All Junos products and platforms with an NTP client or server enabled are affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 931184 to this vulnerability.

Additional information is available from US-CERT at:

http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/348126
Impact': A remote user can conduct amplified denial of service attacks against other sites.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.4R12, 12.1R10, 12.1X44-D35, 12.1X45-D25, 12.1X46-D15, 12.1X47-D10, 12.2R8, 12.3R7, 13.1R4-S2, 13.2R4, 13.3R2, 14.1R1).

The vendor has described a workaround.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10613

Title: Cisco ASR 5000 Series Gateway WSP Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Bypass Network Access Controls
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASR 5000 Series Gateway. A remote user can bypass access controls and browse the network free of charge.
A remote user can send specially crafted Wireless Session Protocol (WSP) packets to the target Cisco ASR 5000 Series Gateway GPRS Support Node (GGSN) to browse free of charge instead of being redirected to a Top-Up portal.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuh28371 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can browse the network free of charge.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2014-0669

Title: (F5 Issues Advisory for F5 BIG-IP) MySQL Multiple Bugs Let Remote Authenticated Users Access and Modify Data and Deny Service and Local Users Access Data
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in MySQL. A remote authenticated user can access and modify data and cause denial of service conditions on the target system. A remote user can partially access and modify data and cause partial denial of service conditions on the target system. A local user can partially access data on the target system. F5 BIG-IP has issued a fix.
The MySQL Client, Server Optimizer, Server, Protocol, Server Installation, Information Schema, InnoDB, Server Full Text Search, InnoDB Plugin, Server Optimizer, Server Replication Information Schema components are affected.

The following researchers reported these and other Oracle vulnerabilities:

Alexandr Polyakov of Digital Security; Andy Yang; Dana Lane Taylor of the University of Pennsylvania; Dominic Sim, Agus Komang; Esteban Martinez Fayo of Application Security, Inc.; Florian Lukavsky of SEC Consult Vulnerability Lab; Francis Provencher
via Secunia SVCRP; John Zimmerman; Martin Carpenter of Citco; Martin Rakhmanov of Application Security, Inc.; Microsoft Vulnerability Research of Microsoft Corp; Paul Harrington of NGS Secure; Pavel Toporkov of Positive Technologies; Ronnie Sahlberg;
Sam Thomas of Pentest Limited; Sjoerd Resink of Fox-IT; Thomas Biege of SUSE; Travis Emmert; and Travis Emmert of Veracode.
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can access and modify data and cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

A remote user can partially access and modify data and cause partial denial of service conditions on the target system.

A local user can partially access data on the target system.
Solution:
F5 has issued an advisory for CVE-2012-3163 for F5 BIG-IP.

The vendor has assigned ID 432467 to this vulnerability.

The F5 advisory is available at:

http://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/14000/900/sol14907.html

Title: Cisco NX-OS ntpd Query Function Lets Remote Users Conduct Amplified Denial of Service Attacks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A remote user can conduct amplified denial of service attacks.
A remote user can exploit an administrative query function in ntpd (via MODE_CONTROL [Mode 6] and MODE_PRIVATE [Mode 7] control messages) to amplify distributed denial of service (DDoS) attacks against other sites.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum52148 to this vulnerability.

Additional information is available from US-CERT at:

http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/348126
Impact': A remote user can conduct amplified denial of service attacks against other sites.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor has described a workaround.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-5211

Title: Cisco IOS and IOS XE ntpd Query Function Lets Remote Users Conduct Amplified Denial of Service Attacks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS and IOS XE. A remote user can conduct amplified denial of service attacks.
A remote user can exploit an administrative query function in ntpd (via MODE_CONTROL [Mode 6] and MODE_PRIVATE [Mode 7] control messages) to amplify distributed denial of service (DDoS) attacks against other sites.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCtd75033 to this vulnerability.

Additional information is available from US-CERT at:

http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/348126
Impact': A remote user can conduct amplified denial of service attacks against other sites.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor has described a workaround.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-5211

Title: (Juniper Issues Fix for Junos) GNU Glibc Stack Exhaustion Flaw in regcomp() Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Glibc. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. Juniper Junos is affected (for local users).
A remote user can supply specially crafted data to an application that uses the regcomp() function to cause the target application to consume excessive stack memory and crash.

Maksymilian Arciemowicz reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
Juniper has issued a fix for JUNOS (10.4S15, 10.4R16, 11.4R9-S1, 11.4R10, 12.1R8, 12.1X44-D25, 12.1X45-D15, 12.1X46-D10, 12.2R6, 12.3R4, 13.1R3-S1, 13.2R2, 13.3R1).

Juniper has assigned PR 705445 to this vulnerability.

The Juniper advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10612

Title: Juniper Junos XNM Command Processor Lets Remote Users Consume Excessive Memory on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
When xnm-ssl or xnm-clear-text is enabled, a remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the XNM command processor to consume excessive memory and adversely affect performance or stability.

The vendor has assigned PR 925478 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause performance degradation or instability.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (10.4R16, 11.4R10, 12.1R8-S2, 12.1X44-D30, 12.1X45-D20, 12.1X46-D10, 12.2R7, 12.3R5, 13.1R3-S1, 13.2R2-S2, 13.3R1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10607

Title: Juniper Junos CLI Commands Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can invoke certain combinations of command-line interface (CLI) commands and arguments to gain root access to the operating system.

The vendor has assigned PRs 924191, 921499, 921219, 915313, 915961, 914042, 915958, 915957, 913831, 913449, 913328, 912707, and 751925 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (10.4R16, 11.4R10, 12.1R8-S2, 12.1X44-D30, 12.1X45-D20, 12.1X46-D10, 12.2R7, 12.3R5, 13.1R3-S1, 13.2R2, 13.3R1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10608

Title: Juniper Junos Branch SRX Series HTTP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted HTTP data to a target system acting as a UAC enforcer with captive portal enabled to cause the target flowd service to crash.

The vendor has assigned PR 846240 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target flow daemon to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (10.4R16, 11.4R8, 12.1R7, 12.1X44-D20, 12.1X45-D10).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10611

Title: Juniper Junos Branch SRX Series IP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted IP packets to cause the target flowd service to crash.

The vendor has assigned PR 795272 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target flow daemon to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (10.4S15, 10.4R16, 11.4R9, 12.1R7).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10610

Title: Juniper Junos BGP Update Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted BGP update to cause the target rpd service to crash.

Both IPv4 and IPv6 environments are affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 918734 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (10.4R16, 11.4R10, 12.1R8-S3, 12.1X44-D30, 12.1X45-D20, 12.1X46-D10, 12.2R7, 12.3R4-S2, 12.3R5, 13.1R3-S1, 13.2R2, 13.3R1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10609

Title: Cisco Access Points Undocumented Test Interface Lets Remote Users Gain Root Access
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Cisco WAP4410N Access Point. A remote user can gain root access on the target device.
A remote user on the local area network can access an undocumented test interface on TCP port 32764 to execute arbitrary operating system commands with root privileges. This can also be exploited to access the administrator account credentials.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCum37566 to this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

https://github.com/elvanderb/TCP-32764

Eloi Vanderbeken reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain root access on the target device.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor plans to issue a fix by the end of January 2014.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140110-sbd

Title: Cisco Gigabit Security Router Undocumented Test Interface Lets Remote Users Gain Root Access
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Cisco WRVS4400N and RVS4000 Gigabit Security Routers. A remote user can gain root access on the target device.
A remote user on the local area network can access an undocumented test interface on TCP port 32764 to execute arbitrary operating system commands with root privileges. This can also be exploited to access the administrator account credentials.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCum43693 and CSCum43700 (for the WRVS4400N Wireless-N Gigabit Security Router) and CSCum43685 (for the Cisco RVS4000 4-port Gigabit Security Router).

The original advisory is available at:

https://github.com/elvanderb/TCP-32764

Eloi Vanderbeken reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the local network can gain root access on the target device.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor plans to issue a fix by the end of January 2014.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20140110-sbd

Title: Cisco NX-OS BGP Update Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted BGP update data to cause all BGP sessions on the target device (configured with a VPNv4, VPNv6, or IPv6 labeled unicast address family) to reset.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuj03174 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause all BGP sessions on the target device to reset.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-6982

Title: Linksys Router Backdoor Grants Administrative Access to Remote Users
Version(s): Models WAG200G, WAG320N, WAG54G2, WAG120N, WAP4410N; possibly other models
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in several Linksys Routers. A remote user can gain administrative access.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to TCP port 32764 to execute commands on the target system with administrative privileges.

The following devices are affected:

Linksys WAG200G 
Linksys WAG320N 
Linksys WAG54G2
Linksys WAG120N
Linksys WAP4410N

Other Linksys models may be affected.

Routers from other companies may also be affected.

The original advisory is available at:

https://github.com/elvanderb/TCP-32764

Eloi Vanderbeken reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain administrative access.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco IOS XE MPLS IP Fragmentation Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted Multiprotocol Label Switching (MPLS) IP packets to exploit a flaw in the MPLS fragmentation function and cause the target Cisco Packet Processor process to crash.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul00709 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target Cisco Packet Processor process to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-6981

Title: Cisco IOS vty Authentication Flaw Lets Remote Users Access the System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE. A remote user can gain access to the target system.
A remote user on a 192.168.x.2 subnet can exploit a flaw in the vty authentication to gain access to the target device with the privileges of the vty line interface.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuj90227 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain access to the target system with vty line interface privileges.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-6979

Title: Cisco ONS 15454 TNC Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ONS 15454 TNC. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send high levels of traffic to the target Cisco ONS 15454 Transport Node Controller (TNC) to cause a process to fail to receive health pings and cause the TNC to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCud97155 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target TNC to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-6701

Title: Cisco IOS XE TFTP Memory Management Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
The system does not properly release memory for flows generated by TFTP UDP traffic. A remote user can make TFTP requests to cause the flow manager to hold UDP sessions in the session table, consuming available memory.

A local user can also trigger this flaw.

The vendor has assigned Bug IDs CSCuh09324 and CSCty42686 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to become unstable on crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-6704

Title: Cisco IOS and IOS XE IPDT Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS and IOS XE. A remote user on the adjacent network can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user on the adjacent network can send specially crafted ARP packets to the target device to trigger a flaw in the IP Device Tracking (IPDT) function and cause the target device to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuh38133 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the adjacent network can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-6705

Title: Cisco ONS 15454 Controller Card TLS/SSL Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ONS 15454. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted packets to trigger a flaw in the TLS/SSLv3 module and cause the target control card to reset.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuh34787 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target control card to reset.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-6703

Title: Cisco ONS 15454 Controller Cards Can Be Reset By Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ONS 15454. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted packets to the target control card to trigger an unspecified flaw in the management functions and cause the control card to reset.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCtz50902 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target control card to reset.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-6702

Title: Cisco IOS XR SNMP Memory Leak Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted SNMP requests for certain MIBs to cause the target SNMP process to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuh43144 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target SNMP process to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-6700

Title: Cisco IOS XE MPLS Processing Flaw Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XE. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted Multiprotocol Label Switching (MPLS) packets via IP through and out of the target device to cause the target device to reload.

Systems configured for MPLS and with certain additional features configured are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuj23992 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-6706

Title: Juniper Junos Proxy ARP Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service and Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
On systems where Proxy ARP is enabled on an unnumbered interface, a remote user can send specially crafted data to poison the ARP cache, creating an alternate forwarding table entry for a target IP address. A remote user can exploit this to cause denial of service conditions or obtain potentially sensitive information.

The vendor has assigned PR 842092 to this vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (10.4S15, 11.4R9, 11.4X27.44, 12.1R7, 12.1X44-D20, 12.1X45-D15, 12.2R6, 12.3R3, 13.1R3, 13.2R1, and later).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10595

Title: Cisco IOS IPSec ICMP Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted ICMP packets to the target device to modify the IPSec tunnel MTU or path MTU and potentially cause IPSec tunnels to drop.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCul29918 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause IPSec tunnels to drop.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-6694

Title: Cisco IOS SSL VPN Gateway Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted Datagram Transport Layer Security (DTLS) packets to cause the target SSL VPN gateway interface to stop processing traffic when the queue is full.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuh97409 and CSCud90568 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target SSL VPN gateway interface to stop processing traffic.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-6686

Title: Cisco Nexus 1000V Switch for Microsoft Hyper-V Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Nexus 1000V Switch for Microsoft Hyper-V. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can supply specially crafted parameters to the install all iso command to execute arbitrary shell commands on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui21340 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can execute arbitrary shell commands on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-5556

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
The system does not properly validate user-supplied configuration parameters. A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP request to cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuh81011 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-6684

Title: Cisco IOS CSG Parse Error Drop Function Flaw Lets Remote Users Bypass Access Controls
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can bypass access controls.
A remote user can send a specially crafted sequence of packets to exploit a flaw in the parse error drop function of the Cisco Content Services Gateway (CSG) to bypass configured policies.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCug90143 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass access controls.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-5552

Title: Cisco NX-OS IPv6 Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users on the Adjacent Network Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user on the adjacent network can send a specially crafted IPv6 packet to cause the target device to stop responding to neighbor solicitation (NS) requests.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCtd15904 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the local network can cause the target device to stop responding to neighbor solicitation requests.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-6683

Title: Cisco IOS SIP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted, valid SIP messages via IPv4 or IPv6 to the target device to trigger a memory leak, causing the system to become unstable, or cause the target device to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuc42558 and CSCug25383 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to become unstable or reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (15.1M, 15.1(4)M7).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20131106-sip

Title: Cisco IOS IKEv2 Anti-Replay Capabilities Can Be Bypassed By Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can conduct replay attacks.
A remote user can exploit a flaw in the Internet Key Exchange version 2 (IKEv2) protocol implementation that disables the anti-replay capabilities to conduct replay attacks.

Systems using the Advanced Encryption Standard Galois/Counter Mode (AES-GCM) or the AES Galois Message Authentication Code (AES-GMAC) algorithms for Phase 2 IPsec Security Associations (SAs) are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuj47795 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can conduct replay attacks.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-5548

Title: Cisco IOS XE Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS XE. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted ICMP error packets through the target device to trigger a flaw in the Zone-Based Firewall (ZBFW) TCP or UDP inspection feature and cause the target device to reload [CVE-2013-5543].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCtt26470 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted PPTP packets through the target device to trigger a flaw in the PPTP ALG feature and cause the target device to reload [CVE-2013-5545].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuh19936 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted TCP packet through the target device to trigger a flaw in the ALG and NAT features to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2013-5546].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCud72509 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted IPv4 or IPv6 EoGRE packets through the target device that is configured with an EoGRE interface to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2013-5547].

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuf08269 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (3.4.2S, 3.5.1S, 3.7.3S, 3.8.1S, 3.9.2S).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20131030-asr1000

Title: Cisco Catalyst 3750X Switch Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Catalyst 3750X Switches. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
The Service Module for Cisco Catalyst 3750X switches uses default credentials. A local user can use these credentials to gain root access to the kernel running on the Service Module.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCue92286 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain root privileges on the kernel running on the Service Module.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-5522

Title: Cisco IOS XR Fragmented Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted fragmented packets to the target device to cause the target route processor to be unable to transmit packets to the fabric.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuh30380 and CSCtz62593 to this vulnerability.

The following processors are affected:

Cisco CRS 16-Slot Line Card Chassis Route Processor (RP-A)
Cisco CRS 16-Slot Line Card Chassis Route Processor B (RP-B)
Carrier Routing System (CRS) Performance Route Processor (PRP)
Cisco CRS Distributed Route Processor (DRP-B)
Impact': A remote user can cause the target route processor to be unable to transmit packets to the fabric.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (XR 4.2.1).

A patch matrix for previous versions is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20131023-iosxr

Title: F5 BIG-IP Traffic Management Microkernel Component Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Version(s): 10.0.0 - 10.2.2, 11.0.0; other versions of some models may also be affected
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target Traffic Management Microkernel (TMM) component to restart. This may temporarily block traffic processing.

The vendor has assigned ID 363504 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the system to temporarily stop processing.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/13000/200/sol13233.html

Title: (Juniper Issues Fix for Junos) Solaris Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Gain Full Control and Local Users Partially Access and Modify Data and Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Solaris. A remote user can gain full control of the target system. A local user can cause denial of service conditions. A local user can partially access and modify data on the target system. Juniper Junos is affected by one vulnerability.
The FTP Server [CVE-2010-2632], XScreenSaver [CVE-2010-3586], libc [CVE-2010-4415], Ethernet Driver [CVE-2010-4433], CDE Calendar Manager Service Daemon [CVE-2010-4435], Kernel [CVE-2010-4440, CVE-2010-4442, CVE-2010-4443, CVE-2010-4446, CVE-2010-4459], CIFS [CVE-2010-4457], ZFS [CVE-2010-4458], and Fault Manager Daemon [CVE-2010-4460] components are affected.

The following researchers reported these and other Oracle vulnerabilities:

Alexander Kornbrust of Red Database Security; Alexandr Polyakov of Digital Security; Alexey Sintsov of Digital Security Research Group; Andrea Micalizzi aka rgod, working with TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative; Andrey Labunets of Digital Security Research Group; Cris Neckar of Neohapsis, Inc.; Daniel Fahlgren; Esteban Martinez Fayo of Application Security, Inc.; Evdokimov Dmitriy of Digital Security Research Group; Karan Saberwal; Laszlo Toth; Maksymilian Arciemowicz of SecurityReason; Martin Rakhmanov of Application Security, Inc.; Matt Parcell of Accuvant; Monarch2020 of unsecurityresearch.com; Robert Clugston of Accuvant; Roberto Suggi Liverani of Security-Assessment.com; Rodrigo Rubira Branco (BSDaemon) via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative; and Sumit Siddharth from 7safe.
Impact':
A remote user can gain full control of the target system.

A local user can cause denial of service conditions.

A local user can partially access and modify data on the target system.
Solution:
Juniper has issued a fix for CVE-2010-2632 for Junos (software releases built on or after 2013-09-12, or Junos OS 10.4R15, 11.4R9, 12.1R7-S1, 12.1R8, 12.2R6, 12.3R4, 13.1R3, and 13.2R1, and all subsequent releases).

The Juniper advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10598

Title: Juniper Junos J-Web Flaw Permits Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos J-Web. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.
A remote user can take actions on the target J-Web interface acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned PR 827189 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can take actions on the target J-Web interface acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (software releases built on or after 2013-08-31, or Junos OS 10.4R13, 11.4R7, 12.1R6, 12.1X44-D15, 12.1X45-D10, 12.2R3, 12.3R2, 13.1R3).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10597

Title: Juniper Junos SRX Series Gateway TCP Proxy Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Version(s): SRX Series services gateways running 10.4, 11.4, 12.1, 12.1X44, or 12.1X45
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos SRX Series Gateways. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted, valid TCP packets to cause the target flow daemon (flowd) to crash.

SRX Series services gateways are affected.

Systems configured with plugins that use TCP proxy are affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 791201 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target flow daemon to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (software releases built on or after 2013-09-18, 10.4S14, 11.4R5-S2, 11.4R6, 12.1R3, 12.1X44-D20, 12.1X45-D15, and all subsequent releases).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10596

Title: Juniper Junos PIM Join Message Processing Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user can send a large number of specially crafted IPv4 or IPv6 PIM join messages to cause the target RPD routing daemon to crash.

Systems configured for a Next-Generation Multicast VPN (NGEN MVPN) environment are affected.

The vendor has assigned PR 669783 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target routing service to crash and restart.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (releases built on or after 2012-09-27, including: 10.0S28, 10.4R7, 11.1R5, 11.2R2, 11.4R1, and all subsequent releases).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10548

Title: Juniper Junos SRX Series Gateway Buffer Overflow in Telnet Firewall Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): SRX Series services gateways running 10.4, 11.4, or 12.1X44
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos SRX Series Gateway. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted telnet protocol messages to a system configured for telnet pass-through authentication to trigger a buffer overflow in the flow daemon (flowd) and execute arbitrary code on the target system.

The vendor has assigned PR 861558 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (software releases built on or after 2013-07-11, or Junos OS 10.4S14, 11.4R7-S2, 11.4R8, 12.1X44-D15, 12.1X45-D10, and all subsequent releases).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10594

Title: D-Link Router Authentication Bypass Backdoor Lets Remote Users Gain Administrative Access
Version(s): firmware v1.13 for the DIR-100 revA
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in D-Link Routers. A remote user can gain administrative access on the target device.
A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP request with the HTTP User-Agent set to 'xmlset_roodkcableoj28840ybtide' to bypass authentication and gain administrative access on the target device.

The vulnerability is due to a non-secure backdoor.

The following versions are affected:

DI-524 Revision A1
DI-524UP Revision A1/A2
DIR-100 Revision A1
DIR-120 Revision A1
DIR-300 Revision Ax
DIR-300 Revision Ax 1.06b02
DIR-300 Revision B1
DIR-300 Revision B1 2.14b01
DIR-600 Revision B1 and B2
DIR-600 Revision B1 and B2 2.15b01
DIR-600 Revision B5
DIR-600 Revision B5 2.16b05
DIR-615 Revision Dx
DIR-615 Revision Dx 4.14b02
DIR-645 Revision Ax
DIR-645 Revision Ax 1.04b05
DIR-815 Revision Ax
DIR-815 Revision Ax 1.04b02
DIR-845L Revision Ax
DIR-845L Revision Ax 1.01b02
DIR-865L Revision A1

Other devices may also be affected.

http://www.devttys0.com/2013/10/reverse-engineering-a-d-link-backdoor/

Title: Cisco IOS Flaw in DHCP Remember Feature Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can obtain a DHCP lease and then release it to trigger a flaw in the remember functionality and cause the target device to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuh46822 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-5499

Title: Cisco NX-OS Lets Local Users Create Arbitrary Files on the Target System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user can exploit a flaw in the command line interface to write arbitrary scripts to arbitrary locations on the file system.

An administrator may inadvertently execute the file.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCua71557 and CSCua71551 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can create arbitrary files on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2012-4141

Title: Cisco NX-OS RIP Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted RIPv4 or RIPv6 messages to UDP port 520 to cause the target RIP service to restart.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCtj73415 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the RIP service to restart.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2012-4091

Title: Cisco NX-OS Nexus 7000 Discloses Configuration Files to Remote Authenticated Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
A remote authenticated user with 'network-operator' privileges can view the Cisco NX-OS configuration files.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCti09089 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can obtain configuration files.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2012-4090

Title: Cisco IOS XR UDP Memory Error Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send UDP packets to the target device to consume all available packet memory and cause critical services on the device to fail.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCue69413 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause critical services on the device to fail.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (XR 4.3.2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20131002-iosxr

Title: Cisco IOS XR CGSE/ISM Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted packet sequences to the Point-to-Point Tunneling Protocol-Application Level Gateway (PPTP-ALG) of the Cisco CRS Carrier Grade Services Engine (CGSE) and Cisco ASR 9000 Series Integrated Service Module (ISM) to cause the target service interface module to reset.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCue91963 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service interface module to reset.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-5498

Title: Blue Coat ProxySG SSL Session Renegotiation Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Blue Coat ProxySG. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can request multiple SSL session renegotiations within a single connection to consume excessive CPU resources on the target system.

The vulnerability resides within the OpenSSL component.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://kb.bluecoat.com/index?page=content&id=SA74

Title: Blue Coat ProxySG HTTP Request Processing Memory Leak Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Blue Coat ProxySG. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote server can return specially crafted data to trigger a memory leak and cause the target device to drop or bypass traffic. HTML with a large number of recursively embedded HREF tags can trigger this flaw.

A reboot is required to return the system to normal operations.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to drop or bypass traffic.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (6.2.14.1, 6.5.2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://kb.bluecoat.com/index?page=content&id=SA75

Title: Cisco IOS Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted multicast Network Time Protocol (NTP) packets encapsulated in a Multicast Source Discovery Protocol (MSDP) Source-Active (SA) message from a configured MSDP peer to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2013-5472]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuc81226 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted Internet Key Exchange (IKE) v1 packets to trigger a memory leak [CVE-2013-5473]. Repeated exploitation can consume excessive memory and cause the target device to reload. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCtx66011 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a stream of valid IPv6 fragments to or through the target device to trigger a race condition in the virtual fragmentation reassembly (VFR) function for IPv6 to cause the target device to hang or reload [CVE-2013-5474]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCud64812 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted DHCP packets to a target device that has the DHCP server or DHCP relay agent feature enabled to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2013-5475]. Devices configured as a DHCPv6 server for IPv6 are not affected. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCug31561 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted HTTP packets via IPv4 through a target device to trigger a flaw in the Zone-Based Firewall (ZFW) component and cause the target device to hang or reload [CVE-2013-5476]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCtx56174 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted, bursty traffic through an interface configured for T1/E1 signaling on an HDLC32 driver to trigger an interface queue wedge condition, which may cause loss of connectivity and loss of routing protocol adjacency [CVE-2013-5477]. A reload of the device is required to return the system to normal operations. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCub67465 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted UDP RSVP packets to the target device to trigger an interface queue wedge condition, which may cause loss of connectivity and loss of routing protocol adjacency [CVE-2013-5478]. A reload of the device is required to return the system to normal operations. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuf17023 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted DNS packets to TCP port 53 to exploit a network address translation (NAT) flaw and cause the target device to reload [CVE-2013-5479, CVE-2013-5480]. The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCtn53730 and CSCuf28733 to these vulnerabilities.

A remote user can send specially crafted PPTP packets to TCP port 1723 to exploit a NAT flaw and cause the target device to reload [CVE-2013-5481]. The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCtq14817 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to hang or reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor advisories.

The vendor's advisories are available at:

http://www.cisco.com/web/about/security/intelligence/Cisco_ERP_sep13.html
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130925-ntp
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130925-ike
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130925-ipv6vfr
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130925-dhcp
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130925-cce
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130925-wedge
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130925-rsvp
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130925-nat

Title: BIG-IP APM Flaws Permit Cross-Site Scripting and Clickjacking Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in BIG-IP APM. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. A remote user can conduct clickjacking attacks.
The access policy logout page does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the BIG-IP interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor has assigned ID 407603 to this vulnerability.

The access policy logon page may allow a remote user to conduct clickjacking attacks.

The vulnerability as ID 395751 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the BIG-IP interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote user can conduct clickjacking attacks.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (BIG IP-APM 11.4.0, 11.4.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/14000/700/sol14700.html
http://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/14000/700/sol14712.html

Title: Cisco NX-OS BGP Regex Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can inject specially crafted Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) autonomous system (AS) path sets to trigger a flaw in a regex engine and cause the target service to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCuf49554 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-1121

Title: Cisco NX-OS ONEP Pointer Validation Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted data to an Open Network Environment Platform (ONEP) enabled network element to trigger a pointer validation flaw and cause the target element to reload.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCui51551 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-5496

Title: Siemens Scalance X-200 Switch Weak Random Number Generation Lets Remote Users Hijack Sessions
Version(s): X-200 Switch Family; Firmware prior to 5.0.0
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Siemens Scalance X-200 switch family. A remote user can hijack user sessions.
The random number generator used by the web server for session authentication uses insufficient entropy. A remote user can exploit this to hijack an active user session.

Eireann Leverett from IOActive reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can hijack user sessions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (firmware v5.0.0).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.siemens.com/innovation/pool/de/forschungsfelder/siemens_security_advisory_ssa-850708.pdf

Title: Juniper Junos J-Web '/jsdm/ajax/port.php' Script Lets Remote Authenticated Users Execute Arbitrary Commands
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.
A remote authenticated user with low privileges can send specially crafted data to '/jsdm/ajax/port.php' to execute arbitrary commands or hijack user sessions.

The vendor was notified on September 27, 2012.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.senseofsecurity.com.au/advisories/SOS-13-003

Phil from Sense of Security Labs reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (10.4R13, 11.4R7, 12.1R5, 12.2R3, 12.3R1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10560

Title: AirPort Extreme Base Station Frame Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in AirPort Extreme Base Station. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
