A remote user on the wireless network can send specially crafted frames to cause the target base station to crash.

Joonas Kuorilehto of Codenomicon reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the base station to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.6.4).

The vendor's advisory will be available at:

http://support.apple.com/kb/HT1222

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Web Administrator Interface Validation Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user in the Full Manager, Read Only, or Lobby Ambassador managers group can exploit a parameter validation flaw on the Web Administrator Interface to cause the target device to reboot.

The vendor has assigned bug IDs CSCuh14313, CSCuh14159, CSCuh14368, and CSCuh14436 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target system to reboot.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-3474

Title: Cisco IOS TCP ACK Processing Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can exploit a flaw in the TCP stack and send a specially crafted sequence of TCP ACK and FIN packets to the target device to cause an ACK storm, consuming excessive network bandwidth and CPU resources.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCtz14399 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive network bandwidth and CPU resources.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-5469

Title: Cisco IOS XR RIPv2 Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted Routing Information Protocol (RIP) version 2 packet to cause the target RIP service to crash.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCue46731 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target RIP service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-3470

Title: Cisco IOS XR ICMP Memory Corruption Flaw Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can send specially crafted Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) messages to cause the device to reload. The flaw is due to a Silicon Packet Processor (SPP) buffer corruption flaw and a mutex flaw and can be triggered by sending an extended ping with 'timeout=0' and a large packet size and then terminating the process issuing a Control-C key command.

The vendor has assigned Bug ID CSCui60347 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-3464

Title: 3Com, HP, and H3C Router OSPF LSA Processing Flaw Lets Remote Authenticated Users Obtain Information and Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in 3Com, HP, and H3C Routers. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) Link State Advertisement (LSA) data to intercept traffic or cause denial of service conditions.

The vendor has assigned SSRT101224 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.

A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://h20566.www2.hp.com/portal/site/hpsc/template.PAGE/public/kb/docDisplay/?docIdemr_na-c03880910-1

Title: Cisco IOS OSPF Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Take Full Control of the Routing Table
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can take full control of the target OSPF routing table.
A remote user can supply specially crafted unicast or multicast Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) Link State Advertisement (LSA) type 1 packets to take full control of the target OSPF Autonomous System (AS) domain routing table. The target router may flush the contents of its routing table and propagate the specially crafted LSA update throughout the OSPF area.

This can be exploited to redirect traffic to a blackhole or to redirect traffic and intercept communications.

OSPFv3 is not affected. Fabric Shortest Path First (FSPF) protocol is not affected.

IOS and IOS-XE are affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCug34485 to this vulnerability.

Dr. Gabi Nakibly from Rafael Advanced Defense Systems and Eitan Menahem, Yuval Elovici, and Ariel Waizel of Telekom Innovation Laboratories at Ben Gurion University reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can take full control of the target OSPF routing table and redirect traffic.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130801-lsaospf

Title: Cisco ASR Router OSPF Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Take Full Control of the Routing Table
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASR Router (StarOS). A remote user can take full control of the target OSPF routing table.
A remote user can supply specially crafted unicast or multicast Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) Link State Advertisement (LSA) type 1 packets to take full control of the target OSPF Autonomous System (AS) domain routing table. The target router may flush the contents of its routing table and propagate the specially crafted LSA update throughout the OSPF area.

This can be exploited to redirect traffic to a blackhole or to redirect traffic and intercept communications.

OSPFv3 is not affected. Fabric Shortest Path First (FSPF) protocol is not affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCug39795 to this vulnerability.

Dr. Gabi Nakibly from Rafael Advanced Defense Systems and Eitan Menahem, Yuval Elovici, and Ariel Waizel of Telekom Innovation Laboratories at Ben Gurion University reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can take full control of the target OSPF routing table and redirect traffic.A remote user can determine the installation path.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (StarOS 14.0.50488).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130801-lsaospf

Title: Cisco NX-OS OSPF Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Take Full Control of the Routing Table
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A remote user can take full control of the target OSPF routing table.
A remote user can supply specially crafted unicast or multicast Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) Link State Advertisement (LSA) type 1 packets to take full control of the target OSPF Autonomous System (AS) domain routing table. The target router may flush the contents of its routing table and propagate the specially crafted LSA update throughout the OSPF area.

This can be exploited to redirect traffic to a blackhole or to redirect traffic and intercept communications.

OSPFv3 is not affected. Fabric Shortest Path First (FSPF) protocol is not affected.

The vendor has assigned bug ID CSCug63304 to this vulnerability.

Dr. Gabi Nakibly from Rafael Advanced Defense Systems and Eitan Menahem, Yuval Elovici, and Ariel Waizel of Telekom Innovation Laboratories at Ben Gurion University reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can take full control of the target OSPF routing table and redirect traffic.
Solution:
No official vendor releases are available at the time of this entry.

Interim releases may be available through Cisco Technical Assistance Center (TAC).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130801-lsaospf

Title: Junos Space Web Interface Lets Remote Authenticate Users View Passwords
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Junos Space. A remote authenticated user can view passwords.
A remote authenticated user on the web-based user interface can view certain configuration tabs to view passwords in plaintext.

Junos Space and JA1500 (Junos Space Appliance) are affected.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can view passwords in plaintext.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Junos Space 12.3P2.8).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=KB27374

Title: Juniper Junos Pulse Secure Access Service (SSL VPN) Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper Junos Pulse Secure Access Service (SSL VPN). A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The web server does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the JUNOS software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Some login pages and a support related page are affected.

The following product models are affected:

SA700, SA2500, SA2000, FIPS SA4000, SA4500, SA4000, FIPS SA4500, FIPS SA6000, SA6500, 
SA6000, FIPS SA6500, MAG2600, MAG4610, MAG6610, MAG6611, Virtual Appliance
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the JUNOS software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.1r13, 7.2r7, 7.3r2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10554

Title: Cisco Aironet Memory Corruption Error Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Aironet. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can disrupt the communications path between a FlexConnect access point and the Cisco Wireless LAN Controller to trigger a memory corruption error and cause the target access point to crash and restart.

The vulnerability is triggered when a switch between FlexConnect and Standalone mode occurs frequently during a 24 to 48 hour period.

The vendor has assigned Bug ID CSCuh71210 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target access point to crash and restart.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-3441

Title: Cisco IOS Group Encrypted Transport VPN Bug Lets Remote Users Bypass Encryption Policy
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can bypass encryption policy.
The default Cisco Group Encrypted Transport VPN (GET VPN) policies to permit Domain of Interpretation (GDOI) traffic to pass without encryption allow a remote user to bypass the configured encryption policy.

The vendor has assigned Bug ID CSCui07698 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass encryption policy.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor has described a workaround.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-3436

Title: F5 FirePass Component Lets Remote Users Install and Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 FirePass. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a flaw in an F5 component to install arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code can later be executed and will run with the privileges of the target user.

The vendor was reported on April 25, 2013.

The original advisory is available at:

https://nealpoole.com/blog/2013/07/code-execution-via-f5-networks-java-applet/

Neal Poole reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will install arbitrary code (that can later be executed) on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/14000/400/sol14468.html

Title: F5 BIG-IP Component Lets Remote Users Install and Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.
A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a flaw in an F5 component to install arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code can later be executed and will run with the privileges of the target user.

The vendor was reported on April 25, 2013.

The original advisory is available at:

https://nealpoole.com/blog/2013/07/code-execution-via-f5-networks-java-applet/

Neal Poole reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will install arbitrary code (that can later be executed) on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/14000/400/sol14468.html

Title: Juniper JUNOS Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service, Obtain Information, and Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Juniper JUNOS. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
A remote user can send specially crafted PIM packets when PIM and NAT are enabled on SRX devices to cause flowd to crash [CVE-2013-4684]. The vendor has assigned PR 842253 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted HTTP requests when the Captive Portal is enabled with the UAC enforcer role on SRX devices to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2013-4685]. The vendor has assigned PR 849100 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted ARP request to trigger a kernel error in certain VLAN configurations with unrestricted arp-resp and proxy-arp settings to cause the target device to crash [CVE-2013-4686]. The vendor has assigned PR 842091 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted TCP packets when certain Application Layer Gateways are enabled on SRX devices to cause the target flowd daemon to crash [CVE-2013-4687]. The vendor has assigned PRs 727980, 806269, and 835593 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted MSRPC requests when the MSRPC Application Layer Gateway is enabled on SRX devices to cause the target flowd daemon to crash [CVE-2013-4688]. Version 10.4 prior to 10.4R11 is affected. The vendor has assigned PR 772834 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information via Ethernet data packets because the SRX1400, SRX3400, and SRX3600 devices do not properly initialize memory locations when padding Ethernet packets [CVE-2013-4690]. The vendor has assigned PR 829536 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (10.4S14, 11.4R7, 12.1R6, 12.1X44-D15).

The vendor's advisories are available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10573
http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10574
http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10576
http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10577
http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10578
http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10579

Title: Cisco Nexus 1000V License Installation Input Validation Flaw Lets Local Users Inject Arbitrary Shell Commands
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Nexus 1000V. A local user can execute arbitrary shell commands on the target system.
A local user can exploit an input validation flaw in the license installation command to execute arbitrary shell commands on the target system.

The vendor has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCuh30824 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-3400

Title: 3Com Router Bugs Let Remote Users Obtain Information and Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in 3Com Routers. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
A remote user [CVE-2013-2340] or a remote authenticated user [CVE-2013-2341] can gain full control of the target system.

HP ProCurve and H3C devices are also affected.
Impact':
A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://h20565.www2.hp.com/portal/site/hpsc/template.PAGE/public/kb/docDisplay/?docId=emr_na-c03808969-1

Title: Cisco IOS XR SNMP Memory Leak Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a large number of UDP packets to SNMP port 162 to trigger a memory leak in the SNMP process and cause the target service to reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCug80345 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the SNMP service to reload.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-1204

Title: Cisco NX-OS Nexus 1000v Bugs Let Remote Users Gain Control, Deny Service, and Bypass Security
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in the Cisco Nexus 1000v. A remote user can monitor or inject traffic. A remote user can gain control of a target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can bypass security.
A remote user can exploit a flaw in the cryptographic implementation to monitor or inject communications between a Virtual Supervisor Module (VSM) and a Virtual Ethernet Module (VEM) [CVE-2013-1208].

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCud14691 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can exploit a flaw in the cryptographic implementation to disable encryption and integrity protections on a per-packet basis [CVE-2013-1209].

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCud14710 to this vulnerability.

The system does not properly validate STUN protocol packets. A remote user can trigger an out-of-bound array index access and cause the ESXi hypervisor to crash [CVE-2013-1210]. Systems with debugging enabled on the VEM kernel driver for VMware ESXi are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCud14825 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can exploit an authentication error and spoof STUN protocol packets to obtain control over a VEM and associated port groups [CVE-2013-1211].

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCud14832 to this vulnerability.

The VSM does not properly validate SSL certificates [CVE-2013-1212]. A remote user can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack to intercept communications between the VSM and the VMware vCenter.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCud14837 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can conduct a UDP flooding attack to cause a VSM to report a VEM as unavailable [CVE-2013-1213].

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCud14840 to this vulnerability.

Felix 'FX' Lindner, Recurity Labs GmbH, reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can monitor or inject traffic.

A remote user can take control of a target VEM.

A remote user can disable encryption and integrity protections.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisories are available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-1208
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-1209
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-1210
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-1211
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-1212
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-1213

Title: Cisco NX-OS igmp_snoop_orib_fill_source_update() Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted IGMP packets to trigger a flaw in the igmp_snoop_orib_fill_source_update() function and cause the target device to reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCts46521 to this vulnerability.

Cisco Nexus 2000 Series and Cisco Nexus 5000 Series switches are affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=26613

Title: Cisco Integrated Services Routers Crypto Engine Memory Management Flaw Lets Local Users Deny Service
Impact: Denial of service via local system
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Integrated Services Routers. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.
A local user can exploit a memory management flaw in the crypto engine process of Cisco IOS when running on Cisco Aggregation Services Router Route Processor 2 to cause the target route processor to crash.

A local user can create a large number of tunnels to the router and then view the encryption statistics to trigger a crash.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCuc52193 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-1136

Title: Cisco ISM Module Authenticated Header Processing Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ISM Module for ISR G2. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user can send a stream of specially crafted authentication header packets over an established IPSec security association to cause the target module to reload, preventing IPSec traffic.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCub92025 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target ISM module to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-1241

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Telnet Session Management Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
The system does not properly clean up incorrectly terminated remote login Telnet sessions. A remote user can exhaust all available Telnet sessions and prevent new administrative Telnet sessions.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCug35507 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can prevent new administrative telnet sessions.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-1235

Title: Cisco IOS XR SNMP Processing Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted SNMP packets to cause the target SNMP process to restart.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCue69472 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target SNMP process to restart.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-1234

Title: Cisco IOS XR SNMP Memory Leak Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted SNMP packets to trigger a memory leak in the SNMP process and consume all memory allocated to the process. The SNMP process will then restart.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCue31546 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-1216

Title: Cisco NX-OS Nexus 7000 Frame Forwarding Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Nexus 7000. A remote user on the adjacent network can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user on the adjacent network can send specially crafted, non-standard Ethernet frames to trigger a frame forwarding loop that saturates all interswitch links and causes a network outage.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCug47098 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the adjacent network can cause a network outage.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor has issued a workaround.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-1226

Title: Cisco NX-OS Buffer Overflows Let Remote Users Deny Service and Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco NX-OS. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted Cisco Discovery Protocol packets to trigger buffer overflows in the Cisco Discovery Protocol (CDP) subsystem [CVE-2013-1178].

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCtu10630 (UCS), CSCtu10551 (Nexus 7000/MDS 9000), CSCtu10550 (Nexus 5000), CSCtw56581 (Nexus 4000), CSCtu10548 (Nexus 3000), CSCtu10544 (Nexus 1000v), and CSCuf61275 (CGR 1000) to this vulnerability.

A remote user with knowledge of the community strings can send a specially crafted SNMP query via UDP port 161 to trigger a buffer overflow in the SNMP and License Manager components to execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges [CVE-2013-1179].

Cisoc has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtx54830 to this vulnerability.

A remote authenticated user with knowledge of the community strings can send a specially crafted SNMP query via UDP port 161 to trigger a buffer overflow in the SNMP component to execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges [CVE-2013-1180]. 

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtx54822 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted jumbo frame packet to the management interface of the target device to cause the device to crash and reload [CVE-2013-1181].

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCtx17544 (UCS), CSCts10593 (Nexus 5000), and CSCtx95389 (Nexus 3000) to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130424-nxosmulti

Title: Cisco IOS XE for 1000 Series Aggregation Services Routers Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS XE. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted fragmented IPv6 multicast traffic to or through the target device to cause the device to reload [CVE-2013-1164].

Cisco 1000 Series ASR with ASR1000-ESP40 or ASR1000-ESP100 is affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtz97563 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted fragmented IPv6 MVPN traffic to or through the target device to cause the device to reload [CVE-2013-1164].

Cisco 1000 Series ASR with ASR1000-ESP40 or ASR1000-ESP100 is affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCub34945 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a large number of specially crafted L2TP packets to the target device to cause the device to reload [CVE-2013-1165].

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtz23293 to this vulnerability.

A remtoe user an send packets through a target device configured for bridge domain interface (BDI) to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2013-1167].

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtt11558 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a large number of SIP packets through a target device configured for VRF-aware NAT and SIP ALG to cause the device to reload [CVE-2013-1166].

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCuc65609 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130410-asr1000

Title: Cisco IOS Resource Reservation Protocol (RSVP) Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted traffic engineering PATH message to trigger a flaw in the Resource Reservation Protocol (RSVP) implementation and cause the target device to reload.

Cisco IOS and IOS XE are affected when used on a device that has Multiprotocol Label Switching with Traffic Engineering (MPLS-TE) enabled. 

Cisco IOS XR is not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtg39957 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130327-rsvp

Title: Cisco IOS Smart Install Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted Smart Install packets to TCP port 4786 to trigger a flaw in the processing of image list parameters and cause the target Cisco Catalyst switch to reload.

Devices that are configured as Smart Install clients are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCub55790 to this vulnerability.

The following products are not affected:

Cisco IOS XR
Cisco IOS XE

Tenable Network Security (via ZDI) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130327-smartinstall

Title: Cisco IOS Internet Key Exchange Memory Leak Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted IKEv1 data to consume excessive memory and cause the target device to reload or become unresponsive. A power cycle may be required to return the device to normal operations.

Devices that do not support IKE version 2 (IKEv2) and are configured to use IKE version 1 (IKEv1) are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCth81055 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload or become unresponsive. A power cycle may be required to return the device to normal operations.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130327-ike

Title: Cisco IOS Protocol Translation Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted TCP data to the target device to trigger a flaw in the Protocol Translation (PT) feature and cause the target device to reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtz35999 to this vulnerability.

The following products are not affected:

Cisco IOS XE Software
Cisco IOS XR Software
Cisco NX-OS Software
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130327-pt

Title: Cisco IOS Zone-Based Policy Firewall SIP Inspection Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) packets through the target device to trigger a memory leak in the Zone-based Policy Firewall (ZBFW) SIP inspection feature and cause the target device to reload.

Network Address Translation (NAT) of SIP traffic is not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtl99174 to this vulnerability.

The following products are not affected:

Cisco IOS XR
Cisco IOS XE
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130327-cce

Title: Cisco IOS IP SLA Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted IP Service Level Agreement (IP SLA) packets to cause the target service to reload.

Devices configured for the IP SLA general responder feature are affected.

Cisco IOS XE is also affected.

The following products are not affected:

Cisco IOS XR Software
Cisco NX-OS Software
Cisco ASA Software
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130327-ipsla

Title: Cisco IOS VRF Network Address Translation Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted IPv4 packets to exploit a race condition in the virtual routing and forwarding (VRF) aware network address translation (NAT) feature to consume available memory on the target device. The device may become unresponsive and reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCtg47129 and CSCtz96745 to this vulnerability.

The following products are not affected:

Cisco IOS XE Software
Cisco IOS XR Software
Cisco NX-OS Software
Cisco ASA Sofware
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130327-nat

Title: HP ProCurve Switch Bug Permits Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in some HP ProCurve Switches. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.
A remote user can take actions on the target device acting as the target user.

The HP ProCurve 1700-8 Switch (Model J9079A) and HP ProCurve 1700-24 Switch (Model J9080A) is affected.

Darren Willis of Fourteenforty Research Institute, Inc. reported this vulnerability via JPCERT.
Impact': A remote user can take actions on the device acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://h20566.www2.hp.com/portal/site/hpsc/template.PAGE/public/kb/docDisplay/?docId=emr_na-c03699981-1

Title: Actiontec MI424WR-GEN3I Router Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Actiontec MI424WR-GEN3I Router. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.
The web interface does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by a target authenticated user, will take actions on the site acting as the target user, including adding a user, adding an administrative user, and enabling remote administration.

The MI424WR-GEN3I router is used in Verizon FIOS deployments.

The original advisory and demonstration exploit is available at:

http://infosec42.blogspot.com/2013/03/verizon-fios-router-csrf-cve-2013-0126.html

Jacob Holcomb of Independent Security Evaluators reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco IOS/IOS XE Type 4 Password Hashing Weakness Facilitates Brute-Force Password Cracking Attempts
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS and IOS XE. A local user with access to a hashed Type 4 password can conduct a brute-force guessing attack.
The Type 4 password implementation fails to use PBKDF2 and fails to use a salt. As a result, a user with access to the hashed password can more readily conduct brute force attacks to recover the plaintext password.

Cisco IOS and IOS XE systems that support Type 4 passwords are affected.

The vendor was notified on March 12, 2013.

Philipp Schmidt and Jens Steube from the Hashcat Project reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user with access to a hashed Type 4 password can conduct a brute-force guessing attack.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor plans to deprecate Type 4 passwords.

The vendor plans to introduce a new password type that correctly implements the requirements intended for Type 4.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityResponse/cisco-sr-20130318-type4

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller mDNS Buffer Handling Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user on the adjacent network can send specially crafted mDNS packets to trigger a buffer handling error and cause the target device to crash and reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCue04153 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user on the adjacent network can cause the target system to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-1141

Title: Cisco Aironet HTTP Profiler Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Aironet Access Point. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user on the adjacent network can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer handling flaw in the HTTP Profiler and cause the target device to crash and reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCuc62460 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2012-6026

Title: (F5 Issues Fix for BIG-IP) ISC BIND RDATA Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in ISC BIND. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. F5 BIG-IP is affected.
A remote user can send a query for a record that has RDATA in excess of 65535 bytes to cause named to exit.

This can be exploited against recursive servers by causing the server to query for records provided by an authoritative server.

Authoritative servers are affected if a zone containing a specially crafted resource record is loaded from file or provided via zone transfer.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target named service to crash.
Solution:
F5 has issued a fix for F5 BIG-IP (10.2.4 HF5, 11.2.0 HF3, 11.2.1 HF2, 11.3.0).

The F5 advisory is available at:

http://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/14000/200/sol14201.html

Title: (F5 Issues Fix for BIG-IP) ISC BIND RDATA Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in ISC BIND. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. F5 BIG-IP is affected.
A remote user can send a request for a record that has been loaded with specific combinations of RDATA to cause the target named service to lock up.

This can be exploited against recursive servers by causing the target recursive server to query for records provided by an authoritative server.

Jake Montgomery of Dyn, Inc. reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to lock up and fail to respond to queries or control commands.
Solution:
F5 has issued a fix for F5 BIG-IP (10.2.4 HF5, 11.2.0 HF3, 11.2.1 HF2, 11.3.0).

The F5 advisory is available at:

http://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/14000/200/sol14201.html

Title: Cisco Carrier Routing System Packet Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Partially Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Carrier Routing System. A remote user can cause partial denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data through the target device to cause packet processing to slow down and partially drop other traffic.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCud79136 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the system to drop some packets.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-1112

Title: Cisco NX-OS Nexus 7000 M1-Series Packet Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS Nexus 7000 M1-Series. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target M1-Series module to reload.

Systems configured with Overlay Transport Virtualization (OTV) and with the physical interface of the connection via the M1-Series module are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCud15673 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target M1-Series module to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has described a workaround.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-1122

Title: Cisco IOS Software HTTP Server Socket Handling Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS Software in the HTTP Server. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to TCP port 80 or 443 to cause the target HTTP service to crash. This can be exploited to cause the target Catalyst switch to crash.

Systems with the HTTP server feature enabled are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCuc53853 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2013-1100

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Linksys Routers) libupnp Buffer Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in libupnp (Portable UPnP SDK). A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. Several Linksys Routers are affected.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger several buffer overflows and execute arbitrary code on the target system.

Multiple networking devices from multiple vendors use the SDK and are affected.

Some devices that use libupnp are configured to accept UPnP queries via the WAN interface and are exploitable via the Internet.

The original advisory is available at:

https://community.rapid7.com/community/infosec/blog/2013/01/29/security-flaws-in-universal-plug-and-play-unplug-dont-play

Rapid7 reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
Cisco/Linksys reports that the following Linksys Routers are affected:

E900
E1200 v2
E1000 v2.1
E1500
M10 v2
WRT610N v1
WRT610N v2

The following Linksys Routers are not affected:

E2500
RE1000
E1000 v2
E1000 v1
E1200 v1
E1550
E3200
E4200
M10 v1
M20
WRT160N v3
WRT310N v2
All EA series

No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Cisco/Linksys has described a workaround in their advisory.

The Cisco/Linksys advisory is available at:

http://homekb.cisco.com/Cisco2/ukp.aspx?vw=1&articleid=28341

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Remote Authenticated Users Modify the Configuration and Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote authenticated user can modify the configuration on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted IP packets to the target device configured with Wireless Intrusion Prevention System (wIPS) via the wired or wireless interfaces to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2013-1102]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtx80743 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) packets to the target wireless access point (managed by the WLC) via the wired or wireless interfaces to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2013-1103]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCts87659 to this vulnerability.

A remote authenticated user can send a specially crafted UserAgent string via the wired or wireless interfaces to execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2013-1104]. Only systems with the HTTP Profiling feature enabled and running version 7.3.101.0 are affected. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCuc15636 to this vulnerability.

A remote authenticated user can view and modify the configuration of the target device via SNMP when the "management over wireless" feature is disabled [CVE-2013-1105]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCua60653 to this vulnerability.

The following product models are affected by these vulnerabilities:

Cisco 2000 Series WLC
Cisco 2100 Series WLC
Cisco 2500 Series WLC
Cisco 4100 Series WLC
Cisco 4400 Series WLC
Cisco 5500 Series WLC
Cisco 7500 Series WLC
Cisco 8500 Series WLC
Cisco 500 Series Wireless Express Mobility Controllers
Cisco Wireless Services Module (Cisco WiSM)
Cisco Wireless Services Module version 2 (Cisco WiSM version 2)
Cisco NME-AIR-WLC Module for Integrated Services Routers (ISRs)
Cisco NM-AIR-WLC Module for Integrated Services Routers (ISRs)
Cisco Catalyst 3750G Integrated WLCs
Cisco Flex 7500 Series Cloud Controller
Cisco Virtual Wireless Controller
Cisco Wireless Controller Software for Integrated Services Module 300 and Cisco Services-Ready Engine 700, 710, 900, and 910

Darren Johnson reported the SNMP vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A remote authenticated user can modify the configuration on the target system.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.0.240.0, 7.2.111.3, 7.3.110.0).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20130123-wlc

Title: F5 BIG-IP Input Validation Flaws Lets Remote Users Inject SQL Commands and Download Files
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote authenticated user can inject SQL commands. A remote user can view files on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted XML entity value in a request to view files on target system with the privileges of the Apache web service [CVE-2012-2997].

A remote authenticated user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database [CVE-2012-3000].

The vendor was notified on September 7, 2012 and October 4, 2012, respectively.

The original advisory is available at:

https://www.sec-consult.com/en/Vulnerability-Lab/Advisories.htm

S. Viehbock of SEC Consult reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

A remote authenticated user can view files on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (11.2.0 HF3, 11.2.1 HF3).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/14000/100/sol14138.html

Title: Cisco NX-OS Nexus 7000 Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Nexus 7000. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target service to crash.

Systems with a higher-density line-card replaced in the same slot by a lower-density card and with the management station continuing to try and poll the non-existent higher ports are affected.

Cisco has a Cisco Bug ID CSCud44300 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive memory and system resources on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityNotice/CVE-2012-6396

Title: Linksys Router Unspecified Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Linksys Router. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user on the local network can send specially crafted data to execute arbitrary code on the target system.

The WRT54GL router is affected. Other routers may be affected.

The vendor has been notified.

DefenseCode LTD reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the local network can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Flaw Permits Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller. A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.
A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser [CVE-2012-6007]. The code will originate from the site running the Cisco Wireless LAN Controller software and will run in the security context of that site.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user [CVE-2012-5992].

One action can cause the target device to reload [CVE-2012-5991].

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCud50283, CSCud65187, and CSCud50209 to these vulnerabilities.

The original advisory is available at:

http://infosec42.blogspot.dk/2012/12/cisco-wlc-csrf-dos-and-persistent-xss.html

Jacob Holcomb/Gimppy042 of Independent Security Evaluators reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco Wireless LAN Controller software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: (Blue Coat Issues Fix for Blue Coat ProxySG) OpenSSL asn1_d2i_read_bio() Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. Blue Coat ProxySG is affected.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to the target application using OpenSSL to potentially trigger a heap overflow in the asn1_d2i_read_bio() function and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target application.

Applications that use ASN.1 BIO or FILE based functions to read untrusted DER format data are affected. The d2i_*_bio and d2i_*_fp type of functions are affected.

Applications that use the memory based ASN1 functions (e.g., d2i_X509, d2i_PKCS12 etc) are not affected.

The SSL/TLS code is not affected.

Applications using only the PEM routines are not affected.

S/MIME and CMS applications that use the built-in MIME parser SMIME_read_PKCS7 and SMIME_read_CMS functions are affected.

Tavis Ormandy, Google Security Team, reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
Blue Coat has issued a fix for Blue Coat ProxySG (5.5.11.1, 6.2.10.1).

A fix is not yet available for 5.4, 6.1, and 6.3.

The Blue Coat advisory is available at:

https://kb.bluecoat.com/index?page=content&id=SA70

Title: F5 FirePass SSL VPN Include File Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service and Potentially Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 FirePass SSL VPN. A remote user can include and execute PHP code on the target system.
The 'CitrixAuth.php' script does not properly validate user-supplied input in the 'sessionId' parameter. A remote user can supply a specially crafted URL to cause the target system to include and execute files located on the target system.

A remote user can also exploit this flaw to view or delete files located on the target system.

The vendor was notified on June 5, 2012.

The original advisory is available at:

https://www.sec-consult.com/fxdata/seccons/prod/temedia/advisories_txt/20121203-0_F5_FirePass_SSL_VPN_Local_File_Inclusion_v10.txt

S. Viehbock of SEC Consult reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can execute PHP code and operating system commands on the target system with the privileges of the target web service.

A remote user can view or delete files on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.0.0 HF-70-7).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/14000/000/sol14046.html

Title: Cisco Nexus 1000V Series Switch Security Policy Can Be Bypassed By Remote Users After Firmware Upgrade
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Cisco Nexus 1000V Series Switch. A remote user can bypass security policy restrictions.
When systems with the Virtual Security Gateway (VSG) are upgraded from Software Release 4.2(1)SV1(5.1a), or prior versions, to Software Release 4.2(1)SV1(5.2) via an in-service software upgrade, the virtual Ethernet ports may stay in the No-Policy pass-through mode. Traffic is not inspected by the VSG. As a result, a remote user can bypass the intended security policy restrictions.

The Cisco Nexus 1000V Series switches are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCud01427 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass security policy restrictions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (4.2(1)SV1(5.2a); pending).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityResponse/cisco-sr-20121107-n1k

Title: 3Com, HP, and H3C Switches SNMP Configuration Lets Remote Users Take Administrative Actions
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in 3Com, HP, and H3C Switches. A remote user can take administrative actions on the target system.
A remote user with knowledge of the SNMP public community string can access potentially sensitive data (e.g., user names, passwords) in the h3c-user.mib and hh3c-user.mib MIBs via SNMP and then use that data to take control of the target device.

A long list of specific products and model numbers is provided in the vendor's advisory.

Kurt Grutzmacher and CERT/CC reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can take administrative actions on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix for some affected products.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://h20565.www2.hp.com/portal/site/hpsc/public/kb/docDisplay?docId=emr_na-c03515685

Title: F5 FirePass SSL VPN Input Validation Flaw Permits Cross-Site URL Redirection Attacks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 FirePass SSL VPN. A remote user can conduct cross-site URL redirection attacks.
A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause the target user's browser to be redirected to an arbitrary URL.

The 'refreshURL' parameter of 'my.activation.cns.php3' is affected.

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

https://[target]/my.activation.cns.php3?langchar=&ui_translation=&refreshURL=http://[arbitrary site]/

The vendor was notified on March 31, 2012.

Aung Khant, YGN Ethical Hacker Group, Myanmar, reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target user's browser to be redirected to an arbitrary URL.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco IOS Intrusion Prevention System DNS Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted (but legitimate) DNS packets through the target device to cause the device to reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtw55976 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20120926-ios-ips

Title: Cisco IOS NAT Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted SIP packets to trigger a flaw in the NAT SIP application layer gateway (ALG) feature and cause the target device to reload [CVE-2012-4618].

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtn76183 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted IP packets to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2012-4619].

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtr46123 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20120926-nat

Title: Cisco IOS on Cisco 10000 Series Tunneled Traffic Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted IP tunneled packets to an interface on the target device to trigger a queue wedge and cause the device to be unable to process traffic on the affected interface. Transit traffic does not trigger the vulnerability.

GRE/IP, IPIP, and IPv6 in IPv4 packets can trigger the flaw.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCts66808 to this vulnerability.

Only the Cisco 10000 Series router is affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the device to be unable to process traffic on the affected interface.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20120926-c10k-tunnels

Title: Cisco IOS DHCPv6 Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target device to reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCto57723 to this vulnerability.

Systems with the DHCP version 6 (DHCPv6) server feature enabled are affected.

DHCP servers for IPv4 are not affected.

Cisco IOS and IOS XE are affected.

Cisco IOS XR Software is not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20120926-dhcpv6

Title: Cisco IOS BGP Attribute Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote peer on an existing Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) session can send a specially crafted attribute to cause all BGP sessions to reset.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug IDs CSCtt35379 and CSCty58300 to this vulnerability.

For Cisco IOS XR, Cisco has assigned Cisco bug IDs CSCtz63248 and CSCtz62914.

Cisco NXOS is not affected.
Impact': A remote user (BGP peer) can cause all BGP sessions on the target device to be reset.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20120926-bgp

Title: Cisco IOS SIP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) data to the target device to cause the target device to reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCtj33003 and CSCtw84664 to this vulnerability.

Systems configured with Session Description Protocol (SDP) pass-through enabled at either at the global level or at the dial-peer level are affected.

Cisco IOS XE is affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20120926-sip

Title: Cisco Catalyst Switch Unspecified Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Version(s): 4500E Series Switch with Cisco Catalyst Supervisor Engine 7L-E
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Catalyst Switch 4500E Series. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted packets to or through the target device to cause the supervisor card on the target device to reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCty88456 to this vulnerability.

The Catalyst 4500E series switch with Supervisor Engine 7L-E is affected.

Cisco IOS XE Software Release 03.02.00.XO.15.0(2)XO is affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the supervisor card on the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (IOS XE 3.3.0SG).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20120926-ecc

Title: Cisco IOS DHCP Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted DHCP packet to or through the target device to cause the target device to reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCty96049 to this vulnerability.

The vulnerability resides in the Device Sensor feature.

Cisco IOS XE and IOS XR are not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20120926-dhcp

Title: F5 BIG-IP Input Validation Flaw in Configuration Utility Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The ASM traffic overview page in the Configuration utility does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the BIG-IP configuration interface and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Roger Webyss with Dell SecureWorks reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the BIG-IP interface, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/13000/800/sol13838.html

Title: Cisco IOS SSL VPN Portal Page Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user can refresh the SSL VPN portal page to cause the target device to reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtr86328 to this vulnerability.

Version 15.1 and 15.2 devices configured for a clientless SSL VPN are affected.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (15.1(2)T5).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/ios/15_1/release/notes/151-2TCAVS.html

Title: Cisco NX-OS CDP Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted Cisco Discovery Protocol (CDP) packet to cause the target device to reset.

Systems with the High Availability (HA) policy configured for Reset are affected.

Cisco has assigned Bug IDs CSCtk34535 and CSCtk19132 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reset.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.2(1)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/switches/datacenter/sw/5_x/nx-os/release/notes/52_nx-os_release_note.html

Title: Cisco Carrier Routing System Lets Remote Users Bypass Access Control Lists
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Carrier Routing System. A remote user can bypass access control lists.
A remote user can send fragmented packets to bypass access control list (ACL) entries.

Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCtj10975 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass ACL entries.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (3.9.2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/cisco/software/release.html?mdfid=279506669&catid=268437899&flowid=1915&reltype=all&relind=AVAILABLE&release=3.9.2&softwareid=280867577

Title: Cisco Catalyst Switch Local Web Authentication Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Catalyst Switch. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote authenticated user can send specially crafted local web authentication data (quickly) to cause the target device to reload.

Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCts88664 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (15.0(1)SE1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/switches/lan/catalyst3750x_3560x/software/release/15.0_1_se/release/notes/OL25302.html

Title: Cisco MDS Fibre Channel over IP Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco MDS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted Fibre Channel over IP (FCIP) header data to cause a module reload on the target system.

Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCtn93151 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause a module reload on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.2(2)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/switches/datacenter/mds9000/sw/5_2/release/notes/nx-os/mds_nxos_rel_notes_522.html

Title: SMC SMC8024L2 Switch Web Interface Discloses Configuration Data to Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the SMC SMC8024L2 Switch. A remote user can obtain configuration data.
A remote user can supply a specially crafted URL to obtain configuration pages.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/377915

Elio Torrisi reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain configuration data.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco Application Control Engine IP Address Overlap May Let Remote Authenticated Administrators Login to the Incorrect Context
Version(s): prior to versions A4(2.3) and A5(1.1)
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Application Control Engine. A remote authenticated user may login to the incorrect context in certain cases.
When the Application Control Engine (ACE) is running in multicontext mode and two or more contexts are configured with the same management IP address, a remote authenticated administrative user may login to an unintended context (virtual instance) on the ACE.

The administrative user must have valid credentials on the target context.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCts30631 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user may login to the incorrect context in certain cases.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (A4(2.3) and A5(1.1)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20120620-ace

Title: (F5 Issues Fix for BIG-IP) BIND NULL rdata Field Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service and Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in BIND. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information. F5 BIG-IP is affected.
When a DNS resource record rdata field is zero length, the server may crash or disclose potentially sensitive information.

On recursive servers, the server may crash or disclose some portion of memory.

On secondary servers, the server may crash on restart after transferring a zone containing affected records.

On master servers, the server may corrupt zone data if the zone option "auto-dnssec" is set to "maintain".

Dan Luther, Level3 Communications, reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
Solution:
F5 has issued a fix for F5 BIG-IP.

F5 has assigned ID 387843 to this vulnerability.

The F5 advisory is available at:

http://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/13000/600/sol13660.html

Title: F5 FirePass Controller Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Inject SQL Commands
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 FirePass. A remote user can inject SQL commands.
The FirePass controller does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

The vendor has assigned ID 387894 to this vulnerability.

Tal Zeltzer reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a hotfix (HF-387894-1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/13000/600/sol13656.html

Title: F5 BIG-IP SSH Configuration Error Lets Remote Users Gain Root Access
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 BIG-IP. A remote user can gain root access.
A remote user can exploit an SSH configuration flaw to gain root access on the target device.

The vendor has assigned ID 379600 to this vulnerability.

The following other F5 products are also affected:

- VIPRION B2100, B4100, and B4200
- BIG-IP Virtual Edition
- Enterprise Manager 3000 and 4000

Florent Daignier of Matta Consulting reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain root access.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/13000/600/sol13600.html

Title: Cisco IOS XR Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service on Certain Devices
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted packet to the target device to cause the route processor to be unable to transmit route processor-based protocol packets to the fabric.

IP traffic transiting the device cannot trigger the flaw.

Cisco IOS XR is affected on the Cisco 9000 Series Aggregation Services Routers (ASR) Route Switch Processor (RSP440) and the Cisco Carrier Routing System (CRS) Performance Route Processor (PRP).

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCty94537 (ASR 9000) and CSCtz62593 (CRS) to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the route processor to be unable to transmit packets.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20120530-iosxr

Title: Cisco Carrier Routing System Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Carrier Routing System. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted network traffic to trigger a flaw in the NETIO and IPV4_IO processes and cause excessive CPU consumption on the target device [CVE-2011-3295]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCti59888 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted fragmented GRE packet to cause the Metro subsystem crash [CVE-2011-3283]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCts14887 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can cause excessive CPU consumption on the target system.

A remote user can cause the Metro subsystem crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisories are available at:

http://www.cisco.com/cisco/software/release.html?mdfid=280777815&softwareid=280867577&release=3.9.1
http://www-europe.cisco.com/cisco/software/release.html?mdfid=279879106&reltype=all&relind=AVAILABLE&release=3.9.2&softwareid=280867577&sortparam=7

Title: Cisco IOS Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Bypass Security Controls, Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information, and Deny Service
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can bypass security controls. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information. A physically local user can read the start-up configuration.
A remote user can send specially crafted SIP packets on a NAT interface to consume excessive CPU resources [CVE-2011-2578]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCts12366 to this vulnerability. Cisco IOS 15.1 and 15.2 are affected.

A remote user can return a specially crafted HTTP response to trigger a flaw in the HTTP client and cause the target device to crash [CVE-2011-2586]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCts12249 to this vulnerability. Cisco IOS 12.4 and 15.0 are affected.

A physically local user can bypass the No Service Password-Recovery feature and read the start-up configuration [CVE-2011-3289]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCtr97640 to this vulnerability. Cisco IOS 12.4 and 15.0 through 15.2 are affected.

A remote user can send specially crafted network traffic to trigger a flaw in the NETIO and IPV4_IO processes and cause excessive CPU consumption on the target device [CVE-2011-3295]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCti59888 to this vulnerability. Cisco IOS XR 3.8 through 4.1 is affected.

A remote user can send specially crafted traffic to trigger a flaw in the "set mpls experimental imposition" command and cause the target device to crash [CVE-2011-4007]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCtr56576 to this vulnerability. Cisco IOS 15.0 and 15.1 and IOS XE 3.x are affected.
