A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger an ICMPv6 ACL bug with unspecified impact [CVE-2011-4012]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID Bug ID CSCtj90091 to this vulnerability. Cisco IOS 12.0, 15.0, and 15.1 are affected. Systems using a Policy Feature Card 3C (PFC3C) are affected.

A remote user can send specially crafted UDP traffic to UDP port 465 to cause an interface queue wedge [CVE-2011-4015]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCts48300 to this vulnerability. Cisco IOS 15.2S is affected.

A remote user can send specially crafted network traffic to trigger a flaw in the PPP implementation and cause the target device to crash [CVE-2011-4016]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCtf71673 to this vulnerability. Cisco IOS 12.2 and 15.0 through 15.2 are affected. Systems using Point-to-Point Termination and Aggregation (PTA) and L2TP are affected.

The device does not properly process the vrf-also keyword during enforcement of access-class commands [CVE-2012-0338]. A remote user can establish a SSH connection from arbitrary IP addresses. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsv86113 to this vulnerability. Cisco IOS 12.2 through 12.4 and 15.0 are affected.

The device does not properly process the vrf-also keyword during enforcement of access-class commands [CVE-2012-0339]. A remote user can establish a Telnet connection from arbitrary IP addresses. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsi77774 to this vulnerability. Cisco IOS 12.2 through 12.4 and 15.0 are affected.

The ACL function does not properly process lines that end with a log or time keyword [CVE-2012-0362]. A remote user can send specially crafted network traffic to bypass access control list (ACL) restrictions in certain cases. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCts01106 to this vulnerability. Cisco IOS 12.2(58)SE2 and 15.0(1)SE are affected.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target device to crash.

A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources on the target system.

A remote user can bypass security controls.

A remote user can connect via Telnet and SSH from arbitrary IP addresses.

A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.

A physically local user can read the start-up configuration.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixes.

The vendor's advisories are available at:

http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/ios/15_1/release/notes/151-4MCAVS.html
http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=24436
http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/switches/lan/catalyst6500/ios/12.2SXF/native/release/notes/caveats_SXF_rebuilds.html
http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/switches/lan/catalyst6500/ios/12.2SX/release/notes/caveats_SXH_rebuilds.html
http://www.cisco.com/en/US/docs/ios/15_1/release/notes/151-2TCAVS.html

Title: HP ProCurve 5400 zl Switch Includes Malware Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP ProCurve Switch. A remote user may be able to gain privileges on other systems.
HP 5400 zl series ProCurve switches sold after April 30, 2011 and having certain serial numbers include a compact flash card that may contain malware. A local user that re-uses the flash card on a separate computer system can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target computer system.
Impact': A remote user may be able to gain privileges on other systems.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://h20000.www2.hp.com/bizsupport/TechSupport/Document.jsp?objectID=c03249176

Title: Cisco IOS Multicast Source Discovery Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted Multicast Source Discovery Protocol (MSDP) packet containing IGMP data to the target device to cause the target device to reload.

Cisco IOS XE is also affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtr28857 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20120328-msdp

Title: Cisco IOS Smart Install Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted Smart Install message on TCP port 4786 to cause the target device to reload.

Devices configured as a Smart Install client or director are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtt16051 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20120328-smartinstall

Title: Cisco IOS Reverse SSHv2 Login Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can attempt a reverse SSH login using a specially crafted username value to cause the target device to reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtr49064 to this vulnerability.

Systems with SSHv2 logins permitted are affected.

Cisco IOS XE is also affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20120328-ssh

Title: Cisco IOS RSVP VPN Routing and Forwarding Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
When the RSVP feature is used on a device configured with VPN routing and forwarding (VRF) instances, a remote user can cause an "interface wedge" that may result in a loss of connectivity, loss of routing protocol adjacency, or other conditions.

Systems with at least one VRF configured without RSVP and at least one other interface (physical or virtual), not in the same VRF, configured with RSVP are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCts80643 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can wedge the receive queue of any RSVP ingress interface.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20120328-rsvp

Title: Cisco IOS SIP NAT Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) packets via the target device to consume excessive memory and cause the target device to reload or become unstable.

Packets requiring network address translation (NAT) on the SIP payload can trigger this flaw.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCti35326 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive memory on the target device.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20120328-nat

Title: Cisco IOS IKE Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted Internet Key Exchange (IKE) data to cause the target device to reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCts38429 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20120328-ike

Title: Cisco IOS Bugs in Traffic Optimization Features Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target system to reload or become unstable.

The Wide Area Application Services (WAAS) Express feature is affected [CVE-2012-1314]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtt45381 to this vulnerability.

The Measurement, Aggregation, and Correlation Engine (MACE) feature is affected [CVE-2012-1312]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtu57226 to this vulnerability.

Systems configured for WAAS Express or MACE are affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to reload or become unstable.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20120328-mace

Title: Cisco IOS Zone-Based Firewall IP/HTTP/H.323/SIP Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in the Cisco IOS Zone-Based Firewall feature. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to the target device to trigger a memory leak and cause the target system to reload or become unstable.

Specially crafted IP packets can trigger this flaw [CVE-2012-1310]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCto89536 to this vulnerability.

A specially crafted HTTP packet sent to or via the target device can trigger this flaw in the HTTP Inspection Engine [CVE-2012-0387]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtq36153 to this vulnerability.

A specially crafted H.323 message sent to or via the target device can trigger this flaw in the H.323 inspection feature [CVE-2012-0388]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtq45553 to this vulnerability.

Specially crafted SIP messages sent to or via the target device can trigger this flaw in the SIP Inspection feature [CVE-2012-1315]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCti46171 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to reload or become unstable.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20120328-zbfw

Title: Cisco IOS Lets Remote Authenticated Users Bypass Command Authorization Level Controls
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote authenticated user can bypass command authorization level controls.
A remote authenticated user can connect via HTTP or HTTPS and execute arbitrary Cisco IOS commands that are configured for their authorization level.

Devices with an HTTP or HTTPS server configured are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtr91106 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary Cisco IOS commands that are configured for their authorization level.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20120328-pai

Title: (Blue Coat Issues Fix for ProxySG) OpenSSL Stored Session Cache Modification Bug May Let Remote Users Downgrade the Ciphersuite
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can cause the ciphersuite to be downgraded. Blue Coat ProxySG is affected.
A remote client user can modify the stored session cache ciphersuite, which may cause the ciphersuite to be downgraded to a weaker one on subsequent connections.

Martin Rex reported reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the ciphersuite to be downgraded.
Solution:
Blue Coat has issued a fix for ProxySG (6.1.2.1).

The Blue Coat advisory is available at:

https://kb.bluecoat.com/index?page=content&id=SA53

Title: F5 FirePass Input Validation Flaw in 'my.activation.php3' Lets Remote Users Inject SQL Commands
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 FirePass. A remote user can inject SQL commands.
The system does not properly validate user-supplied input. A remote user can supply a specially crafted parameter value to execute SQL commands on the underlying database.

The 'state' parameter in 'my.activation.php3' is affected.

The vendor has assigned ID 377712 to this vulnerability.

The vendor was notified on February 3, 2012.

The original advisory is available at:

https://www.sec-consult.com/files/20120328-0_F5_FirePass_SSL_VPN_unauthenticated_remote_root_v1.0.txt

C. Schwarz of SEC Consult Vulnerability Lab reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute SQL commands on the underlying database.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix:

6.1.0 HF-377712-1 (Must be installed on 6.1.0 HotFix_610-7)
7.0.0 HF-377712-1 (Must be installed on 7.0.0 HotFix_70-5)

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/13000/400/sol13463.html

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Bugs Let Remote Users View/Modify the Configuration and Cause Denial of Service Conditions
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controllers. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can view and modify the configuration.
A remote user can submit a specially crafted HTTP URL to the administrative management interface to cause the target device to crash [CVE-2012-0368]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCts81997 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a series of specially crafted IPv6 packets to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2012-0369]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtt07949 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a series of specially crafted HTTP or HTTPS packets via the wired or wireless interface to a target controller that is configured for WebAuth to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2012-0370]. Cisco has assigned CSCtt47435 to this vulnerability.

On systems configured with CPU based access control lists (ACLs) in the wireless controller, a remote user can send specially crafted data via TCP port 1023 to view or modify the configuration [CVE-2012-0371]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtu56709 to this vulnerability. Only the Cisco 4400 Series WLCs, WiSM version 1, and Cisco Catalyst 3750G Integrated WLCs are affected by this vulnerability.

The following models are affected by at least one of the vulnerabilities:

  * Cisco 2000 Series WLC
  * Cisco 2100 Series WLC
  * Cisco 2500 Series WLC
  * Cisco 4100 Series WLC
  * Cisco 4400 Series WLC
  * Cisco 5500 Series WLC
  * Cisco 500 Series Wireless Express Mobility Controllers
  * Cisco Wireless Services Modules (WiSM)
  * Cisco Wireless Services Modules version 2 (WiSM version 2)
  * Cisco NME-AIR-WLC Modules for Integrated Services Routers (ISRs)
  * Cisco NM-AIR-WLC Modules for Integrated Services Routers (ISRs)
  * Cisco Catalyst 3750G Integrated WLCs
  * Cisco Flex 7500 Series Cloud Controllers
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target device to crash or reload.

A remote user can view and modify the configuration.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.0.220.4, 7.1.91.0, 7.2.103.0).

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisories are available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20120229-wlc

Title: Cisco Small Business SRP500 Series Bugs Let Remote Users Upload Files and Remote Authenticated Users Inject Commands
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Small Business SRP 500 Series devices. A remote authenticated user can execute commands on the target system. A remote user can upload files to the target system. A remote user can upload an arbitrary configuration file.
The Services Ready Platform Configuration Utility web interface contains several vulnerabilities.

A remote authenticated user can submit a specially crafted URL to execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system [CVE-2012-0363]. The commands will run with root privileges. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtt46871 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can upload an arbitrary configuration file [CVE-2012-0364]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtw55495 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can exploit a flaw in the Local TFTP file upload application to upload arbitrary files to be installed on the target device [CVE-2012-0365]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtw56009 to this vulnerability.

The models are affected when running firmware prior to version 1.1.26:

  * Cisco SRP 521W
  * Cisco SRP 526W
  * Cisco SRP 527W

The following models are affected when running firmware prior to version 1.2.4:

  * Cisco SRP 521W-U
  * Cisco SRP 526W-U
  * Cisco SRP 527W-U
  * Cisco SRP 541W
  * Cisco SRP 546W
  * Cisco SRP 547W

Michal Sajdak of Securitum, Poland reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary operating system commands with root privileges on the target device.

A remote user can upload files to the target system.

A remote user can upload an arbitrary configuration file.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1.1.26 or 1.2.4, depending on model number).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20120223-srp500

Title: Cisco NX-OS IP Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted IP packet to cause the target device to reload.

The vulnerability occurs when the device attepts to obtain Layer 4 (e.g., UDP, TCP) data from the specially crafted IP packet.

Nexus 1000v, 5000, and 7000 Series Switches are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCti23447 and CSCti49507 (Cisco Nexus 1000v and 7000 Series) and CSCtj01991 (Cisco Nexus 5000 Series) to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (1000v: 4.2(1)SV1(5.1); 5000: 5.0(2)N1(1); 7000: 4.2.8, 5.0.5, 5.1.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20120215-nxos

Title: Cisco Small Business RV Series WPS Protocol Flaw Lets Remote Users Conduct Brute Force WPS PIN Guessing Attacks to Access the Target Network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Small Business RV Series. A remote user can conduct brute force guessing attacks to gain access to the target network.
The PIN External Registrar (PIN-ER) mode of the Wi-Fi Protected Setup (WPS) protocol contains a weakness that allows a remote user within range of the wireless interface to determine if the first half of the 8 digit WPS configuration PIN is correct. A remote user within range of the wireless interface can exploit this to conduct a brute force WPS configuration PIN guessing attack and gain access to the target network in a short amount of time.

The following Cisco Small Business RV Series devices are affected:

Cisco RV110W
Cisco RV120W

The vulnerability resides in the WPS protocol and is not limited to these devices.

The original advisories are available at:

http://sviehb.files.wordpress.com/2011/12/viehboeck_wps.pdf
http://www.devttys0.com/2011/12/cracking-wpa-in-10-hours-or-less/

Stefan Viehbock and Craig Heffner independently reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user within range of the wireless interface can conduct brute force guessing attacks to gain access to the target wireless network.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor plans to issue a fix.

The vendor recommends disabling the vulnerable feature as a workaround.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityResponse/cisco-sr-20120111-wps
