Title: F5 FirePass PHP Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 FirePass. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted multipart/form-data POST request to exploit a flaw in PHP and cause excessive resource consumption on the target device.

HTTP accessible functions such as Portal Access, Application Access, Logon, and the Admin interface are affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause excessive resource consumption on the target device.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/13000/200/sol13279.html

Title: (F5 Issues Fix for BIG-IP) Apache httpd Byterange Filter Processing Error Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Apache. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. F5 BIG-IP is affected.
A remote user can send specially crafted requests to cause the HTTP byterange filter code to consume excessive memory on the target system. This may cause the target system to become unstable.

The 'Range' and 'Range-Request' headers are affected.

This vulnerability is being actively exploited.

A demonstration exploit is available at:

http://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/17696/

Kingcope reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to become unstable.
Solution:
F5 has issued a fix for BIG-IP, which is affected by this vulnerability.

A patch matrix is available in the F5 advisory.

F5 has issued bug IDs 366505 (for BIG-IP and Enterprise Manager) and 366621 (for ARX) to this vulnerability.

The F5 advisory is available at:

http://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/13000/100/sol13114

Title: JUNOS MX Series Ktree::createFourWayNode() Lets Remote Users Crash the Target MPC
Version(s): MX Series; 10.0, 10.1, 10.2, 10.3, 10.4 prior to 10.4R6, and 11.1 prior to 11.1R4
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in JUNOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted route prefix install or delete action (e.g., BGP UPDATE) to trigger a Modular Port Concentrator (MPC) crash in Ktree::createFourWayNode(). Both IPv4 and IPv6 routing prefix updates can trigger this MPC crash.

MX Series routers with port concentrators based on the Trio chipset are affected when active protocol-based route prefix additions/deletions occur.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target Modular Port Concentrator (MPC) to crash. The MPC will return to normal operations automatically.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (releases built on or after 2011-08-03, including 10.0S18, 10.4R6, 11.1R4, 11.2R1, and all subsequent releases).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://kb.juniper.net/InfoCenter/index?page=content&id=JSA10485

Title: (Apple Issues Fix for Time Capsule and AirPort Base Station) ISC DHCP Meta-Character Filtering Flaw in dhclient Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in ISC DHCP. A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system. Apple Time Capsule and AirPort Base Station are affected.
A remote DHCP server can return specially crafted hostname field meta-characters to cause the connected dhclient to execute arbitrary commands.

Sebastian Krahmer and Marius Tomaschewski of the SUSE Security Team reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
Apple has issued a fix for Time Capsule and AirPort Base Station (firmware version 7.6).

The Apple advisory is available at:

http://support.apple.com/kb/HT5005

Title: Cisco Small Business SRP500 Series Bug Lets Remote Users Inject Commands
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Cisco Small Business SRP500 Series Services Ready Platforms. A remote user can cause arbitrary commands to be executed on the target system.
A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by the target authenticated administrative user, will execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system. The code will run with root privileges.

A remote user can also exploit this flaw by conducting a man-in-the-middle attack to intercept an authenticated administrator's session and then inject commands with root privileges.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtr45124 to this vulnerability.

The following models are affected when running firmware prior to version 1.1.24:

Cisco SRP521W
Cisco SRP526W
Cisco SRP527W

The following models are affected when running firmware prior to version 1.2.1:

Cisco SRP541W
Cisco SRP546W
Cisco SRP547W

Michal Sajdak of Securitum, Poland, reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create a URL that, when loaded by the target authenticated administrative user, will execute arbitrary commands on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

For Cisco SRP521W, SRP526W, SRP527W: 1.1.24

For Cisco SRP541W, SRP546W, SRP547W: 1.2.1

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20111102-srp500

Title: Cisco NX-OS Command Validation Flaw Lets Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Some command arguments are not properly validated. A local user can supply specially crafted parameters to execute arbitrary operating system commands on the target system with elevated privileges.

The 'section' command and 'less' command is affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug IDs CSCtf40008, CSCtg18363, CSCtr44645, CSCts10195, and CSCts10188 to this vulnerability.

Peter Adkins reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

Cisco Nexus 7000 Series Switches: 4.2(6), 5.1(1)

Cisco Nexus 5000 Series Switches: 4.2(1)N2(1)

Cisco Nexus 4000 Series Switches: Upcoming 1H Release

Cisco Nexus 2000 Series Switches: 4.1(1)N2(1)

Cisco Nexus 1000V Series Switches: 4.2(1)SV1(5.1)

Cisco MDS 9000 Software: 4.2(6), 5.1(1)

Cisco Unified Computing System: 1.3(1c), 1.4(1i)

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=24458

Title: Cisco IOS IP Service Level Agreement Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS IP Service Level Agreement. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted UDP packets to cause the target device to reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtk67073 to this vulnerability.

IOS devices configured for IP Service Level Agreement (SLA) are affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20110928-ipsla.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS IPv6 Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted IPv6 packet to the target device to cause the target device to reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtj41194 to this vulnerability.

Transit traffic is not affected.

IOS devices configured for IPv6 are affected.

Cisco IOS XR and Cisco IOS XE are not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20110928-ipv6.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS Data-Link Switching Memory Leak Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS Data-Link Switching. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted IP Protocol 91 packets to exploit a memory leak in the Data-Link Switching (DLSw) feature and cause the target device to reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCth69364 to this vulnerability.

Devices with only statically configured DLSw peers are not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20110928-dlsw.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS IPS and Zone-Based Firewall Flaws Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS in the Intrusion Prevention System (IPS) and Zone-Based Firewall features. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can create new sessions at a high rate to trigger a memory leak [CVE-2011-3273]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCti79848 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted HTTP packets to cause the target device to hang or crash [CVE-2011-3281]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCto68554 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to hang, become unstable, or reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20110928-zbfw.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS Network Address Translation Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data via the target device to cause the target device to reload or become unresponsive.

Cisco IOS XR is not affected.

A remote user can send specially crafted LDAP data for the NetMeeting Directory feature to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2011-0946]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtd10712 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) packets via TCP to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2011-3276]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCso02147 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted SIP packets via an MPLS device to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2011-3279]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCti98219 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted SIP packets via UDP to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2011-3278, CVE-2011-3280]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug IDs CSCti48483 and CSCtj04672 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted H.323 packets via TCP port 1720 to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2011-3277]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCth11006 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload or become unresponsive.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20110928-nat.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS IPv6 Over MPLS Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted IPv6 packets over a Multiprotocol Label Switching (MPLS) domain to cause the target device to reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug IDs CSCto07919 and CSCtj30155 to these vulnerabilities.

The devices do not need to be configured for IPv6.

Cisco IOS XR is not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20110928-ipv6mpls.shtml

Title: Cisco 10000 Series Routers ICMP Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco 10000 Series Routers. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a series of specially crafted ICMP packets to or though the target device to cause the device to reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtk62453 to this vulnerability.

Cisco 10000 Series Routers running certain versions of Cisco IOS are affected.

Cisco IOS XR and IOS XE are not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20110928-c10k.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS SIP Processing Flaws Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) data to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2011-0939]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCth03022 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted SIP data to trigger memory leak on the target device [CVE-2011-3275]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCti48504 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted SIP data to trigger a memory leak or cause the target device to reload [CVE-2011-2072]. Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCto88686 to this vulnerability.

Cisco IOS XR is not affected.
Impact': A remote user can trigger a memory leak or cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20110928-sip.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS Smart Install Unspecified Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS Smart Install. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can connect to TCP port 4786 and send specially crafted data to execute arbitrary code on the target system.

The Smart Install feature of Cisco Catalyst Switches running Cisco IOS are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCto10165 this vulnerability.

Cisco IOS XR and IOS XE are not affected.

Greg Jones of Digital Assurance reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20110928-smart-install.shtml

Title: Cisco NX-OS Nexus 3000 and 5000 Switches Let Remote Users Bypass Access Control Lists
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A remote user can bypass access control lists.
A remote user can bypass deny statements in access control lists (ACLs).

Systems with a remark statement configured before a deny statement on an ACL are affected.

IPv4, IPv6 and MAC ACLs are affected.

Quality of service (QoS) classification and route-map ACLs are not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug IDs CSCto09813 and CSCtr61490 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass access control lists to access ostensibly protected resources.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Nexus 3000 NX-OS 5.0(3)U1(2a) or 5.0(3)U2(1); 5000 NX-OS 5.0(3)N2(1)).

The vendor's advisories are available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20110907-nexus.shtml

Title: Cisco NX-OS CDP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send a Cisco Discovery Protocol (CDP) packet with a specially crafted Device ID value to cause the CDP daemon to crash or potentially execute arbitrary code. The code will run with administrative privileges.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtf08873 to this vulnerability.

George Hedfors reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco IOS Data-Link Switching Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a series of specially crafted packets to cause the target device to crash and reload.

Systems with data-link switching (DLSw) enabled are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtf74999 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can the target device to crash and reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.2(33)SCF).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/Support/BugToolKit/search/getBugDetails.do?method=fetchBugDetails&bugId=CSCtf74999

Title: Cisco IOS SSHv2 Custom Login Banner Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can establish two SSHv2 sessions with the target device to cause the device to crash and reload.

Systems with a customized login banner configured using the banner login message global configuration command are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCto62631 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (12.2(58)SE1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/Support/BugToolKit/search/getBugDetails.do?method=fetchBugDetails&bugId=CSCto62631

Title: (F5 Issues Fix for BIG-IP) BIND RRSIG RRsets Negative Caching Off-by-one Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in BIND. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. F5 BIG-IP is affected.
A remote DNS server can supply very large RRSIG RRsets in a negative response to trigger an off-by-one error in a buffer size check and cause the target requesting named process to crash.
Impact': A remote user can cause named to crash.
Solution:
F5 has issued a fix for BIG-IP.

The F5 advisory is available at:

http://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/12000/900/sol12985.html

Title: Cisco ASR 9000 Series Router IPv4 Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ASR 9000 Series Routers. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted IPv4 packet to or via the device to cause a network processor in a line card to lock up and then reload.

Cisco ASR 9000 Series routers running Cisco IOS XR version 4.1.0 are affected.

The following models are affected:

Cisco ASR 9006 router
Cisco ASR 9010 router

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtr26695 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause a line card to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (SMU ID AA05118: asr9k-p-4.1.0.CSCtr26695.tar).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20110720-asr9k.shtml

Title: BIG-IP ASM Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in BIG-IP ASM. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The web scraping feature does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input when configured to Block in the ASM security policy. On a vulnerable web site, a remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the target site and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with a target vulnerable site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has described a workaround in their advisory.

The vendor plans to issue a fix in the upcoming version 10.2.2 HF1.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/12000/900/sol12953.html

Title: Blue Coat ProxySG Discloses Potentially Sensitive Information in Core Files
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Blue Coat ProxySG. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
In version 6.1 and 6.2, the software includes information from the secure heap when writing core files. A user with access to the core file can obtain potentially sensitive information, including keys and HTTP authentication credentials.
Impact': A user can obtain potentially sensitive information, including keys and HTTP authentication credentials for end users.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (6.2.2.1).

A fix for version 6.1 is not yet available.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://kb.bluecoat.com/index?page=content&id=SA56

Title: Cisco IOS XR SSHv1 Lockfile Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
The system may fail to remove a lock file when an SSHv1 session ends. A remote user can initiate multiple sessions to consume all available space in the /tmp filesystem and cause the device to crash.

Devices configured to accept SSHv1 connections are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtd64417 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (3.8.3, 3.9.1, and 4.0.0).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20110525-iosxr-ssh.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS XR SPA Interface Processor IPv4 Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR 12000. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted IPv4 packet to cause the target Shared Port Adapters (SPA) Interface Processor to reload.

All Engine 5 Line Cards (SIP-600, SIP-601, SIP-501, and SIP-401) on the Cisco XR 12000 Series Routers are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCto45095 to this vulnerability.

The following products are not affected:

  * Cisco 12000 Series SPA interface processors running Cisco IOS Software
  * Cisco XR 12000 Series Engine 3 Line Cards
  * Cisco ASR 9000 Series Aggregation Services Routers
  * Cisco Carrier Routing System Series Routers
Impact': A remote user can cause the target SPA interface processor to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (4.0.3, 4.1.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20110525-iosxrspa.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS XR IPv4 Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted IPv4 packets to or through the target device to cause the target NetIO process to restart. If the NetIO process is restarted several times, the Cisco CRS Modular Services Card (MSC) on a Cisco Carrier Routing System (CRS) or a Line Card on a Cisco 12000 Series Router or Cisco ASR 9000 Series Aggregation Services Router will reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCth44147 to this vulnerability.

Systems with an IPv4 address configured on one of the interfaces of a Cisco Line Card or Cisco CRS MSC are affected.

The following Cisco hardware platforms are affected:

  * Cisco ASR 9000 Series Aggregation Services Routers
  * Cisco Carrier Routing System
  * Cisco XR 12000 Series Routers

Cisco IOS, IOS XE, and NX-OS are not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the Cisco CRS MSC on a Cisco CRS or the line cards on a Cisco 12000 Series Router or Cisco ASR 9000 Series Aggregation Services Router to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (3.9.2).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20110525-iosxr.shtml

Title: Cisco Gigabit Security Router Bugs Let Remote Users Obtain Information and Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): Cisco RVS4000 v1 and v2, WRVS4400N V1.0, V1.1, and V2
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in the Cisco RVS4000 and WRVS4400N Gigabit Security Routers. A remote user can obtain sensitive information and authentication data from the target system. A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system with root privileges.
If the administrator of the device has created a backup of the configuration, a remote user can obtain the configuration file [CVE-2011-1645]. The configuration includes the HTTP authentication password and VPN pre-shared keys.

A remote authenticated user can exploit the ping test and traceroute test functions to inject arbitrary operating system commands with root privileges [CVE-2011-1646].

A remote user can obtain the admin SSL certificate private key that is used for Quick VPN [CVE-2011-1647].

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtn23871 to these vulnerabilities.

The web management interface of the Cisco RVS4000 4-port Gigabit Security Routers and Cisco WRVS4400N Wireless-N Gigabit Security Routers are affected.

Michal Sajdak of Securitum, Poland, reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary commands with root privileges on the target system.

A remote user can obtain the configuration backup and private keys.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

For RVS4000v1: 1.3.3.4; available for download June 19, 2011.

For RVS4000v2: 2.0.2.7; available for download June 19, 2011.

For WRVS4400Nv2: 2.0.2.1; available for download June 10, 2011.

WRVS4400Nv1 and WRVS4400Nv1 are no longer supported.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20110525-rvs4000.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS 2921/K9 Router Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to UDP ports 161 and 162 to cause the target service to consume excessive CPU resources when SNMP is disabled.

A remote user can send a large number of UDP packets to cause the target device to consume all available CPU resources and become unresponsive.

The Cisco 2921/K9 router is affected.

The penetration test team Of NCNIPC (China) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume excessive CPU resources on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor is analyzing the report and has not yet confirmed this vulnerability.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sr-20110505-ios.shtml

Title: Blue Coat ProxySG's Blue Coat Authentication and Authorization Agent Stack Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Blue Coat ProxySG's Blue Coat Authentication and Authorization Agent (BCAAA). A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to the Windows-based Blue Coat Authentication and Authorization Agent on TCP port 16102 to trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target BCAAA system. The code will run with System privileges.

ProxyOne is also affected.

Paul Harrington of NGS Secure Research reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (4.3.4.2 [interim fix], 5.4.7.1, 5.5.5.1, 6.1.4.1, 6.2.1.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://kb.bluecoat.com/index?page=content&id=SA55

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller ICMP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user on a wired or wireless segment can send a series of specially crafted ICMP packets to cause the target device to reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCth74426 to this vulnerability.

The following products are affected.

  * Cisco 2100 Series Wireless LAN Controllers
  * Cisco WLC526 Mobility Express Controller (AIR-WLC526-K9)
  * Cisco NME-AIR-WLC Modules for Integrated Services Routers (ISRs)
  * Cisco NM-AIR-WLC Modules for Integrated Services Routers (ISRs)
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (6.0.200.0, 7.0.98.216, and 7.0.112.0).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20110427-wlc.shtml

Title: (Blue Coat Issues Fix for ProxySG) OpenSSL Stored Session Cache Modification Bug May Let Remote Users Downgrade the Ciphersuite
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSL. A remote user can cause the ciphersuite to be downgraded. Blue Coat ProxySG is affected.
A remote client user can modify the stored session cache ciphersuite, which may cause the ciphersuite to be downgraded to a weaker one on subsequent connections.

Martin Rex reported reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the ciphersuite to be downgraded.
Solution:
Blue Coat has issued a fix for Blue Coat ProxySG (5.4.6.1, 5.5.4.1, 6.1.2.1).

Fixes for 4.3 and 5.3 are not yet available at the time of this entry.

The Blue Coat advisory is available at:

https://kb.bluecoat.com/index?page=content&id=SA53

Title: Cisco IOS Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS. A remote or remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote authenticated user can bypass certain certificate controls.
A remote user can simultaneously end two calls that were controlled by CallManager Express (CME) to cause STCAPP-controlled ports to hang [CVE-2010-4687]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCtd42552 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted SIP TRUNK traffic that contains rate bursts and a certain request size to cause excessive memory consumption on CallManager Express [CVE-2010-4686]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCtb47950 to this vulnerability.

The device does not clear the public key cache upon a change to a certificate map [CVE-2010-4685]. A remote authenticated user can bypass a certificate ban by connecting with a banned certificate that had previously been valid. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCta79031 to this vulnerability.

When TFTP debugging is enabled, a remote user can perform a TFTP copy via IPv6 to cause the target device to crash [CVE-2010-4684]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCtb28877 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted SIP REGISTER message via UDP to cause excessive memory consumption on the target device [CVE-2010-4683]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCtg41733 to this vulnerability.

A remote authenticated users can trigger a flaw in CallManager Express (CME) and cause the target device to crash by using an extension mobility (EM) phone to interact with the menu for SNR number changes [CVE-2009-5040]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCta63555 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can make a large number of calls to trigger a memory leak in the gk_circuit_info_do_in_acf function in the H.323 implementation and consume excessive memory on the target devices [CVE-2009-5039]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCsz72535 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can attempt to connect to a certain IRC server after the target device has performed an initial reload to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2009-5038]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCso05336 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send multiple Router Advertisement (RA) messages with different source addresses to cause excessive CPU consumption on the target device and possibly cause the target device to hang [CVE-2010-4671]. Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCti33534 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote or remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote authenticated user can bypass certain certificate controls.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (15.0(1)XA5).

Some vulnerabilities were fixed in prior versions.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.ciscosystems.com/en/US/docs/ios/15_0/15_0x/15_01_XA/rn800xa.pdf

Title: Apple Time Capsule and AirPort Base Station Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service or Access Ostensibly Protected Hosts
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Apple Time Capsule and AirPort Base Station.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  A remote user can access hosts behind the device.
A remote user on the local network can send a large number of IPv6 Router Advertisement (RA) and Neighbor Discovery (ND) packets to cause the target device to restart [CVE-2009-2189].  Shoichi Sakane of the KAME project, Kanai Akira of Internet Multifeed Co., Shirahata Shin and Rodney Van Meter of Keio University, and Tatuya Jinmei of Internet Systems Consortium, Inc. reported this vulnerability.

If a system behind the NAT function on the device has a portmapped FTP server, a remote user on that system can query services behind the device [CVE-2010-0039].  Sabahattin Gucukoglu reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted DHCP reply to cause the target device to stop responding to network traffic [CVE-2010-1804].  Systems configured as a bridge or configured in Network Address Translation (NAT) mode with a default host enabled are affected.  Stefan R. Filipek reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target device to restart or stop responding to network traffic.

A remote user behind the deivce can access other hosts behind the device in certain cases.
Solution:
Apple has issued a fix for Time Capsule and AirPort Base Station (7.5.2).

The Apple advisory is available at:

http://support.apple.com/kb/HT4298

Title: (Apple Issues Fix for AirPort and Time Capsule) Net-snmp GETBULK Request Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Net-snmp.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  Time Capsule and AirPort Base Station are affected.
A remote user can send a specially crafted GETBULK request to cause the target service to crash.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to crash.
Solution:
Apple has issued a fix for Time Capsule and AirPort Base Station (7.5.2).

The Apple advisory is available at:

http://support.apple.com/kb/HT4298

Title: Blue Coat ProxySG Lets Remote Users Bypass JavaScript Filtering
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Blue Coat ProxySG.  A remote user can bypass JavaScript filtering.
The Active Content Transformation or Removal feature of ProxySG does not properly detect and filter JavaScript that is encoded using hex and UTF-8 entities.  A remote user create content that can bypass the JavaScript filtering policy rules.
Impact': A remote user can bypass the JavaScript filtering policy rules.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (5.4.5.1).

A fix is pending for 4.3, 5.5, and 6.1.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://kb.bluecoat.com/index?page=content&id=SA48

Title: HP ProCurve Access Point, Access Controller, and Mobility Controller Bugs Let Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP ProCurve Access Point, Access Controller, and Mobility Controller devices.  A remote authenticated user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A remote authenticated user can gain full control over the target device.

Various models are affected.

No details were provided.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://h20000.www2.hp.com/bizsupport/TechSupport/Document.jsp?objectID=c02544568

Title: Blue Coat ProxySG Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Blue Coat ProxySG.  A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The administrative interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input.  A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the Blue Coat ProxySG device and will run in the security context of that site.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Blue Coat ProxySG device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (6.1.1.1).

Fixes for version 4.3, 5.3, 5.4, and 5.5 are not yet available.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://kb.bluecoat.com/index?page=content&id=SA47

Title: Cisco IOS H.323 Processing Flaws Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted H.323 packets to cause the target device to reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCtc73759 and CSCtd33567 to these vulnerabilities.

Cisco IOS devices with H.323 voice services enabled are affected.

Cisco IOS XR is not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix. A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20100922-h323.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS IGMP v3 Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted Internet Group Management Protocol (IGMP) version 3 protocol packet to cause the target device to reload.

The packet must be sent to an interface that is enabled for IGMPv3 and Protocol Independent Multicast.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCte14603 to this vulnerability.

Cisco IOS and Cisco IOS XE are affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix. A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20100922-igmp.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS SIP Processing Flaws Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted SIP data to cause the target device to reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug IDs CSCta20040, CSCsz43987, and CSCtf72678 to these vulnerabilities.

Cisco IOS based devices with SIP voice services enabled are affected.

The SIP Application Layer Gateway (ALG) is not affected.

Cisco IOS XR is not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.  A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20100922-sip.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS SSL VPN HTTP Redirect Memory Leak Lets Remote Users Deny Serivce
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to exhaust memory on the target device, preventing new TCP connections or causing the device to reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtg21685 to this vulnerability.

The vulnerability is triggered by a leak of transmission control blocks (TCBs) when SSL sessions are abnormally disconnected.

A complete TCP 3-way handshake is required but authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.

Cisco IOS based devices that are configured with SSL VPN and HTTP port redirection are affected.

The following products are not affected:

  * Cisco ASA 5500 Series Adaptive Security Appliances
  * Cisco IOS XR Software
  * Cisco IOS XE Software
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to stop accepting TCP connections or to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.  A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20100922-sslvpn.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS Network Address Translation Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted SIP packet via UDP through the target device to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2010-2831].  Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtf17624 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted H.323 packet via TCP port 1720 through the target device to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2010-2832].  A completed TCP handshake is not required to exploit this flaw.  Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtf91428 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted H.225.0 packet via TCP port 1720 through the target device to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2010-2833].  Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtd86472 to this vulnerability.

Cisco IOS based devices that are configured for NAT and that support NAT for SIP, H.323, or H.225.0 call signaling for H.323 packets are affected.

Cisco IOS XE is not affected.

Cisco IOS XR is not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.  A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20100922-nat.shtml

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Flaws Let Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges and Remote Users Bypass ACLs and Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controllers.  A remote user can bypass access control lists.  A remote authenticated user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted IKE packet to the target device to cause the device to crash and reload [CVE-2010-0574].  Cisco has asssigned Cisco Bug ID CSCta56653 to this vulnerability.

A remote authenticated user can send a series of specially crafted HTTP pakcets to the target device to cause the device to reload [CVE-2010-2841].  Only traffic destined to the target device can trigger this vulnerability.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtd16938 to this vulnerability.

A remote authenticated user with read-only privileges can modify the device configuration [CVE-2010-2842, CVE-2010-2843, CVE-2010-3033].  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCtc91431, CSCsz66726, and CSCtc93837 to these vulnerabilities.

A remote user can bypass CPU-based access control lists (ACLs) [CVE-2010-0575, CVE-2010-3034].  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCta66931 and CSCtf36051 to these vulnerabilities.

The following product models are affected:

  * Cisco 2000 Series WLCs
  * Cisco 2100 Series WLCs
  * Cisco 4100 Series WLCs
  * Cisco 4400 Series WLCs
  * Cisco 5500 Series WLCs
  * Cisco Wireless Services Modules (WiSMs)
  * Cisco WLC Modules for Integrated Services Routers (ISRs)
  * Cisco Catalyst 3750G Integrated WLCs
Impact':
A remote user can bypass access control lists.

A remote authenticated user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (3.2.215.0, 4.2.209.0, 4.2.207.54M, 5.2.193.11, 6.0.199.0).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20100908-wlc.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS XR BGP Attribute Processing Flaw Permits Denial of Service Attacks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR.  A remote authenticated BGP peer can cause denial of service conditions.
When a BGP peer announces a prefix with a specific and valid but unrecognized transitive attribute, the target Cisco IOS XR device will corrupt the attribute before sending it to neighboring devices, causing the neighboring devices to reset the BGP peering session.

Cisco IOS XR devices that are not configured for BGP routing are not affected.

Cisco IOS is not affected.
Impact': A remote authenticated BGP peer can cause peers of the target IOS XR device to cause neighboring peers to reset the peering session.
Solution:
The vendor is issuing a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20100827-bgp.shtml

Title: Blue Coat ProxySG Privilege Enforcement Mechanism Can Be Bypassed By Remote Authenticated Administrators
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Blue Coat ProxySG.  A remote authenticated user can gain elevated privileges on the target system.
A remote authenticated read-only administrator user can send specially crafted commands via an HTTPS URL to bypass the privilege enforcement mechanism and execute arbitrary commands.

Thierry Zoller reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated read-only administrator user can execute arbitrary commands.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (4.3.4.1, 5.4.5.1, 5.5.4.1, 6.1.1.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://kb.bluecoat.com/index?page=content&id=SA45

Title: Cisco IOS TCP Connection Establishment Flaw Lets Remote Users Prevent TCP Connections to the Device
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data during the TCP establishment phase to cause the target TCP connection to remain in a SYNRCVD or SYNSENT state.  A remote user can repeat this to consume excessive system resources and prevent new TCP connections, including management connections.

A completed three-way handshake is not required to trigger this vulnerability.

Transit traffic is not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCti18193 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can prevent TCP connections from being established with the target device.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (15.1(2)T0a).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20100812-tcp.shtml

Title: Cisco Application Control Engine RTSP/SIP/SSL Inspection Flaws Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Application Control Engine.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
The Cisco ACE Application Control Engine Module and Cisco ACE 4710 Application Control Engine are affected.

The Cisco ACE XML Gateway, the Cisco ACE Web Application Firewall, and the Cisco ACE GSS 4400 Series Global Site Selector Appliances are not affected.

A remote user can send specially crafted RTSP packets via TCP through the target device to cause the target device (with RTSP inspection enabled) to reload [CVE-2010-2822].  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCta85227 (for the ACE Appliance) and CSCtg14858 (for the ACE Module) to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted HTTP packets through devices that have HTTP, RTSP, or SIP inspection enabled to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2010-2823].  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtb54493 to this vulnerability.  The ACE Module is not affected.

A remote user can send a series of specially crafted SSL packets via TCP to the target device to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2010-2824].  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCta20756 to this vulnerability.  The ACE Appliance is not affected.

A remote user can send specially crafted SIP packets via TCP or UDP through the target device to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2010-2825].  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCta65603 (for the ACE Module) and CSCta71569 (for the ACE Appliance to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (ACE Appliance A3(2.6), ACE Module A2(3.2)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20100811-ace.shtml

Title: HP ProCurve 2626 and 2650 Switch Grant Unauthorized Access to Remote Users
Version(s): 2626 and 2650 Series (certain models); Releases prior to H.10.80
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP ProCurve 2626 and 2650 Switches.  A remote user can gain access to the target system.
No details were provided.

Versions prior to H.10.80 on the following models are affected:

J8165A ProCurve Switch 2650-PWR
J4899A, J4899B, and J4899C ProCurve Switch 2650
J8164A ProCurve Switch 2626-PWR
J4900A, J4900B, and J4900C ProCurve Switch 2626
Impact': A remote user can gain unauthorized access on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (H.10.80).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://h20000.www2.hp.com/bizsupport/TechSupport/Document.jsp?objectID=c02436047

Title: HP ProCurve 2610 Switch DHCP Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Version(s): 2610 Series (certain models); releases prior to R.11.22
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the HP ProCurve 2610 Switch.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data via DHCP to cause the target service to crash.

Versions prior to R.11.22 on the following models are affected:

J9085A ProCurve Switch 2610-24
J9088A ProCurve Switch 2610-48
J9086A ProCurve Switch 2610-24/12PWR
J9087A ProCurve Switch 2610-24-PWR
J9089A ProCurve Switch 2610-48-PWR
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (R.11.22).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://h20000.www2.hp.com/bizsupport/TechSupport/Document.jsp?objectID=c02436045

Title: HP ProCurve 2610 Switch Unspecified Flaw in the In-band Agent Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Version(s): 2610 Series (certain models); releases prior to R.11.30
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the HP ProCurve 2610 Switch.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can exploit an unspecified flaw in the In-band Agent.

Releases prior to R.11.30 on the following devices are affected:

J9085A ProCurve Switch 2610-24
J9088A ProCurve Switch 2610-48
J9086A ProCurve Switch 2610-24/12PWR
J9087A ProCurve Switch 2610-24-PWR
J9089A ProCurve Switch 2610-48-PWR
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (R.11.30).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://h20000.www2.hp.com/bizsupport/TechSupport/Document.jsp?objectID=c02436043

Title: HP ProCurve 1800 Switch Discloses Potentially Sensitive Information to Remote Users via SNMP
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP ProCurve Switch.  A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
A remote user can send a specially crafted request via SNMP to obtain potentially sensitive information.

The following versions are affected:

HP ProCurve Switch 1800-24G (J9028A/B) Software Releases PB.03.02 or earlier
HP ProCurve Switch 1800-8G (J9029A) Software Releases PA.03.02 or earlier
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix:

HP ProCurve Switch 1800-24G (J9028A/B) Software Release PB.03.04
HP ProCurve Switch 1800-8G (J9029A) Software Release PA.03.04

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://h20000.www2.hp.com/bizsupport/TechSupport/Document.jsp?objectID=c02436028

Title: F5 FirePass Input Validation Flaw in Pre-Logon Sequence Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 FirePass.  A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The device does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input as part of the pre-logon sequence.  A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the F5 FirePass device and will run in the security context of that site.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote user can also exploit a pre-logon sequence flaw to spoof tokens.  The impact was not specified.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the F5 FirePass device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (SOL11795, SOL11797).

The vendor's advisories are available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/11000/700/sol11795.html
https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/11000/700/sol11797.html

Title: Cisco Industrial Ethernet 3000 Series Switch Default SNMP Credentials Let Remote Users Access the Device
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Industrial Ethernet 3000 Series Switch.  A remote user can access the device.
The device uses common hard-coded SNMP community names ("public" and "private") for both read and write SNMP access.

Cisco Industrial Ethernet 3000 devices running IOS Software release 12.2(52)SE or 12.2(52)SE1 are affected.

If the SNMP community names are removed, the hard-coded community names are reapplied to the running configuration when the device reloads.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtf25589 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access and gain full control of the target device.
Solution:
The vendor has developed a fix (12.2(55)SE), to be available in August 2010.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20100707-snmp.shtml

Title: Cisco Application Control Engine Newline Processing Flaw May Let Remote Users Modify HTTP Headers
Version(s): ACE 4710 - Version A3(2.5) build 3.0(0)A3(2.5), possibly other version
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Application Control Engine.  A remote user may be able to modify HTTP headers added by the target device.
HTTP newline sequences are not properly interpreted.  A remote user can supply specially crafted newline sequences to cause the target device to fail to insert the "ClientCert" header values.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCTA04885 to this vulnerability.

The vendor was notified on June 5, 2009.

George D. Gal of Virtual Security Research reported this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.vsecurity.com/resources/advisory/20100702-1/
Impact': A remote user may be able to modify HTTP headers added by the target device.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco Content Services Switch HTTP and ClientCert Headers Can Be Spoofed or Modified By Remote USers
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in the Cisco Content Services Switch.  A remote user may be able to spoof a target user's identity.
A remote user can supply a specially crafted "ClientCert" HTTP header that will be passed on to the target endpoint [CVE-2010-1575].  On an endpoint application that relies on the target device to authenticate clients, a remote user may be able to spoof a user's identity.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCSZ04690 to this vulnerability.

HTTP newline sequences are not properly interpreted [CVE-2010-1576].  A remote user can supply specially crafted newline sequences to cause the target device to fail to properly insert "ClientCert" header values.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCTA04885 to this vulnerability.

The vendor was notified on June 5, 2009.

George D. Gal of Virtual Security Research reported this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.vsecurity.com/resources/advisory/20100702-1/
Impact': A remote user may be able to spoof a user's identity.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: D-Link DAP-1160 Router Lets Remote Users Modify the Configuration
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the D-Link DAP-1160 Router.  A remote user can modify the configuration of the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted UDP packets to the dccd daemon on UPD port 2003 to modify several device parameters, including the SSID, wifi keys, and passwords.  A remote user can also cause the target device to reboot.

Cristofaro Mune of icysilence.org reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can obtain and modify configuration parameters on the target system.

A remote user can cause the target device to reboot.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco PGW Softswitch Multiple SIP and MGCP Flaws Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco PGW Softswitch.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Several vulnerabilities exist in the processing of Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) or Media Gateway Control Protocol (MGCP) messages.

A remote user can exhaust all available TCP connections to cause the device to be unable to establish new SIP, HTTP, SSH, or telnet connections [CVE-2010-1565].  An administrator must reboot the system to return the system to normal operations.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsk13561 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted MGCP packet to cause the target device to crash [CVE-2010-0601].  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsl39126 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted SIP packet to cause the target device to crash [CVE-2010-0602].  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsk32606 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted session attribute to cause the target device to crash [CVE-2010-0603].  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsk40030 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can cause the target device to crash [CVE-2010-0604].  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsk38165 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted overly long message to cause the target device to crash [CVE-2010-1561].  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsk44115 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted Contact Header value to cause the target device to crash [CVE-2010-1562].  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsj98521 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted header to cause the target device to crash [CVE-2010-1563].  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsk04588 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted SIP header to cause the target device to crash [CVE-2010-1567].  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsz13590 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target device to crash.

A remote user can prevent the device from accepting additional connections.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (9.8(1)S5).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20100512-pgw.shtml

Title: Apple AirPort Base Station Lets Remote Users Access Restricted Networks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in AirPort Base Station.  A remote user can connect to a restricted network.
When a network extender is used, a remote user can bypass the MAC address access control list and connect to a restricted network.

Guido Lamberty reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can connect to a restricted network.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (AirPort Base Station Update 2010-001), available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

The manual download is named AirPort Utility 5.5.1.

AirPort Utility for Mac OS X
The download file is named: AirPortUtility551.dmg
Its SHA-1 digest is: 542636fb7d538795cf18db6aa4453c4bcb570c19

AirPort Utility for Windows 7, Vista or XP
The download file is named: AirPortSetup.exe
Its SHA-1 digest is: a18af3cd329ab3adb31c794ede1a408b4f861968

The vendor's advisory will be available at:

http://support.apple.com/kb/HT1222

Title: Cisco IOS Unified CME or Unified SRST SCCP Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS configured for Cisco Unified Communications Manager Express.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user with a registered phone IP address can send specially crafted Skinny Call Control Protocol (SCCP) messages to cause the target device to reload.

Cisco IOS devices configured for Cisco Unified Communications Manager Express (CME) or Cisco Unified Survivable Remote Site Telephony (SRST) operation are affected.

Cisco Unified Communications 500 Series devices are also affected.

Cisco IOS XR is not affected.

Cisco IOS XE is not affected.

Cisco Unified Communications Manager is not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug IDs CSCsz48614 and CSCsz49741 to these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20100324-cucme.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS SIP Processing Flaws Let Remote Users Deny Service and Potentially Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS in the processing of Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) packets.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target device.
A remote user can send specially crafted SIP data to cause the target device to reload or execute arbitrary code.

Only devices with SIP voice services enabled are affected.

Cisco Unified Border Element images are also affected.

The SIP Application Layer Gateway (ALG) used by the Cisco IOS NAT and firewall features of Cisco IOS is not affected.

Cisco IOS XE and IOS XR are not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsz48680, CSCsz89904, and CSCtb93416 to these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20100324-sip.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS TCP Option Processing Error Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a TCP segment as part of the TCP session establishment phase containing specially crafted TCP options to cause the target device to hang or reload.

Systems with any of the following configuration items may be affected:

  * A specific TCP window size
  * TCP path MTU discovery (PMTUD)
  * Stateful Network Address Translation (SNAT) with TCP as the transport protocol

Cisco IOS XR is not affected.

Cisco IOS XE is not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsz75186 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to hang or reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20100324-tcp.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS H.323 Processing Flaws Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted H.323 messages to TCP port 1720 to create an interface queue wedge, causing the packets to remain in the queue.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCta19962 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted H.323 messages to TCP port 1720 to trigger a memory leak and cause the target device to reload.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtb93855 to this vulnerability.

Only devices configured to process H.323 messages are affected by these vulnerabilities [not the default configuration].
Impact': A remote user can cause the target interface to be blocked (queue wedge) or cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20100324-h323.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS IKE Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Version(s): Only 7200 Series and 7301 devices running VAM2+
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted Internet Key Exchange (IKE) packet to cause the target device to reload.

Only Cisco 7200 Series and Cisco 7301 routers running Cisco IOS software with a VPN Acceleration Module 2+ (VAM2+) installed are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtb13491 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20100324-ipsec.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS MPLS LDP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted Label Distribution Protocol (LDP) packet to a target device that is configured for Multiprotocol Label Switching (MPLS) and that has support for LDP to cause the target device to reload.

Systems configured with either LDP or Tag Distribution Protocol (TDP) are affected.

Cisco IOS, IOS XE, and IOS XR are affected.

Cisco IOS XR devices running software prior to version 3.5.2 are affected.

On Cisco IOS XR devices, the remote user can cause the target device to restart the mpls_ldp process.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsz45567 (for Cisco IOS and Cisco IOS XE) and CSCsj25893 (Cisco IOS XR) to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20100324-ldp.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS Skinny NAT Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted Skinny Client Control Protocol (SCCP) messages to a device that is configured with Network Address Translation (NAT) SCCP Fragmentation Support enabled to cause the target device to reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsy09250 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20100324-sccp.shtml

Title: Blue Coat ProxySG Protocol Flaw in SSL Renegotiation Lets Remote Users Conduct Man-in-the-Middle Attacks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Blue Coat ProxySG.  A remote user can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack on SSL session renegotiation.
A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can exploit a flaw in the underlying SSL/TLS protocol to inject arbitrary plain text into the exchange between the client and the server, with the arbitrary data as a prefix to the session.

The vulnerability resides in the TLS 1.0 or later and SSLv3 protocols.

Marsh Ray of PhoneFactor and Martin Rex independently reported this vulnerability.

[Editor's note: The flaw resides in the protocol and not in the protocol implementation. Some vendors are implementing a temporary workaround that prohibits session renegotiation until the protocol itself can be modified. Several protocol implementations are affected, including OpenSSL, GnuTLS, Network Security Services, and Java Secure Socket Extension.]
Impact': A remote user can with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can inject arbitrary plain text data into the exchange, preceding the session data.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://kb.bluecoat.com/index?page=content&id=SA44

Title: F5 BIG-IP TCP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in BIG-IP.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted TCP data to cause the target service to consume all available resources.

Outpost24 reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume all available resources on the target device.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (10.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/10000/500/sol10509.html

Title: F5 FirePass TCP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 FirePass.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted TCP data to cause the target service to consume all available resources.

Outpost24 reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can consume all available resources on the target device.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/10000/500/sol10509.html

Title: Cisco IOS XR SSH Server Memory Consumption Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted SSH version 2 packet to cause a child SSH connection handler process to crash, consuming excessive memory resources.  This may affect system stability.

Cisco IOS and IOS XE are not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCsu10574 to this vulnerability.

Cisco IOS XR versions 3.6.2, 3.6.3, 3.7.1, 3.7.2, 3.8.x, and 3.9.x are not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause excessive memory consumption on the target system, which may result in system instability.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20100120-xr-ssh.shtml

Title: Novatel Wireless MiFi Flaws Disclose the Configuration and Permit Cross-Site Request Forgery Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Novatel Wireless MiFi.  A remote user can obtain the device configuration.  A remote user can conduct cross-site request forgery attacks.
A remote user can obtain configuration data from the target device.  A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

http://192.168.1.1/config.xml.sav

A remote user can commit configuration changes without authenticating.

Several scripts do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input and do not validate user-supplied requests.  A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code or commands to be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the site running the Novatel Wireless MiFi software and will run in the security context of that site.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The original advisoris are available at:

http://evilpacket.net/2010/jan/14/mifi-geopwn/
http://twitter.com/aramosf/status/7829258682
http://www.securitybydefault.com/2010/01/vulnerabilidad-en-modemrouter-3g.html

Adam Baldwin and Alejandro Ramos reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Novatel Wireless MiFi software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote user can commit configuration changes without authenticating.

A remote user can obtain the configuration data.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: JUNOS TCP Option Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in JUNOS.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a single TCP packet with a specially crafted TCP field option value to a listening port on the target device to cause the target device to crash.

[Editor's note: Juniper no longer makes vulnerability reports public.]
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued an advisory, available to customers.  See vendor bulletin number PSN-2010-01-623.

Builds dated January 28, 2009 and later include the fix.

[Editor's note:  The vulnerability was corrected about a year ago but apparently was not considered to be security relevant at the time.  The security relevance was just recently identified.]

Title: (F5 Issues Fix for BIG-IP) NTP Mode 7 Packet Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in ntp.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  F5 BIG-IP is affected.
A remote user can send a specially crafted NTP packet to create a packet reply loop between two target ntpd servers.  This may consume excessive CPU and disk resources on the target system.

Robin Park and Dmitri Vinokurov reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause excessive CPU and disk space consumption on the target servers.
Solution:
F5 has issued a fix for BIG-IP.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/10000/900/sol10905.html

Title: BIG-IP ASM and PSM bd Daemon Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in BIG-IP.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to the BIG-IP Application Security Manager (ASM) and Protocol Security Manager (PSM) bd daemon to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target service.

The following product versions are affected:

    * BIG-IP ASM versions 9.4.4 - 9.4.7
    * BIG-IP ASM versions 10.0.0 - 10.0.1
    * BIG-IP PSM versions 9.4.5 - 9.4.7
    * BIG-IP PSM versions 10.0.0 - 10.0.1 

The vendor assigned issue tracking number CR126690 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (9.4.8).

The vendor has also issued the following hotfixes.

    * Hotfix-BIGIP-9.4.6-425.0-HF3 issued for BIG-IP version 9.4.6
    * Hotfix-BIGIP-9.4.7-333.0-HF2 issued for BIG-IP version 9.4.7
    * Hotfix-BIGIP-10.0.0-5519.0-HF3 issued for BIG-IP version 10.0.0
    * Hotfix-BIGIP-10.0.1-354.0-HF2 issued for BIG-IP version 10.0.1

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/10000/400/sol10417.html

Title: Cisco ONS Protocol Flaw in SSL Renegotiation May Let Remote Users Conduct Man-in-the-Middle Attacks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ONS 15500 series systems.  A remote user can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack on SSL session renegotiation.
A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can exploit a flaw in the underlying SSL/TLS protocol to inject arbitrary plain text into the exchange between the client and the server, with the arbitrary data as a prefix to the session.

The vulnerability resides in the TLS 1.0 or later and SSLv3 protocols.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtd11877 to this vulnerability.

Marsh Ray of PhoneFactor and Martin Rex independently reported this vulnerability.

[Editor's note:  The flaw resides in the protocol and not in the protocol implementation.  Some vendors are implementing a temporary workaround that prohibits session renegotiation until the protocol itself can be modified.  Several protocol implementations are affected, including OpenSSL, GnuTLS, Network Security Services, and Java Secure Socket Extension.]
Impact': A remote user can with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can inject arbitrary plain text data into the exchange, preceding the session data.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20091109-tls.shtml

Title: Cisco Content Switching Module Protocol Flaw in SSL Renegotiation May Let Remote Users Conduct Man-in-the-Middle Attacks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Cisco Content Switching Module (CSM).  A remote user can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack on SSL session renegotiation.
A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can exploit a flaw in the underlying SSL/TLS protocol to inject arbitrary plain text into the exchange between the client and the server, with the arbitrary data as a prefix to the session.

The vulnerability resides in the TLS 1.0 or later and SSLv3 protocols.

Marsh Ray of PhoneFactor and Martin Rex independently reported this vulnerability.

[Editor's note:  The flaw resides in the protocol and not in the protocol implementation.  Some vendors are implementing a temporary workaround that prohibits session renegotiation until the protocol itself can be modified.  Several protocol implementations are affected, including OpenSSL, GnuTLS, Network Security Services, and Java Secure Socket Extension.]
Impact': A remote user can with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can inject arbitrary plain text data into the exchange, preceding the session data.
