http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20091109-tls.shtml

Title: Content Services Switch Protocol Flaw in SSL Renegotiation May Let Remote Users Conduct Man-in-the-Middle Attacks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Content Services Switch (CSS) 11500 Series devices.  A remote user can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack on SSL session renegotiation.
A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can exploit a flaw in the underlying SSL/TLS protocol to inject arbitrary plain text into the exchange between the client and the server, with the arbitrary data as a prefix to the session.

The vulnerability resides in the TLS 1.0 or later and SSLv3 protocols.

Marsh Ray of PhoneFactor and Martin Rex independently reported this vulnerability.

Some vendors are implementing a temporary workaround that prohibits session renegotiation until the protocol itself can be modified.  Several protocol implementations are affected, including OpenSSL, GnuTLS, Network Security Services, and Java Secure Socket Extension.]

As a workaround, Cisco indicates that the client authentication feature can be enabled as mitigation/solution.  Additional information about this workaround is included in their advisory. 

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20091109-tls.shtml

Title: Cisco NX-OS Protocol Flaw in SSL Renegotiation May Let Remote Users Conduct Man-in-the-Middle Attacks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS.  A remote user can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack on SSL session renegotiation.
A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can exploit a flaw in the underlying SSL/TLS protocol to inject arbitrary plain text into the exchange between the client and the server, with the arbitrary data as a prefix to the session.

A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can exploit a flaw in the underlying SSL/TLS protocol to inject arbitrary plain text into the exchange between the client and the server, with the arbitrary data as a prefix to the session.

The vulnerability resides in the TLS 1.0 or later and SSLv3 protocols.

Marsh Ray of PhoneFactor and Martin Rex independently reported this vulnerability.

[Editor's note:  The flaw resides in the protocol and not in the protocol implementation.  Some vendors are implementing a temporary workaround that prohibits session renegotiation until the protocol itself can be modified.  Several protocol implementations are affected, including OpenSSL, GnuTLS, Network Security Services, and Java Secure Socket Extension.]
Impact': A remote user can with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can inject arbitrary plain text data into the exchange, preceding the session data.

Title: Cisco IOS Protocol Flaw in SSL Renegotiation May Let Remote Users Conduct Man-in-the-Middle Attacks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS.  A remote user can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack on SSL session renegotiation.
A remote user with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can exploit a flaw in the underlying SSL/TLS protocol to inject arbitrary plain text into the exchange between the client and the server, with the arbitrary data as a prefix to the session.

The vulnerability resides in the TLS 1.0 or later and SSLv3 protocols.

The specific impact of this protocol flaw depends on the application using SSL/TLS.

Cisco IOS is affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCtd00658 (for IOS and IOS-XE) and CSCtd02658 (for IOS XR) to this vulnerability.

The following Cisco products are also affected [separate Alerts will be issued for each affected product]:

Several protocol implementations are affected, including OpenSSL, GnuTLS, Network Security Services, and Java Secure Socket Extension.]
Impact': A remote user can with the ability to conduct a man-in-the-middle attack can inject arbitrary plain text data into the exchange, preceding the session data.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20091109-tls.shtml

Title: 2Wire Gateway Can Be Crashed By Remote Users Via a Specially Crafted XLST Request
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in 2Wire Gateway.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can submit a specially crafted HTTP request to the remote management interface to cause the target device to reboot.

A demonstration exploit request is provided:

https://[target]:50001/xslt?page=%0d%0a

The vendor was notified on September 9, 2009.

hkm reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reboot.
Solution: The vendor has reportedly issued a fix.

Title: Aruba Access Point 802.11 Association Request Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Aruba Access Points.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user on the wireless network can send a specially crafted 802.11 Association Request frame to cause the target device to crash.  The device will automatically restart.

ArubaOS 2.5 is not affected.
Impact': A remote user on the wireless network can cause the target AP device to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

- - - - 3.3.1.30
- - - - 3.3.2.18
- - - - RN 3.1.1
- - - - 3.4.0.3
- - - - 3.3.2.14-FIPS

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.arubanetworks.com/support/alerts/aid-102609.asc

Title: (Blue Coat Issues Advisory for ProxySG) Various TCP Stack Implementations Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in various TCP stack implementations.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  Blue Coat ProxySG is affected.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause denial of service conditions on the target TCP connection queue.

Published reports indicate that a TCP connection must be established with the target system to exploit these vulnerabilities and that the vulnerabilities are based on weaknesses in the TCP protocol.

Robert E. Lee and Jack Louis of Outpost24 reported these vulnerabilities.

The vulnerabilities were publicly referenced in August 2008 in a blog posting:

http://blog.robertlee.name/2008/08/updates.html

CERT-FI is coordinating with affected vendors.

The CERT-FI advisory is available at:

https://www.cert.fi/haavoittuvuudet/2008/tcp-vulnerabilities.html

[Editor's note:  This Alert is a placeholder to document the overall vendor community investigation of these vulnerabilities.  As vendors and researchers confirm which specific products are affected, separate Alerts will be issued for each affected product.]
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
Blue Coat has issued an advisory for Blue Coat ProxySG, which is affected by this vulnerability.

The Blue Coat advisory is available at:

https://kb.bluecoat.com/index?page=content&id=SA37

Title: 3Com OfficeConnect Router Default User Accounts Let Remote Users Execute Commands
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the 3Com OfficeConnect Router.  A remote user can execute commands on the target device.
A remote user can connect to the SSH or Telnet interface and use several common, built-in accounts and passwords to access the system.

The following user accounts and passwords can be exploited:

   support:support
   user:5
   nobody:admin

Andrea Fabrizi reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute commands on the target device.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: JUNOS J-Web Input Validation Holes Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in JUNOS J-Web.  A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
Several scripts do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input.  A remote user can create a specially crafted URL or POST request that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the site running the J-Web software and will run in the security context of that site.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

http://[target]/"<script>alert(1)</script>

The Host parameter in the pinghost function is affected.

The Host parameter in the traceroute function is affected.

The probe-limit parameter in the configuration function is affected.

The wizard_ids and pager-new-identifier parameters in the configuration function are affected.

The os-physical-interface-name parameter in the configuration function is affected.

The wizard-args and wizard-ids parameters in the configuration function are affected.

The username and fullname parameters in the configuration function are affected.

The certname and certbody parameters in the configuration function are affected.

The 'exec' and 'scripter.php' scripts are affected.

The 'm[]' parameter is affected in several functions.

Several SNMP parameters in the configuration function are affected.

The vendor was notified on July 31, 2009.

The original advisories are available at:

http://www.procheckup.com/vulnerability_manager/vulnerabilities/pr09-08
http://www.procheckup.com/vulnerability_manager/vulnerabilities/pr09-09
http://www.procheckup.com/vulnerability_manager/vulnerabilities/pr09-10

Amir Azam and Richard Brain of ProCheckUp Ltd reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the J-Web software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco IOS Authentication Proxy Race Condition Lets Remote Users Bypass Access Controls
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS.  A remote user can bypass access controls.
On IOS devices configured with Authentication Proxy for HTTP(S), Web Authentication, or the consent feature, a remote user can trigger a race condition to bypass the authentication proxy server or the consent web page and access the requested resource.

Systems are affected if at least one valid authenticated session or accepted consent session exists.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsy15227 to this vulnerability.

The Firewall Authentication Proxy for FTP and Telnet Sessions is not affected.
Impact': A remote user can access ostensibly protected network resources.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090923-auth-proxy.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS IKE Resource Exhaustion Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
On IOS devices configured for Internet Key Exchange (IKE) protocol and certificate based authentication, a remote user can consume all available Phase 1 security associations (SA) and prevent new IPsec sessions from being established.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsy07555 and CSCee72997 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause prevent new IPsec sessions from being established.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090923-ipsec.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS Object Groups for ACLs Lets Remote Users Bypass Access Controls
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS Object Groups for ACLs.  A remote user can bypass access controls.
On IOS devices configured with Object Groups for access control lists (ACLs), a remote user can bypass access control policies to access hosts and networks that are ostensibly protected by the device.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsx07114, CSCsu70214, CSCsw47076, CSCsv48603, CSCsy54122, and CSCsu50252 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass access controls to access hosts and networks ostensibly protected by the target device.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090923-acl.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS H.323, SIP, NTP, Tunneling, and Encrypted Packet Processing Flaws Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted H.323 data to TCP port 1720 to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2009-2866].  Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCsz38104 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted series of SIP messages to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2009-2870].  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsx25880 to this vulnerability.  Only devices configured to process SIP messages with the Cisco Unified Border Element feature are affected.

A remote user can send a specially crafted encryption packets to TCP port 22 or 443 to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2009-2871].  Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCsq24002 to this vulnerability.  The vulnerability can also be exploited on devices configured for IKE encrypted nonces by sending a specially crafted UDP packet on port 500 or 4500 (if configured for NAT Traversal).

On IOS devices configured for GRE, IPinIP, Generic Packet Tunneling in IPv6, or IPv6 over IP tunnels tunnels and Cisco Express Forwarding, a remote user can send a specially crafted packet to cause the target device to reload when switching the packet [CVE-2009-2872, CVE-2009-2873].  MVPN configurations are not affected.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsh97579, CSCsq31776, and CSCsx70889 to this vulnerability.

On IOS devices supporting NTPv4, a remote user can send a specially crafted NTP packet to cause the target device to crash [CVE-2009-2869].  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsu24505 and CSCsv75948 to this vulnerability.

On IOS devices configured with Cisco IOS Zone-Based Policy Firewall SIP inspection, a remote user can send a specially crafted SIP transit packet to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2009-2867].  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsr18691 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisories are available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090923-h323.shtml
http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090923-sip.shtml
http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090923-tls.shtml
http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090923-ios-fw.shtml
http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090923-ntp.shtml
http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090923-tunnels.shtml

Title: (Cisco Issues Fix for NX-OS) Various TCP Stack Implementations Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in various TCP stack implementations.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  Multiple vendors and products are affected.  Cisco NX-OS is affected.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause denial of service conditions on the target TCP connection queue.

Published reports indicate that a TCP connection must be established with the target system to exploit these vulnerabilities and that the vulnerabilities are based on weaknesses in the TCP protocol.

Robert E. Lee and Jack Louis of Outpost24 reported these vulnerabilities.

The vulnerabilities were publicly referenced in August 2008 in a blog posting:

http://blog.robertlee.name/2008/08/updates.html

CERT-FI is coordinating with affected vendors.

The CERT-FI advisory is available at:

https://www.cert.fi/haavoittuvuudet/2008/tcp-vulnerabilities.html

[Editor's note:  This Alert is a placeholder to document the overall vendor community investigation of these vulnerabilities.  As vendors and researchers confirm which specific products are affected, separate Alerts will be issued for each affected product.]
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
Cisco has released a fix (4.0(1a)N2(1) for Nexus 5000, 4.1(4) for Nexus 7000) for NX-OS, which is affected by this vulnerability. Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsv08325 (for Nexus 5000) and Cisco Bug ID CSCsv08579 (for Nexus 7000) to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090908-tcp24.shtml

Title: (Cisco Issues Fix for CatOS) Various TCP Stack Implementations Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in various TCP stack implementations.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  Multiple vendors and products are affected.  Cisco CatOS is affected.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause denial of service conditions on the target TCP connection queue.

Published reports indicate that a TCP connection must be established with the target system to exploit these vulnerabilities and that the vulnerabilities are based on weaknesses in the TCP protocol.

Robert E. Lee and Jack Louis of Outpost24 reported these vulnerabilities.

The vulnerabilities were publicly referenced in August 2008 in a blog posting:

http://blog.robertlee.name/2008/08/updates.html

CERT-FI is coordinating with affected vendors.

The CERT-FI advisory is available at:

https://www.cert.fi/haavoittuvuudet/2008/tcp-vulnerabilities.html

[Editor's note:  This Alert is a placeholder to document the overall vendor community investigation of these vulnerabilities.  As vendors and researchers confirm which specific products are affected, separate Alerts will be issued for each affected product.]
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
Cisco has released a fix (7.6(24a), 8.7(2a)) for CatOS, which is affected by this vulnerability.

All CatOS versions are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsv66169 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090908-tcp24.shtml

Title: (Cisco Issues Fix for IOS) Various TCP Stack Implementations Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in various TCP stack implementations.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  Multiple vendors and products are affected.  Cisco IOS is affected.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause denial of service conditions on the target TCP connection queue.

Published reports indicate that a TCP connection must be established with the target system to exploit these vulnerabilities and that the vulnerabilities are based on weaknesses in the TCP protocol.

Robert E. Lee and Jack Louis of Outpost24 reported these vulnerabilities.

The vulnerabilities were publicly referenced in August 2008 in a blog posting:

http://blog.robertlee.name/2008/08/updates.html

CERT-FI is coordinating with affected vendors.

The CERT-FI advisory is available at:

https://www.cert.fi/haavoittuvuudet/2008/tcp-vulnerabilities.html

[Editor's note:  This Alert is a placeholder to document the overall vendor community investigation of these vulnerabilities.  As vendors and researchers confirm which specific products are affected, separate Alerts will be issued for each affected product.]
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
Cisco has released a fix for IOS, which is affected by this vulnerability.  All IOS releases are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsv04836 to this vulnerability.

A patch matrix is available in the Cisco advisory.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090908-tcp24.shtml

Title: Cisco NX-OS TCP Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco NX-OS.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specific sequence of specially crafted TCP packets to cause connections to get stuck in the FINWAIT1 state. This can be exploited to prevent network connections.

Cisco NX-OS on Nexus 5000 platforms is affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsv08059 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Nexus 5000 4.0(1a)N2(1)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090908-tcp24.shtml

Title: Linksys WRT54GL Router Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Linksys WRT54GL Router.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target service.

The vendor has been notified.

This vulnerability was reported in the VulnDisco version 8.10 release [July 13, 2009].
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: D-Link DIR-400 Router Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the D-Link DIR-400 Router.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target service.

This vulnerability was reported in the VulnDisco version 8.10 release [July 13, 2009].
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: ASUS WL-500W Router Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the ASUS WL-500W Router.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target service.

An additional remote vulnerability exists.  The impact was not specified.

This vulnerability was reported in the VulnDisco version 8.10 release [July 13, 2009].
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: ASUS Router Unspecified Flaw Has Unspecified Impact
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in an ASUS Router.  A remote user can exploit this flaw.  The impact was not specified.
No details were provided.

This vulnerability was reported in the VulnDisco version 8.11 release.
Impact': The impact was not specified.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco Access Points Disclose Potentially Sensitive Information and May Let Remote Users Hijack APs
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Access Points.  A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.  A remote user may be able to hijack access points.
Some Cisco Access Points (APs) transmit unencrypted multicast data frames that include the MAC address and IP address of the wireless controller that the AP is connected to and AP configuration data.  A remote user monitoring the wireless network can obtain this potentially sensitive information.

When the Cisco Over-the-Air-Provisioning (OTAP) feature is enabled, a remote user can inject remote radio management (RRM) packets to cause a non-configured AP that is starting up to connect to an arbitrary wireless controller. 

Cisco Lightweight Wireless Access Point 1100 and 1200 Series devices are affected by this vulnerability.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtb56664 to this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.airmagnet.com/assets/AM_Technote_SkyJack_082509.pdf

The AirMagnet Intrusion Research Team reported this vulnerability.

[Editor's note:  Cisco has determined this to be a "denial of service" vulnerability because the target AP cannot connect to valid network resources.  Cisco indicates that wireless clients will not be able to associate to attacker-controlled APs.]
Impact':
A remote user monitoring the wireless network can obtain potentially sensitive network information.

A remote user may be able to hijack an arbitrary access point.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/viewAlert.x?alertId=18919

Title: Cisco IOS XR BGP Update Processing Flaws Let Remote BGP Peers Deny Service
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS XR.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted (long) BGP update message to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2009-1154].

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtb05382 to this vulnerability.

If the Cisco IOS XR BGP process is configured to prepend a large number of AS Numbers to the AS path, the BGP process will crash [CVE-2009-2056].

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtb12726 to this vulnerability.

[Editor's note:  These two vulnerabilities and the previously reported IOS XR BGP vulnerability (Alert ID 1022739; CVE-2009-2055) have been combined under Cisco Bug ID CSCtb18562.]
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to crash and reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090818-bgp.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS XR BGP Update Processing Flaw Lets Remote BGP Peers Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote router can send a Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) route update with a specially crafted BGP Update message attribute to cause the target router to reset BGP peering sessions from the BGP peer.

The peering session will flap until the remote user stops sending the attribute.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCtb42995 to this vulnerability.

[Editor's note:  This vulnerability and the subsequently reported IOS XR BGP vulnerabilities (Alert ID 1022756; CVE-2009-1154 and CVE-2009-2056) have been combined under Cisco Bug ID CSCtb18562.]
Impact': A remote user can cause the BGP peering sessions to be reset.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.  The vendor plans to issue a fix.

Some workarounds are described in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090818-bgp.shtml

[Editor's note:  The vendor is currently uploading SMUs to their web site and will reissue their advisory when they are available for download.]

Title: Cisco IOS 4-Byte ASN Support Bugs in Processing BGP Updates Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) updates to cause the target device to crash.

Systems configured for RFC4893 support ("BGP Support for Four-octet AS Number Space") and BGP routing are affected.

Cisco IOS XR and Cisco IOS NX-OS are not affected.

A 2-byte AS number BGP speaker can send a specially crafted BGP update containing autonomous system (AS) path segments made up of more than one thousand autonomous systems can cause the target device to crash and reload [CVE-2009-1168].

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsy86021 to this vulnerability.

A 2-byte AS number BGP speaker can send a specially crafted BGP update to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2009-2049].

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCta33973 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to crash and reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090729-bgp.shtml

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Lets Remote Users Gain Control of the Target Device
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Cisco Wireless LAN Controller.  A remote user can modify the configuration to gain full control of the target system.
A remote user can submit a specially crafted HTTP or HTTPS request to the administration interface to modify the configuration and tak full control of the target device.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsy44672 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco 1500, 2000, 2100, 4400, 4100, and 4200 Series models are affected.  The Wireless Services Modules (WiSM), WLC Modules for Integrated Services Routers, and Cisco Catalyst 3750G Integrated Wireless LAN Controllers are also affected.

The Cisco Wireless Controller 5500 Series is not affected.

Version 6.0 is not affected.
Impact': A remote user can gain full control of the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (4.2.205.0, 5.2.191.0).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090727-wlc.shtml

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller SSH and Web Interface Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Some vulnerabilities were reported in the Cisco Wireless LAN Controller.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target device to crash.

The Cisco 1500, 2000, 2100, 4400, 4100, and 4200 Series models are affected.  The Wireless Services Modules (WiSM), WLC Modules for Integrated Services Routers, and Cisco Catalyst 3750G Integrated Wireless LAN Controllers are also affected.

The Cisco Wireless Controller 5500 Series is not affected.

A remote user can send specially crafted data to the SSH management port to trigger a memory leak and cause the target device to crash and reload [CVE-2009-1165].  An established TCP connection is not required.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsw40789 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP or HTTPS request to the administration web interface to cause the target device to crash and reload [CVE-2009-1166].

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsy27708 to this vulnerability.  IBM Research reported this vulnerability.

Version 6.0 is not affected by these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to crash and reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (3.2.215.0, 4.2.205.0, 5.1.163.0, 5.2.191.0).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090727-wlc.shtml

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Basic Authentication Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Cisco 4402 Wireless LAN Controller.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted authentication data to the target emweb http daemon to cause the target device to reboot.

Supplying HTTP Basic Authentication data with a username and password each longer than 63 characters to '/screens/frameset.html' can trigger the flaw.

The vendor was notified on January 13, 2009.

A demonstration exploit is provided:

Authorization: Basic
MTIzNDU2Nzg5MDEyMzQ1Njc4OTAxMjM0NTY3ODkwMTIzNDU2Nzg5MDEyMzQ1Njc4OTAxMjM0NTY3ODkwMTIzNDoxMjM0NTY3ODkwMTIzNDU2Nzg5MDEyMzQ1Njc4OTAxMjM0NTY3ODkwMTIzNDU2Nzg5MDEyMzQ1Njc4OTAxMjM0

The vendor has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsx03715 to this vulnerability.

Versions 4.1, 4.1M, 4.2M, and 6.0 are not affected.

Christoph Bott reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (3.2.215.0, 4.2.205.0, 5.2.178.0).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090727-wlc.shtml

Title: DD-WRT Web Interface Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in DD-WRT.  A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target device.
A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by the target user on the internal network, will execute arbitrary commands on the target device.  The code will run with root privileges.

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

http://[target]/cgi-bin/;command_to_execute

The vulnerability can be exploited via Cross-Site Request Forgery attacks.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.milw0rm.com/exploits/9209

gat3way reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create a URL that, when loaded by the target user on the internal network, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a temporary fix, available at:

http://www.dd-wrt.com/dd-wrtv2/down.php?path=downloads%2Fothers%2Feko%2FBrainSlayer-V24-preSP2%2F07-21-09-r12533/

Title: HP ProCurve Threat Management Services Module Lets Remote Users Gain Access and Deny Service
Version(s): HP ProCurve Threat Management Services zl Module (J9155A) vST.1.0.090213 and prior
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in the HP ProCurve Threat Management Services zl Module.  A remote user can gain access to the target system.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
The HP ProCurve Threat Management Services zl Module (J9155A) is affected.

No details were provided.
Impact':
A remote user can gain access to the target system.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (ST.1.0.090603), available at:

http://www.hp.com/rnd/software/network_security.htm

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://h20000.www2.hp.com/bizsupport/TechSupport/Document.jsp?objectID=c01803910

Title: (Apple Issues Fix for iPhone) Apple Safari Bugs Permit Cross-Domain Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Apple Safari.  A remote user can conduct cross-domain scripting attacks.  Apple iPhone is affected.
A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser in the context of another domain or site.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

An event handler can execute a script in the security context of the next web page that is loaded in its window or frame [CVE-2009-1684].  Michal Zalewski of Google Inc. reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can overwrite the 'document.implementation' property of an embedded or parent document served from a different security zone [CVE-2009-1685].  Dean McNamee of Google Inc. reported this vulnerability.

WebKit does not properly determine the security context associated with scripts [CVE-2009-1688].  Adam Barth of UC Berkeley and Collin Jackson of Stanford University reported this vulnerability.

A form submitted to 'about:blank' can synchronously replace the target document's security context, allowing currently-executing scripts to run in the new security context [CVE-2009-1689].  Adam Barth of UC Berkeley and Collin Jackson of Stanford University reported this vulnerability.

A remote user can modify standard JavaScript prototypes of web sites served from a different domain [CVE-2009-1691].

The contents of a frame can be accessed by an HTML document after a page transition has occurred [CVE-2009-1695].  Feng Qian of Google Inc. reported this vulnerability.

A web site can bypass the same-origin policy by issuing an XMLHttpRequest that does not contain an HTTP Host header [CVE-2009-1697].  Per von Zweigbergk reported this vulnerability.

The handling of Location and History objects may permit cross-site scripting attacks [CVE-2009-1702].  Adam Barth and Joel Weinberger of UC Berkeley reported this vulnerability.

A flaw in Web Inspector in the processing of HTML attributes allows a page being inspected to run injected script with elevated privileges and can read the target user's file system [CVE-2009-1714].  Pengsu Cheng of Wuhan University reported this vulnerability.

A flaw in Web Inspector allows a page being inspected to run injected script with elevated privileges and can read the target user's file system [CVE-2009-1715].  Collin Jackson of Stanford University and Adam Barth of UC Berkeley reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with a target site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
Apple has issued a fix for iPhone OS (3.0), which is affected by some of these vulnerabilities.

The Apple advisory will be available at:

http://support.apple.com/kb/HT1222

Title: NETGEAR DG632 Router Discloses File Source Contents to Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the NETGEAR DG632 Router.  A remote user can obtain the source code of some files on the target system.
A remote user can supply a specially crafted request to bypass authentication and view the source code of certain files on the target device.  A remote user can also determine valid directories and file names on the target system.

The vendor was notified on June 12, 2009.

Tom Neaves reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain the source code of some files on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

[Editor's note:  The vendor has noted that the vulnerable product has reached end of life.]

Title: NETGEAR DG632 Router Web Interface Can Be Crashed By Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the NETGEAR DG632 Router.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user on the local network can send a specially crafted HTTP POST request for '/cgi-bin/firmwarecfg' to cause the target web management service to stop responding.  A power reset is required to return the service to normal operation.

A remote user on the WAN interface can exploit this flaw if Remote Management is enabled.

The vendor was notified on June 12, 2009.

Tom Neaves reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target web service.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

[Editor's note:  The vendor has noted that the vulnerable product has reached end of life.]

Title: F5 FirePass Input Validation Flaw in Unspecified Password Fields Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 FirePass.  A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the F5 FirePass device and will run in the security context of that site.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Unspecified password fields are affected.

The vendor was notified on May 14, 2009.

Sjoerd Resink of Fox-IT BV reported this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

https://www.fox-it.com/nl/nieuws-en-events/nieuws/laatste-nieuws/nieuwsartikel/f5-firepass-cross-site-scripting-vulnerability/106
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the F5 FirePass device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Cumulative HotFix-603-3).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/10000/100/sol10143.html

Title: Linksys WAG54G2 Router Lets Remote Authenticated Users Execute Shell Commands
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Linksys WAG54G2 router.  A remote authenticated user can obtain operating system access on the target device.
A remote authenticated administrative user can inject specially crafted text to execute arbitrary shell commands on the target device.

The vendor was notified on March 18, 2009.

The original advisory is available at: 

http://www.securitum.pl/dh/Linksys_WAG54G2_-_escape_to_OS_root

Michal Sajdak of securitum.pl reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can execute arbitrary shell commands on the target device.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco IOS UDP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS in the processing of UDP packets.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted UDP packets to the target device to cause the target interface to become blocked.  A device reload is required to return the interface to normal operations.

Devices running Cisco IOS and Cisco IOS XE with any of the following features are affected:

  * IP Service Level Agreements (SLA) Responder
  * Session Initiation Protocol (SIP)
  * H.323 Annex E Call Signaling Transport
  * Media Gateway Control Protocol (MGCP)

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsk64158 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target interface to stop processing traffic.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090325-udp.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS TCP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS in the processing of TCP packets.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted sequence of TCP packets to cause the target device to reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsr29468 to this vulnerability.

Cisco IOS and Cisco IOS XE devices configured to use any of the following features are affected:

  * Airline Product Set (ALPS)
  * Serial Tunnel Code (STUN) and Block Serial Tunnel Code (BSTUN)
  * Native Client Interface Architecture support (NCIA)
  * Data-link switching (DLSw)
  * Remote Source-Route Bridging (RSRB)
  * Point to Point Tunneling Protocol (PPTP)
  * X.25 for Record Boundary Preservation (RBP)
  * X.25 over TCP (XOT)
  * X.25 Routing

Cisco IOS XR is not affected.  BGP is not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090325-tcp.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS SIP Implementation Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS in the Session Initiation Protocol implementation.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) data to cause the target device to reload.

Devices with SIP voice services enabled are affected.

The SIP Application Layer Gateway (ALG) is not affected.

Cisco IOS XE Software and Cisco IOS XR are not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsu11522 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090325-sip.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS Secure Copy Server Bug Lets Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS in the Secure Copy server implementation.  A remote authenticated user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A local user with an attached command-line interface (CLI) view on a server configured as an SCP server can read and write to arbitrary files on the target device.  This includes the configuration file, which contains passwords and other potentially sensitive information, and the device image.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsv38166 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco IOS SCP server is disabled by default.

CLI views are part of the Cisco IOS Role-Based CLI Access feature, which is disabled by default.

The Cisco IOS SCP client feature is not affected.

Cisco IOS XR is not affected.

Kevin Graham reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090325-scp.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS Mobile IP NAT or Mobile IPv6 Inteface Blocking Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS Mobile IP NAT or Mobile IPv6.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target interface to become blocked.  The system must be restarted to return traffic processing to normal operations.

Specially crafted MIPv6 packets can trigger this flaw [CVE-2009-0633].  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsm97220 to this vulnerability.

Specially crafted ICMP packets can trigger this flaw [CVE-2009-0634].  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCso05337 to this vulnerability.

Devices configured for Mobile IP Network Address Translation (NAT) Traversal or Mobile IPv6 are affected.

Cisco IOS XR is not affected.  Cisco IOS XE is not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target interface to become blocked and stop processing traffic.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090325-mobileip.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS Various IP Socket Processing Flaws Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS in various features.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data via an established TCP session to cause the target service to stop accepting new connections or sessions, consume device memory, or consume excessive CPU resources or cause the target device to reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsm27071 to this vulnerability.

Devices configured to use any of the following features are affected:

  * Cisco Unified Communications Manager Express
  * SIP Gateway Signaling Support Over Transport Layer Security (TLS) Transport
  * Secure Signaling and Media Encryption
  * Blocks Extensible Exchange Protocol (BEEP)
  * Network Admission Control HTTP Authentication Proxy
  * Per-user URL Redirect for EAPoUDP, Dot1x, and MAC Authentication Bypass
  * Distributed Director with HTTP Redirects
  * DNS (TCP mode only)

Cisco IOS XR is not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to stop accepting new connections or sessions, consume device memory, or consume excessive CPU resources or cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090325-ip.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS WebVPN and SSLVPN Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS WebVPN and SSLVPN.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTPS packet to cause the target device to hang or reload [CVE-2009-0626].  Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCsk62253 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted SSLVPN session date to trigger a memory leak on the target device, eventually causing the device to crash [CVE-2009-0628].  Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCsw24700 to this vulnerability.

Devices configured with SSLVPN are affected.

The following products are not affected:

  * Cisco ASA 5500 Series Adaptive Security Appliances
  * Cisco IOS XR Software
  * Cisco IOS XE Software
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to fail to accept SSLVPN connections or crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090325-webvpn.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS Easy VPN Server Cisco Tunneling Control Protocol Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS when configured as an Easy VPN server.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a series of specially crafted TCP packets to cause the target system to run out of memory.  The target Cisco Tunneling Control Protocol (cTCP) service may crash or the target device may crash.

Devices configured for cTCP encapsulation for EZVPN server are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsr16693 and CSCsu21828 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target cTCP service to crash or the target device to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090325-ctcp.shtml

Title: (Blue Coat Issues Fix for ProxySG) OpenSSH SSH v1 CRC Attack Detection Implementation Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in OpenSSH.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  Blue Coat ProxySG is affected.
A remote user can cause the target OpenSSH service to consume excessive CPU resources when SSH protocol version 1 is enabled.

The flaw resides in the CRC attack detection function in the processing of identical blocks.

Tavis Ormandy of the Google Security Team discovered this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target service to consume excessive CPU resources.
Solution:
Blue Coat has issued a fix (4.2.10, 4.3.3, 5.2.6) for ProxySG, which is affected by this vulnerability.

The Blue Coat advisory is available at:

https://hypersonic.bluecoat.com/support/securityadvisories/ssh_server_on_sg

Title: (Apple Issues Fix for AirPort Base Station) FreeBSD ICMPv6 Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the FreeBSD kernel's IPv6 stack.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  Apple AirPort Base Station is affected.
A remote user can send a specially crafted ICMPv6 'Packet Too Big Message' to trigger a kernel panic.

Systems configured to process IPv6 packets that have active IPv6 TCP sockets are affected.

Tom Parker and Bjoern A. Zeeb reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to crash.
Solution:
Apple has released a fix (firmware 7.4.1) for AirPort Base Station, which is affected by this vulnerability.

The Apple advisory is available at:

http://support.apple.com/kb/HT3467

Title: (Apple Issues Fix for AirPort Base Station) FreeBSD IPv6 Neighbor Discovery Protocol Spoofing Bug Lets Remote Users Modify Routing Data in Certain Cases
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the FreeBSD IPv6 Neighbor Discovery Protocol.  A remote user can modify routing data for a target router in certain cases.  Apple AirPort Base Station is affected.
A remote user on a physical network of an IPv6 router can spoof Neighbor Discovery messages to update routing information for a target router on a different physical network adjacent to the IPv6 router.  The remote user can exploit this to deny service or access network traffic from the target router.

David Miles reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can modify routing data for a target router in certain cases to deny service or redirect and access network traffic.
Solution:
Apple has released a fix (firmware 7.4.1) for AirPort Base Station, which is affected by this vulnerability.

The Apple advisory is available at:

http://support.apple.com/kb/HT3467

Title: Cisco 7600 Series Router Session Border Controller Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Version(s): ACE-based SBC module versions prior to 3.0(2)
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco 7600 Series Routers.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to TCP port 2000 on the target Session Border Controller (SBC) to cause the target SBC card to reload.

Only the Cisco SBC module is affected.  The router itself is not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsq18958 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target SBC card to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (SBC version 3.0(2)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090304-sbc.shtml

Title: Blue Coat ProxySG Host Header Processing May Let Remote Users Bypass Security Restrictions
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Blue Coat ProxySG.  A remote user may be able to bypass security restrictions.
When configured in transparent mode, a remote user that can cause the target user's browser to inject a specially crafted HTTP Host header value can cause the ProxySG to connect to the host specified in the Host header.  This can be exploited by the remote user to connect to servers via the ProxySG device.
Impact': A remote user may be able to bypass security restrictions to connect to arbitrary hosts via the ProxySG device.
Solution:
The vendor has described a workaround in their advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://hypersonic.bluecoat.com/support/securityadvisories/ProxySG_in_transparent_deployments

Title: 3Com OfficeConnect Wireless Gateway Discloses Configuration File to Remote Users
Version(s): Model 3CRWE554G72, Hardware version: 3COM_AP51_v01, Software version: 1.2.0 - Nov 14,2006
Description:
Luca Carettoni reported a vulnerability in the 3Com OfficeConnect Wireless Cable/DSL Gateway.  A remote user can obtain sensitive information from the configuration file.
If the "Backup Configuration" system tool has been invoked by the administrator, a remote user can invoke the 'SaveCfgFile.cgi' script to obtain the 'config.bin' system configuration file, which contains configuration information, usernames, passwords, WIFI keys, and other potentially sensitive information.

A remote user on the Internet interface can exploit this flaw if "Remote Administration" has been enabled.

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

http://[target]/SaveCfgFile.cgi

The vendor was notified on December 8, 2008, without response.
Impact': A remote user can obtain the configuration file, which contains configuration information, usernames, passwords, WIFI keys, and other potentially sensitive information.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can invoke a vulnerability scanner to cause the target system to stop processing web authentication or cause the target device to reload [CVE-2009-0058].  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsq44516 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP POST request to the target web authentication 'login.html' page to cause the target device to reload [CVE-2009-0059].  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsm82364 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted IP packets to cause the target device to hang [CVE-2009-0061].  A reboot is required to return the system to normal operations.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCso60979 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco Wireless LAN Controllers (WLCs), Cisco Catalyst 6500 Wireless Services Modules (WiSMs), and Cisco Catalyst 3750 Integrated Wireless LAN Controllers are affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to hang or reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (3.2.215.0, 4.2.176.0, 5.2.157.0).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090204-wlc.shtml

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Lets Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller.  A remote authenticated user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.
A remote authenticated restricted user (i.e., Lobby Admin) can gain full administrative rights on the target system.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsv62283 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco Wireless LAN Controllers (WLCs), Cisco Catalyst 6500 Wireless Services Modules (WiSMs), and Cisco Catalyst 3750 Integrated Wireless LAN Controllers are affected.

Wireless network users are not affected.
Impact': A remote authenticated restricted user can obtain full administrative rights on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (4.2.176.0).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090204-wlc.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS Input Validation Flaw in HTTP Server Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in the Cisco IOS HTTP server.  A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The server does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input.  A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the site running the Cisco IOS HTTP Server software and will run in the security context of that site.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Special characters are not properly escaped.  Special characters in the ping parameter are also not properly escaped.

Systems with the IOS HTTP server or HTTP secure server enabled are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug IDs CSCsi13344 and CSCsr72301 to these vulnerabilities.

Adrian Pastor and Richard J. Brain of ProCheckUp and Nobuhiro Tsuji of NTT Data Security Corporation with co-operation of JPCert reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Cisco IOS HTTP Server software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sr-20090114-http.shtml

Title: Cisco ONS TCP Processing Flaw in Control Cards Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco ONS.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted TCP data stream to the control card to cause the target control card to reload.

The synchronous data channels traversing the switch will drop traffic until the card finishes reloading.  Asynchronous data channels traversing the switch are not affected.

On the Cisco ONS 15600 hardware, if both the active and standby control cards reboot at the same time, the data channels traversing the switch are not affected.

The following models are affected:

  * Cisco ONS 15310-CL and 15310-MA
  * Cisco ONS 15327
  * Cisco ONS 15454 and 15454 SDH
  * Cisco ONS 15600

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCsr41128 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target control card to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (7.0.7, 7.2.3, 8.5.3, 9.0).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20090114-ons.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS VLAN Trunking Protocol Bug Lets Remote Users on the Local Network Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS.  A remote user on the local network can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user on the local network segment can send a specially crafted VLAN Trunking Protocol (VTP) packet to a target switch interface configured to operate as a trunk port to cause the target device to crash and reload or hang.

Systems configured with the VTP operating mode as either "server" or "client" are affected.

Systems configured with the VTP operating mode as "transparent" are not affected.

The vulnerability affects Cisco IOS and Cisco IOS with Ethernet Switch Modules for Cisco 1800/2600/2800/3600/3700/3800 Series Routers.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsv05934 and CSCsv54651 to this vulnerability.

'showrun.lee' reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the local network segment can cause the target device to crash or reload.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor is working on a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sr-20081105-vtp.shtml

Title: Cisco CatOS VLAN Trunking Protocol Bug Lets Remote Users on the Local Network Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco CatOS.  A remote user on the local network can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user on the local network segment can send a specially crafted VLAN Trunking Protocol (VTP) packet to a target switch interface configured to operate as a trunk port to cause the target device to crash and reload or hang.

Systems configured with the VTP operating mode as either "server" or "client" are affected.

Systems configured with the VTP operating mode as "transparent" or "off" or configured with VTP version 3 are not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsv11741 to this vulnerability.

'showrun.lee' reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the local network segment can cause the target device to crash or reload.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor is working on a fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sr-20081105-vtp.shtml

Title: Blue Coat ProxySG Input Validation Hole in ICAP Patience Page Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Blue Coat ProxySG.  A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The ICAP patience page does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input.  A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.

Juan Pablo Lopez Yacubian reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
Solution:
The vendor plans to issue fixed versions (4.2.9, 5.2.5, 5.3.1.7).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.bluecoat.com/support/securityadvisories/icap_patience

Title: Cisco uBR10012 Series Devices Grant SNMP Access to Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco uBR10012 devices.  A remote user can gain control of the target device.
When Cisco uBR10012 series devices are configured for linecard redundancy, a remote user can gain read/write SNMP access to the target device.

Cisco 10000 series devices and other uBR devices are not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCek57932 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain control of the target device.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.  A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080924-ubr.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS MPLS VPN Routing Bug May Send Potentially Sensitive Information to the Wrong VPN
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS in the routing on Multiprotocol Label Switching (MPLS) Virtual Private Networks (VPNs).  A remote user on a VPN may be able to obtain potentially sensitive information.
If extended communities are used with MPLS VPNs, a corrupted route target may be used to forward traffic, causing traffic to leak from one MPLS VPN to another.

Devices configured for MPLS VPNs or VPN Routing and Forwarding Lite (VRF Lite) and using Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) between Customer Edge (CE) and Provider Edge (PE) devices may be affected.

Cisco IOS 12.1 releases are not affected.

The vendor reports that a remote user cannot deterministically trigger this vulnerability.

The vulnerability was introduced by the fix for Cisco bug ID CSCee83237.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCec12299 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on an MPLS VPN may receive misrouted traffic from a different MPLS VPN.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.  A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080924-vpn.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS SIP Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS in the processing of Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) packets.  A remote user can disrupt voice services on the target device or cause the target device to reload.
A remote user can send specially crafted SIP packets to trigger a memory leak [CVE-2008-3799] or cause the target device to reload.

Repeated exploitation of the memory leak vulnerability may disrupt all voice services, even if the device is still running.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCse56800 to the memory leak vulnerability.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsg91306, CSCsl62609, and CSCsk42759 to the device reload vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can disrupt voice services or cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.  A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080924-sip.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS L2TP Management Daemon Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS in the L2TP implementation.  A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
A remote user can send a specially crafted Layer 2 Tunneling Protocol (L2TP) packet to cause the target device to reload.

Devices running the L2TP management daemon process may be affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCsh48879 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.  A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080924-l2tp.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS NAT SCCP Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS in the processing of Skinny Call Control Protocol (SCCP) messages.  A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
A remote user can send a series of specially crafted SCCP messages to cause the target device to reload.

Devices configured with network address translation (NAT) SCCP fragmentation support are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsg22426 and CSCsi17020 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.  A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080924-sccp.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS PIM Processing Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS in the processing of Protocol Independent Multicast (PIM) packets.  A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
A remote user can send a specially crafted PIM packet to cause the target device to reload.

One vulnerability affects IOS devices and the other affects only Cisco 12000 Series (GSR) routers.

Devices configured for PIM may be vulnerable.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsd95616 and CSCsl34355 to these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.  A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080924-multicast.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS 10000, uBR10012, uBR7200 Series IPC Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS on Cisco 10000, uBR10012, and uBR7200 series devices.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to the interprocess communications UDP port 1975 to cause the target device or linecards to reload.

Only Cisco 10000, uBR10012, and uBR7200 series devices are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsg15342 and CSCsh29217 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device or linecards or both to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.  A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080924-ipc.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS Bug in MPLS Forwarding Infrastructure Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS MPLS Forwarding Infrastructure.  A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
A remote user on a local segment can send specially crafted data to an MPLS interface (either directly or via a tunnel interface) to trigger a memory corruption error and cause the target system to reload.

Systems that support Multi Protocol Label Switching (MPLS) Forwarding Infrastructure (MFI) and are configured for MPLS are affected.

The Label Forwarding Information Base (LFIB) implementation is not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsk93241 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.  A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080924-mfi.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS Intrusion Prevention System Bug in 'SERVICE.DNS' Signature Engine Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS in the Intrusion Prevention System.  A remote user can cause the target system to crash or hang.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger IPS signatures on the SERVICE.DNS signature engine and cause the target device to hang or crash.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsq13348 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco IOS Intrusion Detection System (IDS) is not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target system to crash or hang.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.  A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080924-iosips.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS Bug in Terminating SSL Sessions Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS in the processing of SSL sessions.  A remote user can cause the target device to crash.
A remote user can terminate an SSL session with the target device to cause the target device to crash while processing an SSL packet. The packet is not specially crafted.

Devices running SSL-based services are affected.  Services may include:

* HTTP server supporting SSL encryption (HTTPS)
* SSL Virtual Private Network (SSL VPN) also known as AnyConnect VPN
* Open Settlement Protocol (OSP) for Packet Telephony feature

The following releases are affected:

12.4(16)MR, 12.4(16)MR1, 12.4(16)MR2, 12.4(17)

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsj85065 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.  A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080924-ssl.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS Firewall Bug in HTTP Application Inspection Control Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS in the firewall application inspection control function.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP packet through the target device to cause the target device to reload.

Systems configured for IOS firewall Application Inspection Control (AIC) with an HTTP configured application-specific policy are affected.

The vulnerable feature was introduced in release 12.4(9)T.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCsh12480 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.  A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080924-iosfw.shtml

Title: D-Link DIR-100 Router URL Filter Can Be Bypassed By Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the D-Link DIR-100 router.  A remote user can bypass the URL filter.
A remote user can submit a specially crafted URL to bypass the web proxy filter function.  A long URL (such as a valid URL appended with a lengthy, non-existent parameter) can trigger this flaw.

The vendor was notified on July 25, 2008.

Marc Ruef at scip AG reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass the URL filter to access ostensibly blocked web sites.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: 3Com Wireless 8760 Access Point Web Interface Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the 3Com Wireless 8760 Access Point.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP POST request to the web interface of the target 3Com Wireless 8760 Dual Radio 11a/b/g PoE Access Point device to cause the device to crash.

Brandon Shilling and r@b13$ of Digital Defense, Inc. Vulnerability Research Team reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to crash.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Belkin F5D7632-4 Wireless Router Lets Remote Users Bypass Authentication to Access Administrative Functions
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Belkin F5D7632-4 Router.  A remote user can access the administrative interface.
A remote user can send specially crafted HTTP POST requests to access administrative functions without authenticating.

noensr reported this vulnerability.

The original advisory and demonstration exploit is available at:

http://milw0rm.com/exploits/6305
Impact': A remote user can access administrative functions on the router.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Alcatel OmniSwitch Management Web Server Stack Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Alcatel OmniSwitch.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted "Cookie: Session=" header value to trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target service.

The vulnerability resides in the Agranet-Emweb embedded management web server.

The following OmniSwitch versions are affected:

OS7000 Series
OS6600 Series
OS6800 Series
OS6850 Series
OS9000 Series

The vendor was notified on May 22, 2008.

Deral Heiland of www.LayeredDefense.com reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued the following fixes (AoS Releases):

    * 5.4.1.429.R01 and above
    * 5.1.6.463.R02 and above
    * 6.1.3.965.R01 and above
    * 6.1.5.595.R01 and above
    * 6.3.1.966.R01 and above

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www1.alcatel-lucent.com/psirt/statements/2008002/OmniSwitch.htm

Title: Cisco IOS Predictable Source Port Address Translation May Leave DNS Servers Vulnerable to Recent Cache Poisoning Attack
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco PIX Firewall.  A remote user can conduct DNS cache poisoning attacks through the router in certain cases when port address translation is enabled.
The device uses a predictable source port allocation method in certain cases when performing port address translation.  As a result, a DNS server that is ostensibly protected by the firewall may still be vulnerable to the DNS cache poisoning flaw described in CVE-2008-1447 even if patched against that flaw.

The device uses an incremental source port allocation policy if the original source port is already allocated to an existing translation.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsr29691 to this vulnerability.

Network address translation configurations that provide a separate public IP address for each private IP address are not affected.
Impact': A remote user can conduct DNS cache poisoning attacks that may bypass the target DNS vendor's fix.
Solution:
No public information was available at the time of this entry.

[Editor's note:  Cisco has not issued a security advisory for this vulnerability.]

Title: Cisco Content Switching Module Predictable Source Port Address Translation Leaves DNS Servers Vulnerable to Recent Cache Poisoning Attack
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Content Switching Module.  A remote user can conduct DNS cache poisoning attacks through the device in certain cases when port address translation is enabled.
The device uses a predictable source port allocation method when performing port address translation.  As a result, a DNS server that is ostensibly protected by the device may still be vulnerable to the DNS cache poisoning flaw described in CVE-2008-1447 even if patched against that flaw.
