Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsr61220 to this vulnerability.

Network address translation configurations that provide a separate public IP address for each private IP address are not affected.
Impact': A remote user can conduct DNS cache poisoning attacks that may bypass the target DNS vendor's fix.
Solution:
No public information was available at the time of this entry.

[Editor's note:  Cisco has not issued a security advisory for this vulnerability.]

Title: Blue Coat ProxySG DNS Query Port Entropy Weakness Lets Remote Users Spoof the System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Blue Coat ProxySG.  A remote user can spoof the system.
The domain name system (DNS) service does not use sufficiently random UDP sockets to process queries.  A remote user can send specially crafted DNS queries and responses to the target service to spoof responses and insert records into the DNS cache. This may cause traffic to be redirected to arbitrary IP addresses specified by the remote user.

Dan Kaminsky of IOActive reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can spoof the DNS service, causing traffic to be redirected to arbitrary hosts.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (4.2.8.6 GA).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.bluecoat.com/support/security-advisories/dns_cache_poisoning

Title: Juniper JUNOS DNS Query Port Entropy Weakness Lets Remote Users Spoof the System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in JUNOS.  A remote user can spoof the system.
The domain name system (DNS) service does not use sufficiently random UDP sockets to process queries. A remote user can send specially crafted DNS queries and responses to the target service to spoof responses and insert records into the DNS cache. This may cause traffic to be redirected to arbitrary IP addresses specified by the remote user.

J-series routers running JUNOS Enhanced Services Software (junos-jsr) built prior to May 23, 2008 are affected.

Juniper switching products running JUNOS Enhanced Switching Software (junos-ex) built prior to May 23, 2008 are also affected.

Dan Kaminsky of IOActive reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can spoof the DNS service, causing traffic to be redirected to arbitrary hosts.
Solution:
It is unclear if a fix is available or not.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

https://www.juniper.net/alerts/viewalert.jsp?actionBtn=Search&txtAlertNumber=PSN-2008-06-040&viewMode=view

Title: (Cisco Plans to Issue Fix for Cisco ACNS) Cisco IOS DNS Query Port Entropy Weakness Lets Remote Users Spoof the System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS and other Cisco products that provide DNS services.  A remote user can spoof the system.  Cisco Application and Content Networking System (ACNS) is affected.
The domain name system (DNS) service does not use sufficiently random DNS transaction ID values and/or random UDP sockets to process queries. A remote user can send specially crafted DNS queries and responses to the target service to spoof responses and insert records into the DNS cache. This may cause traffic on the target system to be redirected to arbitrary IP addresses specified by the remote user.

Cisco IOS devices that are configured as a DNS server are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCso81854 to this vulnerability.

Cisco Network Registrar, Cisco Application and Content Networking System (ACNS), and the Cisco Global Site Selector (GSS) products are also affected.
Impact': A remote user can spoof the DNS service, causing traffic to be redirected to arbitrary hosts.
Solution:
Cisco plans to issue a fix (5.5.11) for Cisco Application and Content Networking System, to be available in late July 2008.

Cisco ACNS 5.5 software is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/pcgi-bin/tablebuild.pl/acns55

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCsq21930 to this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080708-dns.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS DNS Query Port Entropy Weakness Lets Remote Users Spoof the System
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS and other Cisco products that provide DNS services.  A remote user can spoof the system.
The domain name system (DNS) service does not use sufficiently random DNS transaction ID values and/or random UDP sockets to process queries. A remote user can send specially crafted DNS queries and responses to the target service to spoof responses and insert records into the DNS cache. This may cause traffic on the target system to be redirected to arbitrary IP addresses specified by the remote user.

Cisco IOS devices that are configured as a DNS server are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCso81854 to this vulnerability.

Cisco Network Registrar, Cisco Application and Content Networking System (ACNS), and the Cisco Global Site Selector (GSS) products are also affected.
Impact': A remote user can spoof the DNS service, causing traffic to be redirected to arbitrary hosts.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080708-dns.shtml

Title: (Cisco Issues Advisory for Cisco Wireless LAN Controller) Net-snmp SNMPv3 Authentication Bug Lets Remote Users Bypass Authentication
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Net-snmp.  A remote user can bypass authentication.  Cisco WLC is affected.
A remote user can send an SNMPv3 packet with a specially crafted Hash Message Authentication Code (HMAC) value to bypass the authentication function.  The user can read and modify SNMP objects with the privileges of the target user.

UCD-SNMP is also affected.

SNMPv1 and SNMPv2 are not affected.

Wes Hardaker reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass authentication.
Solution:
On June 20, 2008, Cisco updated their advisory to indicate that Cisco Wireless LAN Controller (WLC) is affected by this vulnerability. Cisco plans to issue a fix for WLC (5.2.x.x).  The fix is to be available in August 2008.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080610-snmpv3.shtml

Title: (Juniper Issues Fix for SRC Modules) Net-snmp SNMPv3 Authentication Bug Lets Remote Users Bypass Authentication
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Net-snmp.  A remote user can bypass authentication.  Juniper's Session and Resource Control (SRC) modules are affected.
A remote user can send an SNMPv3 packet with a specially crafted Hash Message Authentication Code (HMAC) value to bypass the authentication function.  The user can read and modify SNMP objects with the privileges of the target user.

UCD-SNMP is also affected.

SNMPv1 and SNMPv2 are not affected.

Wes Hardaker reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass authentication.
Solution: Juniper Networks Session and Resource Control appliances are affected.  Versions 1.0.0, 1.0.1, or 2.0.0 on C-series appliances are vulnerable.  The vendor has issued a fix, available from the Juniper Networks Customer Support Center.

Title: Linksys WRH54G Router Management Interface Can Be Crashed By Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Linksys WRH54G Router.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP request to the management interface to cause the target service to crash.  A hard reset is required to return the interface to normal operations.

Traffic processing through the device is not affected.

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

dubingyao at gmail dot com reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the management interface to hang.
Solution:
Some reports indicate that version 1.01.04 is not affected.

[Editor's note:  The Cisco/Linksys documentation for driver version 1.01.04 does not mention this vulnerability.]

Title: (Cisco Issues Fix for Cisco MDS) Net-snmp SNMPv3 Authentication Bug Lets Remote Users Bypass Authentication
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Net-snmp.  A remote user can bypass authentication.  Cisco MDS is affected.
A remote user can send an SNMPv3 packet with a specially crafted Hash Message Authentication Code (HMAC) value to bypass the authentication function.  The user can read and modify SNMP objects with the privileges of the target user.

UCD-SNMP is also affected.

SNMPv1 and SNMPv2 are not affected.

Wes Hardaker reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass authentication.
Solution:
Cisco plans to issue a fix for Cisco MDS (3.4.1), which is affected by this vulnerability.  This fix is to be available in June 2008.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080610-snmpv3.shtml

Title: (Cisco Issues Fix for CatOS) Net-snmp SNMPv3 Authentication Bug Lets Remote Users Bypass Authentication
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Net-snmp.  A remote user can bypass authentication.  Cisco CatOS is affected.
A remote user can send an SNMPv3 packet with a specially crafted Hash Message Authentication Code (HMAC) value to bypass the authentication function.  The user can read and modify SNMP objects with the privileges of the target user.

UCD-SNMP is also affected.

SNMPv1 and SNMPv2 are not affected.

Wes Hardaker reported this vulnerability.

Cisco CatOS is affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsf29976 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass authentication.
Solution:
Cisco has issued a fix for CatOS (6.4(23), 7.6(19), 8.5(7), 8.6(1)), which is affected by this vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080610-snmpv3.shtml

Title: (Cisco Issues Fix for IOS) Net-snmp SNMPv3 Authentication Bug Lets Remote Users Bypass Authentication
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Net-snmp.  A remote user can bypass authentication.  Cisco IOS is affected.
A remote user can send an SNMPv3 packet with a specially crafted Hash Message Authentication Code (HMAC) value to bypass the authentication function.  The user can read and modify SNMP objects with the privileges of the target user.

UCD-SNMP is also affected.

SNMPv1 and SNMPv2 are not affected.

Wes Hardaker reported this vulnerability.

Cisco IOS is affected.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsf04754 to this vulnerability.

Cisco IOS-XR is affected.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsf30109 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass authentication.
Solution:
Cisco has issued a fix for IOS, which is affected by this vulnerability.

A patch matrix is available in Cisco's advisory.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080610-snmpv3.shtml

Title: F5 FirePass Input Validation Hole in 'css_exceptions' and 'sql_matchscope' Parameters Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 FirePass.  A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
Several scripts do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input.  A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the F5 FirePass device and will run in the security context of that site.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The 'css_exceptions' parameter in '/vdesk/admincon/webyfiers.php' and the 'sql_matchscope' parameter in '/vdesk/admincon/index.php' are affected.

Some demonstration exploit URLs are provided:

https://[target]/vdesk/admincon/webyfiers.php?
a=css&click=1
&css_exceptions=%22+onfocus%3Dalert%28%26quot%3BXSS1%26quot%3B%29+foo%3D%22
&save_css_exceptions=Update

https://[target]/vdesk/admincon/index.php?
a=css⊂=sql
&sql_matchscope=%22+onfocus%3Dalert%28%26quot%3BXSS2%26quot%3B%29+foo%3D%22
&save_sql_matchscope=Update

nnposter reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the F5 FirePass device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco Service Control Engine SSH Server Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Service Control Engine in the SSH server.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause management access to become unavailable or cause the target device to reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsi68582, CSCsh49563, and CSCsm14239 to these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload or cause management access to become unavailable.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (3.1.6).

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080521-sce.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS SSH Service Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS in the SSH server.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to trigger a memory access error and potentially cause the target device to reload.

Only devices configured to accept SSH connections are affected (not the default configuration).

12.4-based IOS releases prior to 12.4(7), 12.4(13d)JA, and 12.4(9)T are not affected.

The 10-based releases, 11-based releases, 12.0-based releases, 12.1-based releases, 12.2-based releases, and 12.3-based releases are not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsk42419, CSCsk60020, and CSCsh51293 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.  A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080521-ssh.shtml

Title: Cisco Content Switching Module Memory Leak Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Content Switching Module.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
When the target device is configured for layer 7 load balancing, a remote user can send TCP packets with specially crafted TCP flag combinations.  If the servers behind the target device are overloaded and/or fail to accept a TCP connection, a memory leak may occur and the target device may stop processing traffic.

The Cisco Content Switching Module with SSL (CSM-S) is also affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsl40722 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to stop processing traffic.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions (4.2.9 of the Cisco CSM, version 2.1.8 of the Cisco CSM-S software).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080514-csm.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS OSPF/MPLS VPN Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS.  A remote user can prevent traffic from entering an interface.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to block the input queue and prevent the target interface from accepting traffic.

Certain Cisco Catalyst 6500 Series and Cisco 7600 Router devices running Cisco IOS 12.2-based branches are affected.

Certain devices that are configured for Open Shortest Path First (OSPF) Sham-Link and Multi Protocol Label Switching (MPLS) Virtual Private Networking (VPN) [not the default configuration] are affected.

The Cisco Catalyst 6500 Series and Catalyst 7600 Series devices with the Supervisor Engine 32 (Sup32), Supervisor Engine 720 (Sup720), or Route Switch Processor 720 (RSP720) modules are affected.

The Supervisor 32, Supervisor 720, Supervisor 720-3B, Supervisor 720-3BXL, Route Switch Processor 720, Route Switch Processor 720-3C, and Route Switch Processor 720-3CXL are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsf12082 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can prevent traffic from entering an interface or cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix. A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080326-queue.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS Multicast Virtual Private Network (MVPN) Data Leak Lets Remote Users Obtain VPN Traffic
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS in the Multicast Virtual Private Network implementation.  A remote user can create multicast states or obtain VPN traffic.
A remote user can send specially crafted Multicast Distribution Tree (MDT) Data Join messages to create extra multicast states on the core routers or obtain traffic from other Multiprotocol Label Switching (MPLS) based VPNs.

The remote user must know or guess the Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) peering IP address of a remote PE router and the address of the multicast group that is used in other MPLS VPNs.

Devices that are configured for MVPN are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsi01470 to this vulnerability.

Thomas Morin reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can create extra multicast states on the core routers or obtain traffic from other Multiprotocol Label Switching (MPLS) based VPNs.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix. A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at: 

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080326-mvpn.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS Bugs in Virtual Private Dial-up Network PPTP Connection Termination Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
When virtual private dial-up networking (VPDN) is configured and PPTP is used, a remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

When a PPTP session is terminated, the virtual access interface that is associated with the PPTP session is not reused, which may exhaust all available interface descriptor blocks [CVE-2008-1150].  This may prevent VPDN connections.  Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCdv59309 to this vulnerability.

When a PPTP session is terminated, a memory leak may occur [CVE-2008-1151].  Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCsj58566 to this vulnerability.

Cisco IOS XR is not affected by these vulnerabilities.

Martin Kluge of Elxsi Security reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix. A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080326-pptp.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS UDP Router Services Bug on IPv4/IPv6 Devices Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS when IPv6 is enabled.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
When IPv6 is enabled [not the default configuration] and certain IPv4 UDP-based services are also enabled, a remote user can send a specially crafted IPv6 packet to cause the target service to stop accepting traffic.  If the Resource Reservation Protocol (RSVP) is the target service, the device will crash.

The following IPv4 UDP-based services are affected:

    TACACS - port 49
    Domain Name System (DNS) server - port 53
    Resource Reservation Protocol (RSVP) - port 1698
    Layer Two Forwarding (L2F)/Layer Two Tunnel Protocol (L2TP) - port 1701
    IP SLA Responder - port 1967
    Media Gateway Control Protocol (MGCP) - port 2427
    Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) - port 5060

Cisco IOS XR and Cisco PIX/ASA are not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCse56501 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target UDP service to stop accepting traffic or cause the target device to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix. A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080326-IPv4IPv6.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS Data-link Switching Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS in the processing of Data-link switching (DLSw) packets.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted UDP packet to UDP port 2067 or IP Protocol 91 packet to trigger a memory leak on the target device or cause the target device to reload

Cisco IOS devices that are configured for DLSw Fast Sequenced Transport (FST) are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsk73104 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.  A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20080326-dlsw.shtml

Title: AirPort Extreme Base Station AFP Input Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in AirPort Extreme Base Station.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted AFP request to cause file sharing to become unresponsive.

The Fast Ethernet and Gigabit Ethernet models are affected.

Time Capsule and AirPort Express are not affected.

Alex deVries reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a firmware fix (7.3.1).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.apple.com/kb/HT1226

Title: ZyXEL Prestige Gateway Lets Remote Users Conduct Cross-Site Scripting Attacks and Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in ZyXEL Prestige Gateway devices.  A remote authenticated user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.  A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The device does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input submitted via SNMP before displaying the input via the web administration console.  A remote user can submit a specially crafted value via SNMP.  When the target administrator views certain administration pages, arbitrary scripting code will be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the Prestige device and will run in the security context of that site.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The system is configured with SNMP read and write access enabled by default.

A remote authenticated user can gain administrative privileges by retrieving and modifying certain administrative settings via the web interface.

A remote authenticated user can hijack administrative sessions.

The system's authentication mechanism can be bypassed using replay attacks.

The system does not use encryption when transmitting various types of authentication credentials.

Adrian Pastor of ProCheckUp reported these vulnerabilities.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.procheckup.com/Hacking_ZyXEL_Gateways.pdf
Impact':
A remote authenticated user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Prestige Router (ZyXEL) device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: BIG-IP Application Security Manager Input Validation Hole in '/dms/policy/rep_request.php' Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in BIG-IP Application Security Manager.  A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The '/dms/policy/rep_request.php' script does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the 'report_type' parameter before displaying the input.  A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target authenticated administrative user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the site running the BIG-IP software and will run in the security context of that site.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

https://[target]/dms/policy/rep_request.php?report_type=%22%3E%3Cbody+onload=alert(%26quot%3BXSS%26quot%3B)%3E%3Cfoo+

nnposter reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the BIG-IP software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: BIG-IP Input Validation Hole in SearchString Parameter Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in BIG-IP.  A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The search function on several script pages does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the BIG-IP device and will run in the security context of that site.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The SearchString parameter in the following scripts is affected:

/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/virtual_server/list.jsp
/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/http/list.jsp
/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/ftp/list.jsp
/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/rtsp/list.jsp
/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/sip/list.jsp
/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/persistence/list.jsp
/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/fastl4/list.jsp
/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/fasthttp/list.jsp
/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/httpclass/list.jsp
/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/tcp/list.jsp
/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/udp/list.jsp
/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/sctp/list.jsp
/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/clientssl/list.jsp
  /tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/serverssl/list.jsp
/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/authn/list.jsp
/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/connpool/list.jsp
/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/statistics/list.jsp
/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/profile/stream/list.jsp
/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/pool/list.jsp
/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/node/list.jsp
/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/monitor/list.jsp
/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/locallb/ssl_certificate/list.jsp
/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/system/user/list.jsp
/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/system/log/list_system.jsp
/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/system/log/list_pktfilter.jsp
/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/system/log/list_ltm.jsp
/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/system/log/resources_audit.jsp
/tmui/Control/jspmap/tmui/system/log/list_asm.jsp

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

https://[target]/[page]?SearchString=%22%20type=%22hidden%22%3E%3Cscript%3Ealert(%22list-xss%22)%3C/script%3E%3Cinput%20type=%22hidden%22%20value=%22

The vendor was notified on January 3, 2008.

nnposter reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the BIG-IP device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: LevelOne WBR-3460A Wireless Router Grants Management Access to Remote Users
Description:
Anastasios Monachos reported a vulnerability in the LevelOne WBR-3460A router.  A remote user can gain access to the management interface.
A remote user on the internal network or the wireless network can connect to the management interface via telnet.  No authentication is required.

The remote user can access files on the target device to obtain the web administration password and other potentially sensitive information and to modify the configuration.

The vendor was notified on January 1, 2008 without response.
Impact': A remote user can gain access to the target device.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: ZyXEL Wireless Router Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the ZyXEL P-330W Wireless Router.  A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The web management interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input.  A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the ZyXEL device management interface and will run in the security context of that interface.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

http://[target]:<router_port>/ping.asp?pingstr=   ><script>alert("Merry Christams")</script>

Cross-site request forgery attacks are also possible.

Santa Clause at hushmail.com reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the ZyXEL device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Juniper JUNOS BGP and IPv6 Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in JUNOS.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted BGP messages to cause the target interface to flap.

A remote user can send specially crafted IPv6 packets to trigger a memory leak in the kernel and cause the target router to crash.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has reportedly issued a fix.

No public advisory was available at the time of this entry.

The Juniper technical note for the BGP vulnerability is available to registered customers at:

https://www.juniper.net/alerts/viewalert.jsp?actionBtn=Search&txtAlertNumber=PSN-2007-12-008&viewMode=view

Title: F5 FirePass Input Validation Holes in 'my.logon.php3' and 'my.activation.php3' Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in F5 FirePass.  A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
Several scripts do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input.  A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the F5 FirePass device and will run in the security context of that device.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the device, or take actions on the device acting as the target user.

Some demonstration exploit URLs are provided:

https://[target]/my.logon.php3?"></script><textarea>HTML_injection_test
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the F5 FirePass device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the device, or take actions on the device acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (SOL7923).

The F5 advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/7000/900/SOL7923.html?sr=1

Title: F5 FirePass Input Validation Hole in 'download_plugin.php3' Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 FirePass.  A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The 'download_plugin.php3' script does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the 'backurl' parameter before displaying the input.  A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the F5 FirePass device and will run in the security context of that device.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the device, or take actions on the device acting as the target user.

Jan Fry and Adrian Pastor of ProCheckUp Ltd. reported this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.procheckup.com/Vulnerability_PR07-13.php
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the device running the F5 FirePass software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the device, or take actions on the device acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (see SOL7498).

The F5 advisory is available at:

https://support.f5.com/kb/en-us/solutions/public/7000/400/sol7498.html

[Editor's note:  The vendor advisory is not publicly available.]

Title: Blue Coat ProxySG Management Console Input Validation Hole in Processing CRLs Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Blue Coat ProxySG.  A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The management console does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input.  A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the site running the Blue Coat ProxySG software and will run in the security context of that site.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Adrian Pastor of ProCheckUp reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Blue Coat ProxySG software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions (4.2.6.1, 5.2.2.5).

The Blue Coat advisory is available at:

http://www.bluecoat.com/support/securityadvisories/advisory_cross-site_scripting_vulnerability

Title: Cisco IOS Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP) Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in certain Cisco IOS and CatOS devices.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted EAP Response Identity packet to cause the target EAP-enabled device to reload.

Cisco Access Points and 1310 Wireless Bridges running Cisco IOS in autonomous mode are affected.

Cisco switches running certain versions of Cisco IOS are affected.

All Cisco switches running certain versions of Cisco CatOS are affected.

EAP is not configured by default on any of the vulnerable devices.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsj56438 (for Wireless EAP) and CSCsb45696 and CSCsc55249 (Wired EAP) to this vulnerability.

Laurent Butti, Julien Tinnes, and Franck Veysset of France Telecom Group reported this vulnerability at HACK.LU 2007.  Benoit Stopin also reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sr-20071019-eap.shtml

Title: NETGEAR ProSafe SSL VPN Concentrator Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the NETGEAR ProSafe SSL VPN Concentrator 25.  A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The web interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input.  A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the site running the NETGEAR Router software and will run in the security context of that site.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

The vendor was notified on October 9, 2007.

A demonstration exploit request is provided:

/cgi-bin/welcome/XYZ?err=<script>alert('XSS');</script>"

SkyOut reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the NETGEAR Router software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco IOS LPD Protocol Stack Overflow May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS.  A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user with the ability to set the hostname of the router can send specially crafted data to the Line Printer Daemon (LPD) port to trigger a buffer overflow and cause the router to crash or potentially execute arbitrary code.

A hostname of longer than 99 characters can trigger the overflow.

The system is affected only if the LPD functionality is enabled (not the default configuration).

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID to this vulnerability CSCsj86725.

Andy Davis of Information Risk Management (irm) reported this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.irmplc.com/index.php/155-Advisory-024
Impact': A remote user can cause the target router to crash or potentially execute arbitrary code.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions (12.2(18)SXF11, 12.4(16a), 12.4(2)T6 and later).

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sr-20071010-lpd.shtml

Title: Cisco 7600 May Let Remote Users Bypass ACLs Using Loopback Addresses
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Cisco 7600.  A remote user may be able to bypass access control lists.
A remote user on the local network may be able to bypass access control lists using 127.0.0.0/8 loopback addresses.  Authentication and authorization capabilities cannot be bypassed using this exploit method.

Systems that run Hybrid Mode (CatOS software on the Supervisor Engine and IOS Software on the Multilayer Switch Feature Card) and Native Mode (IOS Software on both the Supervisor Engine and the MSFC) are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCek49649 to this vulnerability.

Lee E. Rian reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the local network may be able to bypass access control lists.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (12.2(33)SXH).

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sr-20070926-lb.shtml

Title: Cisco Catalyst 6500 May Let Remote Users Bypass ACLs Using Loopback Addresses
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Catalyst 6500 Switch.  A remote user may be able to bypass access control lists.
A remote user on the local network may be able to bypass access control lists using 127.0.0.0/8 loopback addresses.  Authentication and authorization capabilities cannot be bypassed using this exploit method.

Systems that run Hybrid Mode (CatOS software on the Supervisor Engine and IOS Software on the Multilayer Switch Feature Card) and Native Mode (IOS Software on both the Supervisor Engine and the MSFC) are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCek49649 to this vulnerability.

Lee E. Rian reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user on the local network may be able to bypass access control lists.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (12.2(33)SXH).

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sr-20070926-lb.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS Stack Overflow in Processing IP BGP Regex Commands Lets Remote Authenticated Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS.  A remote authenticated user can cause the target device to crash and reload.
A remote authenticated user can execute a specially crafted command line command containing a regular expression to trigger a stack overflow and cause the target device to crash.

Regular expressions that use combined repetition operators and pattern recalls can trigger the overflow.

A demonstration exploit command is of the following form:

ip bgp regexp [regexp]

A regular expression used as part of a filter receiving piped output.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsk14633 to this vulnerability.

Cisco IOS XR is not affected.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.heise.de/newsticker/meldung/94517
https://puck.nether.net/pipermail/cisco-nsp/2007-August/043002.html

Sebastian Wiesinger reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can cause the target device to crash and reload.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sr-20070912-regexp.shtml

Title: Cisco Content Switching Module TCP Packet and Service Termination Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Content Switching Module.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted TCP packets to cause the target module to reload or to consume all available CPU resources.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCsd27478 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can cause a reload on a module that is under high network utilization when service termination is enabled on the module.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCsh57876 to this vulnerability.


Both the Cisco Content Switching Modules (CSM) and Cisco Content Switching Module with SSL (CSM-S) are affected by these vulnerabilities.

CSM versions 3.1, 3.2, and 4.1 are not affected.

The vendor discovered these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target module to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions (CSM 4.2.7 and CSM-S 2.1.6).

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20070905-csm.shtml

Title: Aztech Router Lets Remote Users Access the Management Interface Via TCP Spoofing
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Aztech DSL600 EU Router.  A remote user can access the internal management interface.
In the default configuration, a remote user on the external interface can conduct a TCP spoofing attack to connect to the web-based management interface on the internal interface.

AchedDamiman reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the internal management interface.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: (Apple Issues Fix for AirPort Extreme) BSD IPv6 Type 0 Route Headers May Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in IPv6, affecting OpenBSD and FreeBSD.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  Apple AirPort Extreme systems are affected.
A remote user can use IPv6 Type 0 route headers to conduct denial of service attacks against hosts and networks.

[Editor's note:  The vendor indicates that this a design flaw in IPv6 and not a flaw in OpenBSD.]
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
Apple has issued a fixed firmware version (7.2.1) for AirPort Extreme 802.11n base stations, which are affected by this vulnerability.

The Apple advisory is available at:

http://docs.info.apple.com/article.html?artnum=306375

Title: Cisco IOS May Disclose Potentially Sensitive Information in IPv6 Routing Headers
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS when running IPv6.  A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information.
A remote user can send a specially crafted IPv6 packet with a Type 0 Routing Header present to cause the target device to crash. On Cisco IOS XR, the IPv6 subsystem may crash (instead of the entire device crashing).

The system may swap the destination IPv6 address with 16 bytes of content from the packet buffer memory, with contents from the packet header up to 1500 bytes from the packet header start.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCef77013 and CSCsi74127 to this vulnerability.

Cisco and Tom Cross from IBM Internet Security Systems X-Force independently discovered this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive information or cause the target device or service to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions.  A patch matrix is available in the Cisco advisory.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20070808-IOS-IPv6-leak.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS Next Hop Resolution Protocol (NHRP) Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service or Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS in the Next Hop Resolution Protocol (NHRP) implementation.  A remote user can cause the target device to restart or potentially execute arbitrary code.
This can be exploited at the link layer, over GRE or mGRE tunnels, and directly via IP.

Only devices configured for NHRP functionality are affected.  NHRP is not enabled by default.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug IDs CSCin95836 and CSCsi23231 to this vulnerability.

Martin Kluge discovered this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target device.

A remote user can cause the target device to restart.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions.  A patch matrix is available in the Cisco advisory.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20070808-nhrp.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS Secure Copy (SCP) Lets All Remote Authenticated Users Transfer Files
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS.  A remote authenticated user can transfer files, regardless of their privilege level.
A remote authenticated user can use Secure Copy (scp) to transfer files to and from arbitrary locations on the target device (when the device is configured to be a Secure Copy server).  The user can exploit this to retrieve the configuration file, which may contain potentially sensitive information.

Certain 12.2-based IOS releases are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsc19259 to this vulnerability.

Vijay Sarvepalli from University of North Carolina at Greensboro discovered this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can transfer arbitrary files to and from the target device.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions.  A patch matrix is available in the Cisco advisory.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20070808-scp.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS Bugs in Voice Services Let Remote Users Deny Service or Potentially Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS when running voice services.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target device.
A remote user can send a specially crafted SIP packet to cause the target device to crash or potentially execute arbitrary code.

A remote user can send a specially crafted MGCP packet to cause the target device to crash or become unresponsive (preventing new telephone calls).  A reboot is required to return the system to normal operations.

A remote user can send a specially crafted H.323 packet to cause the target device to crash.

A remote user can send a specially crafted RTP packet to cause the target device to crash.

A remote user can send a specially crafted facsimile packet to cause the target device to crash.

Cisco discovered some of the vulnerabilities during internal testing.  Other vulnerabilities were discovered in customer networks.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target device to crash or become unresponsive.

A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target device.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions.  A patch matrix is available in the Cisco advisory.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20070808-IOS-voice.shtml

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller ARP Processing Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco Wireless LAN Controller.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
The device does not properly process certain Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) requests.  A remote user can send an ARP request to trigger an ARP packet storm.

This may be triggered when two devices attached to the same set of Layer-2 VLANs each have a context for the wireless client (which can occur after a cross-subnet roam or when guest WLAN [auto-anchor] is configured).

The following hardware platforms may be affected:

Cisco 4100 Series Wireless LAN Controllers
Cisco 4400 Series Wireless LAN Controllers
Cisco Airespace 4000 Series Wireless LAN Controller
Cisco Catalyst 6500 Series Wireless Services Module (WiSM)
Cisco Catalyst 3750 Series Integrated Wireless LAN Controllers

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsj69233, CSCsj50374, and CSCsj70841 to these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20070724-arp.shtml

Title: F5 FirePass Input Validation Flaw in 'my.activation.php3' Permits Remote Command Execution
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 FirePass.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted 'username' value to the 'my.activation.php3' script to execute arbitrary commands on the target system.  The code will run with the privileges of the target service.

The vendor was notified on February 22, 2007.

Leonardo Nve of S21sec discovered this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.s21sec.com/avisos/s21sec-035-en.txt
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary commands on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has reportedly issued a hotfix (HF-75705-76003-1).

The F5 advisory is not publicly available.

Title: (Cisco Issues Fix for IOS) RSA BSAFE ASN.1 Parsing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in RSA BSAFE.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  Cisco IOS and IOS XR are affected.
A remote user can send specially crafted ASN.1 encoded data to trigger a parsing flaw and cause the linked application to crash.

The RSA BSAFE Crypto-C and Cert-C libraries (and applications that link to these libraries) are affected.

RSA has assigned Bug ID 46337 to this vulnerability.

US-CERT reported this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/754281
Impact': A remote user can cause the target application or device to crash.
Solution:
Cisco has released a fix for Cisco IOS and IOS XR, which are affected by this BSAFE vulnerability.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20070522-crypto.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS ClientHello, ChangeCipherSpec, and Finished SSL Messages Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data during an SSL protocol exchange via TCP with the target device to cause the target device to crash.

Specially crafted ClientHello, ChangeCipherSpec, and Finished messages can trigger a crash.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID numbers CSCsb12598, CSCsb40304, and CSCsd92405 to this vulnerability.

The following Cisco IOS application layer protocols are affected:

  * Hyper Text Transfer Protocol over SSL (HTTPS)
  * Cisco Network Security (CNS) Agent with SSL support
  * Firewall Support of HTTPS Authentication Proxy
  * Cisco IOS Clientless SSL VPN (WebVPN) support

IPSec and Secure Shell (SSH) are not affected.

Cisco discovered these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.  A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20070522-SSL.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS Firewall/IPS Feature Set Lets Remote Users Evade Detection With Certain Character Encodings
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS with the Firewall/IPS feature set.  A remote user can evade detection.
A remote user can encode packets using a full-width or half-width unicode character set to evade detection by the target device.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsi67763 to this vulnerability.

Fatih Ozavci and Caglar Cakici of Gamasec Security discovered this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/739224
Impact': A remote user can evade detection by the intrusion prevention feature.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sr-20070514-unicode.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS FTP Server Lets Remote Users Read and Write Files and Denial of Service
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS in the FTP server function.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
The FTP server function does not properly validate authentication credentials.  A remote user can connect to the FTP service to read and write arbitrary files to the filesystem on the target device.  This can be exploited to obtain passwords and other sensitive information and to execute arbitrary code.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCek55259 to this vulnerability.

A remote authenticated user can transfer files via FTP to cause the target device to reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCse29244 to this vulnerability.

The FTP server is not enabled by default.

The IOS FTP Client feature is not affected.

Cisco IOS XR is not affected.

This vulnerability was reported to Cisco by a customer.
Impact':
A remote user can modify files on the target device to cause arbitrary code to be executed.

A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
Cisco has issued a fixed version that removes the vulnerable FTP server function.  A patch matrix is available in the advisory.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20070509-iosftp.shtml

Title: HP ProCurve 9300m Switches Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in certain HP ProCurve Switches.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
No further details were provided.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (08.0.01k), available at:

http://www.hp.com/rnd/software/switches.htm

The HP advisory is available at:

http://h20000.www2.hp.com/bizsupport/TechSupport/Document.jsp?objectID=c01034753

Title: Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Lets Remote Users Modify the Configuration and Deny Service
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in the Cisco Wireless LAN Controller (WLC).  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  A remote user can modify the configuration.  Access control lists may not be properly enforced.
The WLC uses common values for the SNMP read-only and read-write community strings.  A remote user can user these values to access SNMP services.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCse02384 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted Ethernet data to cause the target WLC to crash.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsc90179 to this vulnerability.

A remote user can send specially crafted data to cause the target WLC's network processing unit to lock up.  Specially crafted SNAP packets, 802.11 data, and packets with unexpected length values in certain headers can trigger this flaw.  The WLC must be restarted to return the network processing unit to normal operations.

The 2000 Series WLC, the 2100 Series WLC, and the Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Module are not affected by these network processing unit vulnerabilities.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsg36361, CSCsg15901, and CSCsh10841 to these vulnerabilities.

A remote user with physical access to the console port can use a hard-coded password to access the Cisco Aironet 1000 Series and 1500 Series Lightweight Access Points.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsg15192 to this vulnerability.

The WLC version 4.0 may not properly load access control lists when rebooted.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCse58195 to this vulnerability.

The following products are affected by the above listed vulnerabilities:

Wireless LAN Controllers

  * Cisco 4400 Series Wireless LAN Controllers
  * Cisco 4100 Series Wireless LAN Controllers
  * Cisco 2100 Series Wireless LAN Controllers
  * Cisco 2000 Series Wireless LAN Controllers
  * Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Module

Wireless Integrated Switches and Routers

  * Cisco Catalyst 6500 Series Wireless Services Module (WiSM)
  * Cisco Catalyst 3750 Series Integrated Wireless LAN Controllers
  * Cisco Wireless LAN Controller Module

Cisco Aironet Access Points

  * Cisco Aironet 1000 Series
  * Cisco Aironet 1500 Series

Cisco discovered these vulnerabilities while investigating customer support issues.
Impact':
A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote user can access SNMP services to view and modify the configuration.

A remote user may be able to bypass access controls.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (4.0.206.0) for most of the vulnerabilities.  Cisco plans to issue a fix for the SNMP community string vulnerability on April 19, 2007.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20070412-wlc.shtml

Title: AirPort Extreme Base Station with 802.11n Discloses Filenames to Remote Users and Allows Incoming IPv6 Connections
Version(s): prior to irmware version 7.1; for AirPort Extreme Base Station with 802.11n*
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the AirPort Extreme Base Station.  A remote user on the local network can view filenames.  A remote user can send IPv6 packets to connected systems.
When the AirPort Disk feature is used, a remote user on the local network can view filenames on a password-protected disk [CVE-2007-0734].

The device supports incoming IPv6 connections in the default configuration [CVE-2007-1338].  A remote user can send IPv6 packets to connected hosts.

Only the AirPort Extreme Base Station with 802.11n is affected.
Impact':
A remote user on the local network can view filenames of files on the password-protected AirPort Disk.

A remote user can send IPv6 packets to connected hosts.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed firmware version (7.1).  The vendor has also described directions for correcting the IPv6 default configuration error.

The Apple advisory is available at:

http://docs.info.apple.com/article.html?artnum=305366

Title: ZyXEL Router ZyNOS Can Be Crashed By Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in ZyXEL ZyNOS.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted SMB data to cause the target ZyNOS operating system to crash.

Joxean Koret reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to crash.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco Catalyst 6000 and 6500 and Cisco 7600 Network Analysis Module SNMP Spoofing Lets Remote Users Gain Access
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Catalyst 6000 and 6500 series and the Cisco 7600 series when a Network Analysis Module is installed.  A remote user can gain full control of the target device.
A remote user can spoof SNMP packets between the Network Analysis Module (NAM) and the Catalyst device to gain complete control of the target device.

Catalyst 6000 and 6500 series and Cisco 7600 series systems are affected if they have a NAM installed.  Both IOS-based and CatOS-based systems are affected.

Systems that do not have a NAM are not affected.  NAMs for Cisco Branch Routers (NM-NAM) are not affected.

This vulnerability was introduced in CatOS versions 7.6(15) and 8.5(1).

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug IDs CSCsd75273, CSCse52951, and CSCse39848 to this vulnerabilitly.

Cisco discovered this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain full control of the target device.
Solution:
Cisco has issued fixed versions.  A patch matrix is available in their advisory.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20070228-nam.shtml

Title: Cisco Catalyst 6000 and 6500 and Cisco 7600 MPLS Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Cisco Catalyst 6000 and 6500 series and the Cisco 7600 series.  A remote user on the local network can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user on the local network segment can send a specially crafted Multi Protocol Label Switching (MPLS) packet to cause the target device or card to reload.

Cisco Catalyst 6500 series systems running version 12.2(18)SXF4 in Hybrid Mode or running with Cisco IOS Software Modularity are affected.

Cisco Catalyst 6000, 6500 and Cisco 7600 series systems with Multilayer Switch
Feature Card (MSFC) [MSFC2, MSFC2a, or MSFC3] running in Hybrid Mode are affected.

Systems that are running in Native Mode but without Cisco IOS Software Modularity are not affected.

Systems without an MSFC2, MSFC2a, or MSFC3 are not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsd37415 and CSCef90002 to this vulnerability.

This vulnerability was reported to Cisco by a customer.
Impact': A remote user on the local network segment can cause the target device or card to reload.  A repeated attack can cause prolonged denial of service conditions.
Solution:
Cisco has issued fixed versions.  A patch matrix is available in the Cisco advisory.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20070228-mpls.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS IPS Feature Set Lets Remote Users Deny Service or Evade Intrusion Detection
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS in the Intrusion Prevention System (IPS) feature set.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  A remote user can evade intrusion detection.
A remote user can send specially crafted fragmented IP packets to evade signature detection.  The vulnerability resides in signatures that use regular expressions.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsg15598 to this vulnerability.

The following versions are affected by this packet evasion vulnerability (when the IPS feature set is enabled):

  * 12.3T, except versions 12.3(2)T, 12.3(4)T, and 12.3(7)T
  * 12.4
  * 12.4T
  * 12.4XE

A remote user can exploit a flaw in the ATOMIC.TCP signature engine to cause the target device to crash.  Signature 3123.0 (Netbus Pro Traffic) is one of the affected signatures.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsa53334 to this vulnerability.

The following versions are affected by this denial of service vulnerability (when the IPS feature set is enabled):

  * 12.3T, except versions 12.3(2)T, 12.3(4)T, and 12.3(7)T
  * 12.3XQ, 12.3XR, 12.3XS, 12.3XW, 12.3XX, 12.3XY
  * 12.3YA, 12.3YD, 12.3YG, 12.3YH, 12.3YI, 12.3YJ, 12.3YK, 12.3YM,
    12.3YQ, 12.3YS, 12.3YT, 12.3YX, 12.3YZ
  * 12.4
  * 12.4MR
  * 12.4T
  * 12.4XA, 12.4XB

A customer reported the ATOMIC.TCP regular expression vulnerability to Cisco.  Cisco discovered the packet evasion vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target device to crash.

A remote user can evade signature detection.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.  A patch matrix is available in their advisory.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20070213-iosips.shtml

Title: IP3 NetAccess Missing Input Validation in 'getfile.cgi' Lets Remote Users Traverse the Directory
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in IP3 NetAccess.  A remote user can view files on the target system.
The 'getfile.cgi' script does not properly validate user-supplied input in the 'filename' parameter.  A remote user can supply a specially crafted request to view files on target system that are located outside of the document directory.

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

http://[target]/portalgroups/portalgroups/getfile.cgi?filename=../../../../../../../../etc/shadow

The vendor was notified on December 31, 2006.

Sebastian Wolfgarten reported this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.devtarget.org/ip3-advisory-02-2007.txt
Impact': A remote user can view files on the target system.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fixed version (4.1.9.6).

Title: Cisco IOS Can Be Crashed in Certain Cases By Remote Users Sending SIP Packets
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted Session Initiated Protocol (SIP) packet to UDP port 5060 on the target device to cause the target device to crash and reload.

The cause of the vulnerability has not been identified.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsh58082 to this vulnerability.

Some systems that support voice but are not configured for SIP may process SIP messages anyway.  Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsb25337 to this vulnerability.

The following models support voice and may be affected:

  * 815
  * 871
  * 876
  * 877
  * 878
  * 1701
  * 1711
  * 1712
  * 1721
  * 1751
  * 1751-V
  * 1760
  * 1801
  * 1802
  * 1803
  * 1811
  * 1812
  * 1841
  * 2610XM-2611XM
  * 2620XM-2621XM
  * 2650XM-2651XM
  * 2691
  * 2801
  * 2811
  * 2821
  * 2851
  * 3220
  * 3250
  * 3270
  * 3725
  * 3745
  * 3825
  * 3845
  * 7200
  * 7200-NPE-G2
  * 7301

Routers that are as SIP Public Switched Telephone Network (PSTN) Gateways are affected.

Routers configured as SIP Session Border Controllers (SBCs) are affected.

The CAT6000-CMM card is affected.

A Cisco customer reported this vulnerability to Cisco.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to crash and reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix for one of the vulnerabilities that disables the TCP and UDP 5060 listening ports on systems that support voice but are not configured for SIP.

A patch matrix is available in the Cisco advisory.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20070131-sip.shtml

Title: Cisco Catalyst Switch Lets Remote Users Deny Service With Specially Crafted VTP Packets
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Catalyst Switches.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user on the local Ethernet segment can send specially crafted VLAN Trunking Protocol (VTP) packets with the proper VTP domain name to a switch port that is configured for trunking to cause the target device to reload.

Switch ports configured for voice VLANs are not affected.

The following devices are affected:

    * Cisco 2900XL Series Switches
    * Cisco 2950 Series Switches
    * Cisco 2955 Series Switches
    * Cisco 3500XL Series Switches
    * Cisco 3550 Series Switches
    * Cisco 3750 Series Switches

Cisco assigned Cisco bug ID CSCsa67294 to this vulnerability.

David Barroso Berrueta and Alfredo Andres Omella reported this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.s21sec.com/es/avisos/s21sec-034-en.txt
Impact': A remote user on a local Ethernet segment can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor issued a fix in May 2005 but did not issue a security advisory at that time.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sr-20070129-vtp.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS ICMP, PIMv2, PGM, and URD IP Option Bug May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a packet with a specially crafted IP option value to the target device to potentially execute arbitrary code on the target device or cause the device to reload.

The device is not affected by packets routed via the target device.

This vulnerability can be exploited via Protocol Independent Multicast version 2 (PIMv2) packets, Pragmatic General Multicast (PGM) packets, and URL Rendezvous Directory (URD) packets.  No other IP protocols are affected.  Also, Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) Echo, Timestamp, Information Request, and Address Mask Request packets can be used.

All Cisco devices running Cisco IOS software are affected when configured to process IPv4 packets.  Cisco IOS XR versions 2.0.X, 3.0.X, and 3.2.X are also affected.

Devices processing only IPv6 are not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCec71950 for Cisco IOS and Cisco Bug ID CSCeh52410 for Cisco IOS XR.

Cisco discovered this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target device.

A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
Cisco has issued fixes.  A patch matrix is available in their advisory.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20070124-crafted-ip-option.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS TCP Listener Memory Leak Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted TCP packets to the target device to cause the target device to leak memory and eventually consume all available memory.

The memory leak can be triggered without completing the 3-way TCP handshake.

Only traffic sent to the device is affected.  Traffic routed through the device is not affected.

All Cisco devices running Cisco IOS software are affected.

Cisco IOS-XR is not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCek37177 to this vulnerability.

Cisco discovered this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause performance degredation.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.  A patch matrix is available in the Cisco advisory.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20070124-crafted-tcp.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS IPv6 Type 0 Routing Header Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target device.
A remote user can send specially crafted IPv6 Type 0 Routing header data to a target device running IPv6 (not the default configuration) to cause the target device to crash.  It may also be possible to execute arbitrary code.

The IPv6 Type 2 Routing header used in mobile IPv6 is not affected.

Cisco IOS XR is not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsd40334 and CSCsd58381 to this vulnerability.

Arnaud Ebalard from EADS Corporate Research Center reported this vulnerability to Cisco.
Impact':
A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target device.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions.  A patch matrix is available in the Cisco advisory.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20070124-IOS-IPv6.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS DLSw Capabilities Exchange Lets Remote Users Cause the Device to Reload
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS in the Data-link Switching (DLSw) feature.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user (DLSw device) can send a DLSw message with a specially crafted option value during the DLSw capabilities exchange process to cause the target DLSw device to reload.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsf28840 to this vulnerability.

Martyn Ruks of MWR InfoSecurity reported this vulnerability to Cisco.

This vulnerability was originally presented at DEFCON in August 2006.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
Cisco has released fixed versions of IOS.  A detailed patch matrix is available in their advisory.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20070110-dlsw.shtml

Title: B-FOCuS Wireless Router Discloses Configuration Files to Remote Users
Description:
Tal Argoni (LegendaryZion) reported a vulnerability in the B-FOCuS wireless router.  A remote user can view files on the target device.
The device does not properly restrict access to the configuration files.  A remote user can supply a specially crafted request to view router configuration files and other files on target system.

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

http://[target]/html/defs/

The B-FOCuS Wireless 802.11b/g ADSL2+ Router is affected.
Impact': A remote user can view the configuration files.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: 3Com SuperStack 3 Switch Discloses SNMP Community String to Remote Users
Version(s): Models 4400/4400PWR/4400SE/4400FX; Firmware version 5.11, 6.00, and 6.10 and prior
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in 3Com's SuperStack 3 switch.  A remote user can determine the SNMP community string password.
A remote user on the management VLAN can cause the target device to disclose the SNMP Read-Write community string.  With this information, the remote user can perform certain operations on the target switch, including the disabling of ports or possibly modifying the VLAN configuration.

Andrew Brennan discovered this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can determine the SNMP community string, which can then be used to modify part of the device configuration.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix, available at:

http://pa.3com.com

The 3Com advisory is available at:

http://www.3com.com/securityalert/alerts/3COM-06-004.html

Title: F5 FirePass 1000 Input Validation Flaw in 'my.acctab.php3' Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Version(s): F5 FirePass 1000 version 5.5; possibly earlier versions
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 FirePass 1000.  A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The 'my.acctab.php3' script does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the 'sid' parameter before displaying the input.  A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the F5 FirePass device and will run in the security context of that device.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the device, or take actions on the device acting as the target user.

Richard Brain of ProCheckUp reported this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.procheckup.com/Vulner_PR0603b.php
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the F5 FirePass device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the device, or take actions on the device acting as the target user.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (6.0).

The vendor also plans to issue a fix in the future release of version 5.52.

Title: Cisco IOS Default DOCSIS Community String May Grant Remote Users Access via SNMP
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS on certain devices.  A remote user can gain access to the device via SNMP.
The software may contain a default hard-coded SNMP read-write community string ("cable-docsis") associated with Data Over Cable Service Interface Specification (DOCSIS) devices, even though the devices are not DOCSIS compliant.  As a result, a remote user can gain privileged access to the device via SNMP.

The Cisco IAD2400 series, 1900 Series Mobile Wireless Edge Routers, and Cisco VG224 Analog Phone Gateway devices are affected, including the:

  * Cisco IAD2430 Integrated Access Device
  * Cisco IAD2431 Integrated Access Device
  * Cisco IAD2432 Integrated Access Device
  * Cisco VG224 Analog Phone Gateway
  * Cisco MWR 1900 Mobile Wireless Edge Router
  * Cisco MWR 1941 Mobile Wireless Edge Router

The following products are not affected:

  * Cisco IAD2420 Integrated Access Device
  * Cisco IAD2421 Integrated Access Device
  * Cisco IAD2423 Integrated Access Device
  * Cisco IAD2424 Integrated Access Device
