Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsb04965 (for the Cisco IAD2400 series and Cisco VG224 Analog Phone Gateways) and CSCsb06658 (for the 1900 Series Mobile Wireless Edge Routers) to this vulnerability.

A customer reported this vulnerability to Cisco.
Impact': A remote user can gain full control of the device via SNMP.
Solution:
Cisco has issued fixed versions.  A patch matrix and temporary workaround instructions are available in the Cisco advisory.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20060920-docsis.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS VLAN Trunking Protocol Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS in the processing of VLAN Trunking Protocol (VTP) packets.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user on the local network segment can send a specially crafted VTP version 1 summary packet with the VTP version field set to "2" to a trunk enabled port to cause the switch to reset with a Software Forced Crash Exception.

A remote user can send a VTP summary advertisement with a Type-Length-Value containing a specially crafted VLAN name that is longer than 100 characters to a trunk enabled port to cause the switch to reset with an Unassigned Exception error.

A remote user can send specially crafted VTP udates to trigger a heap overflow and potentially execute arbitrary code.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsd52629, CSCsd34759, CSCse40078, CSCse47765, CSCsd34855, and CSCei54611 to these vulnerabilities.

Cisco Catalyst switches running Cisco IOS with VTP Operating Mode set to "server" or "client" are affected.

Cisco Catalyst switches running Cisco CatOS with VTP Operating Mode set to either "server" or "client" are affected by the "Integer Wrap in VTP revision" vulnerability.

Switches with VTP Operating Mode set to "transparent" are not affected [this is the default setting].

The vendor was notified on July 6, 2005.

FX from Phenoelit Group reported these vulnerabilities.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.phenoelit.de/stuff/CiscoVTP.txt
Impact':
A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sr-20060913-vtp.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS GRE Parsing Error May Let Remote Users Inject Packets
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS when using GRE.  A remote user may be able to inject packets into the routing queues.
Cisco IOS does not properly parse GRE packets containing GRE source routing information.  A remote user can send a specially crafted GRE packet to cause the router to reuse packet packet data from unrelated ring buffer memory and inject the the data into the routing queues.

As a result, memory contents of the packet ring buffers may be interpreted as the payload IP packet and reinjected into the routing queue.

A remote user may be able to exploit this to bypass access control lists.

The vendor was notified on July 7, 2005.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCuk27655, CSCea22552, and CSCei62762 to this vulnerability.

FX of Phenoelit Group discovered the original vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.phenoelit.de/stuff/CiscoGRE.txt
Impact': A remote user may be able to inject packets into the routing queues to bypass access control lists.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix in Cisco IOS 12.3 and 12.4 based trains.

Cisco IOS 12.0(23)S or later is not vulnerable when Cisco Express Forwarding (CEF)
is enabled (default behavior).

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sr-20060906-gre.shtml

Title: Linksys WRT54g Router Lets Remote Users Modify the Configuration
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Linksys WRT54g Router.  A remote user can modify the configuration.
The 'Security.tri' script does not require authentication for HTTP POST requests.  A remote user can submit a specially crafted request to modify the configuration on the target device.

A demonstration exploit curl command to disable wireless security on the device is provided:

curl -d "SecurityMode=0&layout=en" http://192.168.0.1/Security.tri

The vendor was notified on June 24, 2006.

Ginsu Rabbit reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can modify the configuration.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: ProCurve Switch Memory Leak Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in HP ProCurve Switches.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Under certain conditions, a remote user can trigger a memory leak and cause the switch to consume all available packet buffer space.

The 3500yl, 6200yl, and 5400zl switches are affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
HP has issued a fixed version (K.11.33), available at:

http://www.hp.com/rnd/software/switches.htm

The HP advisory is available at:

http://www2.itrc.hp.com/service/cki/docDisplay.do?docId=c00732233

Title: ZyXEL Prestige 660H-61 Router Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Prestige 660H-61 Router.  A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The router administration interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input.  A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the Prestige Router device and will run in the security context of that device.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the device, or take actions on the device acting as the target user.

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

http://[target]/Forms/rpSysAdmin?a=%3Cscript%3Ealert('www.eazel.es')%3C/script%3E 

Jose Ramon Palanco discovered this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.eazel.es/media/advisory004-Zyxel-Prestige-660H-61-Cross-Site-Scripting.html
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the Prestige Router device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the device, or take actions on the device acting as the target user.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: SpeedStream Web Administration Interface Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in SpeedStream.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted packet to the administrative web server to cause the target router to freeze.  A reboot is necessary to return to normal operations.

The vendor was notified on May 4, 2006.

Jaime Blasco discovered this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.digitalarmaments.com/2006310665340982.html
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to freeze.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: D-Link Router UPnP Stack Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in D-Link Routers in the Universal Plug and Play (uPnP) stack.  A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can send a specially crafted M-SEARCH request parameter via the LAN interface to UDP port 1900 on the target device to trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.

The following D-Link devices are affected:

DI-524 Rev A
DI-524 Rev C
DI-524 Rev D
DI-604 Rev E
DI-624 Rev C
DI-624 Rev D
DI-784 Rev A
EBR-2310 Rev A
WBR-1310 Rev A
WBR-2310 Rev A

The vendor was notified on February 27, 2006.

Barnaby Jack discovered this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.eeye.com/html/research/advisories/AD20060714.html
Impact': A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fix.

Title: Juniper DX Application Acceleration Platform Input Validation Hole in Web Interface Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Juniper DX Application Acceleration Platform.  A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The web administration interface does not properly filter HTML code from the system log before displaying the input.  A remote user can submit a specially crafted login username value.  When the target administrative user views the system log file, arbitrary scripting code will be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the DX Application Acceleration Platform software and will run in the security context of that site.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

A remote user can exploit this to obtain full administrative access to the target Juniper DX appliance.

Darren Bounds reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the DX Application Acceleration Platform software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: JUNOS Memory Leak in Processing IPv6 Packets Lets Remote Users Crash the Router
Version(s): M-series, T-series, and J-series routers; JUNOS versions built prior to May 10, 2006
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in JUNOS.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted IPv6 packets to trigger a memory leak in the kernel and cause the target router to crash.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target router to crash.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix for JUNOS releases 6.4 through 8.0 inclusive.  All releases of JUNOS built on or after May 10, 2006 include the fix.

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.juniper.net/support/security/alerts/IPv6_bug.txt

Title: F5 FirePass Input Validation Holes in Multiple Fields Permit Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5 FirePass.  A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
Several scripts do not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input.  A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the site running the F5 FirePass software and will run in the security context of that site.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

Marc Ruef discovered this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.scip.ch/cgi-bin/smss/showadvf.pl?id=2352
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the F5 FirePass software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
Solution: The report indicates that version 6.x is not affected.

Title: Siemens SpeedStream Wireless Router UPnP Support Lets Remote Users Access Restricted Files
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the SpeedStream wireless router.  A remote user can access restricted files.
A remote user can access protected files without having to login to the system by using the UPnP support interface.

The vendor was notified on May 2, 2006, without response.

Jaime Blasco discovered this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.digitalarmaments.com/2006290674551938.html
Impact': A remote user can access ostensibly protected files on the target device.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco Access Point Configuration Error May Let Remote Users Gain Administrative Access
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Cisco Access Point.  A remote user may be able to gain administrative access.
When an administrator invokes the web-browser interface and modifies the 'Security --> Admin Access' setting from "Default Authentication (Global Password)" to "Local User List Only (Individual Passwords)", the Access Point will be reconfigured so that passwords are not required.  If this occurs, then a remote user can subsequently gain administrative access to the device via the web management interface or via the console port.

The following models are affected:

  * 350 Wireless Access Point and Wireless Bridge
  * 1100 Wireless Access Point
  * 1130 Wireless Access Point
  * 1200 Wireless Access Point
  * 1240 Wireless Access Point
  * 1310 Wireless Bridge
  * 1410 Wireless Access Point
  * Cisco 3200 Series Wireless Mobile Interface Card (WMIC)

Only Access Points configured with the web management interface enabled and running Cisco IOS 12.3(8)JA, 12.3(8)JA1, or 12.3(8)JK are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsd67403 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can gain administrative access to the device.
Solution:
Cisco has issued a fixed version (rebuild 12.3(8)JA2 and maintenance build (12.3(11)JA).

Users of 12.3(8)JK should contact the TAC.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20060628-ap.shtml

Title: D-Link DWL-2100ap Discloses Configuration File to Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the D-Link DWL-2100ap wireless router.  A remote user can obtain sensitive information from the target device.
A remote user can directly request files in the '/cgi-bin/' directory with a '.cfg' file extension to obtain the device configuration.

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

http://[target]/cgi-bin/Intruders.cfg

Wendel Guglielmetti Henrique and the Intruders Tiger Team Security discovered this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.intruders.com.br/adv0206en.html
Impact': A remote user can obtain the device configuration, including password information.
Solution:
The vendor has reportedly issued a firmware patch, available at:

http://www.dlink.com.br/internet/downloads/Wireless/DWL-2100AP/DWL2100AP-firmware-v210na-r0343.tfp

Title: D-Link DSA-3100 Router Input Validation Hole in 'login_error.shtml' Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the D-Link DSA-3100 Router.  A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The 'login_error.shtml' script does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the 'uname' parameter before displaying the input.  A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the D-Link Router interface and will run in the security context of that device.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the device, or take actions on the device acting as the target user.

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

http://[target]/login_error.shtml?uname=%3CBODY%20ONLOAD=alert%28%27www.eazel.es%27%29%3E

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.eazel.es/media/advisory003-D-Link-DSA-3100-Cross-Site-Scripting.html

jaime.blasco(at)eazel(dot).es discovered this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the D-Link Router, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the device, or take actions on the device acting as the target user.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Linksys WRT54GS UPnP Bug Lets Remote Internal Users Cause Packets to Be Forwarded to External Systems
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Linksys WRT54GS wireless router.  A remote user on the internal network can cause the router to forward packets to an external host.
A remote user on the internal interface (i.e., LAN side) can set the UPnP InternalClient parameter to point to a host on the external network.  The router will then perform network address translation on incoming packets and forward the packets to the specified external host.

The vulnerability was discovered by Armijn Hemel and disclosed at the System Administration and Network Engineering (SANE) Conference.  Some limited information is available at:

http://www.securityview.org/dutch-student-finds-a-bug-in-upnp.html
http://www.securityview.org/how-does-the-upnp-flaw-works.html
Impact': A remote user on the internal network can cause the router to forward incoming packets to an external host.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed firmware version (4.71.1).

http://www.linksys.com/servlet/Satellite?blobcol=urldata&blobheadername1=
Content-Type&blobheadername2=Content-Disposition&blobheadervalue1=text%2Fplain
&blobheadervalue2=inline%3B+filename%3Dwrt54gs_ver%252C2.txt&blobkey=id
&blobtable=MungoBlobs&blobwhere=1130809757362&ssbinary=true

Title: D-Link DSL-G604T Wireless Router Bug in 'webcm' Script in 'getpage' Parameter Lets Remote Users Traverse the Directory
Version(s): DSL-G604T Wireless Router, firmware version V1.00B02T02.EU.20040618
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the D-Link DSL-G604T Wireless Router.  A remote user can view files on the target system.
A remote user can access the management interface and invoke the '/cgi-bin/webcm' script with a specially crafted 'getpage' parameter to view arbitrary files on the target device.

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

http://[target]/cgi-bin/webcm?getpage=/etc/passwd

SecuriTeam posted a notice that credited Qex with reporting this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can view files on the target system.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: 3Com Baseline Switch 2848-SFP Plus Lets Remote Users Deny Service With Specially Crafted DHCP Packets
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in 3Com Baseline Switch 2848-SFP Plus.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted DHCP packet that is larger than 342 bytes to cause the target switch to become unstable.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (Switch 2848-SFP Plus Release 1.0.2.0).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://support.3com.com/infodeli/tools/switches/baseline/3C16486_V1_0_2_0_readme.pdf

Title: JUNOSe DNS Response Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in JUNOSe.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote DNS server can return specially crafted data in response to a DNS query to trigger a flaw in the DNSclient code.

The 'c09-dns-response' test can trigger this flaw.

The specific type of denial of service impact was not specified.

JUNOS and ScreenOS are not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution: The vendor has issued fixed versions of JUNOSe:  5-3-5p0-2, 6-0-3p0-6, 6-0-4, 6-1-3p0-1, 7-0-1p0-7, 7-0-2, 7-1-0p0-1, and 7-1-1 and later releases.

Title: Cisco IOS XR MPLS Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS XR.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Several flaws exist in the processing of Multiple Multi Protocol Label Switching (MPLS) data.  Only systems that are running Cisco IOS XR and are configured for MPLS are affected.

A remote user can send specially crafted data to Modular Services Card (MSC) on a Cisco Carrier Routing System 1 (CRS-1) or a Line Card (LC) on a Cisco 12000 series router to cause the card to reload.  This may affect switched traffic.

Cisco has assigned Bug IDs CSCsd15970, CSCsd55531, and CSCsc77475 to these vulnerabilities.

This vulnerability was reported to Cisco by a customer.
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
Cisco has issued a fix.  A patch matrix is provided in the Cisco advisory.

The Cisco advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20060419-xr.shtml

Title: Cisco ONS 15000 Series Common Control Cards Can Be Reset By Remote Users
Version(s): ONS 15310 Multi-service Provisioning Platforms (MSPP), ONS 15327 MSPP, ONS 15454 MSPP, ONS 15454 Multi-service Transport Platform, and ONS 15600 MSPP.
Description:
Several vulnerabilities were reported in the Cisco Optical Networking System (ONS) 15000 series devices.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the Common Control Cards.
The ONS 15310 Multi-service Provisioning Platforms (MSPP), ONS 15327 MSPP, ONS 15454 MSPP, ONS 15454 Multi-service Transport Platform, and ONS 15600 MSPP are affected.

Optical nodes that have the Common Control Cards connected to a Data Communications Network (DCN) and are enabled for IPv4 are affected.

For network entities (NEs) with IP configured on the LAN interface, a remote user can conduct a TCP ACK attack against a management port to cause the control cards to consume all available memory and stop accepting network connections and potentially reset [Cisco Bug ID CSCei45910].

The following remote management TCP ports may be affected:

    80:    HTTP
    443:   HTTPS
    1080:  SOCKS
    2361:  TL1
    3081:  TL1-LV
    3082:  TL1-RAW
    3083:  TL1-TELNET
    57790: non-secure Internet Inter-ORB Protocol (IIOP) port
    57791: Secure Socket Layer Inter-ORB Protocol (SSLIOP) port. 

For NEs with IP configured on the LAN interface and secure mode is enabled for element management system (EMS)-to-NE access, a remote user can send a specially crafted IP packet to cause the control card to reset [Cisco Bug ID CSCsc51390].

For NEs with IP configured on the LAN interface, a remote user can send a specially crafted IP packet to cause the control card to reset [Cisco Bug ID CSCsd04168].

For NEs with OSPF configured on the LAN interface of the control card, a remote user can send a specially crafted OSPF packet to cause the control card to reset [Cisco Bug ID: CSCsc54558].
Impact': A remote user can cause the common control card(s) to reset.
Solution:
The vendor has issue fixed versions.  A fix matrix is available in the vendor's advisory at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20060405-ons.shtml

Title: Cisco 11500 Content Services Switch HTTP Compression Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Cisco 11500 Content Services Switch.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
When a CSS 11500 Series switch is configured for HTTP compression, a remote user can send a specially crafted HTTP request to cause the target device to reload.

Only Cisco CSS 11500 Series Content Services Switches that are configured for HTTP compression are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCek24160 to this vulnerability.

A customer discovered this vulnerability and reported it to Cisco.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (8.10.1.6), available at:

http://www.cisco.com/cgi-bin/tablebuild.pl/css11500-maint?psrtdcat20e2

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20060405-css.shtml

Title: F5 FirePass Input Validation Hole in 'my.support.php3' Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description: A vulnerability was reported in F5 FirePass. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks. The 'my.support.php3' script does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the 's' parameter before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the FirePass device and will run in the security context of that device. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the device, or take actions on the device acting as the target user. A demonstration exploit URL is provided: https://[target]/my.support.php3?c=1&s=username&lang=en&charset=iso-8859- 1&uilangchar=en.iso-8859-1 ILION Research Labs, Geneva Switzerland, discovered this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the FirePass device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the device, or take actions on the device acting as the target user.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Compex NetPassage WPE54G Router Lets Remote Users Crash the UConfig Agent Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Compex NetPassage WPE54G router.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted packet to the target system to cause the target UConfig agent to crash.

/dev/0id Ukr Security Team reported this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.security.nnov.ru/Ldocument605.html
Impact': A remote user can cause the target UConfig agent to crash.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Thomson Speed Touch 500 Series Web Interface Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Thomson Speed Touch 500 series modems.  A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The web interface does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input.  A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by an authenticated target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser.  The code will originate from the device and will run in the security context of the device.  As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the device, or take actions on the device acting as the target user.

A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

http://[target]/cgi/b/intfs/_intf_/ov/?ce=1&be=0&l0=3&l1=1&name=[code here]

Preben Nylokken discovered this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the device, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the device, or take actions on the device acting as the target user.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Blue Coat ProxySG Policy Error May Let Remote Users Bypass Default CONNECT Policy Rules
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Blue Coat Proxy Security Gateway OS.  A remote user may be able to bypass connection filters.
When the 'Deep Content Inspection' function is invoked via a connection inspection rule in a policy, the ProxySG will no longer enforce the implicit CONNECT blocking rule to block all connect attempts except those on the HTTPS port.  As a result, CONNECT requests are permitted when they should otherwise be blocked.

SGOS versions 2.x, 3.x, and 4.2 are not affected.

Dominique Gregoire reported this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.secumind.net/content/french/modules/news/article.php?storyid=8
Impact': A remote user can bypass connection policy filters when deep inspection is used.
Solution:
The vendor plans to issue a fixed version (4.1.4).

The vendor has provided the following workaround for ProxySG [quoted]:

Place the following policy rule in the beginning of every VPM Web Access layer or CPL Proxy layer that contains an ALLOW, DENY or EXCEPTION action:

      http.method=CONNECT url.port=!443 DENY

Adding this in a layer by itself will not workaround the issue, it must be added to the beginning of every Web Access or <Proxy> layer.

Title: Cisco VPN 3000 Concentrator Bug in HTTP Service Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco VPN 3000 Concentrator.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a small series of specially crafted HTTP packet to the target concentrator to cause the target device to halt and drop user connections.  A remote user can also generate connections to the HTTP port to cause excessive memory and other resource consumption.  As a result, concentrator may stall and drop user connections.

In both cases, the power must be reset to return the system to normal operations.

The system is only vulnerable if the HTTP service is enabled (the default configuration).

Only HTTP packets sent to the target device can exploit this flaw.  HTTP traffic that traverses the device cannot exploit this flaw.

Models 3005, 3015, 3020, 3030, 3060, and 3080 are affected.

Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCsb77324 and CSCsd26340 to this vulnerability.

This vulnerability was discovered by Eldon Sprickerhoff of eSentire and disclosed at the ShmooCon security conference on January 12, 2006.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to halt.  User connections will be dropped.  A power reset is required to return the system to normal operations.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a new version (4.7.2.F and later), available at:

http://www.cisco.com/pcgi-bin/tablebuild.pl/vpn3000-3des

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20060126-vpn.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS AAA Command Authorization Feature May Let Remote Authenticated Users Gain Elevated Privileges
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS in the Authentication, Authorization, and Accounting (AAA) command authorization feature.  A remote authenticated user may be able to gain elevated privileges.
Commands executed from the Tool Command Language (Tcl) exec shell are not properly validated.  A remote authenticated user may be able to bypass command authorization checks in some configurations to execute any IOS EXEC command at the user's authenticated privilege level.

Devices that run the AAA command authorization feature and support the Tcl functionality may be affected.

Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCeh73049 to this vulnerability.

The system may also allow a remote authenticated user to enter Tcl Shell mode automatically if a previous user was in Tcl Shell mode and terminated the session before leaving the Tcl Shell mode.  The previous Tcl Shell process will remain active and attached to the corresponding virtual type terminal VTY or teletypewriter TTY line.  As a result, the remote authenticated user may be able to execute commands with the privileges of the previous user.

Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCef77770 to this vulnerability.  Only 12.3T, 12.4, and 12.2(25)S and onward trains are affected by this second issue.

The vendor credits Nicolas Fischbach of COLT Telecom with reporting this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user may be able to gain elevated privileges.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.  A patch matrix is availabe in the vendor's advisory at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-response-20060125-aaatcl.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS Stack Group Bidding Protocol Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS in the Stack Group Bidding Protocol (SGBP) feature.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a specially crafted UDP packet to port 9900 of the target device to cause the device to freeze and stop processing traffic.  The system's watchdog timer will restart the device after the timeout period.

Only systems that have the SGBP protocol enabled are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCsb11124 to this vulnerability.

Cisco discovered this vulnerability during internal testing.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to become unresponsive and trigger a hardware reset.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.  A fix matrix is available in the vendor's advisory at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20060118-sgbp.shtml

Title: Linksys BEFVP41 VPN Router Can Be Crashed By Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Linksys BEFVP41 VPN Router.  A remote user can cause the router to crash.
A remote user can send a specially crafted IP packet with a null length value for IP option #0xE4 to cause the target device to crash.

The device can be crashed from the LAN-side interface.  A reboot is required to return the device to normal operations.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target router to crash.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco Aironet Wireless Access Point Memory Can Be Consumed With Spoofed ARP Packets
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Aironet Wireless Access Points (AP) running IOS.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user that has successfully associated with a target Cisco IOS Wireless Access Point can send specially crafted, spoofed ARP packets to the management interface on the target device to consume all available physical memory.  As a result, the device will no longer process traffic.  A power cycle is required to return the device to normal operations.

The following devices are affected:

    * Cisco Aironet 1400 Series Wireless Bridges
    * Cisco Aironet 1300 Series Access Points
    * Cisco Aironet 1240AG Series Access Points
    * Cisco Aironet 1230AG Series Access Points
    * Cisco Aironet 1200 Series Access Points
    * Cisco Aironet 1130AG Series Access Points
    * Cisco Aironet 1100 Series Access Points
    * Cisco Aironet 350 Series Access Points running IOS

Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCsc16644 to this vulnerability.

The vendor credits Eric Smith at Bucknell University with reporting this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause packet forwarding services to become unavailable.
Solution:
Cisco has issued a fixed version of IOS (12.3-7-JA2), available at:

http://www.cisco.com/public/sw-center/sw-wireless.shtml

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20060112-wireless.shtml

Title: Apple AirPort Base Station Lets Remote Users Deny Service on the Network Interface
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Apple AirPort.  A remote user can cause the base station to stop responding.
A remote user can send specially crafted packets to the target AirPort base station device to cause the target station's network interface to stop responding normally.

Apple credits Michael Zanetta of NETwork Security Consortium with reporting this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the base station network interface to stop responding.
Solution:
Apple has issued a firmware fix, available via the Software Update pane in System Preferences, or Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

AirPort Express Firmware Update 6.3 for Mac OS X
The download file is named:  "AirPortExpressFWUpdater.dmg"
Its SHA-1 digest is:  2d6a7c7b35e84fda44e52a7b994ed31a2f8e25d7

AirPort Express Firmware Update 6.3 for Windows
The download file is named:  "AirPortExpressFWUpdater.exe"
Its SHA-1 digest is:  d8ff8310ef19b5fc4f022091742578ca2cd664d6

AirPort Extreme Firmware Update 5.7 for Mac OS X
The download file is named:  "AirPortExtremeFWUpdater.dmg"
Its SHA-1 digest is:  06f0e12b95f27b020e45f616317f8d9e97ca4f76

AirPort Extreme Firmware Update 5.7 for Windows
The download file is named:  "AirPortExtremeFWUpdater.exe"
Its SHA-1 digest is:  05b39317a1388b85569e9be1333f85a0019edb39

Title: Cisco IOS EIGRP Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service or Obtain Potentially Sensitive Information
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS in the processing of the EIGRP routing protocol.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.  A remote authenticated user can obtain information about the target network.
A remote user can send a spoofed, specially crafted EIGRP Goodbye Message to a target device to cause a route maintained by the target device to be torn down and subsequently reformed.  All versions of IOS are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsc13698 to this vulnerability.

A remote authenticated user (authenticated router) that receives EIGRP Hello Updates can reply with a specially crafted packet to obtain potentially sensitive information about the target EIGRP domain.  Packets that are replayed with modified HELLO values can be used.  Specially crafted packets can also be used to cause denial of service conditions on the target network.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsc13724 to this vulnerability.

The vendor was notified on October 10, 2005.

Andrew A. Vladimirov of Arhont Ltd. reported these vulnerabilities.

The vendor credits Mr. Vladimirov and Konstantin V. Gavrilenko of Arhont Ltd. with reporting these vulnerabilities.
Impact':
A remote user can cause routes to be torn down and reformed, resulting in denial of service conditions.

A remote authenticated user can obtain potentially sensitive routing information.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Cisco has confirmed these vulnerabilities and has provided workarounds, available at:

http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/sw/iosswrel/ps1828/products_security_notice09186a00805b5e5f.html

Title: Dell TrueMobile 2300 Wireless Router Lets Remote Users Reset the Authentication Credentials
Description:
iDEFENSE reported a vulnerability in the Dell TrueMobile 2300 wireless router.  A remote user can bypass authentication.
A remote user may be able to load the following page to reset the router's authentication credentials:

http://[target]/apply.cgi?Page=adv_password.asp&action=ClearLog

The system will request authentication credentials but the remote user can press 'cancel' to avoid having to provide authentication parameters.

The vendor was notified on November 17, 2005.

iDEFENSE reported this vulnerability.

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.idefense.com/application/poi/display?id=348&type=vulnerabilities
Impact': A remote user can reset the authentication credentials.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.  The vendor does not plan to issue a fix, as a newer model that is not vulnerable is available.

Title: Cisco IOS HTTP Server Input Validation Hole in Buffers Command Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
Hugo Vazquez Carames reported a vulnerability in Cisco IOS in the HTTP server.  A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.
The web-based '/level/15/exec/-/show/buffers' function does not properly filter HTML code from user-affected inputs before displaying the input.  The 'dump' and 'packet' options are vulnerable.

A remote user can send a packet containing specially crafted HTML code to or though the target router.  Then, when a target administrator uses the web-based buffers function to view system memory, the HTML code will be executed by the target administrator's browser.  The code will originate from the router's web interface and will run in the security context of that interface.  As a result, the code will be able to access data recently submitted by the target administrator via web form to the interface or take actions on the interface acting as the target administrator.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCsc64976 to this vulnerability. 

The original advisory is available at:

http://www.infohacking.com/INFOHACKING_RESEARCH/Our_Advisories/cisco/index.html

Hugo Vazquez Carames, iDefense, and Adrian Pastor (ProCheckup Ltd) reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access data recently submitted by the target administrator via web form to the web interface or take actions on the web interface acting as the target administrator.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

The vendor issued an advisory confirming the vulnerability and providing some workarounds, available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20051201-http.shtml

Title: Juniper JUNOS/JUNOSe  IKE Processing Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Juniper's JUNOS and JUNOSe in the processing of IPSec Internet Key Exchange (IKE) packets.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
The University of Oulu Secure Programming Group (OUSPG) "PROTOS" Test Suite for IPSec can be used to cause denial of service conditions on Juniper routers.

A remote user can send certain specially crafted ISAKMP Phase 1 packets to cause denial of service conditions.  The specific impact was not disclosed.

Juniper JUNOS and JUNOSe are affected.

Juniper has assigned issue number CQ/68020 for JUNOSe and issue numbers PR/61076 and PR/61779 for JUNOS to these vulnerabilities.

The original advisory from CERT-FI and NISCC is available at:

http://www.niscc.gov.uk/niscc/docs/re-20051114-01014.pdf?lang=en
Impact': A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions for JUNOSe software:  5-2-4p0-8, 5-2-5, 5-3-4p0-5, 6-0-2p0-5, 6-0-3, 6-1-1p0-7, 6-1-2, 7-0-0p0-1, 7-0-1, 7-1-0.

The vendor has issued a fixed version for JUNOS software:  Releases 6.4 and later releases built on or after July 28, 2005.

[Editor's note:  The vendor has or plans to issue bulletin PSN-2005-11-007 regarding this vulnerability.  However, the bulletin was not available on the vendor's web site at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco MDS IKE Processing Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco MDS in the processing of IPSec Internet Key Exchange (IKE) packets.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
The University of Oulu Secure Programming Group (OUSPG) "PROTOS" Test Suite for IPSec can be used to cause denial of service conditions on several Cisco products.

A remote user can send certain specially crafted packets to cause the target IKE process to reset.  This can be done repeatedly to cause prolonged denial of service conditions against the IKE service.  No other Cisco MDS operations are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCei46258 to this vulnerability.

The original advisory from CERT-FI and NISCC is available at:

http://www.niscc.gov.uk/niscc/docs/re-20051114-01014.pdf?lang=en
Impact': A remote user can cause the IKE service to restart.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (2.1(2)).

The vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20051114-ipsec.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS IPSec IKE Processing Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS in the processing of IPSec Internet Key Exchange (IKE) packets.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
The University of Oulu Secure Programming Group (OUSPG) "PROTOS" Test Suite for IPSec can be used to cause denial of service conditions on several Cisco products.

A remote user can send certain specially crafted packets to cause the target device to reset.  This can be done repeatedly to cause prolonged denial of service conditions.

The vulnerabilities were introduced in IOS version 12.3(11)T.  Versions 12.3T, 12.4, 12.4T, and 12.2SXD are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCed94829 to this vulnerability.

The original advisory from CERT-FI and NISCC is available at:

http://www.niscc.gov.uk/niscc/docs/re-20051114-01014.pdf?lang=en
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reset.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.  For a patch matrix, see the vendor's advisory at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20051114-ipsec.shtml

Title: Cisco Airespace Wireless LAN Controller May Allow Use of Unencrypted Connections
Version(s): Cisco 1200, 1131, and 1240 Access Points controlled by Cisco 2000 and 4400 series Airespace WLAN Controllers running version 3.1.59.24
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Airespace Wireless LAN Controllers.  A remote device can use unencrypted connections.
Cisco 1200, 1131 and 1240 series access points that are controlled by Cisco 2000 or 4400 WLAN controllers in Lightweight Access Point Protocol (LWAPP) mode of operation may incorrectly accept unencrypted traffic from remote hosts even when they are configured to encrypt traffic.

Only the access points running in LWAPP mode are affected. Access points that are running in autonomous mode are not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCsc11134 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote device can use unencrypted connections even if the access point is configured for only encrypted connections.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fixed version (3.1.105.0).

Title: Cisco IOS System Timers May Permit Heap Overflow Exploitation
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS.  A remote user may be able to execute arbitrary code on the target device.
Cisco indicated that IOS does not provide sufficient protection against heap-based buffer overflows.  If an attack vector exists, a remote user may be able to trigger an overflow to cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target device.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCei61732 to this issue.

Cisco IOS XR is not affected.

[Editor's note:  This advisory does not identify any specific attack vectors.  Instead, it recognizes that if an attack vector exists, heap overflows may be exploitable.  It appears that the purpose of the vendor's advisory is to announce additional protections within IOS to attempt to prevent exploitation of vulnerabilities that have not yet been discovered.]
Impact': A remote user may be able to cause the target device to crash or execute arbitrary code.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.  A fix matrix is contained in the vendor's advisory is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20051102-timers.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS IPS Signatures May Be Disabled When Configured via the Cisco Management Center for IPS Sensors
Version(s): Cisco IOS IPS devices that have been configured by IPS MC v2.1
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Cisco Management Center for IPS Sensors when generating configuration files for Cisco IOS IPS.  Some signatures on the Cisco IOS IPS devices may be disabled.
If a Cisco IOS IPS device has been configured by using the Cisco Management Center for IPS Sensors software (Cisco IPS MC v2.1), the management center may generate and download a configuration file to the target device that is missing a value for the appropriate TCP/UDP port field in one or more signatures.  As a result, the target Cisco IOS IPS device will disable the affected signatures.

Only signatures using the STRING.TCP or STRING.UDP signature micro-engine (SME) are affected and only Cisco IOS IPS devices that have been configured by IPS MC v2.1 are affected.

Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCsc33696 to this vulnerability.

[Editor's note: The vulnerability resides in the management center software but manifests itself in the Cisco IOS IPS devices.]
Impact': An incomplete analysis of network traffic traversing the Cisco IOS IPS device may result, allowing some attacks to go unnoticed.
Solution:
Cisco has issued a fixed version, available via the VMS Software download page for IDS MC and IPS MC at:

http://www.cisco.com/pcgi-bin/tablebuild.pl/mgmt-ctr-ids-app

The fix consists of the following files [quoted]:

    * idsmdc2.1.0-win-CSCsc336961.tar - this file contains the fix itself for IPS MC v2.1 running on the Windows operating system.
    * CSCOids2.1.0-sol-CSCsc336961.tar - this file contains the fix itself for IPS MC v2.1 running on the Solaris operating system.
    * CSCsc33696-w2k-README.txt - this file contains instructions on how to apply the software fix to an affected IPS MC v2.1 installation on Windows, and any needed pre and post installation tasks to be carried out by the user.
    * CSCsc33696-sol-README.txt - this file contains instructions on how to apply the software fix to an affected IPS MC v2.1 installation on Solaris, and any needed pre and post installation tasks to be carried out by the user.

Title: Cisco 11500 Content Services Switch Lets Remote Users Deny Service With Malformed SSL Client Certificates
Version(s): CSS 11500 Series with WebNS version 7.1, 7.2, 7.3, 7.4, or 7.5
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Cisco 11500 series Content Services Switch.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the target device.
If the device is configured to support SSL termination services, then a remote user can supply a specially crafted digital client certificate during the negotiation of an SSL session to cause the target device to reload.

SSL termination services are not configured by default.

The Cisco CSS 11000 Series Content Services Switches are not affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCee64771 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the device to reload.
Solution:
Cisco has issued the following fixes.

For 7.3: 7.30.4.02 and later

For 7.4: 7.40.2.02 and later

For 7.5: 7.50.1.03 and later

For 7.10 and 7.20: Upgrade to a fixed version of 7.30 or greater.

Fixes are available at:

http://www.cisco.com/pcgi-bin/tablebuild.pl/css11500-maint

Title: Linksys WRT54G Router Administration Interface Bugs Let Remote Users Modify the Configuration, Execute Arbitrary Code, or Deny Service
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Linksys WRT54G Router.  A remote user can change the device configuration or execute arbitrary code on the target device.  A remote user can also deny servie to the management interface.
The 'ezconfig.asp' script does not properly authenticate user-supplied requests.  In certain cases where no authentication has occured on the device since the last reboot, a remote user that can determine an encryption key used by the device can upload a new configuration to the target device.

The 'apply.cgi' script contains a buffer overflow [CVE: CVE-2005-2799].  A remote user can send a specially crafted POST request with more than 10000 bytes to trigger the overflow and cause the device to crash and reboot or to execute arbitrary code on the target system.

The 'restore.cgi' script does not properly authenticate user-supplied POST requests until after the request is processed.  A remote user can exploit this to upload a new configuration to non-volatile memory on the target device.  The new configuration will be loaded the next time the device reboots as long as no newer configuration modifications are made.

The 'upgrade.cgi' script is affected by the same authentication flaw.

Several scripts do not properly process user-supplied POST requests submitted to the management interface.  A remote user can send a specially crafted request with a Content-Length header set to a negative value to cause the target web service to take a long time to process the request, potentially causing denial of service conditions on the web service.

The vendor was notified of one vulnerability on June 5, 2005, two of the vulnerabilities on June 7, 2005, and three of the vulnerabilities on July 5, 2005.

Greg MacManus of iDEFENSE Labs discovered two of these vulnerabilities.

The original advisories are available at:

http://www.idefense.com/application/poi/display?id=304&type=vulnerabilities
http://www.idefense.com/application/poi/display?id=305&type=vulnerabilities
http://www.idefense.com/application/poi/display?id=306&type=vulnerabilities
http://www.idefense.com/application/poi/display?id=307&type=vulnerabilities
http://www.idefense.com/application/poi/display?id=308&type=vulnerabilities
Impact':
A remote user can change the configuration on the target device.

A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target device.

A remote user can cause denial of service conditions on the management interface.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (4.20.7) to address the 'restore.cgi' and 'upgrade.cgi' authentication flaws and the 'apply.cgi' buffer overflow.

[Editor's note:  It is not clear if the fix also applies to the 'ezconfig.asp' vulnerability and the denial of service vulnerability, as the vendor link provided in the report was not functioning at the time of this entry and the report was unclear.]

Title: Cisco Content Services Switches Let Remote Users Bypass SSL Authentication
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Cisco CSS 11500 series Content Services Switches.  A remote user may be able to bypass SSL authentication to access ostensibly protected content.
When SSL encryption is enabled and client authentication using SSL certificates is enabled, the target device may fail to properly renegotiate the SSL session.  As a result, validation of the client certificate can be bypassed.  The remote user may be able to access content without authorization.

Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCei31328 to this vulnerability.

The following models are affected:

- Cisco CSS 11500 Series Content Services Switches with the CSS5-SSL-K9 SSL module
- Cisco 11501 Content Services Switch with SSL (CSS11501S-K9)
Impact': A remote user may be able to bypass client certificate authentication to access protected content.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.

For the 7.4 train, use 7.40 b119s (image sg0740119s.adi).

For the 7.5 train, use 7.50 b11s (image sg0750011s.adi).

Title: Cisco IOS Buffer Overflow in Firewall Authentication Proxy for FTP and/or Telnet Sessions May Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS in the Firewall Authentication Proxy used for FTP and telnet sessions.  A remote user can cause the device to reload or can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
A remote user can supply specially crafted authentication credentials when authenticating via the Firewall Authentication Proxy for FTP and/or Telnet Sessions feature to trigger a buffer overflow.  This may cause the device to reload or may cause arbitrary code to be executed on the device.

The HTTP and HTTPS proxy authentication is not vulnerable.

The 12.2ZH, 12.2ZL, 12.3, 12.3T, 12.4, and 12.4T based trains are vulnerable.

Cisco IOS versions 12.2 and earlier (including 12.0S) are not affected (excluding 12.2ZH and 12.2ZL).  Cisco IOS XR is not affected.

Cisco has assigned Bug ID CSCsa54608 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload or potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.  A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20050907-auth_proxy.shtml

Title: Linksys WRT54GS Lets Remote Users Bypass WPA Wireless Encryption
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Linksys WRT54GS.  A remote user can connect via the wireless interface without encryption when encryption is specified.
When the system is configured with WPA Personal/TKIP authentication enabled, a remote user can connect to the wireless interface without any encryption.

A remote user with encryption but with the wrong key or wrong settings will be denied access.

Steve Scherf reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can access an encrypted wireless network without using encryption.
Solution: The report indicates that version 4.70.6 appears to be not vulnerable.

Title: Cisco IOS IPv6 Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
Impact: Execution of arbitrary code via network
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS in the processing of IPv6 packets.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions or execute arbitrary code on the target device.
A remote user on the local network segment can send a specially crafted IPv6 packet to a logical interface on the target device to cause the device to reload or execute arbitrary code.

Only systems that are configured to process IPv6 are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCef68324 to this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can cause the target device to reload.

A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.
Solution:
Cisco has issued fixes.  A patch matrix is available in the vendor's advisory at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20050729-ipv6.shtml

[Editor's note:  Cisco silently fixed this bug in April 2005, but failed to notify customers of any security impact.  Cisco released their security advisory on July 29, 2005, after the vulnerability was disclosed at the Black Hat conference.  Internet Security Systems (ISS) was responsible for researching the impact of the vulnerability.  However, at the request of Cisco, ISS did not disclose the vulnerability.  ISS has agreed to keep any vulnerability details secret.]

Title: Linksys WRT54G Common SSL Certificate and Private Key Lets Remote Users Decrypt Management Sessions
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Linksys WRT54G wireless router in the SSL implementation.  The device uses a common certificate and private key.
A remote user with access to an SSL management session can decrypt the session.

Nick Simicich reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user with access to SSL management session traffic can decrypt the session.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Office Connect Wireless 11g Access Point Discloses System Information to Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Office Connect Wireless 11g Access Point.  A remote user can obtain system information.
A remote user can access "hidden" pages on the web interface to obtain sensitive administrative information.
Impact': A remote user can obtain sensitive administrative information.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (1.03.12), available at:

http://webprd1.3com.com/swd/jsp/user/index.jsp?id=OCWAP15

Title: Blue Coat ProxySG Error in Processing TCP Sequence Numbers in ICMP Messages Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Version(s): SGOS 2.1.11 and earlier, SGOS 3.2.4 and earlier, SGOS 4.1.1
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Blue Coat's ProxySG in the processing of ICMP error messages.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
The software does not properly validate TCP sequence numbers in ICMP error messages.  A remote user can send spoofed ICMP error messages to cause TCP connections processed by the target system to be dropped or to cause the peformance of those connections to degrade.
Impact': A remote user can cause TCP connections processed by the target system to be dropped or cause the peformance of those connections to degrade.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed versions (3.2.5 and 4.1.2), available at:

http://download.bluecoat.com/release/SGOS3/index.html
http://download.bluecoat.com/release/SGOS4/index.html

Title: Blue Coat CacheOS Error in Processing TCP Sequence Numbers in ICMP Messages Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Blue Coat's CacheOS in the processing of ICMP error messages.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
The software does not properly validate TCP sequence numbers in ICMP error messages.  A remote user can send spoofed ICMP error messages to cause TCP connections processed by the target system to be dropped or to cause the peformance of those connections to degrade.

All CacheOS systems are affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause TCP connections processed by the target system to be dropped or cause the peformance of those connections to degrade.
Solution:
No solution was available at the time of this entry.

For more information, contact the Blue Coat Technical Support Department at:

http://www.bluecoat.com/support/index.html

Title: Apple AirPort Card May Connect to Malicious Networks
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Apple's AirPort card software.  The card may automatically connect to a malicious wireless network.
If the AirPort card is enabled but not connected to a known or trusted network, the card attempts to connect to a randomly generated network number (ostensibly a non-existent network) using a default WEP key.  A remote user can create a network that uses the same WEP key to cause AirPort cards to connect to the network.

AirPort Extreme is not affected.

The vendor credits Dino Dai Zovi with reporting this vulnerability.
Impact': The system may connect to a malicious network without warning.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (4.2), available from the Software Update pane in System Preferences or from Apple's Software Downloads web site at:

http://www.apple.com/support/downloads/

For Mac OS X v10.3.3 through Mac OS X v10.3.9
The download file is named:  "AirPortSW42.dmg"
Its SHA-1 digest is:  bf2876b1873392e64b2e1061b835d35bfb67c3a6

The AirPort security fix is also contained within the
Mac OS X v10.4.2 update:

If updating from Mac OS X v10.4.1
The download file is named:  "MacOSXUpdate10.4.2.dmg"
Its SHA-1 digest is:  5a11375c29f1f656061189b9467cf9291153de46

If updating from Mac OS X v10.4
The download file is named:  "MacOSXUpdateCombo10.4.2.dmg"
Its SHA-1 digest is:  5149def0b79f030bdb2763283c376e4d87d085e9

Title: MRV's In-Reach Port-Specific Access Controls Can Be Bypassed By Remote Authenticated Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in MRV's In-Reach servers.  A remote authenticated user can bypass port access controls.
If the target system is configured to permit remote access using SSH public key authentication, then a remote user can bypass user-based port access control restrictions.

Dr. Dirk Wetter reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote authenticated user can bypass port-specific access controls.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fixed version (3.5.1).

Title: Belkin Wireless Router Grants Administrative Access to Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Belkin 'belkin54g' series wireless routers.  A remote user can gain administrative access on the target device.
The system has a telnet management access port enabled by default.  A remote user can access the device via the telnet service using an empty password.  The web management interface can also be accessed with an empty password.

With access via the telnet service, the remote user can perform administrative functions, including adding user accounts, viewing the access password for ISP service, and browsing the filesystem.

pagvac (Adrian Pastor) reported these vulnerabilities.
Impact': A remote user can gain administrative access to the target device.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco ONS 15216 OADM Telnet Processing Error Lets Remote Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Cisco ONS 15216 Optical Add/Drop Multiplexer (OADM) in the Telnet service.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted data to the telnet management interface to cause the telnet session to lock up, preventing any additional telnet sessions from being established.

The management plane must be restarted to return to normal operations, affecting the data plane during reboot.
Impact': A remote user can disable the telnet management function.  A reboot is required to return the system to normal operations.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fix.

Title: F5 BIG-IP Unspecified SSL Authentication Bug May Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in F5's BIG-IP.  A remote user may be able to cause denial of service conditions.
An unspecified SSL authentication flaw may allow remote users to cause denial of service conditions for SSL connections to the device.
Impact': A remote user may be able to cause denial of service conditions for SSL connections to the device.
Solution:
The vendor has reportedly issued the following fix:

ftp://ftp.f5.com/Domestic/bigip/bigip9x-hotfix-CR49528/

Title: Cisco IOS RADIUS Fallback 'None' Authentication Error Lets Remote Users Bypass Authentication
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS when using RADIUS authentication in a certain configuration.  A remote user may be able to bypass authentication.
When Remote Authentication Dial In User Service (RADIUS) authentication is configured on Cisco IOS with a fallback method set to none, then authentication can be bypassed.  In this configuration, a remote user can send a long username to be successfully authenticated by the target device.

Systems that are not configured with a fallback method set to none are not affected.

Only certain versions of Cisco IOS are affected.

Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCee45312 to this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can bypass authentication.
Solution:
The vendor has issued fixed versions.  For a patch matrix, see the vendor's advisory at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20050629-aaa.shtml

Title: Enterasys Vertical Horizon Common Default Password Grants Access to Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Enterasys Vertical Horizon switch.  A remote user can access an undocumented account using a common, default password.  A remote authenticated user can access debug commands.
A remote user can access the 'tiger' user account using 'tiger123' as the password.

A remote authenticated user can invoke certain debug commands by pressing ctrl-f, ctrl-b, ctrl-g, or ctrl-l.  After pressing ctrl-g, the user can access write commands.

The vendor was notified on March 8, 2005.

Jacek Lipkowski from Andra Co. reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can access an undocumented account using a common, default password.

A remote authenticated user can access debug commands.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix, available at:

http://www.enterasys.com/download/download.cgi?lib=vh

Title: ExtremeWare XOS Lets Remote Authenticated Administrators Gain Access to the Operating System on BlackDiamon Switches
Version(s): 10.x, 11.0 - before 11.0.2.4, 11.1 - before 11.1.3.3; BlackDiamond 10808 (10K) Switches, BlackDiamond 8800 Switches
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in ExtremeWare XOS, affecting certain BlackDiamond switches.  A remote authenticated administrator can access the switch operating system.
A remote authenticated user-level administrator can exploit an unspecified flaw to gain administrator-level access to the underlying operating system of the switches.  The user can gain unrestricted access to all front panel and management interfaces.
Impact': A remote authenticated administrator can access the switch operating system.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fixed version (11.0.2.4, 11.1.3.3).

Customers on the 11.0 code branch should upgrade to 11.0.2.4 or 11.1.3.3 or later versions.  Customers on the 11.1 code branch should upgrade to 11.1.3.3 or later.

Title: Cisco MGX WAN Switches TCP/IP Timestamp Option Error Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the MGX8200, MGX8800, and MGX8900 series switches.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a packet with specially crafted TCP timestamp options to cause a target TCP connection to stall until the TCP connection is reset.  Only the target TCP session is affected.

Only the management services are affected, as these WAN switches use TCP only for management services.
Impact': A remote user can cause a target TCP connection to reset.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fix as part of the solution identified in Cisco Bug ID CSCeh85125 for MGX8200 series and CSCeh85130 for MGX8800 and MGX8900 series switches.

Title: Cisco AP35/AP1200 TCP/IP Timestamp Option Error Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Cisco AP350 and AP1200 series Access Points.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a packet with specially crafted TCP timestamp options to cause a target TCP connection to stall until the TCP connection is reset.  Only the target TCP session is affected.

Only the systems that are running VxWorks are affected.  Access points that are running Cisco IOS are not affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause a target TCP connection to reset.
Solution:
Only systems running VxWorks are affected.  Systems running VxWorks can be upgraded to Cisco IOS to address this issue.  Information on upgrading access points to Cisco IOS is available at:

http://www.cisco.com/en/US/products/hw/wireless/ps430/products_tech_note09186a008019fea0.shtml

Title: Cisco CSS11000 TCP/IP Timestamp Option Error Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Cisco CSS11000 content services switch series.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a packet with specially crafted TCP timestamp options to cause a target TCP connection to stall until the TCP connection is reset.  Only the target TCP session is affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause a target TCP connection to reset.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fix as part of the solution identified in Cisco Bug ID CSCeh40395.

Title: Cisco SN5400 TCP/IP Timestamp Option Error Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Cisco SN5400 series storage routers.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send a packet with specially crafted TCP timestamp options to cause a target TCP connection to stall until the TCP connection is reset.  Only the target TCP session is affected.
Impact': A remote user can cause a target TCP connection to reset.
Solution: The vendor has issued a fix as part of the solution identified in Cisco Bug ID CSCin85370.

Title: Cisco IOS ICMP PMTUD Attacks Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in Cisco IOS in the processing of ICMP messages.  A remote user may be able to cause denial of service conditions for certain router sessions.
IOS devices that have Path Maximum Transmission Unit Discovery (PMTUD) enabled are affected.  All IOS versions are affected.

A remote user can send specially crafted "fragmentation needed and DF bit set" ICMP packets to the target device to set the connection's Path MTU to an excessively low value.  As a result, higher layer protocols may start timing out due to low throughput.  The connection may also be reset.

Only connections originating from or terminating at the device are affected.

Several other Cisco products are also affected.

The vendor reported this vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause connections originating from or terminating at the device to have extremely low throughput or possibly reset.
Solution:
The vendor has released fixed versions.  For a patch matrix, see the vendor's advisory at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20050412-icmp.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS SSH Server TACACS Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Cisco IOS Secure Shell Server in the TACACS implementation.  A remote user can cause the target device to reload.
A remote user can send a specially crafted packet to an IOS device running SSH version 2 to cause denial of service conditions in certain cases [Cisco Bug ID CSCed65778].

If the device is configured to authenticate users via a TACACS+ server (e.g., "aaa authentication login <group name> group tacacs+ local") and the username includes a domain name, the vulnerability can be triggered.

If a remote authenticated user issues the 'send' command while a new SSH session has been initiated but not yet authenticated, the vulnerability can be triggered.

If an SSH session is terminated while the SSH server is sending data to the client and the server is configured to log messages via that session (via the terminal monitor command), the vulnerability can be triggered.

A remote user can connect to the SSH port and supply an invalid username or password when the system is configured to authenticate against a TACACS+ server to trigger a memory leak [Cisco Bug ID CSCed65285].  Both SSH version 1 and version 2 are affected.  The memory leak can cause the system to consume excessive memory resources and eventually reload.
Impact': A remote user can cause the target device to reload or to consume excessive resources.
Solution:
The vendor has released a fix.  For a fix matrix, see the vendor's advisory at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20050406-ssh.shtml

Title: Cisco IOS IKE Authentication Bugs Let Remote Users Bypass Xauth Authentication to Gain Access to Hosts and Resources
Description:
Two vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco IOS in the Internet Key Exchange (IKE) Extended Authentication (Xauth) implementation.  A remote user may be able to authenticate without proper credentials.
Systems configured to be an Easy VPN Server (Xauth version 6 authentication) are affected.

A remote user with knowledge of the shared group key can complete the normal IKE Phase 1 negotiation process and then send specially crafted UDP packets to the target Cisco IOS Easy VPN Server on port 500 to complete the Xauth authentication process without valid authentication credentials [Cisco Bug ID CSCin82407].  The remote user can then gain access to hosts and network resources protected by the IOS device.

A remote user that has performed Phase 1 negotiation can cause an ISAKMP profile to be assigned but the associated attributes not processed [Cisco Bug ID CSCeg00277].  Then, during the resulting deadlock condition, the remote authenticated user can conduct Phase 2 negotiation to establish an IPSec security association (SA).  ISAKMP profiles that are matched by certificate maps may be affected.
Impact': A remote authenticated user (with knowledge of the shared group key) can authenticate to the system and gain access to protected hosts and network resources.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix.  A software fix matrix for affected 12.2T, 12.3, and 12.3T release trains is available in the vendor's advisory at:

http://www.cisco.com/warp/public/707/cisco-sa-20050406-xauth.shtml

Title: Samsung ADSL Router Discloses Files to Remote Users and May Grant Root Access Via Common Default Passwords
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in a Samsung ADSL Router.  A remote user can view arbitrary files on the device.  The device also uses common default accounts and passwords.
A remote user can supply an HTTP GET request to view arbitrary files on the target device.  Some demonstration exploit URLs are provided:

http://[target]/etc/passwd
http://[target]/etc/hosts
http://[target]/bin/
http://[target]/dev/
http://[target]/lib/
http://[target]/tmp/
http://[target]/var/ppp/chap-secrets
http://[target]/bin/sh

The device uses several default user account names (with a default password that is the same as the account name) on the web and telnet services.  The user account names are 'root', 'admin', and 'user'.

The vendor has been notified.

Donnie Werner from exploitlabs reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can view arbitrary files on the target device.

The device also uses common default accounts and passwords.  If the defaults have not been changed, a remote user can gain root access on the target device.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Cisco VPN 3000 SSL Processing Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Cisco VPN 3000 in the processing of SSL connections.  A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can send specially crafted SSL packets to the target device to cause the device to reload and/or drop user connections. The target device is only vulnerable if the HTTPS service is enabled on the target device.

SSL traffic passed through the device does not trigger the vulnerability.
Impact': A remote user can cause the device to reload and/or drop user connections.
Solution: The vendor has released a fixed version (4.1.7.B).

Title: Symantec Nexland Router Incorrect SMTP Routing May Send Mail via Untrusted Networks
Version(s): Nexland Pro800turbo; firmware prior to build 1.6X and later than 1.5Z
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the Symantec Nexland Pro800turbo router in the SMTP binding function. SMTP traffic may be routed over an untrusted network.
In certain versions, outbound SMTP traffic may be load-balanced regardless of the wide area network binding configuration. As a result, some SMTP traffic may be routed via an unintended network path (such as over an untrusted network).

Arthur Hagen of Broomstick Net Services discovered this vulnerability.
Impact': SMTP traffic may be routed over an untrusted network.
Solution:
The vendor has issued a fix (Build 1.6X), available at:

http://www.symantec.com/techsupp

Title: GigaFast EE400-R Router Discloses Administrative Password to Remote Users and Can Be Crashed By Remote Users
Description:
A vulnerability was reported in the GigaFast EE400-R router.  A remote user can obtain the administrative password.  A remote user can also cause denial of service conditions.
A remote user can bypass the authentication mechanism and directly access the 'backup.cfg' file, which contains configuration data and the administrator password.  A demonstration exploit URL is provided:

http://[target]/backup.cfg

Remote users on the local area network interface can access the file by default.  If remote administration has been enabled, then the flaw can be exploited from the external network interface.

If the DNS proxy option is enabled, a remote user on the local area network can send malformed DNS queries to cause the router to crash.  A cold reboot is required to return the system to normal operations.

The vendor was notified on May 13, 2004.

Gary H. Jones II of PointBlankSecurity.com reported this vulnerability.
Impact':
A remote user can obtain the administrative password.

A remote user on the local network can cause the device to hang.
Solution: No solution was available at the time of this entry.

Title: Juniper JUNOS Unspecified Packet Processing Error Lets Remote Users Deny Service
Description:
